Service was okay... was given a lame timeshare offer as a gift of Aloha... Was glad the A/C worked.

Good place to stay around Waikiki, the main reason we choose here is wanted to collect n drop off our car rental with Alamo which is just round the corner at Discovery bay centre. Flash room key get 15% off in IHOP next to hotel. Walking distant to Hilton Hawaiian village n the famous rainbow tower is there n we can chill out at the public lagoon

We booked this hotel as a last minute stay as we decided to go out to hawaii earlier than expected. We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of October before our booked stay started. The staff were attentive, friendly and helpful! Nothing was too much trouble and Every time you walked in they gave you a warm Aloha. The rooms were slightly dated but clean and tidy, you cant ask for much more. The maid service was on point and the beds were really comfortable! The parking although not valet is very reasonable for waikiki and there is a parking attendant there all the time. The hotel overall is lovely and a great find in a great location. It is about a 5 Min walk to the marina and another 5 mins to the beach. We would definitely stay here again and if your trying to do waikiki on a budget, which can be difficult this is the place to stay!! Thanks Ramada

Found this on the internet & chose it for a walking base in Waikiki.It cost $35 in a cab from the airport, pulling right up to the front door. It was Halloween & the reception staff were in costume, a nice touch. Check in was quick, we had asked for a high floor & that was what we got. Reception was clean & well organised, the room was spotless, big bed, couple of chairs & desk areas. Small fridge, small microwave and safe.Shower over one of those shallow bath tubs the American hotels like. Good hot powerful showers with shampoo etc there.Lots of local shops and bars etc. Keep an eye out for ABC stores, they're everywhere & sell everything you could want or need.The hotel has a pool, nothing spectacular just a rectangular pool with sun beds etc but it did the job if the busy beach isn't for you. The pool is accessed through the laundry which has a couple of big machines that are on a first come first served basis.An easy flat stroll down the main road to Waikiki beach with lots of shops, markets, restaurants etc. Plenty of bus routes, trolleys etc.The front desk ordered us a cab on departure with no problems.All in all a good stay in a good clean hotel.

We stayed at the Ramada for 4 days and 3 nights and right from the beginning when we walked in the hotel was very clean and just gave you that glowing first impression.The staff was helpful and very nice. Our room was exceptionally clean and tidy. We had a personalized card in our room telling us who cleaned our room and I believe it said "Gina" or "Nina". Room service was also very consistent. I will say I have worked in the hotel and resort business for about 10 years and was very happy with my stay. Thank you for making my first trip to Hawaii a great one!

Close to everything! Stroll the beach morning, noon or night. Shop the streets lined with music, stores and food! Walk to the zoo or watch it all from the balcony of the Ramada. All for a price that could not be beat.

Beautiful balcony view. Nice downtown location. Need to upgrade furnishings. Staff friendly and informative. Did not like the pressure to buy timeshare while visiting. Extra parking fee? Did not know about that though.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our first visit to Hawaii. Check in was quick. As for the interior appearance, I expected more given the Ramada name. Definitely in need of a little remodeling. Not your average luxury hotel but it gives you what you need. A clean room, mini fridge, iron with ironing board, television, and coffee maker. Vending machine on second floor serves drinks only, but the machine was almost empty. Bus Stop and Trolly close by. Eateries and ABC store very close by. All within a five minute walk.

Stayed here for two weeks vacay from Sydney Australia. Staff instantly made me feel like Ohana. Great location close to most places. Can't wait to come back. Joined wyndham rewards before my trip too so I've now earnt points towards my next stay

Needs updating especially the musty carpet. I have stayed in Ramada’s before but this one is easily the worst (tired/old). Plus one elevator was down which was an inconvenience as you waited with a group of 15 other travellers to eventually jam on.

Slightly out of the way of the main shopping/restaurant/beach area however still close enough to walk. The room was clean and comfortable, particularly good beds and pillows. Housekeeping staff are just lovely but the reception staff could be a little more friendly and helpful. The lady on the tour desk was also very good, booking a hire car and tours during our stay. We stayed for 5 nights and this was a good place for this length of stay. Good value for price paid. We would definitely return.

Wonderful hotel. Very friendly staff who are there to help with anything you need. Location is great. Currently still on our holiday. And staying here for 11 nights. Would definately stay here again and recommend this hotel. ThankyouSteven & Aneta - Melbourne Australia

Arrived at 8am after 10 hr flight check in staff couldn’t have been less interested couldn’t check in until 3pm and made us wait until then even though room was ready at 2pm . Room fine smelt old and musty. Not bad location. Male staff and cleaners were pleasant but expected a more friendly place. Rhonda the concierge was amazing friendly and very helpful I wouldn’t recommend this hotel I’ve stayed at Ramada around the world this was the worst. Is close to bus and pick up points and has food places near by but couldn’t get past rudeness of the female staff who checked us in. Even a simple question was too much it was as if we were an inconvenience. Was a very negative start to our trip. We had heard Hawaii is a very friendly place these people were definately not showing the aloha spirit

There is no excuse for the state of this hotel. It has not been renovated in decades. Filthy, musty, damp carpets. Horrible smells, broken lights, disgusting decor. The owner of this property should be ashamed and the hotel should be shut down for health reasons. The poor staff were very friendly and tried their best to help us, but the property is hopeless. We left immediately. Value hotels can be remodelled and updated. Renovation needs to commence immediately.

Jessica Pan and Kevin Shim went out of their way to assist with a special request during my recent visit to Waikiki. This is a less expensive hotel but the service was beyond exceptional. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

We stayed at this hotel for 1 night prior to a cruise. The hotel was adequate for our needs for one night. The room was badly in need of a refurbishment. When we returned from our cruise we stayed at a different hotel

Let's face it you didn't come to Hawaii to stay in your hotel. This hotel is just perfect for a nice sleep, clean, quiet, friendly, and close to everything. No, it's not a resort, but neither are the prices. It's also recently redone so nothing feels old and yucky. We come from and outer island and stay here all the time. You won't be sorry. The locals also give you the best tips on restaurants too.

The Ramada Plaza may be a cheaper option hotel, but the level of service we received was second to none. It's a small hotel compared to some others but it has everything that you need for a comfortable stay. It has tea & coffee making facilities, a mini fridge, microwave, hairdryer & iron in the rooms. Because it's a smaller hotel it's much quieter than the larger ones like the Hawaiin Village Hilton, so for us that was a plus. What made it such an enjoyable stay was the staff, from the housekeeping who made sure our room was immaculately clean, to the concierge who helped us deal with a couple of problems we encountered with transportation. The front desk staff were very welcoming & happy to answer any queries we had. Every staff member we met were happy to chat and very accommodating, we felt very welcome. I have to have an injection to fly & upon my return flight i was concerned about where to put the used injection as i didn't have a sharpes box with me, and the nearby pharmacist was unable to help me. I spoke to the front desk & explained the situation and between us we came up with a solution & they were happy to dispose of it for me. The hotel is in an ideal location, right opposite the Hawaiin Hilton Village and the AliKai hotel, both of which you can walk through to access the beach. There are plenty of eateries nearby if you want to eat out, but there is also the food pantry just around the corner that is like a mini supermarket. The food is really fresh and there is a lot of choice, i would highly recommend, especially for the fruit. A bus stop is located right outside the hotel & all of the tour buses pick up from the Alikai hotel over the road, so everything is on your doorstep. The pool area is small, but is more than suitable for the size of the hotel. The only downside to our visit was that to book trips you cannot pay by cash, they only accept credit/debit cards, but after looking around this seemed to be the case in the majority of the hotels. Unfortunately for us we'd taken cash, but just around the corner by McDonalds is a tour stand run by a lady by the name of Cindy & she does accept cash. A taxi from the hotel into Waikiki can cost anything from $7-$10 dollars depending on where you're going. Overall, this is a fantastic little gem & i wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

This was my second trip to Oahu! I came with 2 friends for an 8 day vacation! Hotel is in a great location! Walking distance to the beach but still far enough away that it’s quiet and not crowded with people! I have to say the staff is AMAZING! Everyone was so friendly! I was always greeted when coming into the lobby! I met Kevin Shim 2 days into our stay! I must say he made my visit so much better! I looked forward to our chats during the day and enjoyed all the stories he told us about Oahu! I have made a friend and will stay here whenever I come back! (I’m going again in May) I met so many guests that were staying in the hotel and learned so much about the countries they came from! This was a favorite vacation of mine! Thank you to all the hotel staff and all the guests I met that made my vacation even better!

This hotel is at the quieter end of Waikiki, opposite Hilton Hawaiian Village where you could find some f&b and ABC groceries stores. Around 10 mins walk to gigantic Ala Moana mall that kept me quite busy. Hotel staff service was acceptable. Complementary coffee provided near main lobby at around 8-10 am. Hotel could do with some refurbishment. Lobby, pool and room are basic and furnishings look tired. No shower gel provided in bathroom (!) only soap. Shower head is fixed not user friendly. Noise level was still ok for level 16 where I was staying except one night was could hear seem like cleaning trucks clearing thrash bins. If you prefer more food and entertainment choices and conveniences, pay a bit more to stay closer at heart of Waikiki.

Excellent location. Friendly and helpful staff. Clean rooms. Microwave and refrigerator in room. HBO. Parking onsite for a fee. Bed was comfortable. Was only in Honolulu for 2 nights after a cruise so was looking for affordable in Waikiki. This hotel checked all of my boxes and then some. We arrived for check in that morning before rooms were ready, but they held our luggage. We would be returning late after a day at the Polynesian Cultural Center, but we were able to have the bellhop take our luggage to our room when it was ready after leaving a tip in the envelope at the front counter. This was nice because we didn't return until after 11:00pm...almost ten hours later. Luggage was in our room waiting for us, and we only had to get our keys from the front desk. Water in the lobby and a computer is available near the elevators. Small gift shop onsite. Room hallways were not air conditioned, but I've come to find this is normal in Hawaii. Air conditioning is not as common there as the mainland. However, it worked great in lobby and room. Hotel is a steps from Waikiki Beach, eateries, and shops.

Great location near hop on and hop off stop. Very friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are large and clean. Microwave and fridge very convenient. Pool is clean with lots of space to lay around and enjoy.

Has an unpleasant oldness smell that most unrefurbished american hotels have. That made me feel miserable and I slept pretty bad. Hope one day they fix it. Also, in the late evening I needed drinking water and there was only a vending maschine without clear water left, had to drink some sugary tea. Not a 3 star hotel. Positive: good bed and sheets, close to Ala Moana beach.

We were scheduled to stay at an Airbnb but it fell through at the last minute. Airbnb comped us this hotel. Had we been planning on staying there for a lengthy stay we would have found something else even though it was free. Extremely dated and noisy. The bed was not comfortable at all. The word basic comes to mind when describing the hotel.

I stayed three nights at the hotel. The walls was very thin and I overheard conversations from other rooms. Although I stayed at the ninth floor I heard the traffic as it almost would have been in the room. On top of that; the air condition was very noisy as well. I used earplugs but it was not enough to keep all noise out. The beds and the pillows was very comfortable. The hotel is a bit worn. You can see it on the furniture as well as on the surfaces.

Needed somewhere to overnight on my way back to Australia after spending some time on the Big Island. I liked the fact that it wasn't too far from the airport or from the action in Waikiki. My Room was quite functional -a comfortable big bed, clean and tidy room, reasonably sized bathroom. The air conditioning in my room was amazing - I set it to arctic cold (I slept so well). I was on the 6th floor with a view of the lane way outside and a tiny balcony if I wanted to sit outside. The hotel itself feels a little old, but reasonably well maintained, the pool area was quite small, but at least it's there if you want a swim. Overall, a nice and tidy hotel, nothing too fancy, but well located and functional. Good value.

Nice hotel with very friendly people who work here. Our room was spotlessly clean and very comfortable. Coffee, fridge, microwave and most importantly a safe. From 06:30 there were hot drinks available in the lobby and there were computers and access to a printer. The location was ok. Not right in the centre of Waikiki but a pleasant walk to there through nice gardens. We found a great place to eat breakfast just over the road and also just across the street is the hotel that Elvis did some filming in. They have a wall showing the great and the good who have stayed there over the years. We arrived the day before everything shut down due to hurricane lane. The hotel posted letters around the hotel and to our room informing everyone what may happen and how to prepare. What more could they do? Thankfully the hurricane didn't arrive and shops and restaurants began to open their doors again. We only used the pool once. Towels are provided and the pool itself was ok. There was a laundry, gym and vending machines but no bar. After a day out in Waikiki it was a nice place to come back to. The hotel was full but it never felt particularly busy, there was always a relaxed feel around the place.

The location is about 15 min walk from downtown Waikiki, directly across from the Hawaiian Hilton village. Plenty of eateries around ( Buffalo Wild Wings,ihop, red lobster etc) a 10 minute walk to a large mall in opposite direction. Wifi was working well and they have cable tv too. The hotel is a little tired but you only sleep there any way and is a budget concious choice

My wife and I stayed here on our way back from Seattle Washington USA. Great central location very clean and friendly service. Close to beaches, transport and restaurants. All at a very reasonable price.

Great Hotel whether you are there for just one night or more. About 10 min to cruise port and walking distance to beach and trolley. Uber was 22.00 one way to airport and about 15.00 to the port. Staff was excellent and personable. Parking was 25.00 per night, but what I understand was cheaper than other hotels. Great location for shopping. Refrigerator and Microwave a plus. ABC Stores to get anything you need right around the corner.

didn't know what to expect so I was pleasantly surprised at how great this hotel was. nice staff, clean room perfect location. easy parking. loved that the room had a microwave and compact refrigerator. will definitely stay here again.

I had a great stay. I don't need much to be happy. This wasn't a place of luxury but that doesn't mean it was a bar place to stay at. I traveled for business and went for the lease expensive hotel in Waikiki to help with the company budget. In any case, I believe that for the dollar this was a great hotel.

This hotel was really nice for the price we paid. It's in a convenient location and at the end of the street corner is a 24 hour cafe which we spent most of our time haha All staff were really nice and helpful too

As a 2-3 star hotel, it's a little bit pricy. If it's around 120 bucks before the tax, as at such a location, I would book it without a hesitation However, everything is so great, 10 out of 10!They let me borrow the towl and keep my luggage in the morning for my snorkelling morning tour when I check out at 7 a.m.! Absoultely Great!

This hotel is acrosss from the Hilton at half the price. This is a modest hotel that is aging but still good . The staff are amazing and helpful. The Ala Moana plaza is a quick walk and it not far from down town. There is abus and trolley stop out the front . There is a chinese restaurant attached but we never ate . I hop is next door and Mcdonald not far if that’s what you are into. Don’t expect a glamour hotel expect a hotel that is safe comfortable and does the job .

accomodations are well maintained . availability of good eating selections within 2 block area. the selections are variable depending on your taste from breakfast to hamburgers and many choices for more executive dinners. acess to the beach is approximately a 20 minute walk. the bus and trolley lines make it unnecessary to renting a car. The concierge is very helpful with arranging tours and very honest about the quality of the tours. i would reccomend the oahu photography tour . the guide was extremely knowledegable of the best areas for great photo opportunities and can enlighten thoes with i phones asm to tips that we were not aware of.

We loved the location of this property as it was slightly away from the main hustle and bustle of Waikiki Beach. As you could imagine travelling in July the Waikiki restaurants and beaches were packed with most having over an hour wait to dine. Closer to the ramada there are plenty of great restaurants with no wait time! The property is also right on trolley pick up points. The hotel was clean and staff were friendly. We would have liked a restaurant or bar at the property. However for the price compared to the other properties at this location it was worth not having these extra amenities.

Since this was the first time I stayed near Waikiki, I don't really have any other properties to compare it to, so I had to compare it to the experience of similar hotels on the mainland. The check-in was fairly quick and incident free. The rooms were a bit small but suffice and clean. The parking was annoying as the spaces are very tight. It was $25 per night in addition to the room rate. If you planned to park here, bring a compact car. It's much easier to maneuver. No free breakfast. Ice machine was on the second floor only. Didn't use the pool but looked clean. We stayed on the 16th floor so we had a nice view of the surrounding buildings. Although I gave this place a three star rating, I'd probably stay here again because the prices is very reasonable and within walking distance to Waikiki beach.

Good location with close proximity to the beach and Ala Moana Shopping Centre. Budget hotel. Hence, don't expect any luxuries. No restaurant within the hotel. Decent pool. Friendly staff. No breakfast. Only tea/coffee at the foyer in the mornings.

This hotel is just opposite the Hilton Hawaiian Village. We only stayed for 1 night for our last night in Waikiki. This feels more like an upmarket motel rather than a hotel so adjust your expectations accordingly. However it’s about half the price of other Waikiki hotels so you get what you pay for. Rooms are rather dark & dated. However this appears to be the norm in Waikiki. But bathroom, whilst no frills, is at least clean & bright. It served its purpose for a quick transit but I wouldn’t want to be spending my entire holiday here.

Had an amazing stay at the Ramada.. was a little concerned it may have been too far away from the main area but it was much better . We crossed the road everyday to the beach and it was fantastic nowhere near as busy as further up . The location you can’t go past it’s a ten minute walk to the ala Moana shopping centre and ten minute walk to the main area of waikiki. Staff were amazing and so easy to deal with and friendly. Wifi is actually the best we had throughout the US . We really enjoyed our stay at Ramada

It's about 20 minutes from the airport on a bustling street about 5 minutes walk to the beach.The rooms are large and well equipped with everything you will need for a comfortable stay. The lobby is surprisingly small but the staff are friendly and helpful. There is a trolly service that runs past the hotel ( actually there are 5 services, each labeled a different color which serve different routes). This service costs $25 per person per day, it is much better to get the city bus, $5.50 (exact change) and get a one day pass. Also download the app,DaBus2, and you can find your way to anywhere .From the airport you can book a ride in advance on Ohana transit, $10 per person.

1. Staff are friendly, they let us check in 1 hour before check-in time because our fly came in 3 hours earlier than check in time.2. Hotel room is small but clean3. There's coffee and ice water at the lobby every morning4. Location is convenient to use bus, walking to mall, markets, mcdonalds...5. Hotel is quiet, we had a good, fully sleep at night.6. Hotel staff let you know right away of your charges at the time of check out.

Good location to access various areas on foot. Comfortable beds and pillows. Clean rooms. Don't recommend breakfast as the Chinese restaurant at the front is also the venue for breakfast. Buffet only and expensive given that there are plenty of other places to go to on the same block. Would stay again.

Reception staff at this hotel managed to ruin our first day in Hawaii. Yes, we arrived early and, although we emailed requesting an earlier check in, this is never guaranteed. Nothing is available we are told when we arrive. No problem we say to the lady, we will go out and get something to eat, have a walk to kill a couple of hours, then come back by which time rooms are likely to be free. But when we come back this same lady looks at us surprised and says we’re too early. Then she says that if we want to check in early we will have to pay an extra $70! There was no mention of this when we were in earlier!Just what we needed after an exhausting overnight flight. Camping out in the crappy Ramada lobby for hours. The staff know we are there the whole time and make zero effort to get us an available room. Or are we to believe every guest in this hotel checks out at one minute to noon?!I will never come back.

This Location is awesome, It's in the heart of the main attraction of Honolulu. The Beach, shopping Malls, Transport are all in walking distance.The staff are very friendly and ready to go the extra mile

I gave this a 5 star rating mostly for cleanliness which to me is important. The entire hotel is spotless, staff is cordial and check in/out went smooth. This hotel is near all the Waikiki area and also near bus stops if needed. Across the street is the Hilton Hawaiian Village with many shops and restaurants, behind that is ocean swimming. I found a delicious Shrimp truck beyond that in the parking lot, Gilligan's. Very good! I would stay in this hotel again.

We just needed a place to stay for one night on our way back home from one of the other islands. This was good value, nice and central location and it was clean. The service was good and friendly too. No frills but good value.

Perfectly fine place to stay if on budget. Close to the beach and shops. Bus stop at door. Staff very friendly. They should supply scales to weigh luggage downstairs. Pool very basic. Not much parking. Very strange smell outside the ffront of hotel. The restaurant on site average for meals.

Given the moderate price compared to many other hotels with a pool, I had very modest expectations for my one night lay over. So I was pleasantly surprised: my room was very clean and comfortable with more space and amenities than I was expecting. The pool was welcome after a long flight and was open until 9 pm. The staff were efficient, friendly and helpful. I was directed to an american style diner down the road for breakfast, which was fine. The hotel is not particularly attractive on the outside, but this shouldn't put you off. The much more expensive Hilton is across the road, with the beach and lagoon just behind it.

We used the hotel for a layover from Vancouver to Sydney. The Ramada brand in Asia is apparently different to that in the USA and other parts of the world. Also we did not realise the cost of hotels in Honolulu was comparatively so much higher than in Asia.We were disappointed with our room as the photos on the websites appear enhanced compared to reality. The manager was extremely helpful and changed our room for another. He explained the situation of comparable standards around the globe for Ramada. The lobby wasn’t somewhere where one could relax so we went to the Hilton, Westin or Hyatt. Entertainment and food at the Hilton Hawaiin Village was nearby.There was no offer to help with luggage although the staff were very helpful and polite. The room was well appointed with power outlets, USB connectivity and wifi. Coffee in the room but we had to buy fresh milk from a nearby ABC store.The location was fine for transport and the beach.Would we stay again no. Mainly because we wouldn’t come back to Hawaii because of the high cost of hotels. Also the food available is so bad, typical of the USA. At least at the Cheesecake Factory you can get a decent salad.

Ramada Hotel is a great Location very close to everything the Beach is right across the streetThe food is everywhereMy room is very clean they gave refrigerator inside the room that really help especially when it's got outside u can store your waters and JuicesThey do have a microwave ABC stores r on each block so u buy a lot of fun items,The front desk Mgrs were so nice to me many thanks I will be returning in Aug WOW I love it that much ! It's not a fancy hotel but it's a wonderful price and very clean buses r outside to take u to the Mall and around the city!! Don't eat at that MacDonald on the corner they don't have air condition and its to expensive u can grab something at the ABC Store they are famous for Spam@egg@rice $1.99 - Check it outAll in All I had a wonderful time the gift shop inside the hotel was very cuteI am very lucky to travel to many wonderful places to share with u all Please book the Ramada . TONYA - 1115 -

I can’t say enough about the customer service at the Ramada Waikiki. They were friendly, accommodating and excellent hosts. This property is an easy walk or cheap Uber to the heart of Waikiki and it’s very reasonably priced. The parking is easy and staff is available 24-7. Nearby is IHOP, several diners, ABC convenient stores and a park across the street. If you’re busy all day why waste money on a huge resort with a hefty price tag when the Ramada is clean, comfy and friendly for a fraction of the price? This is our new favorite in Waikiki.

Close to shopping, restaurants and beach. Parking expensive but secure with around the clock attendant. Smaller hotel that you dont have to walk a mile to get from point a to point b. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Was a good place to stay! The staff was very friendly and helpful. I do wish the pool had been open longer but that’s okay. I also would like a breakfast buffet with vegetarian options. This hotel does offer a discount for breakfast at the place next door though

Stayed for 4 nights and never had a problem. Parking will cost you $25 extra per night. It's close to just about everything and the staff was always helpful. The rooms are clean with plenty of room. I was very happy for the value of this hotel. Other, much much more expensive hotels are nearby, but why pay so much more when you end up on the same beach?

the room was not overly large but very adequate. We had two suitcases sprawled out, so it was tight. But the room was very clean and kept well. it was not overly used and did not show wear. I would stay there again in a heart beat!

Spent a couple nights here to see a bit more of the western end of the tourist district after staying near the zoo to start with. Nothing spectacular, but nothing bad either. Well situated for walking to Ala Moana Mall also, and the major bus lines running between Pearl Harbor and Waikiki stop right in front of the hotel. One of them stops at the airport also.Wailana coffee shop/diner is at the end of the block and Goofy Cafe is across the street if you're looking for classic and modern versions of diner food and breakfast. The Cobb Salad at Goofy could be the biggest I've ever seen.Room was a bit on the smallish side, and furnishings were a bit stodgy for my taste but clean and in good shape. Did not try the chinese buffet restaurant that serves breakfast at the front of the hotel property. Not sure of any amenities, as we just slept in the room and that was it. Seems like there was a bunch of tour offerings in the lobby but I didn't really pay close attention.Would I go back? Not sure. Would probably try someplace else for a change of scenery, since the main thing this place has going for it is value pricing.

This hotel was close to everything. The bus stops right in front. Although there is no restaurant in the hotel, we never ate at the same restaurant twice in 5 days. The bed was firm and the pillows were fine: some hard, some soft. There were no

We stayed for 3 nights. The hotel was clean and the staff very pleasant and helpful. Good location, close to a mall and some very good restaurants. No view of the beach (lots of high rises in the way), but it is within walking distance. There is a pool, looked clean, but we never got a chance to use it. It isn't a l.luxury hotel, but it is very nice and a great value. Bed was very comfortable. Hair dryer and coffee pot in room.

The Ramada was an excellent experience for a Hawaiian vacation. The rooms were very clean and staff friendly and accommodating. I would thoroughly recommend staying at this hotel. Its location is central to all parts of Waikiki.

The tittle of my review pretty sum up it all. A comfortable nice little hotel tucked in on a side road of the main Ala Moana Boulevard. Nothing fancy, but you get all amenities you need. The room even has a microwave, besides the usual tea/coffee machine and fridge.Coin operated laundry machine, ice, gym, and pool located on the 2nd floor.Bus stops and beaches are within short walk. Many food outlets nearby.Stay here if you just need a place to sleep while enjoying Honolulu. Unless, of course, if you want to splurge and have a view of the ocean from the plush beach hotels.

I stayed for five nights. My overall experience was good. Location-wise this hotel is great. A bus stop is just on the opposite side of the street. You can take buses to the Waikiki beach. There are a convenience store, IHop, McDonalds, an indian restaurant, a chinese place nearby.

Surroundings not as nice as other Hotels. The Hilton, by the beach, was awesome to hang out at. Waterfalls outside and ponds with gold fish, blue fish. That would've been my number one choice next time I stay.

Great location, Friendly staff and very helpful. We enjoyed the fireworks across the street on Friday. Its close to the beach, shopping, Diamond head and a great local spot for breakfast. Rooms were clean and room service was just fine.

We stayed for one night before flying out. Check-in was easy and our room was nice, clean and quiet (facing away from the main street). Parking is a staggering $25 a night, but we didn't have time to drive around and find any alternatives. It's a 15 minute or so walk to Waikiki Beach, so just keep that in mind. There are some restaurants and such nearby, but we just went to Waikiki, so I can't say if they're good or not. All in all, it's an easy place to stay and a short walk to the beach.
Everything about the hotel was fine- A little walk to the beach. No breakfast only coffee, but there were restaurants close by

Excellent location, walking distance to beach, shopping and resteraunts. The staff was outstanding, professional and helpful with any questions or issues. The room was very clean but the air conditioner was so loud that at night it had to be turned off and if you didn't leave it on during the day the room smelled musty. We enjoyed our time there.
Definitely recommend to family and freinds. Was pleasant stay. It should be best if parking can be free and offer simple break fast. But over all very good.

Just want to say thanks to the team at Ramada Plaza Waikiki. All the staff that we had the pleasure of dealing with were very helpful and friendly. Nothing was of any trouble at all. The hotel is clean and very comfortable. The location was ideal for us. Out of the centre of the Waikiki so its a little quieter but close enough so its not far to get in there if you want. Transport is right out the front for The Bus and Trolleys. $5.50 gets you a day pass to use on all the buses which was very handy for getting downtown and out to Diamond Head as well as Pearl Harbour. Plenty of dining options within walking distance or just get the bus if it's too far to walk. So easy. Close to the beach as well without the Beachfront Resort price and no resort fee as well. Bonus!. Ala Moana shopping center is not far away, either walk it or catch the bus in just 3 stops. Easy. Thanks again and look forward to staying there again.Mahalo.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Ramada. Although the rooms are on the smaller side they're very comfortable. We're a family of four and were pleased with our stay. The hotel is close to everything and we appreciated not being in the middle of Waikiki but close enough to walk to. We will definitely stay here again and will recommend this hotel to friends and family. We wanted to say a big thank you to Grace from room service who went above and beyond in keeping our room clean everyday; it was a pleasure to walk into at the end of a beach day. I also want to thank Rachel at the front desk. Every time we dealt with her she was helpful, accommodating, and truly caring about our experience; not everyone at the front desk was this way. Mahalo!
Only here for the weekend, even though we just needed a place to sleep (we were out and about most of the days) it was a good location, good price for our weekend getaway.

If you don't plan to spend much time in your room this is a great way to save and still be close to the beautiful beach!! Awesome little diner on the corner to get your veggies in and have kids eat for cheap! Pool was great, and our entire Honolulu experience was wonderful! Would definitely stay here again! Might try to get a room with a Lanai for when the kids go to sleep!

I am mobility limited and there was not any parking close to the door for me at all. As a matter of fact, I was abruptly told that parking is around the corner in spaces 9 through 45. Even though $20 was paid per night to park, I was made to walk more than the buildings length to get there. I am used t shuttles and or transportation to and from hotels, perhaps not at the Ramada. My 1st time here. The Timeshare people will shuttle you to their presentation, and keep you longer than you want, but not to the mall, airport, beach, etc.

Well this is our 9th visit to Honolulu and the first to the Ramada. Well this is the worst hotel I have ever experienced. Total lack of interest in their jobs that I have ever come across and being gold with Wyndham has no value at all. This is our 2nd night and we come back to the room and it has not been cleaned. It is an extremely old hotel and desperately needs a good clean all over. Air conditioning is lousy. Lucky it is not summer. But I have stayed in older hotels and had a great time. You can just feel that the staff are totally disinterested in their jobs or are extremely unhappy either way it delivers an unpleasant experience for the guests

I decided a few months ago to have my 50th birthday in Hawaii and for me it had to be Honolulu. So 5-0 in Hawaii five-0 it was. I chose the Ramada because as a Wyndham member it offered me a great location and a reasonable cost. The hotel has been renovated in recent years and was in good shape when I stayed there. We had the 2 queen beds jr suite and the room was very large and had a the kitchenette if you wanted to save a few dollars on your stay. The beds were very comfortable and we even had a bit of a view. The bathroom could have been a little larger, but was manageable. I would definitely stay there again. The staff at the hotel were all friendly and helpful.

3 night stay, kamaaina and out of town family occupied several rooms and suite to hangout before the wedding, and dress for the big day. Hotel was close to great restaurants. Staff was friendly and very accommodating, rooms were clean and comfortable.

Check in was quick and helpful. the rooms were above average. but clean and tidy and the house keeping was very good. the concierge was helpful and informative. advising us of the best places to eat and what attractions on offer during our short stay. Plus it was a short walk to Waikiki beach.

Just had a 5 night stay. What a little suprize of a hotel. After reading reviews I didn't expect much , at time I made booking was the cheapest option I had to be close to other family members who I was joining for a celebration event. Staff were good , room was super clean every day after maids came in. Hotels not bad location, u can walk to Ala Moana shopping. Cut through Hilton to get to beach. Bus stop out front. Hotel has front and back access so was good for our über drivers to get in and out. Good quick food options close by. I'm so fussy with beds. This bed was fine I actually slept all night , I bring my own pillow everywhere but my friend said even pillows good. So yeah no problems at all staying there.
Great value and location. And don't miss Goofy's across the street for a fresh and unique dining experience.
We were in town overnight before a cruise. This hotel was nice and relatively reasonable priced. It was a short walk to the beach and plenty of restaurants within walking distance too.
This is a simple, lovely hotel just about 2 blocks from the beach. Really great location, and way less expensive than other options nearby. Clean room, friendly staff, pretty lobby. No complaints!
We had a good stay at this hotel. The housekeeping staff did a great job. The room was a little small but was good for the price and location.

Hotel was pretty clean. Rooms were outdated. Wall A/C units made the room feel damp whenever they were on. Had a odd experience with my shower...the water pressure would cut out completely (as in no water coming out) when the handle was turned to halfway between hot and cold, so my options were either too hot or too cold. Reported this to the front desk after my first of four nights but nothing was done about it.
This hotel was clean, beds and pillows were comfortable, bathroom was clean and every request was fulfilled. I would definitely stay again.
Hotel meet our needs for overnight stay before cruise. Does need updates and carpeting on our floor is in need of repair! Employees were nice and helpful with diner suggestions

The Toilet does not flush very well easily stopped up. Tried to contact front desk from my room at check out could not get help by phone one touch dialing for Bell Person and Front desk not working. Employees not attentive at front desk.

This hotel is located walking distance to the Ala Moana shopping center (10 min.) and across the Hilton Hawaiian Village. It is a short walk to the heart of Waikiki (15 min.) and the beach (10 min.). The rooms are very comfortable, spotless and the service personnel are attentive and welcoming. The beds are the best. There is a wonderful underutilized swimming pool and lounge area with sun there much of the day as well as most of the year. I have stayed at the Ramada Plaza many times.
Attentive, friendly staff (Mahalo!). Rooms are clean and cozy. Location is conveniently located near the beach as well as shopping downtown, you can walk to just about any spot.

we are a family of 4 (2xadults2xchidlren) on a recent trip to hawaii for 7 days I had booked the ramada plaza....firstly it should not be called a hotel its the size of a motel and the rooms are old and dated. Although booked for 7 nights we checked out after 4 nights (should have done that earlier) and moved to the marriot waikiki. If you are staying in Ramada you are about 20 minutes walk from the main beach area so it is not very convenient to step out for a swim @beach or lunch/shopping/coffee. The only good thing is that they charge any resort fees which most hotels in waikiki do charge but that is built in to their price as they are not coming cheap for the services at offer. The hotel itself is old and dated and so are the bed rooms and bathrooms...you will totally be away from the main action waikiki beach so my recommendation is to spend a little bit more and stay at one of the good hotels on the main strip i.e. kalakaua ave where you can use the pool and relax with lovely cocktails. fyi....There is a pool in ramada but it was cold and deserted.
This hotel is nothing fancy but when you’re in Hawaii why do you need anything fancy! The location was great and the staff was nice. The room was clean and we had everything we needed!

Front desk personnel were not friendly at check in. We had to pay for parking, which was not indicated any where on their website. And there where several repairs that need to be made to the rooms and the lobby

As a lifelong East Coast resident who has been to nearly all of the fifty (50) states, I always yearned to visit Hawaii. Finally, I was able to journey out to Hawaii for a week in 2018 from late February to early March. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. For example, a staff member taught me about an app to use for my cellular telephone in order to learn about the bus schedules. The hotel valet assisted me in how to open a coconut; obviously, this role was not a part of his job duties. Also, when I called the front desk to ask if I could obtain some shaving cream, a staff member actually brought the shaving cream to my door! I frequently conversed with staff members, housekeeping, and parking attendants, and everyone was always a pleasure to be around. The pool is beautiful and it is surrounded by coconut trees. There is a gym on the premises which is always open. There is a business center, and the views from the rooms are incredible! Most of the major sites in Honolulu are within walking distance, and if one is able to walk a few miles, he or she can visit most of the major attractions without the need to use a bus. Moreover, a bus stop is conveniently located right next to the hotel. One of my favorite features of the hotel is that it is roughly a five (5) minute walk to Waikiki Beach. Despite this hotel's location which is so close to the action, there is fortunately not much noise. The hotel was very clean, and my room came with a television, telephone, coffee/tea, microwave, and a refrigerator. The housekeeping staff would come by each morning to make the beds and to clean the bathroom. I thought that based on the excellent service and the fact that this hotel is in such a central location, I was very fortunate to pay approximately $150.00 per night. Many of the adjacent hotels charged much more money than the Ramada Waikiki. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone, and I would definitely stay here again. My only recommendation would be to serve a continental breakfast, but otherwise, I was a very satisfied guest.

This hotel represents a very good value. Our room was very well maintained, the service was very good, and the location convenient. If your objective is to have easy access to a beach, this location may not be ideal. But if your goal is sight seeing, shopping, dining, etc., the location is perfect. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Paid a little extra to have a lanai (balcony). We were on the "Penthouse" floor. Was expecting something a bit nicer being on the "penthouse" level, but our room was clean and well stocked. I never get a car when I'm staying in Waikiki as the parking fees can be $30 a night on top of your room. And you don't really need a car. Between The Bus and Uber, you can get anywhere in the city and not equal the $30 a day parking fee. The location is really walkable to all of Waikiki.

I travel to Oahu semi-regularly for business, and I always try to stay at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki. While the rooms could benefit from a refresh, the hotel offers excellent value with its dependable, clean rooms. The staff have always been extremely welcoming and courteous. The hotel is located at the edge of Waikiki, so you can get away from the hustle and bustle of the tourist strip, but there are still plenty of food options within a short walk. If you are looking for a clean, dependable hotel in Waikiki, I'd recommend the Ramada Plaza.

Nice but dated hotel. Comfortable and quiet. We were just needing one night to have some rest after long flight before we joined our family. Bed was comfy and super nice pillows. Staff friendly. There is a $25 fee to park your car.

My husband and I flew into Honolulu and before moving on to the Big Island, decided to explore Oahu. The Ramada Plaza Waikiki was our "home" for four days. Although we didn't have an ocean view room, we enjoyed our stay there. Wonderful, welcoming staff - comfortable balcony room - frig and microwave - cozy beds. There's a bus stop right outside the hotel and Waikiki Beach is a very short walk away. Restaurants, bars, shops, car rental, etc... within a few blocks. A pretty good value for Waikiki.

My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights. The front deask staff were very welcoming and helpful. We were in room 1514 at the end of the hall so it was very quiet. The room was clean for the most part although the carpet had not been vacumed. There was a microwave and mini fridge which we took advantage of to have breakfasts in our room. Lots of drawer space but a small closet with not many hangers. Iron and iron board included. The bathroom counter was quite low. I am 5'3" and it was even a bit low for me. If you are tall, t his would be uncomfortable. The beds were comfy. Conveniently located a ross from the Hilton Hawaiian Village which has a Friday night fireworks show. Lots of restaurants nearby and a bus stop right in front of the hotel. Self (paid) parking . Join the Wynham club and save on daily parking fee.

Great location, affordable prices, friendly and helpful staff. 24 hour front desk. Close to restaurants and public transport. Also has a tour desk with reasonable deals. Swimming pool and facilities. Walk to fireworks at Hilton Hawaiian Village

This is a review and we didn't actually stay there. However, Kristen Pagtulingan is one of the more responsive front reservation staff of any hotel. She immediately responded to e mails, very helpful, even when we had to cancel. Professional and responsive - great qualities for front desk!

We had a volleyball tournament at the Hawaii Convention center and we picked the perfect hotel with the perfect location. Staff was very friendly and helpful! Will definitely be staying here for future reservations.

This was a great hotel to stay in...the front line staff were very helpful and always smiling...check in was speedy, rooms were clean, AC worked well. great location, always had a spot for the rental car. We would stay here again!

Paid for a king bed but was given a double. No compensation was made. Was given a different room the next night but we were only there for two nights. Such a pain to pack everything up again. And there never seemed to be a supervisor on duty when I asked!

This is not a five star hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean, but dated. The signage said vending machines on 2and floor. When you get to the room marked vending machines, it has Ice maker and washer/dryer. Never found the vending machines. A block away is an ABC store.

We stayed here for a week in January and were very pleased with the hotel.The hotel is directly across the street from Hilton Hawaiian Village and right across the street from the beach.The room was nice and had a fridge and microwave in it.We did have to switch rooms once due to a malfunctioning toilet ,which was no big deal to us .The staff provided us excellent service with our luggage and were very friendly.The price of the room was definitely the best value in Waikiki and the room was always clean and well stocked!

Mid range hotel, conveniently located with bus stop right outside and pink line bus two minutes away. Comfortable rooms, quiet pool with sun lounges and plenty of towels. No resort fee which is good for Waikiki
I just moved to Honolulu & this was the first place I landed while looking for an apartment. The staff was amazing & went above & beyond during my stay.

It was a great stay at the Ramada. It was close to the beach. Quiet and clean. Had lots of restaurants near the hotel. The staff were friendly and were always happy to assist in where we should go next. The coffee in the morning was really good in the lobby.

Great location. Walking distance to places to eat. Clean room. Loud fans but was able to get a good night's rest. They provide matrix biolage shampoo and conditioner which was nice. I would recommend to family and friends. No resort fees. Parking is 25/night. Uber was easy to catch if you didn't want to walk around. Staff was friendly. Complimentary Tea/coffee/water available for limited time daily.
We stayed just a few blocks from Waikiki. In the past, we have stayed on Waikiki. It was so much more relaxing this time being just a few steps back from the hustle and bustle. Great

Very good clean hotel, The pool was one the cleanest. Loved the location right across the Blvd from Hilton Hawaiian Village and Kobe Steak House restaurant. Could not have been a better location for my stay. Would stay there again..

Firstly Nice staff ! Now the bad, very old outdated Hotel, it is surrounded by food options and not far from the action. My biggest complaint is noise that is preventable. I am a day sleeper and house keeping staff has no respect for guests that may be sleeping. Talking to other house keepers very loudly and lots of banging around while cleaning other rooms. No considuration what so ever. Business center very outdated. Rooms are clean but bathrooms very small.

We needed a hotel for our last night in Honolulu. We wanted to be near Waikiki and wanted to use some Wyndham Rewards points. We chose the Ramada Plaza Waikiki and used 3000 points on a "go fast" reward. It cost us less than $100.00. A shared ride from the airport dropped us right at the door of the hotel. Check in was quick and the desk workers were very friendly. We got dinner suggestions from them. The hotel is right on Ala Moana Blvd across from the Hilton Hawaiian Village, which has fireworks on Friday nights. They gave us directions where to walk for the best viewing. Our room was on the top penthouse floor and had a great view, but the fireworks were blocked. We walked a short distance to view them. The room was comfortable. The only complaint was that it has the old style AC unit on the wall under a window. It was very loud and my wife couldn't sleep so we had to turn it off.
The Hotel Was great . If you plan to go see the Volcano give yourself plenty of time , Because it is 96 miles and slower speed limits to get there.

Guy at the front desk was nice and friendly. We were able to check into our room at 1:30. We got lucky and were given one of the few balcony rooms. Decor is dated, but we didn't care much. The room was clean. When you consider the room is less expensive then most Waikiki hotels, 5 stars. 4 or 4.5 stars for the non-balcony rooms.

Nice reasonably priced hotel close to beach, restaurants, shoppingThis is a medium size hotel, located across from the Ilikai and Hilton Hawaiian village. The rooms are fair sized, clean, with fridge and microwave, which we used everyday. Our room had 2 large beds with shower-bathtub. The lobby is very clean and comfortable, They provided pots of brewed Kona coffee and hot water for tea between 7Am till noon free of charge. Next door was a Chinese buffet restaurant with decent offering and price. Within blocks is a Red Lobster, Mcdonald, Wailana 24 hr Cafe. Or you can walk to the Ala Moana mall with a huge food court and Foodland Farms supermarket with choices of grocery and fruits at reasonable prices. There is a bus stop out by hotel where you can catch The Bus of Honolulu to Pearl Harbor (Arizona Memorial ), Honolulu airport, within walking distance you can catch the bus to Hanauma Bay, Diamondhead crater trails, Sea life Park. Our location was unbeatable, we did not need a rental car during our stay.Would stay at this hotel again next time.

We stayed at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki for one week. The staff was great. Very friendly. The room looked clean but dated. Could have used more accessible plug ins. The plug behind the nightstand between the beds was fully occupied by the alarm clock and the lamp. The extra plug in the lamp was occupied by the telephone. There was a couple usb plugs in the phone but they did not support quick charging.Hair dryer in the bathroom, microwave, small refrigerator and room safe. Small issue with the fridge, the bar on the door shelf kept falling off.Not much of a view. Surrounded by tall buildings. There is a tiny sliver of an ocean view between buildings. My only concern with the room was the door between the adjoining room and mine. From my side the door looked fine. When I opened the door, the other side looked as if it had been repaired with masking tape and then painted. Not very secure if you do not know the people next door.5 minute walk to the beach and the lagoon by the Hilton. Loved our stay and would return.

The staff members are very friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and professional, especially the Front Desk agents. It's also a great location. I would highly recommend this property to my family and friends.
It’s not a bad location close to Waikiki beach. I was just surprised at the quality it felt stuffy but now knowing of other hotels around we are more likely so stay elsewhere.

We stayed there for 5 nights in January and found the hotel clean and centrally located. Unfortunately while we were staying there the missle warning was issued. The staff did nothing to calm the fears or offer any advice or assistance to the guests. Several were clearly upset but were not approached by any member of the staff. When asked what the procedure was I was told that the desk clerk would be hanging out with co-workers. They really didn’t seem to care and only offered the advice that we should find someplace safe. Not what any of us were hoping for from an upscale hotel. Hopefully something like this never happens again but just in case you might want to train the staff in caring, compassion and emergency preparedness.
Service and staff were great! We enjoyed our stay and the view was amazing!! I recommend staying here

We stayed at the Ramada Plaza a couple months ago because I had to fly in to Oahu from Maui for a medical procedure. The hotel was very busy but could tell we were exhausted (we were only in town for one day so we flew in on the earliest flight and then drove to North Shore) and were able to secure a room for us quite quickly before the official check in time, which was very nice of the staff. The hotel is in a great location. I loved that there was plenty within walking distance or just a short drive. Just two doors down is the coffee shop where they film Hawaii 5-0 sometimes. I walked by and recognized it immediately. The International Marketplace and the Ala Moana Center are very close to the hotel. What made me the most happy was how accommodating staff were to us. They gave us a late check out after I explained why we were in town and were very understanding. My medical procedure was in the morning so I would be groggy after and the later check out allowed me to rest before flying home. When we left the housekeeping employees were waiting kind of outside the room- we must have been their last room. We felt bad but they were in such good moods and very happy they did not make me feel like a burden. Staff here showed the aloha spirit. Thank you for being so kind.

We had an overnight trip to Oahu for a little staycation/medical visit and stayed at the Ramada Plaza. Great location with walking distance to many sites. Not super fancy but very clean and comfortable. We were offered early check in and the staff were extremely nice. Parking was convenient - easy in and out. Will book again!

This hotel is across the road from the Hilton Hawaiin Village and is a cheaper alternative to the expensive rooms there. You will get a decent bed etc. here at a more reasonable price. A short walk to the beach.Check in was impersonal and cold. Staff do not seem to value guests and do not seem keen to help them ( they should we pay their wages and can go to other hotels!). As it was not check in time, I was not able to access my room ( I found it hard to believe that all rooms in the hotel were not available). Nevertheless no effort was made to inform me that as soon as a room was available , they would call me. It was pretty much - "come back at check in time". This is silly if the room can be made available before check in time - it is good customer focused service to try and get a guest in their room before check in time ( which is late at this hotel - 3pm).Curtains only close a 1/4 of the way over white curtains ( not sure if these are see through at night when lights are on).No green tea available and staff do nothing if you request this - they do not seem to care.Wifi is free and seems to work ok.Check out time is 12pm which is good.Radio available - but no list of radio stations.Bath was faulty - the plug to keep the water in the tub was not working.If you want sheets changed you will need to leave a card on your bed.There is a sign saying that you can request a toothbrush, toothpaste, comb, razor, shaving cream and deoderant if you need these - this is helpful if you need any of these.Bible is available in the room which is helpful for those wanting to read and pray.They have water, tea and coffee in the lobby in the morning but this seems to disappear in the afternoon and evening.Computers in lobby provide free internet.There is a travel info. desk in the lobby but I found the staffmember there not very helpful and interested.The luggage you ask staff to mind is not stored away - you can see it in the lobby area - could be stolen.Some staff are not professional - e.g. one manager does not give their full name when writing formal letters to guests - this makes it difficult to reply to the right person and address them appropriately.

Good hotel. Couldn't beat the price since we used our Wyndham Reward Points! Desk staff was attentive and helpful. Good pool, workout room and laundry room. Many restaurants close by. A little tricky to get to the beach but it is walkable. Room was clean and hotel well-kept.

As others have said, if you're expecting 5 stars than just go to the Hilton Village and pay a ton more. If you're looking for a nice place to stay that's in a great location at a great price, this is it! Walked the end to end beach that's just a couple blocks away, and enjoyed all the shops and restaurants near by. Also enjoyed the pool, and the staff were fantastic.

We had a room on the 16th floor, looking at the city. It was noisy outside but since the windows do not open, we slept very well. Inside, it was very quiet. The room was fine. The air conditioning was a bit loud at night, but did not prevent us from sleeping well. It would have been nice to have a balcony, for the difference in price, I would take a room with a balcony next time. The room is not newly decorated, but quite fine. We had a king bed room with microwave and small fridge. The free Internet in the room was good and convenient. The elevator was very fast. The people at the counter were nice and efficient. No problem for us. There is a ABC store and a Food Pantry not far where we got some decent food. Convenient for public transportation and the beach is very near. The hotel is located across the street from the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Overall, it is not a new fancy hotel, but it is very well located and clean, and the price is good for Waikiki.

Waikiki is expensive so we got this at a bargain when a booking agent had had 50% off. Hotel was adequate for our needs - away from the madness of Waikiki beach but close enough to bars and restaurants. Room was clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. Our room had a fridge and a microwave but no cutlery or plates etc, just didn't see the point in having those facilities without any plates. It's across the road from the Hilton that has the fireworks on a Friday and also down the road is the Brewery which does great food/happy hour.

I was very satisfied of my stay at this hotel.It exceeded my expectations.The hotel is one of the most economic in Honolulu but it is quite comfortable and the staff is quite nice.In my stay the breakfast was not included and so I went to a near Starbucks.

We moved from the Hilton to Ramada Plaza and wasn’t sure how well the room will be as we were moving from a five star to a three.We were pleasantly surprised to see our room which was the same level as the Hilton. Rooms were clean and well presented. Excellent house keeping and in house do it your own laundry etc. The room was a bit small compared to the Hilton but the Ramada had a Microwave oven which Hilton didn’t have. Every thing you want from a five star was in this three star hotel. We stayed for five days with the family. No complaints. Well done Guys!

This was our 5th time to Oahu and our first stay with Ramada plaza. This was absolutely the best hotel experience! At check in Kimo was very friendly, helpful and knowlegable and definetely demonstrated a high level of customer service, he made us feel welcome right away along with the rest of the staff. There is an excellent coffee shop a couple stores down and the beach is a close walking distance. The beds and rooms were so comfortable. We loved everything! We will be back! Little tip..dont buy boogie boards or floaties the hotel has so many from guests checking out and leaving them there just ask.

The hotel is in a great location on the main strip. The staff was very friendly and helpful. However, the woman at the travel desk wasn't as helpful. She definitely wasn't looking to assist if it didn't relate to money in her pocket. The facilities were fine. The room was clean it just wasn't anything special or that stood out.
Very clean. Close to the beach. Front desk staff was very helpful, and was able to guide us to where interested in visiting.
Dated building. Comfortable beds and rooms are clean. Friendly and helpful staff. Great location in Waikiki!

My wife and I stayed 2 nights at Ramada Plaza Waikiki, chosen for its location and brandname.Whilst location was exactly what we wanted, and the property was in good order, we were disappointed with the attitude of front desk personnel who checked us in. For someone working in hospitality, there was no warmth or smiles when dealing with guests, instead a rather sour face greeted us. Not a good impression at all. I hope management would appoint people with aptitude for the job at hand.
Was not happy that you had to pay $ 20. per night for parking. Only paid $ 12. closer to the beach.

Clean. No bugs. Someone left their lunch. The cable sucks. Free HBO was all static. Parking has zero security is on street level. The room rumbles when the door next door slams close. It’s noisy. I heard people talking and sirens. I was told the cheap rooms are always their worst. I called front desk regarding someone’s food left in room. I was told housekeeping would be right up. After waiting 45 minutes with not seeing anyone I placed the bag of food outside the door.

We stayed for about a week and were disappointed here in comparison to other Ramada or Wyndham properties. The hotel is very dated and carpet/furniture clearly worn, everything seemed to be on the cheap side: flimsy coffeemaker, air-con unit in room blows air behind the curtains, totally non-descript hallways. The pool deck had a few chairs around it but the noise and the constant passing by of staff made it unbearable to be outside (the staff lounge is off the pool deck so everyone walks by, we counted 18 people in 12 minutes). Some staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful, others not so much. The housekeepers left dark hair behind almost every day (in the bed, on the bathroom counter). What did we like, you ask: the location and reasonably priced parking at $20 per day for Wyndham members.

Well situated hotel with easy access by car, on foot and public transit. Clean comfortable rooms. Excellent cleaning staff. I object to paying for parking when I am staying at a hotel. We stayed six nights and still had to pay for parking for the one night we had a car.

I stayed at this hotel in late November, one of the days being Thanksgiving. It was a quick ride from the airport. It was very centrally located with an ABC Store located just downstairs and to the left. They have just about any Sundries or beverages including alcohol that you can think of. It's also the most reasonable place around to shop for tourist'y souvenirs.The hotel was staffed with friendly, and efficient front desk help.Just down the block on the same side was an incredibly Charming local Diner and it had a decent salad bar. (Also the most reasonable prices in town). The wait staff was cheery and very professional there. All in all I can highly recommend the Ramada over the Hilton which was a horrible stay for me during the same trip. The maid removed a bag of my personal items and the Hilton was absolutely horrible about the unfortunate situation.I used to prefer Hilton's over Ramada but being out about a grand has made me revisit Ramada and I was SO VERY PLEASED with my short stay there.

The staff was excellent and very courteous, professional, & helpful. The location is perfect with walking distances to the beach and many local attractions. You are in downtown Honolulu / Wakiki so the expected sound of the city is all around. The rooms are dated but well kept and we very much enjoyed the balcony.

Friendly staff. Rooms are a bit dated and small but only stayed for 1 night luckily. They had a little shop for souvenirs. And a restaurant attached that you get a discount for. I liked that they had chargers for you attached to the phone. Very convenient.

Stayed here for a week recently. First impression starts at check in and when you have a unhelpful rude person across the counter it does not set the tone for your stay. It was clear that if I was from an asian backgound I would of been treated better! Seems they have different rules for different races. Yes the room is old but I knew that when booking however the room and bathroom were spotless each day. Well done to the maid who worked hard each day. Bed was comfortable so if the front desk attitude changed this would be a good place to stay as it was a quick 10 min walk to Ala Moana and around a 15 min walk to Waikiki.

We chose the Ramada Plaza Waikiki because of it's easy access to everything we had planned for our stay on Oahu. The room was comfortable and clean and we slept very well on the bed. The enterance driveway was a little hard to find, but everything else was fine. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful.
Geat location, staff very helpful. We enjoyed our stay and the area was very close to all downtown.
I highly recommend this hotel! Great accommodations and wonderful staff at a very reasonable price!

stayed for 10 days was pleased and surprise for a 3 star hotel,rooms were always very cleaned all the basic amenities great bed,staff friendly close to the beach hilton fireworks ala moana centre 5 minute walk,clean safe area great access to buses for the price would stay again and recommend
This hotel location and value for money was ok but little problem was some smell in the room. most staff was kind but some one was not kind. They make clean room but carpet or chair was too old.

Great location just across from Hilton Hawaiian Village. Clean rooms with comfortable beds. Parking is a steal for Waikiki, $20/day for registered guests and $25 for non guests. I booked through the Wyndham app but could have saved some money with a travel site. Pool is small and cold, located on the second floor of the building.

I am staying at the hotel as I write. The rooms are clean and quiet. I recommend getting rid of the worn chairs. Replace with two chairs at the table. The beds are comfortable. The carpet look s clean and new. Great location. I have stayed at the hyatt. Too much money.

Ten minute walk to the beach! Fifteen minute walk to the Alana Moana shopping centre and an IHOP two doors down- could not have asked for a better location at such a good price! The staff are fantastic- so helpful and friendly :)The rooms are decently sized, neat and clean. My one recommendation would be to wear warm pyjamas if you're a cold frog like me cause there is no doona/quilt provided on the bed, just a thin sheet like blanket. Great place to stay and I'll definitely be back! :)

We recently stayed at this hotel. The room was clean and the staff were very nice. We stayed 3 nights here before moving on to Big Island. It suited our needs and was well located. We would have no hesitation on staying here again.

The location of the hotel was good for meeting up with family and friends. Staff were all very helpful and friendly, the room was clean and spacious. Our only problem was that the air conditioning did not function well and the room was quite warm even after hours of leaving the temp at a cool setting. We were only there for one night so did not report the problem.

Had a Great time staying here at Ramada Plaza Waikiki. I really don't have anything bad to say, most of the staff was very nice, I do have to say that Gene one of the person on the desk was very helpful and was able to explain how the Wyndham Rewards work. He was able to save me 20 dollars on parking fees that i was not aware of.

Excellent Budget option in expensive Waikiki.If you are looking for a well located reasonably priced hotel in 3 star range, look nowhere else.Location: Western edge of Waikiki, near Ala Moana mall and many restaurants, short walk to beach, on bus route to airport and pearl harbour.Room: smallish, tired, bit worn out but clean and functional Amenities: adequate, free water on first day, tea coffee in room and also in lobby in morning Service: excellent, everyone is polite. Mr Gene was so nice, he managed to give me a room at 1:45pm. Housekeeping ladies were very sweet, concierge was great guy, when asked to book a taxi, he made sure about my preferred mode of payment (cash or card).Wish list:1) offer tea coffee in evening also2) consider adding some ice tea/punch to tea coffee service3) options of early check in (at 8am onward?) by charging additional 1/2 day of room rate whenever possible In super expensive Waikiki, I find Ramada Plaza as an excellent Budget option. On my next trip, I will definitely stay here. Employees are excellent, and hotel also take care of their employees. Night before thanksgiving, we got this letter asking guests to let housekeeping know early if they need service. So that those sweet ladies can go home early for thanksgiving, Nice.

The hotel was in a great location in Waikiki. It’s within walking distance to many shopping locales and restaurants. Less than a block away is the Wailana Coffee Shop, featured on Hawaii Five 0. All in all we were very satisfied with our stay. Hotel staff accommodated me with a late check out when I explained that I was there for a medical procedure. Because of this, I will definitely stay here again when visiting Oahu.
Our room was clean. The AC did not work well. I am now sick. The noise outside is loud. But you get over it. Our bathroom sick leaked and toilet sometimes would run.

We booked a holiday through Groupon Australia on three occasions to stay in Honolulu and stayed here on 2 other occasions . The Ramada Plaza Waikiki is the worst place we have stayed at here Hawaii. Tonight the the drink machine in is broken so when I asked reception about where I can get some bottle water I was told to go to a local shop. The change machine for the laundry is broken AGAIN, not the first time this week. There is no room service or bar. Please consider not staying here. Be warned.

Stayed at Ramada at beginning and end of our trip, worked out well as we are at least a three hour drive from home. Used the stay and park program, left the car at the hotel and used the hotel shuttle. Would recommend.

At check-in I was informed there was a parking fee of 25$ a day. This was no where when I booked. The cleaning lady threw away some of things maybe not on purpose but it's the principle. I was just going to let that go but then the cust rep at the desk was not helpful when there was a mishap with my reservation. Called and talked to Manager at hotel felt as if he was just appeasing me by listening. Did not feel like he even cared. It's unfortunate Hawaii was beautiful and to have this happen last day there didn't leave a good taste.
The location is good (across the street from the Hilton, close to beach and the Ala Moana shopping center). The hotel hasn't been renovated recently but is clean and staff are efficient and polite.
Great night’s sleep on a wonderful bed. Spotless comfortable rooms. Very good value with no resort fee.

We arrived very early...6 AM and they had an area near the front desk to store all our bags until check in. No charge. We then took a short walk through the Hilton Hotel area to the beach and had breakfast at a restaurant with an ocean view. Official check-in is not until 3:00 but the staff will allow check in at noon if they have availability. This was great since we got some sleep and recovered from our flight from Australia. Later we walked back to the beach to eat dinner. There are several restaurants and some have entertainment and all had ocean views. I would definitely recommend this hotel because of the helpful staff, great location and reasonable price.

Secret tip: If you are single or couple with no kids, walk to one of the luxury oceanfront resorts and spend time on their beach. Children tend to set off alarm bells to hotel staff and your goal is to do this discreetly. Don’t take Ramada’s towels with you. This way, you enjoy time at a beachfront resort & pay much less for it. I walked around the Hilton with no problem - even sat to hear some music. Just pay all purchases in cash & pretend you’re a hotel guest. For breakfast, go to Wailena Coffee House and get there early. Lines form at 9:00AM. Food and service is excellent.
A little bit away from the major hotels but within walking distance of restaurants and the beach

We were placed into the Penthouse! Definitely a surprise! We made late arrangements and found a treasure. Decent price for late reservation and close enough to the beach without view. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. It had more than we needed for refrigerator and microwave. and it was quiet for some needed rest. Recommended for necessities stay with view of city.

Hotel old, house keeping one day left dirty cups in bathroom, sheets not changed every day but sheets were clean and a good standard. location good and having balcony was good but most rooms don't have them.

We had a problem when we first checked in in that there was a smoke smell on the 14th floor and in our room but it's a smoke free hotel. We told the front desk and they fixed it. The hotel is very simple and nothing fancy. It could really do a make over
front desk shld tell to guest right away that the parking is not free. need to pay for parking. so guest should not surprised when they check out.
arrived very early and staff very helpful in giving me information on where to eat and places close to hotel that I could visit until I could check into my room
Staff was VERY friendly, Hotel was a little outdated but still very nice. Great value for the price

Hotel is fine but a long walk in the heat to shopping centre and the best beaches are further away. You could catch the bus but next time we will stay closer to Waikiki Beach. The rooms need updating. I think it's a little overpriced.

The room/bathroom was neat. All staff was friendly & welcoming. ONLY downside but it was manageable was th a/c in the room. The lowest it could only go to was 68 and it was a bit warm at night and after being outside, cruising, in the hot weather there it was a bit hard to cool off in the room. Other than that, everything went very well.

You don't expect much from Waikiki Hotels, I've stayed in a few and it always feels like the land that time forgot, it's like someone built everything in the 70's and never came back to update it. What I do expect is clean, friendly good service and comfort and this hotel delivers that, it's just it leaves you feeling a bit so what. You could literally put this hotel anywhere in the world and it wouldn't feel out of place but this is Hawaii and you feel like it should have something a bit extra.If you like a game of chance then try getting a coffee in the lobby, the facilities seem to make fandom appearances, I couldn't find any pattern but I was only there for a short while, or maybe you are thirsty, Hawaii is hot so dehydration is a certainty and cold water is provided only in a cup the size of a large thimble, seemed pointless and petty water cannot be that expensive.Overall the hotel is well placed and good for a couple of days.
