Even when we slept in and didn't leave our room until after noon, our room ALWAYS got made up (housekeeping was wonderful).There is a 24/7 parking lot attendant which is nice so your vehicle is safe. We originally planned to park on the street for free to avoid the parking fee, but quickly found out that street parking is hard to come by - there are a lot of condos and hotels around so it's difficult to find a spot on the street and frankly isn't worth the headache. By signing up for the free Wyndham rewards program we saved $5 per day on parking which was a nice deal since we stayed 7 nights. Overall, I would recommend this hotel over the pricey resorts in the area.

We had a complimentary bottled water on arrival.We were told we only get it once.When we try to go to the vending machine,our key card has to be reprogrammed downstairs.The air conditioner in our room is loud.The hotel employees needs to smile.The housekeeping is great,and friendly.The transportation is very convenient.Otherwise we had a good time in Waikiki

My wife and I arrived the hotel early in the morning, but our room is not ready for check-in as yet, so we left our luggage with the reception and off we go. The hotel is close to Waikiki Beach and the Ala Moana Shopping Centre, both within walking distance. Our room is clean and spacious, bed is comfortable. The swimming pool and gym are small but in good conditions, however not many people using them. The black-out curtain is behind the lace blind, which we didn't find initially. Bus stop is just in front of the hotel, so it is convenient to go places by bus like City centre, Pearl Harbour etc...
Comfortable room close to shopping including McDonald's and a huge ABC store. Staff is very courteous and helpful
the front desk makes ya feel welcome housekeeping was very polite nice clean hotel . However dont bother going to the gift shop the lady working in there is very rude and speaks zero english

Enjoyable stay. Clean facilities, Friendly staff. Great location, Great new king-size bed with Fridge and Microwave/ Safe Will stay again, $20 parking was nice and close. Many airline people stay there... They know a great value
The facility is relatively old, but well located for our purposes and convenient to many attractions.

The staff was great. Everyone was very friendly and helpful, going out of their way to see that we had all we needed. The room was clean and bed comfortable. One outlet didn't work, but I didn't know it was not working until I unplugged my phone that hadn't charged. We were leaving, and the desk said they would get it fixed.
Was a nice place to stay when on a "limited budget" and within walking distance of public transportation.

Stayed at the Ramada for 2 nights before our Hawaiian Island cruise. Front desk pleasant on arrival. Rooms were clean & spacious. Easy 10 minute walk to Ala Moana Shopping Mall & 20 minute walk to Waikiki restaurants.

My wife & I just spent a week at this hotel. We had a pleasant stay being our first time to Hawaii. The hotel was ideally placed at the western end of Waikki beach with a short walk across the road, through the Hilton Hawaiian Village, to the beach. We opted to pay an extra AUD $40 per night for a balcony room which gave us slightly more space in an otherwise standard size room. We asked for a high and quiet room and was allocated a room at the rear of the hotel on the 14th floor. Due to the high degree of activity in the area there was still a lot of noise throughout the night which made us have the very noisy (in the wall) airconditioner on all night to drown out the outside noise. The hotel is old & overdue for a renovation but I guess that would then put the price up for future guests. A budget hotel close to the action if you want a holiday in Honolulu.

We are not experienced Hawaii visitors, and our stay was only a quick overnight, so it's impossible to compare experiences & dollar values, but - we were very happy with our stay at Ramada Plaza Waikiki. Above all, the staff was SO friendly and accommodating. Location was good - short walk to beaches (a bit of a "maze" to get there, but fun to explore!). Room was nice and clean, bed very comfortable! AGAIN, WARM AND FRIENDLY STAFF! Would stay there again!

the lobby, elevators, rooms, are all clean and the place is beautiful. male employees at front desk could be a bit more friendlier. I didn't feel as welcome as I should have. it's maybe because I'm a local girl.
We are very happy with the rooms, I wish they could have kept couple of bottles of water after long flights it would have helped.

Being that I was alone. My me time was quiet & relaxing. You can take a short walk to Outback Rest., ABC Store, McDonald. Discovery Mall has Subway, Aloha Sushi, Roberto's (coffee/blended juices), Thai food & India food.
This hotel is a smaller, well run hotel in a very good location. It's not a resort, however, it is extremely well run and very clean. The staff is very attentive and pleasant.
Grest deal and location across from waikiki beach with some restaurants close by and shops. No food for breakfast and parking is $25 per day.

Rooms are nice. But could use an update. Nice to have balcony. My husband forgot his hat Under Armour hat in the room, called to see if they found it, but I'm not surprised they didn't seem to find it in the room.

The hotel staff was excellent. They helped us with any questions we had. Rooms were clean and hotel was centrally located. We walked to the beach every day and if we wanted anything the desk service and bell hop exceeded our expectations. Would definitely stay at the Ramada Plaza again
Very helpful and polite staff. Surprise on $20 per night parking however. Parking does offer in and out privileges though. Good location.

Location was great and if you only want to sleep and shower this is the perfect place. Close to the Ala Moana shopping centre on one side and near Kalakaua Ave an upmarket shopping strip in the opposite direction. Where there are some fabulous restaurants and a little food truck assembly with shrimp, tacos etc. if you want something quick or to take to the beach.Diagonally across the nearest intersection is Fort DeRussy Park which you can walk through all the way to Waikiki Beach. There is a bus stop out front too. Some information about bus routes, price etc. Turned out the bus was $2.50. There was also a Trolley Bus at $25, presumably a day pass.The staff were pleasant enough but not super helpful like I experienced in Maui. Some information about the buses would have been helpful. The lobby is pleasant enough but the rooms are showing their age. I was unable to get any fresh air in my room and it smelt a little musty and stale. To be fair the room rate took this all into account.

If you are planning on sing their airport shuttle realize that you have to leave 3 hours before your flight and they only run from 6am until 9pm. So, if you have an 8:00am flight you have to take a taxi that will cost you $35.00. And even then, the taxi was late picking us up!

We flew from Maui to Honolulu for two days and one night. Hotel was nice, got to check in a couple hours early. AC did not work very good. Clean room,lobby. A couple blocks from the beach. Would stay there again. They do charge for parking, but I guess every where does. Was just my husband and I. Just needed one night.
Rooms were Clean, I requested a king size bed and I got it.it's close to restaurant and shops. Will book again unless I want a different hotel.
I have been staying at this hotel for many years. Reasonable rates and the staff is great! Always helpful and accommodating. I would recommend this place highly. Clean rooms and really no negatives.
Great Hotel, perfect location, clean, comfortable, great staff, onsite parking, should be a 4 star hotel.

We stayed at the Ramada near the Ala Moana shopping center and Waikiki beach September 2016. The front desk and concierge were friendly and useful. Our room was next to the elevator on the 14th floor--just right in terms of cleanliness, quiet, and comfort. We didn't use the pool or exercise equipment but could have. Our Wyndham Rewards points came in handy and the airport shuttle made renting a car unnecessary.

One night stay on 09/30/2016. It was just your run of the mill, standard hotel in a desirable location. Room was clean, but dated. Staff was reasonably friendly, but seemed overly concerned with how many occupants would stay in each room, requiring me to give the full names of each guest staying. Plus, the only entrance was by the front desk, requiring you to walk around the building from the parking lot each time you entered the building. Parking cost $20 U.S. per night with my Wyndham Rewards discount. Bottom line; the hotel did it's job, and had nice views. It is across the street from the Hilton Hawaiian Village, so it is in a prime location, and for the area, has reasonable rates. But it was for me, just an adequate room to hold us over for one night.

No frills hotel. If you are looking for a hotel with lots of amenities, this isnt the place to go. It's basic. But the housekeeping staff were WONDERFUL. Rooms were very clean! They were very friendly and did a great job.The front desk staff and the parking attendants could have been friendlier. Only one of the guys at the front desk actually smiled and greeted us. Everyone else didn't really provide very good customer service. One of the security guards was rude. Kicked people out of the pool when it was closed. He was not a friendly guy.

We had a minor issue in our room. The front desk and housekeeping staff bent over backwards to correct the problem, and went well above and beyond the minimum in apologizing for any inconvenience, and making sure we left with a good impression.If service is important to you, you should definitely consider the Ramada Plaza Waikiki when staying in Honolulu.

We booked this using points plus some $$ and hoped for the best. All of the staff were very helpful during our stay of two nights and we found our room very clean and well maintained. The only downside that we found was that it was very hot in the hallways but the room was always comfortable. Glad we stayed there for our brief time in Waikiki. The people at the desk steered us to a nearby restaurant that was also very good and very reasonably priced.

Customer service was great! Room was very nice and clean. The bed was super comfortable and felt luxurious. The price was the best we found. Definitely staying here next time we need a little staycation.
Good place to stay. Very clean and close enough to everything but far enough that you can relax
The room is OK and clean but the hotel has construction from 8.30 am to 4 pm and they make really loud noises.
Tucked behind all the big resorts made this less hustle and bustle but close to all the action!
Very comfortable, clean room.. very friendly staff. Grateful for the early check in.. great location .

While not the most luxurious hotel in Waikiki, it is our go-to. The staff are great, it's clean and a great value. We usually reserve the junior suite which is larger than most apartments in Waikiki. Having a stove top, fridge, sink and microwave is worth the extra cost. Plus, the balcony for this room is killer! They have on-site parking for $20 a night (compared to $45+ at other hotels) when you join Wyndham Rewards (free). We will definitely be back!

My wife and I spent seven relaxing nights at the Ramada Plaza in August and enjoyed every second of it. The staff were friendly and efficient. They really could not do enough for us especially the concierge who gave us great advise even though we did not book any trips through them. The room was spacious, comfortable and clean. The hotel is in a great location as only a short ten minute walk to the beaches and into Waikiki itself. The restaurant was being refurbished while we were there so never got a chance to sample the food but we will certainly stay here again when we come back to Oahu.

Comfortable and Clean Room. I stayed here the first week of September. It was a great place to keep my suitcase and get a good night sleep before heading out for the day. I did not spend too much time in the room. There are no fancy amenities at this hotel, just the basics. They do have a small pool and a small gym on the 2nd floor, but who goes to the pool in a beautiful place like Hawaii.

The rooms were average. Needed a late chech out for 2:00 pm and they were not able to accommodate us. Requested a king bed got twin. The room did not cool with the AC on 64 degrees stayed hot and stuffy on the other half of the room .

Close to Ala Moana shopping center, you can easily go to shopping center by walk or take shuttle bus. Also easy to reach the beach side, around hotel have many small shops, you do not have to worry if you forget to bring something.Overall, it is a very comfortable place to stay.

Hotel was clean, staff was great and location is within walking distance to near by restaurants, shops, harbor and beaches. I travel often and would definitely stay here again compared to some of the "dumps" in Honolulu that charge the same or higher rates for closet size rooms.

one of the major things you miss is restaurant. it is important and needed mainly to have breakfast before you start your day. as well it is important that some people when they arrive late it is important to be able to get meal. I mean after 9:00 p.m.

Well it was mid-July and ALL Waikiki hotels are at their most expensive! This was no exception. For the price I paid I was certainly expecting more than what I got. Very noisy A/C with a malfunctioning thermostat was my biggest issue. Next was the mostly-miss housekeeping where the room was made less than half the time I was there, and poorly-executed when they did as sometimes wet towels on the floor weren't removed or toiletries not replenished - and I always tip housekeeping! But I persevered with my week-long stay as I liked the convenience of the location. Dunno, maybe it was just a fluke of an experience but it could certainly have been much better.

We stayed here for two nights on a recent trip to Hawaii, having loyalty points to use which made the hotel price even more attractive. Overall, this was a very clean hotel, and a great location within about 1/2 mile of the beach. They do not serve a breakfast, but there are many dining options with a block or two. They do serve coffee in the mornings. The only problem we encountered was the air conditioning, which seemed to be on a motion sensor. It would run as long as you were moving in the room, but if you stopped moving, after about 10 minutes, it would shut off. So when you would leave the room, and come back at the end of the day, it was quite warm inside, and it would get stuffy overnight. The hotel did have a small pool, but we spent our time at the beach. Overall, a very nice, clean, budget friendly hotel that I would not hesitate to stay at again.

We reserved a room with a King sized bed. On arrival (at 4 in the morning, 6 hours late due to airline delays we were told that a preference is not a reservation). Otherwise a good location and relatively inexpensive to the local options and n proximity to the Convention Centre

Stayed there for one night. Good value overall. Easy self parking. Good central location for the money. The room was a bit tight and small in size. The biggest area of improvement has to do with cleanliness. We found strands of hair in several towels in our bathroom upon checkin.

We found it somewhat difficult to find the hotel in the dark. Handicap parking was a bit difficult due to construction. Rooms were average but, considering Hawaii prices, it was good value. Parking was a bit steep at $25.

I stayed at the Ramada Plaza in August, 2016. I found the room clean and very satisfactory. The staff was professional and cordial. No question went unanswered. One employee stood out. KEVIN SHIM was friendly, very professional, extremely kind, and managed the housekeeping dept. with efficiency, courtesy, and diplomacy. I needed more coffee, etc. and immediately it was delivered to my room. Kevin also volunteered very useful information about the area. Kevin helped make my stay very positive. Thank you for a positive experience.

I was well aware of the construction/remodeling going on at this hotel, so that was expected. The room was as expected, nothing special. The pool was nice and I very much liked the access I had to extra towels there. Just a tip about parking though, its $25 and it is ran by another company that isn't a part of the hotel. So they are no way responsible for any damages or loses. The parking stalls are meant for very small compact cars, so mines was hit and banged up pretty badly. Very unfortunate!! But other than the parking situation the hotel itself was nice.

No room heat or heater provided, They took the money and ran they did $2300 Canadian. $1,700 USD. Ramada Franchise needs to drop these jokers. Upon checking in Gene said there was no booking.com reservation number. Wrong I Dealt with Booking.com regarding the heater. Don not stay here under any circumstance. WAS I TO RUN OUT A GET SEVERAL CONCUBINES IN THEIR MIND?

I found this hotel great value for money. It's my second time in Hawaii... the first trip took me about 1 hour to check in! At the Ramada we were checked in within 5 minutes - there were no long lines and the room was clean and comfortable. The large king size bed was heaven, great mattress, and curtains kept out the light - so we had wonderful sleeps night after night.. The shower water was always hot, and when the hair dryer didn't work, they got onto it straight away. I found that the borrowed dryer that afternoon was replaced the next day with a brand new dryer!!! My only suggestion would be - could you add in house movies (pay for new release movies). I'd definitely return to this hotel!

If I wanted to come and go, they made it difficult to park without paying immediately. sometimes I wasn't sure whether I wanted all day or only a couple hours. sometimes I ended up paying both due to pressure from the desk and parking police. Made me very uncomfortable to stay there

This was such a perfect place to stay but the front desk people were extremely unhappy people. I thought the first nite it was because it was a bad day, but then I realized it was just bad service. I've travel a lot and have stayed at various hotels, this is by far the worst front desk service that I've ever received. Even when we asked for the bell man cart and all they offered was, "you have to return the cart here when you're done". But the hotel itself was great and the house keeper.

Excellent location to the beach, resto and mall. We will use this hotel again. The Ala Moana location is not so crowded so very convinient for short runs in the morning. The hotel is very clean, beddings crisp, hallways are clean and bright. Well maintained. The price is great too.

So I got to stay here on my first night in Hawaii, was supposed to be meet up with some people to go on a camping trip, didn't find them at the airport. So I ended up getting online and finding this hotel as the perfect place to stay for a night. It was a nice clean room at a great price. It has a ABC store right around the block, along with a IHOP

The location is good and the room reasonable although getting a bit tired. There were a couple of issues: the air conditioning was so noisy that we had to switch it off to sleep. Unfortunately, that is very common in the USA, which doesn't seem to have discovered quiet AC yet. There was only one standard coffee sachet plus a decaf. Surely most people want standard and it was a double room. There were no glasses only 4 paper cups. There was no basin plug.On the good side, the bed and pillows were very comfortable.

This is good for people wanting to go to Hawaii on a budget. The hotel is not on the beach. In fact, you have to cross the road by going down to a crosswalk and then walk beside or through another hotel. The rooms were what you expect at any other hotel. No great views, no continental breakfast and you have to pay 25 dollars a day for parking. The pool was very clean and the staff was really friendly. I recommend using the concierge. He was really helpful.
Hotel needs room upgraded, everything is worn, a.c. Never cooled the room, front desk was very pleasant, employees friendly but hotel needs upgrading

We are Wyndham owners and decided to stay at the Ramada as there was no availability with our time share. We are well travelled and stayed in a range of resorts, hotels, motels and time share.The Ramada is in the timeshare group so we decided to support them, we paid cash. I did allot of searching prior to booking this hotel and for the price we paid, and no resort fee we could not complain at all. This hotel is well located across from the Hilton Village, a 10 min walk to the major shopping centre. We were really happy with the location.We were welcomed upon arrival and the hotel was able to accommodate an early check in which was great as we did travel from New Zealand. The room was very big and had a king size bed with allot of pillows for comfort. There was a desk and another chair with foot stool which was great for extra seating. The room has a safe, coffee making facilities, fridge and microwave which was good too. There was a bath with shower over with excellent water pressure. Loads of space to store our two very large cases too.The rooms are cleaned daily and soaps etc..replaced each day. I was really impressed with this. There is a full laundry room by the pool area and the pool itself was fantastic. There is a full gym onsite too. At the pools there are toilets and towels for you to use when swimming. During our stay there were outside renovations happening however NOT once were we disturbed and we did not even know this was going on.We booked our rental car through the activities desk and the service was great, no complaint again.Overall - we were very happy with our choice, for the cost we were very happy with our accommodation, the hospitality. Highly recommend.

Clean, tidy, fantastic staff and over the road from the Hilton Village with several good eateries nearby. Bus stop out the front gets you to Ala Moana mall or you can enjoy the 15 minute walk in the sunshine.

We had a wonderful time spent at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki Hotel. Great Customer service, clean rooms and convenient parking. We were pleased to be upgraded with a room with a balcony, great view. We look forward to our next staycation and recommend the Ramada Plaza Waikiki.

Pleasant stay.. rooms were a bit noisy due to the location as the hotel is on main road but otherwise very clean and well maintained. Ikaika, front desk staff member was awesome.. really helpful and pleasant to deal with.. wish there are more staff members like him in this industry.
Good old hotel. Renewal is needed. Clearness should improve. Bed Sheets are not changed frequently.

We stayed here from the 16th to the 23rd August in room 1112, great location, 10 mins walk to the heart of Waikiki and 5 mins walk to the beach/lagoon. very efficient and friendly staff, cleaners did a great job.Room was very good, balcony had a pleasant view, swam most evenings and used the laundry facilities a few times. Would definitely stay here again.

I stayed in this Ramada on and off for about 4 months. The rooms were clean, well maintained, and comfortable. The service staff is excellent. It is close to MANY good restaurants, and in walking distance (about 15 min) from the Waikiki strip.

We stayed in a high floor king room with a balcony. The room was small but clean and comfortable. Waikiki is busy and noisy so we were not able to take advantage of opening the balcony door to get fresh air when sleeping which is what we like to do when possible. The air-conditioning worked fine but probably equal to the cities noise at night. We spent two nights at the hotel and it seemed like most every guess was asian including many flight crews from asian airlines. We didn't spend much time in the room so it worked fine for us but be aware that the hotel lacks any real amenities so if you plan to spend much time at a hotel the Ramada would not be a good choice.
Had a restful night at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki. It was easy to find, clean and the staff was very helpful and welcoming.

The location is excellent, only 10 minutes from Alamoana and 20 minutes to Waikiki centre. The service is great however the facilities are only average and do not compare with Wyndham resort living. Don't waste points on this property.

We stayed here for 2 nights prior to boarding a cruise ship. upon entering the room it was very hot, the A/C was turned off. when turned it on , we turned the temp down and put the fan on high. We then went out for dinner and when we came back the air was not any cooler than we turned it on. We reported it to the front desk, they had a maintenance man come and check it out. he told us it was because it works on a motion sensor and we weren't in the room to activate it. Other than that it was a very good stay, we stayed there for 2 more nights after our cruise and the A/C worked just fine. would definitely recommend this Ramada.

I stayed for ten days the staff was very good and helpful the room had to double beds as requested. The room was clean on arrival had house keeping daily. The hotel was central to every thing needed. I stay there again.

Hotel room itself was nice & clean. Staff were friendly & helpful.Aircon wasn't that good & the pool area wasn't very nice. Edge of pool was all cracked. No umbrellas for shade & just reminded me of a cement carpark with a pool on it.

After reading some of the reviews on this hotel, I was a bit apprehensive of what to expect. However, my one night stay here before moving to Ko Olina was a pleasant experience. Contrary to what other reviewers had to say, I found everyone on the staff to be friendly and courteous. The room was clean and well-kept. It was in a perfectly good section -right across from the Hilton Hawaiian Village where I could see the fireworks from their Friday show. If you want to save $5.00 in parking join the Wyndam club. Another plus is no resort fee here. Definitely would recommend others to stay at this hotel.
Good location, moderate price. More updated than I thought it would be, and decent gym. Overall, a decent value for Waikiki.

Very conveniently located to the Ala Moana Shopping Center and to the rest of Waikiki. Well priced and comfortable. Liked the coffee and tea available on the ground floor near the lifts every morning. Very helpful and friendly staff on the front desk and tour desk.
I was pleased with the accommodations and the price. However the floor that I stayed on and my room was really musty. I was comfortable in my room and the maid service was excellent.

Conveniently located at the outskirt of Downtown Waikiki with a few eateries (e.g. McDonalds, iHop and Red Lobster) and convenient stores (ABC stores) just around the corner. Within walking distance (about 15 mins) to the largest outdoor mall, Ala Moana Mall and the Ala Moana Beach Park. The decor of the place is a little dated though the rooms are generally comfortable and clean. However, on a couple of occasions, I found strands of hair probably left by housekeeping staff on the bathroom floor and on the towels on the towel rack. But I guess this is not a big deal.Though I do have to agree with some of the reviews I have read while researching on the hotel that the hotel has a very hostile and unwelcoming atmosphere from the moment you step into the lobby and checking in. As I had arrived earlier than check-in time (arrived at the hotel at about 12-1pm), I was just told by the front desk that they do not have a room now as their check-in time is 3pm. Without advising what I can do or even if they can help store my luggages, I was just told to come back at 3pm. No smiles on the face of staffers and the staffs are nonchalant, unhelpful and at times close to rude and impatient with basic of questions and will simply give you a map without any directions, recommendations or advises. As I have forgotten to bring along a razor for my trip, I left a note in the morning to the housekeeping for a razor. But instead i got a reply note saying that she does not have a razor in her cart and ask me to call the front desk for one. So I called the front desk upon my return in the evening for a razor, I was curtly told on the phone to call the housekeeping or go to the front desk to get it. When I asked if he could help transfer the call to housekeeping, I was again curtly told that there is a housekeeping button on the phone and he ask me to call myself. Though I understand that the hotel is very popular with large Chinese tour groups, I am not sure, and I certainly hope it is not due to the fact that majority of the guests are Chinese and Mandarin speaking. and so the bad attitude Attitude of staffers needs to be improved which I seriously find unacceptable in the service and hotel industry.
Receptionists were helpful and friendly. Hotel is just few minutes walk from Waikiki beach and is accessible to a lot of food places. I will recommend this to my family and friends

Not the best hotels but it does the job. Staff is friendly, parking was the most affordable, right in front of the Hilton. They are remodeling so it's a bit of a mess but they try to keep it down and warn you in advance. They make sure to leave the rooms clean each day. They offer coffee in the morning but don't get up at 6am expecting it to be ready. It is usually brewed by 7am. They have mini fridge and microwave so if your trying to experience all of Hawaii buy some groceries, your best bet is to go to Safeway. The locals are friendly and let us use there member card to get lower price on groceries.

It is conveniently located if you don't want to be in downtown Waikiki. Very expensive hotels across the street on the bay. There is above beach and many restaurants, as well as the Ala Moana mall within walking distance. The majority of the guests are Asian. The room was comfortable and clean and I slept well. The pictures are views of the surroundings.

We toured 3 islands in Hawaii and stayed in our share of hotels, however we found this to be the worst one of all of the hotels that we stayed in.The hotel has a very hostile atmosphere from the moment you check in. Staff are rude and unhelpful with even the most basic of questions and simply tell you to 'check the information book in your room', an attitude that we found unnecessarily hostile. There are no complimentary shuttles provided by the hotel from the airport, which tells its own story.Located in a 'seedier' part of town, on our walk to the hotel (and around the local area in search of a place to eat) we were accosted on several occasions by homeless people asking for money. There are very few decent places to eat within the immediate vicinity of the hotel, and instead it is surrounded by diners, tattoo parlours and seedy sports bars. The hotel itself is *very* popular with large Chinese tour groups, to the extent that the buffet attached to the hotel has signs around it written only in Chinese/Mandarin. We didn't bother going inside as looking through the window from the outside we could see that we would have immediately felt very uncomfortable once seated inside.As a result, the whole atmosphere of the hotel feels very unwelcoming. As there was only 2 of us staying overnight to visit Pearl Harbor this wasn't too much of an issue, however I would strongly advise against staying in this hotel if you are staying in Oahu for any decent length of time, particularly if you have children and/or value an 'inclusive' and welcoming atmosphere.

This hotel is convenient to Waikiki beaches, restuarants and shopping malls. The staff were most friendly, efficient and helpful with any requests. The room we had was on the 14th floor and was quite roomy, only complaint i would have was the noise from outside as the window is loose in its frame and does not seal correctly, a wonder it has not fallen out, (dangerous).We were quite happy with our room and the facilities it provided.

Found hotel to be very visually pleasing in the lobby, that usually gives you a good indication of what to expect. The room was clean and well furnished, all amenities in the bathroom, plus coffee, tea and two bottles of water and candy in the main room, at no charge. Small parking area, but it sufficed, found parking daily. Staff friendly and helpful. Lots of eating places around the hotel and all in walking distance. As I was not a tourist, the location is good, it is at the start of Waikiki and a good walk for those that like walking and sightseeing. Thank you for a great stay.

We booked a suite which finished up being the penthouse suite on the top floor. Private double balcony, huge lounge room and own kitchen. Fantastic room in a great location. A number of hire car places just 5 minutes walk away and various trolleys/buses stop nearby. Exceptional staff! The place to stay in Honolulu!!

I had an event nearby and my wife and kids wanted to stay overnight in Waikiki also. The room with the two double beds fit our needs. Room was clean, only issue was the ceiling light near the doorway was burnt out. Called maintenance and was told to flip switch on and bang on the wall. Yep, it went on! I like the free coffee and tea in the lobby. Wife and kids liked the pool and fitness room on the 2nd Floor. Uncovered parking stalls for your cars but this service was provided by Diamond Parking; not the by hotel.

This hotel did the trick. We were out and about most of the day and just needed somewhere to rest. While it is not located on the beach, it is not too far from the hotels on the beach. The room was equipped with two full size beds, a side table, chair, closet, suitcase rack, laundry bag, TV, and alarm clock. The bathroom had shampoo, soap, mouthwash, and lotion. There is a noisy A/C connected to the window. There is no restaurant attached to the hotel. Parking was very expensive ($25/day). Rewards members receive a $5 discount on parking so I recommend signing up for the program before making your reservation.

We were fortunate to have the junior suite, which made our stay with 3 kids (2-14) enjoyable. We had plenty of space and the small kitchen made for easy meal planning. The verandah was a wonderful bonus with our ocean view (small, but good!).

The hotel was dated once you left the lobby. The hallways were in desperate need of paint and the carpet was very worn, also the air conditioning was almost nonexistent in the halls. The room was clean and the bed linens were nice,but it was very small and only had double beds instead of queens.

This hotel was very convenient to the beach, restaurants and shops. The staff was helpful and friendly and that hotel was very nice. There was some construction being done to the balconies during daytime hours and we couldn't use our balcony but we knew that beforehand so it wasn't an issue. We made a reservation for an excursion to Pearl Harbor and we were picked up right outside of our hotel. It was easy, a good value and stress free....

Really enjoyed the service I got. I didn't spend much time in the hotel but when I did, everything worked as expected. The only issue I had was with the cleaning service... they promoted their eco work of reusing the towels and recycling but I didn't see it. The cans were not taken away as stated and (although not sure) it looked like I got fresh towels every day.

Unfortunately for Ramada Plaza we arrived after having already stayed at 2 great hotels during this trip and our expectations were probably too high. The room was clean but quite small. When we opened the fridge we got knocked out by the smell of off fish. The bathroom was very compact and on the basin right next to the toilet were our coffee & tea facilities. No thanks. We were however on the top floor and did have a small balcony with city views. One the 2nd day our room key wouldn't work. There happened to be a house keeper right there who we told our key wasn't working. She opened the door without saying a word to us. Not good!!!! 10 mins later she knocked on our door and told us to leave so she could clean it. We decided to put our valuables in the safe but it was broken. This stay was the last in our trip and we wanted to be able to relax and feel comfortable in our room if we chose to stay in but this was not possible here. There were a number of other little things that normally wouldn't affect us however all compacted they added to our disappointment. On the plus side, we did make use of the pool and laundry facilities and the rest of the staff that we dealt with were all very friendly. Unfortunately we won't be staying here again.
It was absolutely wonderful the staff the rooms the adventure was exceptional. Location for beach is great. We had a blast

Loved our experience here. The staff were especially friendly and welcoming each time we arrived. My only comment would be that the way some of the things are laid out in the lobby could be done more professionally. For instance, the coffee and simple amenities near the elevator (though nice to have!) looks a bit too unprofessional in how it's presented on top of a table. I think some more intentional use of the space could really step it up a notch. Just my 2 cents, but it was a great visit.

The hotel was reasonably priced and was a nice place to stay. If you're looking for a view, this is not the place. It is comfortable and close to lots of things so that's nice. If you're just looking for a place to lay your head at night, then this is a great option.
Too expensive, toilet wouldn't flush,fire alarms ringing late at night, rude parking lot attendants, mattress too soft. I will not recommend this place.

This was an average hotel, actually more of a motel as far as services and amenities. Rooms were a bit small but had adequate storage. Beds were comfortable and linens crisply clean. We appreciated the safe for valuables, the microwave and small fridge. The room, halls and lobby were clean. The lobby was extremely small and very busy most of the time. The location was great for walking to shopping restaurants and beaches. The front desk, bellman, and tour desk were friendly and helpful. My only real complaint is that I thought it would be a little more upscale for the price; but apparently I don't know what the norm is for Hawaii tourism.
Nice room, comfy bed, coffee pot in bathroom by toilet area, not so great. Refrigerator smelled like onions or something. We didn't use it.
Excellent experience, due to warm atmosphere of the personnel and all of the hotel surroundings (room and staff).

We had a very short overnight stay at this hotel. We found it to be very clean & quiet, which was what we were looking for.I tried to use the blow dryer but it started to smoke, so I called downstairs to the front desk & they immediately brought up another one. Very good customer service, would stay at this hotel again.
Very nice room for the money, very clean, nice facility and lobby and no hidden fees and found parking on the street every time. Great location 5 minutes from the beach. Very happy with stay!

Typical hotel in which you can feel sevure to stay with your family. They are currently making construction improvements. I think the improvements start at 830am. It is within walking distance from the boats.

This place was nice and clean, and one of the most reasonably priced properties in the area! The people were so friendly and helpful! The hotel is centrally located and walking from there is easy enough for all to do.
Good location, good price with no resort fee. Room was always clean and staff was always helpful.

Located just a block from the famous Waikiki beach. Very quick to register .Easy to get in and out of parking .Very reasonable rates .Directly across from the Hilton Hawaiian village . Walk to just about everything from this hotel .I give this hotel a two thumbs up

The room was quite dated. Price was quite expensive for the style of room however the bed was very comfortable. No noise. Some of the staff were not that friendly. We have been to hotels where every time you go past the lobby you are greeted with a hello or goodbye. We didn't find this with most of the staff. The location of the hotel was very good.
We only needed a room for one night and this choice was awesome. The staff was very friendly and the location was great. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone wanting to come visit.

We had a very nice stay at this hotel and the location was great. We were able to walk to Waikiki beach and there were many shops and restaurants within walking distance. We scheduled a tour of Pearl Harbor and that worked out perfectly as well. The room was nice, the bed was comfortable and the staff was helpful and very pleasant. We would recommend this hotel.
Great location, great price. We stayed here 8 days and the room was cleaned everyday. Staff was friendly. We would stay here again.

Nice location, close to Wakiki but away from the craziness. Rooms were fine. Self parking was nice, the lot was small but we never had an issue finding a spot. Price was excellent - Would highly recommend if you want to stay close to all the action while not paying resort fees and the like

Comfortably situated on Ala Moana Boulevard and just a block off the beach , the Ramada Plaza has all the convenience but none of the high prices of the beachfront properties! The convenient pink line bus will take you all over downtown Honolulu, even right to Waikiki round the clock for a $2 fee. Local eateries nearby keep the cost of dining low and, if You want some of the best...it is all right directly across the street. Great and helpful staff...It makes a very practical way to enjoy Honolulu on a modest budget!!
Great location, friendly staff, good housekeeping, spacious penthouse room and balcony. Will come back again.

I just spent a week at the Ramada Plaza and really enjoyed my stay. The bed was very comfortable, the shower was great, the airconworked and the pool and hotel were nice and clean. Nothing flash but everything you need. Not located in the middle of Waikiki but a short walk to Ala Moana and a bus right outside the hotel. I would definitely stay here again. Thanks for a lovely week.

Location--A few blocks from the beach and Friday night fireworks. Affordable cafe just around the corner. Entrance is set back from the street. Amenities--small refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker in the room. Refreshments in the lobby. Room--very clean and contemporary. Bathroom updated. Staff--very helpful and attentive. I did not give this hotel a 5 star rating because construction work was being done on the outside [I was notified] and the popcorn ceilings might be a turnoff to people expecting a "resort-look" hotel. Great hotel for pre-cruise stay,..close enough to the piers [avoids most of the Honolulu traffic]; but in town for beaches and fun. Affordable--I used some Wyndham points and added $50..
Hotel was all right it would've been nice if they offered breakfast. Rooms are outdated and small but were clean. The price was good that's why we stay here just for one night.

Took my spring break after surviving the winter at O'Hare and, again, the stay was wonderful. Rented a car this time since stayed from the 11-16 of April. Was put up in the penthouse level (room 1701) since I had a room with a balcony this time. Facing the right direction to catch the breeze off the ocean. Concerning the car: another reason to be a Wyndham Rewards member: you receive $5.00 off a day for parking so instead of $25.00 per day it's $20.00. The parking is monitored... seemed like they allowed no more cars than rooms so I always found a place to park no matter when I arrived back at the hotel.Arrived at check-in time and was quickly given my room so that I could relax. Had gone grocery shopping (room equipped with microwave and refrigerator) so wanted to cut down on meal expenditures. Bellman handled all the items plus my luggage while I went to park my car.Normal routine was completed... nothing there but me:-) and I went outside to sit on the lana'i (balcony) and got a pleasant surprise: either the pigeons know NOT to come here or they just weren't around... FOR THE ENTIRE STAY. Because usually when I sit outside to eat, I usually have at least ONE land on my railing... none appeared. Lana'i was extremely clean as well as spacious. I even had an area that could be used for either outdoor tanning or sleeping: I'm not sure what it was supposed to be for but I used it to stretch out and sleep underneath the stars... wonderful.Another great stay at a great place with a fantastic location. Be back for Pearl Harbour Day's 75th anniversary in December!

Had a great holiday at the Ramada plaza. The rooms were a bit small but it was close to lots of shopping and some great restaurants. Outbacks was devine cuisine and the staff were faboulous. So is Red Lobster... mmmmmm yummy. There is very little in utensils to use in room, so i suggest a quick trip to the local ABC store to stock up. Room service is good and staff are mainly very friendly. There is a great pool and gym to use. There is a chinese restaurant attached to the front of the motel and the food was good. Buses were our most favoured form of travel at $2.50 per trip. Although i would suggest getting a 4 day pass f or $35.00 if you are travelling as a couple or in a group.

Everything was as agreed in the booking and the cheking and check out very fast and nice.The only problem is parking (separate payment), but I thing is a Hawaii problem, but I thing must be Include in the hotels cost. Parking cost is near 80% of the cost of accommodation.Please keep in mind. Please keep in mind. My answers consider relationship between cost of the hotel and what we expect from them.

The hotel staff were excellent and they kept the room and environs really clean, Although there are restaurant close by, and they are good, it would have been good to have a breakfast facility at least inside the hotel, the internet is passable.

Even though this hotel is located (north end of Waikiki) away from the hustle and bustle of central Waikiki, we found this a wonderful spot. Quieter, less congested and easy to walk to where you want along the beach.Hilton Hawaiian Village is across the street with all its shops and restaurants. For those watching the budget, there is an IHOP just 3 doors down and a diner at the end of the block.Staff was helpful and courteous. Rooms were good for our short 4 day stay. Roof pool was cold and the shadow cover portions all day, but the beach is just a short 10 min walk away.
The Hotel was Close to everything people were very nice as well as the workers would stay there again
Location was excellent, staff was very friendly and helpful, and I couldn't beat the rates. I will stay here again on my next trip.
Disappointed that website indicated that they provided shuttle service to and from airport but none was available.

We have always stayed ocean front when holidaying in Honolulu but this time was a special deal too hard to let go. The Ramada Plaza Waikiki is a 3 star hotel set back from the beach, so no daily room tax (bonus). A 10 min walk to Ala Moana Shopping centre and 20 min walk to Ward Center (my pick as TJ Maxx and Nordstrum Rack). A leisurely stroll through the Hilton Hawaiian Village to the beac....not too hard. We stayed on the PH level which is the top level in a King Balcony Room, we would like to thank the Hotel Management for checking us into this wonderful room. The trolley into Waikiki central stops outside the hotel and is a US$2 trip. We walked most days, about 20 mins, great to work off all the Happy Hour cocktails. Just a plain hotel but clean with no hassles or line ups for lifts.

The hotel itself is a simple hotel - nothing fancy or extravagant but it is clean and well maintained. The prize is its location. This hotel is right across the street from Hilton Village and the beach, 10 minute walk from Ala Moana, trolley stops just outside, and all kinds of restaurants. It is also just a short 15-20 minute walk from downtown Waikiki. I really can't say enough about how perfect the location is - access to everything but because you are just outside of downtown it is quieter, less crowded, and a bit cheaper. My only complaint would perhaps be housekeeping. We had issues getting a crib for our daughter and the day to day service was somewhat inconsistent - some days they would take out the garbage and other days it would be left even though it was full and we had to ask for the recycling to be taken.
Right across the street from beach and restaurants and store close by. Great price with AAA rate. I already booked my next trip there.

We really love this hotel , but the previous trip I left my diamond earring an my watch on the counter in the bathroom an I called to let the hotel know an they said no one found it . I was really upset beach use I know I left it on the counter . It was really expensive . My watch was $1000 something an my earrings was $2000 . Also I stay here 4 times a year for business

Very quiet guests, in general. All the staff went out of their way to make my stay comfortable and a true joy. Kudos to the three (maybe four) staff members that tried to help me find location via phone interaction after arrival at Honolulu International Airport. These gentlemen went above and beyond all expectations to help me arrive safely at hotel on 04 APR 2016. ALL should be highly commended.

It was my first time to Hawaii and we selected Ramada for the location and price, plus the reviews on Trip Advisor. Our stay was great. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. They were accessible, knowledgeable and accommodating (we were keeping our rental car day by day and had to keep requesting for 'one more night...'.Here is my advice. If you are going to sight-see and tours all of the one-of-a-kind places on Oahu, the Ramada is an excellent, priced-right hotel that allows you to get a good nights rest, and be up and out the door at 6am to explore. We did this nearly every day of our 10 days, returning late each evening. We literally used the hotel as home-base, and to sleep but we were hardly there. I would highly recommend this hotel.

I travel to Honolulu frequently for business. I had never stayed at this hotel before. It is located on Ala Moana Boulevard across from Waikiki Beach. It's not as fancy as your upper end hotels, but, it is clean and quiet. My king room was comfortable. This hotel does not have a restaurant but there are many within walking distance including Red Lobster, Outback, The Outrigger and several restaurants in the hotels lining Waikiki Beach. I will stay here on my next visit to Oahu.
user_location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States

review_body: This hotel is pretty rundown. The elevators are filthy dirty. The hotel itself had some type of smell to it. It is just not the cleanest of hotels. The only good thing I can say is it is centrally located in the heart of Waikiki. It's walking distance from all the shops and restaurants and about a 15 minute walk to the beach. Rooms are very small and outdated. I realized when I was there that it was a Wyndham property, so that explains a lot to me. I am not fond of Wyndham properties. There was no bar or restaurant on the site. Actually at the hotel itself there really is nothing to do. You have to go outside of the hotel. The pool is very tiny. I won't stay here again
Towels, sofas, beds, bathroom... clean, neat.... I am 100% satisfied. If Ramda can give free parking... but it seems inpossible in Waikiki.

The room was nice but this was my wedding and honeymoon. The couch was very unclean soild spots every where one bed was broke. Refrigerator didn't work, toilet leaked, coffee maker didn't work, for 6 days it was a constant somethings needed to be replaced or repaired. The cleaning team will enter your room unannounced again honeymoon. It's an awesome view from the balcony. Just too many interruptions

Stayed here before our cruise, hotel is in a great location, very clean, checked in and out super easy. Great wifi. Coffee shop around the corner open 24 hours great for the time change when you are hungry and 4am. Close to beach and shops within walking distance. Took the speedy shuttle to the hotel, worked well. Very happy with this hotel, highly recommend it!

The hotel was clean and 15 minutes from the beach. I was surprised that staff were not more friendly nor outgoing. No one offered a map or told about the pool and amenities on the second floor. There was no offers of finding activities or restaurants. Although there was a desk with a concierge title and leaflets, there was never anyone there to consult. However the desk people were helpful when requested .

Great location with easy access to Waikiki beach, Alamona shopping center, and lots of restaurants, The room was spacious and very clean. We took Balcony option which we felt is not worth the extra money. Overall, we were happy with our 4 nights of stay at this hotel. The thing we did not like is the information that was on the hotel website about the buffet breakfast. The website indicates "a small charge" for buffet breakfast but when I asked at the front desk about its cost, he does not know. I was told the hotel is no way connected to the restaurant.
Room was very clean and comfortable. Highly recommend this hotel. Easy access to shopping and food areas. Felt very secure in walking the areas.

Staff was friendly, room was clean. Coffee was available every morning. No onsite restaurant but lots of choices in easy walking distance. Parking cost extra. We walked to the beach every day and found lots to do without needing a car.

Coming off of a less than desirable cruise, we had two days and a night in Honolulu to see the sights. We arrived at the hotel around 11 a.m. and were informed that check in time was 3 p.m. but would accommodate us if a room became available earlier. In the meantime, we checked in with the concierge who assisted us with putting together two tours of Honolulu. After a quick lunch we were able to check into our room early. The room was neat and clean and well situated to take a walk to the beach or find a restaurant for dinner etc. We gave this property 5 stars.
The front desk workers were curt and impolite. The hotel itself was alright. The cleanliness was alright.

Ramada Waikiki is a clean and friendly chain hotel near Waikiki beachesClose to all amenities and a range of restaurants.Price was right and much better than some of the traveler hotels I have stayed at in Waikiki.Just a short walk to the beaches at Hilton Hawaiian Village and Fort Derusse.Also a bit easier to find free parking along the canal.

The Ramada Plaza Waikiki is definitely a great hotel in which I would highly recommend. I was born and raised on the island and I tend to stay in a hotel whenever I have functions here in Waikiki for my convenience. Therefore, with the many events that I attended to in my lifetime, I have stayed at many hotels in the past and my ratings is based on price, credibility, cleanliness, friendliness, and a sense of a safe feel. Ramada Plaza Waikiki Hotel has all of that plus more. In addition, I like that they have hot coffee, hot tea, and iced water for guests in the lobby every morning.

Nice place, housekeeping service is excellent, they say sea views on the website but that's only if you have the penthouse - maybe! all you can see is the road and the back of the other buildings. But we stayed there 3 nights and it was a very spacious room. Downside is that I picked to share one bed when booking, and the room had two seperate beds.. oh well, overall opinion of the place is pretty good though! Will probably stay again if i don't win the lottery to be able to afford all the other places around there...

Nice for the price - but EVERYTHING needs updated and cleaned really well. The place was just old which contributed to its dusty, musty, uncleanliness. Staff was nice - I probably wouldn't go back after knowing more about the area now.

Great location and clean rooms. The staff was amazing and very helpful with all of our many questions. Special shout out to Sui who made us feel like we were visiting Ohana from the night we got there.

The Ramada Plaza is definitely not the Ritz but is excellent in its own way.Most of the staff were really friendly and happy to help with all requests.Our room was large, clean and equipped with coffee/tea making facilities; a reasonable size bar fridge; a large microwave; a bath/shower; hairdryer; free internet; an array of cable chargers; and a safe.The foyer has a fantastic gift shop which sold cow hula fridge magnets and the same thing as an ornament too. :-)The outside pool was clean, was medium in size and went from 3 feet to 7 feet deep. Unfortunately area surrounding the pool was missing something to make it more appealing. Perhaps some pot plants or some colour as it just had a drab, cement look and feel to it.There is an undercover, designated, smoking area outside, across from the foyer.The Hotel is extremely well position as it seemed to be in the middle of everything.It was only a very pleasant 10 - 15 minutes walk to Waikiki beach in one direction, or Waikiki shops in an other.The Ala Moana Shopping centre was also 10 - 15 minutes walk from the Hotel or you could catch the (19 or 20) bus. The bus stopped right outside the front of the hotel. The cost of a bus ride, no matter how far you were going was $2.50US.There was plenty of good eating places which surrounded the hotel that served breakfast, lunch and dinner. Our favourite was Snappers as they served Cider on tap. We had and excellent experience at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki and would be happy to recommend this hotel to anyone who was looking for comfort and homely rather than Ritzy and expensive.

Arrived late on Sat night, 5 Mar, 2016 from LAX. Had requested a late check-in, and all paperwork was ready upon arrival. @ 2330. Had arranged a flat rate Star Taxi transfer from HNL to the hotel, and avoided huge taxi line. Cost was $30;+ tip; took ~ 25 minutes; and the driver was awake!Room 1404 had a city view; a microwave, fridge & coffee serice; flat screen TV; King size bed; 2 chairs& work desk; free high speed internet; & refurbished bathroom, with amenities - very nice!The lobby contains a travel bureau, internet service, newspapers, gift shop, and cold water/coffee/tea setup through about 1300 hrs. Staff is very friendly & accommodating.Waikiki Beach is about a 10 minute walk, with direct access in between hotels. Very handy! A geat variety of eating establishments are close by, including an Oriental Buffet right outside the hote; an IHOP about 50 yards away; and a 24 hr coffee shop about 100 yards away. Most places offer free Wi-Fi.A bus stop right in front of the hotel will take you to Chinatown on Bus #19 or 20. Fare is $2.50 for adults or $1 if you're over 65 (show your medicare card). Most buses have a sign indicating which stop you're approaching.This was NOT the Hilton Hotel; however, for the location, price & overall service, we highly recommen it, and will stay here again. Enjoy it!

We stayed here for 3 nights and the location was perfect for us, right across the street from the Hilton Hawaiian Village and the Ilikai resorts, but without the resort fees for hotels right on the beach. We weren't going to spend much time there except to sleep and to get ready for our day on the island, so the hotel was perfect for us.The facility is clean, up-to-date, safe, and the staff is friendly. I noticed airline crews staying there which I think is a good sign about a hotel. It was an easy walk to the beach, restaurants, and other attractions of Waikiki but without the noise and chaos over closer to the beach. The mall is only three blocks away but we didn't go there. The ABC stores (convenience stores) are close by, but I think they are everywhere over there.We were in a balcony room and I really enjoyed sitting out there early in the morning and at the end of the day. We had a city-view room which I think would be quieter than the rooms on the other side of the building facing the busy road the hotel is on. The area our balcony faced seem to be mainly residential and condos. There are normal city sounds (car horns, sirens occasionally, construction noise in the day), but I left our sliding door open all night to enjoy the fresh air and could sleep with no problem. Looking left out of our balcony you could see just a tiny patch of ocean. I think the rooms on the other side may have a bit bigger patch of ocean visible, but the view is mainly blocked on that side too due to the highrises and hotels between the Ramada and the water.The bed and pillows were comfortable and the room was made up well each day. There is a mini fridge and microwave in the room. Water pressure and temperature were good. They have ice water and coffee available in the mornings in the lobby. We had a car and parked at the hotel for $20 per night as Wyndham Rewards members; I think it is $5 more per night without the card. The city buses also stop right in front of the hotel. Parking seems safe as there is a person on duty and actually patrolling the lot all day and night.We didn't use the pool but it looked OK and seems like only a few people were using it at any given time. It wasn't an issue for us, but there was a sign on the gift shop in the lobby saying it would be closed until May. There is also a concierge / tourist info person in the lobby, but we had made our own plans.The only problem we encountered was the hair dryer outlet in the bathroom didn't work and wasn't fixed while we were there. We tried resetting the GFI button on the outlet but that didn't do the trick either. I had told the front desk about the problem the first morning of our stay but nothing was done to repair it before the end of our stay.All in all, we enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.

The Ramada Plaza Waikiki was definitely a great stay while we were in Oahu. We arrived at two separate times, me from Ohio and my boyfriend from Kwajalein. I was the first to arrive and the staff was very professional, courteous, fun and helpful. It was nearing the Christmas Season and the hotel lobby area was beautifully decorated. Our room was clean and comfortable as was the pool area. Our main stay was at another hotel, but for work scheduling purposes, the Ramada Plaza Waikiki was our first night and last night lodging location. I can say that having been in another resort in Oahu and one in Maui, the staff absolutely won out over the other two with their hospitality.We would definitely stay here again.
We stayed here for 4 days and must say we had a great stay. Would def come back to this location if we would return to Honolulu. The Staff is really friendly and very helpful.

This is a Wyndham family hotel and is situated just a trolley ride or short walk from Waikiki Beach. The rooms are clean and well equipped and are affordable. Good family restaurants are close by and is just across the street from the Hilton Hawaiian Village.

My wife and I recently spent four nights at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki (RPW). For three of the four days she attended a conference at the Hawaii Convention Center while I goofed off. For our purposes the RPW was ideally situated. It was convenient to both the Convention Center as well as the Waikiki Beach district (a ten minute easy walk to either location). Plenty of nearby restaurants to frequent (we visited Chiba Ken (twice!), Chai's Waikiki and the Waikiki Brewing Company. Also the Wailana Coffee House for breakfast. The room was we ll maintained for the price and the staff was great. I particularly appreciated their concierge service, who gave us good advice on both dining and tour options. Overall I'd recommend the RPW to anyone who is attending a conference or event at the Hawaii Convention Center.

The Ramada Plaza Waikiki is in the midst of quite a number of hotels near the convention center. It is clean, and the staff is very friendly and helpful. There is no view of the ocean or bay, but it is in a decent neighborhood near many restaurants, shops, etc.

My stay was a quite pleasant one. The room was clean, neat and fresh. I was very satisfied about the room. My stay was too quick to judge the other facilities.However, when we first arrived, the staff at the receptionist don't even say good evening to my wife, and he just asked for my identification right off the bat. He was quick and leaves the feeling that he just want to get it done with, even though there were no other guests around, so there was not even a reason to rush things over.

I visited Honolulu for a conference and stayed at this hotel . I reached the hotel after a 10 hour flight from Melbourne at 0700 . I was told that the check in would happen only at 1500 hrs . Staff were extremely inconsiderate and rude . I had to unpack my stuff in the lobby area . There are better hotel options in this area . Rooms are ok but I would never visit if the staff are so unfriendly
Though the hotel has no ocean view and not close to the beach, I would recommend this to everyone . The hotel is very clean , the staffs are very accomodating.

Rooms were clean, staff was friendly and it has a gym and pool. I stayed here while at a conference and it was pretty perfect for that. The restaurant attached to the hotel is an actual Chinese buffet, but there's plenty of other options in the area. It's across the street from the beach and generally has good access to everything.

We stayed here in Feb. of 2016. Glad it was just one night. The lobby looks inviting, a little busy (cluttered), and the rooms are a good size, but my feet were literally brown after walking on the carpet barefoot for just a few minutes. The hallways are dingy, low cielings and very warm (it was only about 80 outside). It was ok for a one night stay, but I would not stay here again.

It was great! We couldn't expect more! Sparkling cider and box of chocolates were waiting for us in the room. Room was spacious, very clean with a huge balcony. I would definitely stay there on any occasion.

Stayed on the 8th floor in one of the 20 or so rooms with a balcony. It was a city view. I am a tough grader and the hotel experience was PERFECT. I have no suggestions! Property was clean and in great shape. Everyone on the staff took great pride in their work. I will definitely stay here again. If you want a property near the beach and walk-able to Waikiki shopping and restaurants, this is the place. My rate was much less than the Hilton across the road and since I wanted to enjoy the beach, why pay resort fee for things I did not need.Need to walk half a block in either direction from the front entrance to head toward the beach or city. Saw an airline crew check in, so you know the place is top notch.Self parking in a surface lot. If full, no hassle, the onsite attendant will take your keys and park car later when a space opens up. Spotless laundry room on the 2nd floor and a small clean outdoor pool. Bus stops in the block if you don't have a car. Coffee/tea in the lobby each morning. 2 computers and tour assistance in the lobby.Flat-screen TV, Time Warner cable TV and WiFi.

Room was great clean and comfortable beds. Shower pressure was perfect. The only downfall was the location. After previously staying at the Ohana east hotel I preferred that location better as there is more nightlife. If you like the Ala Moana shopping centre think would be great for you as it is quite close. The great thing about this hotel was the no daily fee charge. Wifi was quick aswell. The beach was a bit of a trek to get to as we had to go through the Hilton. If your looking for a clean room with free wifi and no room charge this is for you but if your wanting more off a nightlife zone I'd say try another location

Our flights have been cancelled and we stayed there for two nights at the last minute. We arrived at noon and the frontdesk charge us in advance the sum of the two daily and another filing fee. After all expenses paid, he said that we have to come back at 3PM to enter the hotel (???).All we ask in reception, the answer was "we can't" and "don't have". The computer didn't work for we print the boarding passes and the check out could not be increased by less than $ 70. We do not recommend this hotel to anyone, definitely they don't know how to handle or to please the guests!

Convenient location to restaurants, shops and beach. Clean and comfortable room. Good facilities and friendly helpful staff. A little traffic noise at night was the only negative, so a room away from the main road may help light sleepers.

Very clean, pleasant staff, close to Waikiki Beach, close to food & shopping. Stayed 2 nights & beds were comfortable. Jazmine the Concierge was very sweet & helpful. She recommended restaurants that were terrific. Recommended some tasty local food also. Glad we listened to her.

This is the 3rd stay at this hotel, I like it. The staff are always pleasant and professional. The room, lobby and elevators are very clean. The only concern I had was that due to the room's location above the pool, the AC had a fragrance of chlorine. I'm sure that I could have gotten another room. But as I stated before, I like this hotel and the way it's run.

Excellent service and rooms!.Staff at the hotel could not do more for us.They were ever so willing to help out anytime, be it with hotel services or general information about busses or touring.The hotel is ideally situated and has very easy access to the local busses. Great eateries around too and just a 20 min stroll to Alamona Shopping centre.A great place to stay!

Stayed here with a family of 4. Rooms were "tidied" daily although having room service knock on the door at 0800-0830 in the morning was a bit early. Majority of the staff were unapproachable and didn't appear friendly except for concierge staff who were very welcoming and extremely helpful. The pool area was very run down and kids ended up with ear/sinus infections after swimming there. Not a bad room for the price especially if you are planning to be out all day exploring but I wouldnt stay for more than a day or 2.

Though it is not in the busiest part of Waikiki, there are some small shops and some restaurants in walking distant, thus it is not too noisy and quite fit my preferance. Within 2 mins driving time, cross the river, you arrive the center of Waikiki.

Staff and Rooms , Very Good, Access to Shopping and Dining within feet of the Hotel. Women's and Men's Hawaiin Clothing and Accessories and Souveniers at Great Deals at the little shop around the corner from the Hotel called "WOW HAWAII" Waikki Harbor and Boats 1 block away . beautiful Harbor View. A highlight of our trip. Doug Christensen

The property itself is older and not quite as fancy as others, but my stay here was excellent! My fiance and I stayed in a room that had a balcony overlooking Ala Moana Blvd, and the city lights at night were beautiful. The room was a decent size and always clean. The staff was extremely friendly and welcoming the entire stay! What I liked most about this hotel was its location; it's across the street from Hilton Hawaiian Village and Waikiki Beach. We loved that we could walk over the the Hilton and enjoy all the hustle and bustle of that area, and then go back to our quiet hotel when we were done. Also, the pool area at the Ramada was clean and very quiet - we were often the only people there, which is so much better than the pools at the larger hotels, that were always packed with people! I highly recommend staying here if you want something near the beach but don't want to be within the crowds every second. Overall it was a great stay, thank you!
Older hotel, but lobby is welcoming and staff is very accommodating. Room nothing fancy, but clean, comfortable, and quiet. Would recommend, especially for a short stay in Honolulu.
Just a quick overnight stay. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Rooms were clean, nicely decorated, and quiet.

The Ramada is an older property but is in a good location on the edge of Waikiki. The rooms are fairly small, but the balcony makes the room seem larger and it is nice to be able to sit outside. The air conditioners are quite noisy. The room was clean and the employees are very friendly. The pool is small but okay. The guest computers would not print our boarding passes; however, the front desk was able to print them with ease. Buses are readily available to other areas of Waikiki. Ala Moana shopping center is within walking distance.

One thing that will impress the traveler staying at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki, is that, you are warmly welcomed by attentive and courteous front desk help. The rooms are clean and equipped with microwaves and internet connections. Though the wifi connection worked, my connection did drop rather frequently which was a bit of a pain. All in all, one should seek a hotel that gives one the ability to relax in a clean surrounding with nice views and the Ramada Plaza Waikiki achieves this.

One of the most beautiful places to visit with friends or family. It's warm..magic and expensive.. but worth it! Need to rent a car if you wanna visit all the places... and not allowed to miss the Wonderful luau party.

Here's a very nice hotel with a great location when travelling on a budget. It's across the street from the Hilton village (and its beach) close to many good restaurants. Slept well and has a nice pool (slightly cool). Staff could be a little more friendly/helpful. This also seems to be the hotel for AirChina crews. Not a problem except that they arrive/leave in large groups so if you happen to arrive at the same time, you might a wait.

Love this hotel. Nice and clean and the staff were excellent. Rooms were big and the hotel is in a great area for all the attractions. We have stayed at all the hotels in Waikiki and this hotel is better than any 4 or 5 star hotel!
Room was clean comfortable if a little small for 4adults. Great helpful staff. Good location close to beach and shopping centres.

I like everything in this hotel except the front desk staff. The customer service is very poor at the front desk. They never give a smile when you approach them. No THANK YOU even once during our entire visit in this hotel. I feel like I am not the one paying for our stay and I owe them for letting me stay in this hotel. Not a good welcome. I guess they should be sent to a hotel seminar on how to deal with guests to gain guests loyalty. I arrived past 2 to check in and I was told that my check in time is at 3 PM. So I waited at the lobby and it was already a little past 3PM and nobody approached me still until I went to the front desk and asked. No guests at the front desk at that time so no excuse that they are busy dealing with other guests. I am sorry but very poor service at the front desk which is the window of the hotel. Thank you for asking.
Room was cramped. A/C was totally inadequate. Bellman rude. But as usual...location, location location.

Stayed at Ramada after our cruise around the islands. Overall it was a pretty good choice for us due to its proximity to Waikiki Beach and lower price. The staff was very helpful and courteous. We got a room with two double beds through Expedia. The room was clean and well maintained although it was pretty small for three adults. There were also relatively few electrical outlets available for charging electronic devices. With that said we would recommend the hotel to others traveling to Honolulu for a short stay during the Christmas period when rates are high all over the island.

There is really nothing special about the Ramada. It is a cheap mid-level apartment block hotel. It is situated within a short walk to Waikiki and the associated bars and restaurants (which is really good).It is slightly tired in places and the $15 a day parking fee was steep. The outdoor pool was on the roof of a lower floor so was overlooked by hundreds of hi-rise apartments, so no sun after 3pm.For all that, the Ramada was a good price when it comes to staying in Honolulu. Don't knock that. A reasonable room and a slightly less than perfect location at a less than £100/night is not to be sniffed at.The problem with Honolulu is that if you want to be near Waikiki, you need to pay through the nose for an airport shuttle or taxi. If you have a hire car, you pay for parking. Oh, by the way, traffic in Honolulu is horrendous come the rush hour.However, my criteria is always "value for what we paid". So £110 (including the parking) for a small room in a tired hotel cannot really lead to a good rating. (Beware though, on my ratings most of Honolulu would be average - definition of average?).

Good option for my business trip but it wouldn't be my first choice for vacation. Convenient location with relatively short walk to convention center as well as the beach. I'd recommend trying to get a high floor because it is on a busy/noisy street. My room on the top floor was surprisingly quiet as long as the door to the small balcony was closed. Unfortunately the only view from the balcony was of the even taller hotels right on the beach.

The lobby isn't terrible but the rooms themselves are seriously weathered and WAY past due for some updating. And when I say updating I mean totally gutted. Location OK. Staff were adequate. Found some maggots on the shelf next to the mini fridge, in plain sight. Only stayed here 1 night as the good hotels were booked for the Honolulu marathon. The price seemed reasonable when I booked but once we got into to the room not so much. Most of the other guests I saw resembled "the people of Walmart" emails I have seen.
Fabulous location. Helpful staff, nice rooms. Close to everything. Discounted parking for Wyndam Rewards members.

Although right on the strip of Ala Moana Drive, we spent the majority of our time at other resorts. The room was clean, but the decor felt a stuck in the 80s. The facilities were poorly maintained, for example the few exercise machines, the bicycle wasn't working and the pool had major cracks in it and didn't feel kept up, especially when we would find napkins and other personal items in the water. The noise level was high with old windows that didn't seal completely, and in the mornings, we could smell the Chinese Restaurant below prepping their food.

This was our first stay in Waikiki, as we live on the Windward side. We were greeted helpfully by the parking attendant and efficiently by the front desk. Our small room was located on the 10th floor, facing Ala Moana Blvd, which was not that noisy. Best thing: we both thought the bed was very comfortable and clean. The shower had great pressure and plenty of hot water, the room was stuffy and warm without the fan/ac, but the fan made enough noise to wake me a few times. My wife thought the room could be better cleaned. We did not partake in breakfast or anything else hotel related. The price was very good for staying in Waikiki, and the location was close to Ala Moana Center and park.
