The hotel probably caters to budget travelers; we were there for the location: close to the start of the Honolulu Marathon.The wifi was free, but a bit slow.We have stayed in worse hotels and better hotels, this was very average
Great location for our business trips, nice clean room and excellent internet connection. Thanks for the friendly services!

Booked as a last minute stay for Pearl Harbour Day. Hotel is an older one but appears to be recently refreshed from top to bottom. Checking in was very quick and all the amenities were explained up front. I didn't rent a car this time but, since the bus stops right outside of the property (right at the end of the driveway), it wasn't needed. You will need one (or catch a cab) if you need to get your day started before 05:30 since that is when TheBus begins operations. Parking is on site and $25.00 per day which is pretty much the standard amount if you can park on the property where you're staying.Room was exceptionally clean and all amenities listed on the website were provided: refrigerator, microwave and free WiFi. I did use it and, perhaps because I had a higher floor (room 1505), it worked great... not slow and no dropping. Did my typical bed check, down to the mattress, and nothing there but me. Air-conditioning worked oh too well during the day and, due to unusually chilly nights, so did the heat!A very pleasant stay and literally a five minute walk to Waikiki beach and the stores. TheBus down to Ala Moana shopping centre (all the routes that pass by the hotel stop there... $2.50 a ride with a free two time transfer ticket) is clean and professional. The drivers will be happy to make sure you get where you're going and transfer where you should. The routes 19 & 20 both serve the airport internally while the others pass by on Nimitz Hwy. My no car vacation was great... stay here and yours may be as well.
The staff was very courteous and helpful! The rooms are very Clean and Comfortable ! Very enjoyable Stay!
Great staffMy biggest problem was the in room WiFi speed which was very slow (3 mbps), and the lobby computers which were so slow that I could not print my Boarding passes.This needs to be fixed

As part of our RTW trip we also stayed a few nights in Honolulu. We chose the Ramada fpr its location (not knowing the area and not wanting to book an all-inclusive package). Location and parking are good and within a short walking distance we found restaurants, a Starbucks and the beach (part of our morning routine, the hotel does not offer restaurant/food services apart form in-room dining provided by 3rd parties). Our room was what we expected and all furnishings worked just fine (including internet access). The hotel staff was very friendly and attentive/helpful and we enjoyed our stay at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki.

Room was not ready for check in at 3:00 pm like started for check-in time. When i was given the rim key and went to the room it was still being cleaned. Computer system was down so they could not charge my card. When i checked out the next day, 11/15/15, computer was still down and i was told i would be emailed a receipt. I still have not received a receipt and my card was not charged until the 27th. Hotel was not with the money I was charged for one night.

We stayed 2 nights at the Ramada on our way to and back from Australia. The checkin was friendly and simple, arriving early or flying out late they have a secure lockup for your luggage. I left my camera back with no worries. The rooms are clean and well equipped including a safe (no charge). There is also free wifi, a small fridge and a microwave. The location is great, across from the Hilton and less than 5 minutes to walk to Waikiki Beach. I rate it as a four star only because it cannot be called luxurious but in its price range you could not ask for more.
Large clean room. Location was close to the the beach and shopping. All of the employees were great.

I had a quick stay there on a business trip. The staff was very friendly and the grounds were well kept. The rooms were alot larger than a neighboring hotel my co-worker was staying at. It is in areat location although you don't get a great view fom the hotel. I would definitely stay there again.

Location was good, walking to restaurants and beach very doable. Bed was comfy and plenty of pillows to choose from. Mini Fridge and microwave in all rooms. Stayed on the 15th floor and never had a problem getting one of the two elevators in less than a minute. Try to get a balcony on the ocean side-we did not and were pretty well surrounded with other buildings. Service was cordial, great visit to this beautiful island. We will be back!

The hotel lobby and my room were very nicely decorated - it must have been recently renovated. It is across the street from Hilton Hawaiian Village so not too far from the beach.It is one of the less expensive Waikiki hotels and easily the best I have stayed in.

This hotel was so much more than I expected. Everything was excellent! The price was fabulous using Wyndham's new program with points and money. The location and was excellent and the people were totally helpful . I have stayed in many properties in Waikiki; this one I would recommend without hesitation. It was clean and comfortable.

We actually stayed here in March 2012 for 9 days. Our flight in was around 8:30am and raining really bad, unfortunately due to been early we couldn't check in til 3pm and after a 9hr flight all we wanted to do is wind down, after sitting in the lobby for an hr or so we freshened up and were able to leave our bags at reception til our room was ready. After walking around Waikiki (feeling much better) we headed back at 3:30pm and our room was ready. The room wasn't too bad, bed and pillows were comfy. Our room was always serviced no matter what time we left. One downfall we had was they switched the water off around 9:30pm til 6am next day which was really annoying because we couldn't flush the toilet or shower and worse part was my hubby had way to much to drink that night and spewed all in the toilet and of course it had to sit in there til the water came on to flush. The wifi wasn't the best, but the computer in the lobby wasn't to bad. Don't eat at that asian buffet thing next to it, its absolutely terrible. The trolley stops right out front which was great, and also the local bus is out front too which was great as we used it to go to Pearl Harbor and only cost $2.50 at the time. All in all was a good hotel for us, away from the hustle n bustle of Waikiki, which made it a more enjoyable walk to and from the hotel to Waikiki. So for the price we paid it was nice here especially when you're just looking for a room to sleep knowing your going to be out sightseeing all day.

Though this is not beachfront, I had an adequate room, clean bathroom and grounds, excellent service, and a lower cost airport shuttle than taxis. With a priceline.com combo with airfare, I paid under $100 a night. It's about a mile to the beach and there are a lot of restaurants, shops, buses, and taxis in the area. The staff was very attentive and they had free kona coffee in the morning and ice water throughout the day in the lobby. Very handy was free Wi-Fi in my room and a business computer downstairs where I checked in to my flight and printed my boarding passes right there for free.

We stayed at the Ramada Plaza recently and were pleasantly surprised. Although the lobby is small and there is no food service, our room was quite ample, clean, and priced reasonably.We were very near the beach, the Hilton Hawaiian village and a number of good restaurants. The staff was super helpful and nice. We would stay there again.

Pros:Clean, reasonably sized rooms, decent location, fridge, microwave, everything worked well, no issues.Very friendly front-desk staffCons:Not in the heart of Waikiki (15-20 min walk via shopping or 30 mins walk along the water/beach/boardwalk) if that is what you wantCheck-in, check-out slow. Computer was apparently down both times, but seeing their process, we think it is never up

All service were good, staff made real efforts to please. The room was good and location was not far from anything really. What I liked best was that the staff treated everyone great. the real downer was paying to park. Paying $25 a day was over the top! Yeah, it was reduced to $20 because I became a member of the rewards club. But in all my years of travel, I never had to pay to park as a guest. Really disappointed.

I looked for several hours and this was the most reasonably priced and clean hotel that I found in Waikiki, near Ala Moana. My only problem was not being able to stay after noon (my flight left in the early evening) without being charged half a nights fee. I got to the airport hours too early and slept on the floor there.

If you are looking for a place to lay your head while staying in Honolulu, the Ramada Plaza is centrally located and is priced for what you get. The rooms were clean and basic. While it is across the street from one of the more opulent resorts, the Hilton Hawaiian Vacation Resort, the Ramada is about as basic as you get. My only complaint was the noisy flight attendants whose voices I could hear through the adjoining suite/pass-through doors at 5:00am. They have a small roof-top pool and welcoming, professional front desk help which was nice as well.

I just completed a stay here. The hotel staff is terrific, from front desk to security to housekeeping. Everyone gets an A+! It's a great value.My only concern is the location. If you want to be in the thick of it on Waikiki and not walk much, you may want to look elsewhere.Having said that, my walk time to the beach and such was about 10 minutes. Check it out on Google maps and see what suits you. It was great for me.I would love to stay here again!

It was within walking distance to the beach and shops.Room was basic but the only downfall was having been bitten by bed bugs for 2 nights. Caught the bug and took it downstairs to show management. Got moved to another room. A discount of rooms would have also been nice.Also the room keys kept on wiping off and had to change and reload room keys 5 days out of the 7 nights we were there.

Thanks RPW, really pleasant stay. Look its dated but the bed is comfy, the room is clean and the staff are friendly! In our room was chocolates and apple cider with their compliments and I have to say it's doubtful our hotel next week in Waikiki will offer the same. Close to a major shopping centre and Hilton Hawaiian Village is across the road, nice to visit for dinner or a good bar.

Don't let the Ramada name fool you they bought this from another hotel it is extremely clean and nice looking and for the price good luck matching it. I had a balcony room on the 12th floor it was very nice I could see a little bit of the ocean and had a nice view of the mountains. the 10% Kona coffee in the room was a joke the coffee down stairs was way better just wish it was offered all day. Lobby computers are a joke couldn't print my boarding passes they are too slow and kept crashing the front desk was able to print them very quickly for me. My only real issue is all the dang buses that crowd the entrance often blocking me in the handicapped parking stall.

Older Hotel, but well kept up. Staff was very friendly and was parking was a breeze. Note that there was a daily fee for parking. We had a room on the 17th (top) floor that was clean and comfortable. Although it faced the ocean, there were taller hotels around us so there was no view of the water, just of other hotels. We were only here for a short one night stay, so this was fine. It was within walking distance to the beach as well as a large number of restaurants and shopsWifi worked well. It was a treat to see a charger in the room that could handle all type of connections – perfect for those that forget their charger!

In the middle of Waikiki, the hotel is close to everything. You can walk every where and it was off the freeway so it was a short drive to my family's hose. The hotel was clean and well maintained. The front desk staff is very friendly and helpful.
Overall good service and nice room and location. Lose the paper cups, get rid of the loud air conditioning and it will improve the room and its perception.
Hotel staff great, room a little dated but very clean and comfortable and the wifi speed was great. No complaints, it was a perfect place for an overnight stopover/

The hotel is not the Hilton, but it is very very nice for the price. The beds are comfortable, refrigerator and microwave in room. Spent 10 days there enjoying myself. Service staff was friendly and not intrusive. Parking is the only drawback if you have a large car....
The stay here is good. The price was right and the staff was competent and professional. Good value.

Very affordable, clean rooms, big pool that my son enjoyed swimming in, and very close to downtown where I was attending business meetings! Close to a variety of restaurants from budget to expensive and the beach was nearby too. Overall, I would stay here again!
Very kind and helpful staff, especially that I did not have a credit card for security but the staff accepted a cash deposit which was refunded upon check out.

For most purposes, the hotel was just fine and reasonably priced by Waikiki standards. Everything was clean, the a/c worked fine, and the bed was nice. Of course you don't have beachfront access, but at this price I can accept that. If they attended to a couple of weak points it would have been a perfect stay:- half-empty bottle of mouthwash in the bathroom- very unstable wi-fi; certainly not useful for streaming audio, and having to rely on mobile data service for 5 days means I'm up against my monthly limit. Considering this is emphasized as a selling point, it should work properly.- clock radio does not receive anything on FM, which is why I was trying to stream audio in the first place.- the pool itself was clean, but the patio was warping from moisture, and had crumbling grout between the slate flagstones. Also, a late 8am opening means no early morning swim before the kids come out...- judging by the smell wafting out, the restaurant (Wok-kiki - geddit?) was a greasy Chinese place. For breakfast (and other stuff) you're better off checking out one of the excellent nearby options like Goofy or Kimobean, or something in one of the other hotels.
Hotel was ok. No hot water in the bathroom sink and adjusting the temp in the shower was a problem. Otherwise ok.

Location was not the best, it was close to a lot of high end shops which we were not looking for. ABC store down the street, Starbucks in the Hilton hotel across the street, and many restaurants located close by. About 10 min walk from Waikiki beach which was nice. Service was good but rooms were outdated for the price. Pool was small. Parking was reasonable and convenient, only $20 a night for Wyndham Rewards member. Overall a pleasant experience.
Helpful concierge, great location, paid a 3 star price for something like a 4 star. Bellmen were on it. I'd book there again.

The hotel was sparkling clean, the staff were very nice, and the rooms comfortable. The location was conveniently located with a good bus stop just outside the property. The hotel isn't luxurious by any means, but we slept well. The high speed Internet was a bit iffy at times, but overall very valuable.

Checked in 9/25/15Checked in time was supposed to be at 3pm. We got to the hotel around 4:15 but the room wasn't ready yet, so we waited for another 30 minutes or so. Then the room was different than what I had reserved. I had reserved a superior double room with a Partial ocean views are featured from a covered balcony. Featuring a sofa sectional to accommodate guests, room also provides a kitchenette with stove, fridge, microwave, Keurig coffee maker, and dinnerware. And got to the room WITHOUT all these features except small fridge & a microwave. I had wanted the extra space in the room since my husband and I we're traveling with my 15 yrs old daughter & 20 yrs old son on vacation. We went back down to the front desk letting them know we didn't get what we reserved. We even showed them the picture what does it says on their website about room details. But was so disappointed the clerk said the booking.com made a mistake and he couldn't do anything about it. Then I asked him if I could speak to the manager, he came and I showed him my reservation online regarding room details and he said that's for a suite room and that's not what I paid for. They were both so rude and told me it wasn't their fault and that I need to call the booking.com. It was a false advertisement.

We stayed at Ramada Plaza for three nights in July 2015. Our room was pretty dated, and the air-con was noisy, but this helped cover the noise of the street below.Despite this, the room was clean and big enough, and the location was good (about 5mins walk from the beach and about 15mins walk from Ala Moana).We wouldn't recommend this hotel if you're on your honeymoon, however if you're looking for a budget hotel that's not outstanding in any one regard, but is not terrible in any aspect either, then this might be the place for you.

Had no issues with stay really. Bed was fairly comfortable for a hotel bed. Room was clean, and quiet. TV, A/C worked fine. Only gripe I have is with the hotel Internet. Wi-Fi connected fairly easily, however, the Internet speeds were really slow. I ended up just using my phone's data since it was faster. Good place to just unwind after spending a nice long day out on the island exploring. Right across the street from the Hilton Hawaiian Village. About a 5-10 minute walk from the beach, depending on which beach you intend to go to. Tons of places to eat within a 10 minute walking radius. Overall, a good stay.

I had very bad time from the manager in hotel front.His behave and manner of speaking was very bad for me.He does not know what is a service and manner.As he speaks chinese, he is a Chinese or Chinese American.I will never have been there anymore.

We stayed for 1 night while in transit home from US. Rooms were clean and comfy. It is an older building but fine for what we needed. Has ice machine and washing machines. Parking is a bit steep at $25USD but all in all in a good location

The hotel is closed by Ala Moana Mall (around 10 minutes walk)& Waikiki beach (around 15 minutes walk) where you can spend time to shop around or just lay on the beach enjoy the sun & great view. The staff of the hotel is very kind & helpful. They are professional with good customer services. The facility in the room cannot really in modern style, but it gives you the feeling like home. There are lots selection of different kind of restaurants nearby, where you can find some exotic food, which is very convenient. All in all, I like this hotel a lot, and certainly will go back again!!! If you are going to Honolulu, this hotel would be my recommendation.

The room was ok even though it was different than the what I had reserved. I had reserved a superior double room with balcony and kitchenette and got to the room it was a smaller room with 2double beds and no balcony, couch or kitchenette. I had wanted the extra space in the room since I was traveling with my elderly mother on vacation. After showering and noticing the difference in the room I was too tired to go back down to the front desk. When I checked out the next day I mentioned it to the same gentleman who checked me in... He said if I didn't see the picture on their website then they didn't have that room. He lied and told me their rooms did not have balconies nor a k kitchenettes and then proceeded toc credit me $5 for that. The room had a $50 difference in price. I've stayed at hotels around thew irks an have never had an employee flat out lie to me like this. Also, beware there is a $25 daily charge to park in the hotels spots that is operated by a local parking company, not even the hotel even though it's on the hotel property.

Three couples holidaying in Hawaii. We stayed at the Ramada for 4 nights in total. The staff were fantastic, so helpful and couldn't do enough for you. The rooms were huge as were the beds. The Ramada is within walking distance to shopping, restaurants and the beach. We would definately stay there again.

Welcome gift in room was a bottle of water and chocolate macadamia candy. Yummy! I went to Wakiki to watch the Aloha Week parade but was concerned because of the fickle weather. When I got in my room I was happy to see it had a great view of Ala Moana Blvd. The next morning I stayed dry and cool as I enjoyed a bird's eye view of the parade from my window.. Would do it again. The noon checkout meant I was able to see the entire parade. Staff were friendly and efficient.

Last few times visiting Hawaii I've stayed here. The location is easy to get to and I like how the parking is right there. You don't have to park in some huge parking garage and walk so far to get to your room. The only bad thing is if you have a guest coming to see you there's no street parking anywhere close. It's always full all day long. But you can get a parking pass for the hotel parking for an hourly fee or overnight pass. The rooms are nice and I had a balcony this time which I loved to just relax on at night. I would definitely stay here again next time.

We selected this hotel following on-line research which indicated it included airport shuttle service. Upon arriving at the airport we learned that the hotel does not provide complimentary transportation to/from the airport. Even after we showed management where on line it says they provide this transportation option, the manager failed to compensate us even a little for the additional $60 we were out.

I only stayed one night and wished I could have stayed longer. Very clean and comfortable. Great location for walking to Ala Moana Mall or catching The Bus to go down to Waikiki. All the employees at this hotel were so nice and friendly.Awesome stay.

I visited Honolulu to take a professional certification exam at the Pearson Vue Testing Centre in the Ala Moana Centre. The Ramada Plaza was just a 15 minute walk from the testing centre and so I booked a room because it was the best deal in the neighbourhood for a 3 star hotel.My favorite things about the Ramada Plaza were the free internet, great air conditioning, mini fridge and microwave, and easy access to all attractions in the Ala Moana neighbourhood. My room was clean, cool, and decent sized. The shower had excellent water pressure and the shower head was very high end with adjustable massage spray. The shampoo/conditioner/moush wash/body lotion/soap were average quality. There were plenty of towels and the cleaning ladies did a wonderful job each day. The work-out room had decent but older equipment. Everything worked well and that room was kept especially cool, making a vigorous work-out much more enjoyable. There was also a nice cool drinking fountain in the workout room which was nice.The downsides were as follows: View from my window was only into other hotel windows. I did not have a view to the ocean. Even on the 14th floor, the street noise was noticeable and I was awakened one morning at 0300 by a car alarm going off. There was no breakfast buffet or even continental breakfast option. Parking is $25/day on site.

Stayed here for one night while touring Oahu. The hotel is a 5 min walk to the beach. The room was very clean and beds were comfortable. a/c worked great and the wifi was very good. No breakfast, but a small Coffee house just down the street has great food and prices. Parking was $25/nt but if youre a Wyndham rewards member, it was $20. Alot cheaper than other hotels in the area. Would stay here again!

we enjoyed our stay and most likely we will stay in this hotel again.Front desk and housekeeper are very friendly. it's just the location kind offar to walk from the beach. Our room has no balcony to sit and relax, but overall our stay were great.

This property is a few blocks from the beach, and a good value for the money. Room was super clean, and everything worked. Older but in great shape. And it was quiet too; furnishings were fine. Many restaurants in walking distance.

We enjoyed our stay here. Yes the hallways weren't air conditioned but that didn't bother us. Priced reasonably, clean, necessary amenities, within walking distance to beach, restaurants and shopping. Above all the staff was friendly and very helpful! I would recommend and stay here again. Thank You Ramada Plaza for contributing to the best vacation ever!!

Hotel was in fair condition.....there was no A/C in the hallways and very bad odor in the hallways. On Monday 14 Sep 2015 there was no running water in the hotel around 3 pm we almost miss our diner because we could not take shower and after water was fixed it was dark brown color for the rest off the day. The hotel staff not the friendliest if I would have to grade the in friendliness it would give them 3+
Room was nicely air conditioned with good sofa chairs,good view.Service was excellent.aSwimming pool could have been cleaner.Hotel well located.
We stayed here overnight on our trip to Kauai. We found it clean and convenient for our purposes. The be d was extremely comfortable

I occasionally return to hawaii to see family and have stayed at the ramada several times. My family is always happy with the polite and helpful staff. They have always gone the extra mile to make our stay special. The rooms are exceptionally clean and comfortable. I will be traveling to Honolulu again for some family business in october and will be staying at the ramada again.

The location was not on the beach but it was close enough to walk to it. It was also in walking distance to the mall and other shopping. Unfortunately, the view did not include a beach view. The concierge did help us book excursions which included transportation and directions to get around. The room did have a safe, microwave and refrigerator.

I stayed at the Ramada Plaza for 7 days the first week in September to attend a conference in the nearby conference center. We arrived early and were fortunate that we could check in around noon time. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is in walkable distance to the conference center and the Aloa Mona Shopping Mall. Just across the street it the Hilton Hawaiian Village with lots of shops and restaurants and a bit further down you are in Waikikis shopping area.The room was clean, WiFi reliable, coffee maker, fridge and microwave were provided.A word of caution: don't use the coffee provided. It says Kona coffee but it is undrinkable. There are ABC stores close by where we went and got 100%Kona coffee. In talking to another guest I was told the coffee provided in the lobby area is better but I never had time to check it out.We will be returning for our last 2 nights on Ohau before flying back home.

I have family in Hawaii. So why do we stay in a hotel for half the trip? Because it's Hawaii! You have to make a vacation of any trip to this beautiful state. That said we choose this hotel because it's reasonably priced at about $110 a night. You can find better rates. For the money it's a true value. It's across the street from Hilton Hawaiian Village, one block from the sands of Waikiki, a short walk to the mall. It's the quietest part of Waikiki.The rooms are clean, the staff is courteous, helpful and treats us like we're in a higher priced hotel. Some people will call the stay average. I call it a bigger bang for my buck! You have to put the hotel and service in context. This is Hawaii. It costs up to $7 for a half gallon of milk. The Hilton across the street, $400 a night minimum! So for about $100 a night I get a clean room, friendly service, 1 block beach access and not a lot of tourists. How could I ask for more at these rates? Granted the views from the rooms are not spectacular, but there's an IHOP next door! I would recommend this hotel if you want a clean affordable place to stay and don't mind being giving up a few amenities nor do you mind staying at the tail end/or start of the Waikiki strip. Aloha
The room was very noisy. Air-conditioning was terrible and stopped every two minutes due to some sensor and the reason was to save electrical bill.Very disappointing experience

Overall, my stay was pretty average. The room was sufficiently clean. The coffee maker was not conveniently located in the room near an electrical outlet. The pool was heavily chlorinated, which is standard for most average hotels. Internet was intermittent.

We stayed at this hotel recently and was delighted with the accommodation and service. Special kudos goes to staff member Kevin, who went out of his way with his outstanding hospitality and made us feel welcomed! Great location, clean rooms, comfortable beds and helpful and friendly staff. We definitely will be returning.
The hotel is located in a nice area with easy access to both Ala Moana and Waikiki. The staff was friendly and the hotel had good service and facilities.
Never again will I stay in a budget hotel. You get what you pay for and I paid $190 and regret it.

We enjoyed our stay at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki. The room was well kept, there was available parking on the property, and the beaches were close. It was fairly inexpensive for its location as well. Wifi was free. Recommended!

We use points for are two nights here and I was pleasantly surprised from some of the reviews I read. I didn't experience any problems and was walking distance to most things. A fitness center with more modern equipment would be nice. Other than that...very good.

Excellent location. Very nice room. The bed was comfortable. The room had a refrigerator and microwave. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay. Would highly recommend.

I stayed here the night before my wedding in Hawaii. Other family members and relatives also stayed in nearby rooms at this hotel. The reservations staff and front desk staff were really nice and the customer service was amazing, both for me and my other extended family members. Thank you so much!

The Ramada Plaza was clean, comfortable and quiet. The parking fee is usually $25 daily but Wyndham members get a $5 discount.The daily room charge was $152 but taxes and parking brought it up to $193.Hot coffee in the lobby every day starting around 630am, perfect for two sleepy guys going to work.Safe parking with an attendant patrolling and checking us every time we drove in. Walking distance to Waikiki and the Ala Moana shopping center.No hotel beach but who cares, just walk 1/2 block and use the Hilton Hawaiian Village or the Hale Koa beach. Bring pool towels from the Ramada and you're set. In Hawaii, the public can access all beaches, even the ones outside hotels.Nice hotel. If I can't get the Hale Koa, I'll stay here.p.s. special thanks to Sui, our favorite bellhop.
parking attendant was very rude and made us feel very uncomfortable. I was suppose to get a call from the manager and they never contacted me.

There was a language barrier/comprehension when checking in, parking was terrible- I had to pay $25 per day. Pool was dirty - and it smelled outside- never used it. This hotel caters primarily to the Asian airline employees, no peace and quite. Too much noise at night.
We enjoyed our stay. Staff was very friendly and efficient. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel or your staff.

This was a nice, comfortable place to stay in Waikiki that is close to shopping and some nice restaurants. I love it that the room included a refrigerator and microwave, and the bed was super comfortable.

I was very surprised about the condition of the furniture in the room as the chairs had significant wear and tear marks. Gave the room a 1990's look as a result. Would not recommend this hotel location.

Room was small, old and cramped, not at all as pictured via internet. No ice machine or other amenities on each floor. No central AC, all window units. Wired internet unusable due to broken connector. Very limited parking available. No in house resturant. Room rate is excessive for what you get. Better price and room next door. Hotel is difficult to locate for strangers to the area. Paid well over $200 per nite for a room that in my home town would not go for $50. Would not stay here again you can bet.

I surprised my sister, son and my son's girlfriend to a "birthday gift" of a week in HNL. I picked the Ramada Plaza without really knowing anything about it, so was just a little leery at first. When we arrived, we were treated very well and given rooms exactly as I had requested. I was overall pleased with the friendliness of the staff (including the housekeeping staff) as well as their knowledge of the island. I was so pleased to find that we were about a block and a half from the beach, lots of shopping around, and good places to eat. The rooms were not very big, but the beds were comfortable and everything was clean. Thanks to the Ramada Plaza Waikiki for helping to make my "gift" all it could be!!!!

Bed looked impressive with six pillows, found them uncomfortable and too small. Room over looked the city, good view. Bus stop right outside door.Ate in restaurant next door for breakfast , Chinese style with Cook own toast, French toast, scrambled eggs, delicious. Other nearby places to eat good too.Almoa shopping centre $2 bus ride away great place to eat in food court. Hilton Hotel nearby lots places to dine, even had fireworks on beach there at 7.45 pm nightly,Tours of island easy to organise as well as to Pearl Harbour.

It would be nice if ice and vending machines were on each floor. The concierge was very nice and helpful setting up activities. It would also be much better if a complimentary or continental breakfast was provided.

The front desk and staff were very helpful and friendly. They dealt with our relatively few questions readily and clearly. The room was nice, nothing special but we weren't looking for any place "special." We were looking for good lodging, convenient location, and reasonable price. We got it.

Our 1st room had a very heavy smell like urine. They said the room received new curtains, however it was obviously not coming from curtains. Our 2nd room of the night the AC was not chilling the room. The maintenance man said its a cool as it gets. We where sweating. Our 3rd room the AC worked and it smelt fine. There are a ton of hotels in the area pick a different one. The bellboy did bring new keys up to room each time, but it was a giant pain to change rooms 3 times.

I stayed here about 9 days. The hotel is pretty close to the beach and other attractions. If you have a rental car, then this is a great place to pretty close to many places while not in middle of waikiki.

Enjoyed our stay the room was serviced and cleaned everyday my only problem was the lousy coffee perc they have in the room it would be best to put a jug and some coffee/tea and sugar sachets overall rating is pretty good
I think that to pay such a high rate for a room then to pay to park and put up with the lot attendents is ridiculous

Staff were friendly, the room was cleaned and sheets straightened everyday. Free WIFI was a plus. Beach was a walking distance, bus stop a few feet away from the hotel, great eating places close by. Mahalo.
Away from Waikiki Beach, small rooms, parking fees are a rip off, free wifi is a bonus, Staff are friendly though. Wouldn't recommend to family with kids

This hotel was more reasonably priced compared to others in the same area, but it did not offer the amenities you would expect in Waikiki. The wifi service and business center computers were painfully slow. There were ants all over the pool area. The maintenance area was poorly disguised near the pool. The balcony did not offer an extraordinary view. However, the staff were welcoming, the laundry machines worked better than any other laundromat I've been to, and the pool water/ chairs disinfected every morning. This would be a good choice if you are a vacationer on the go and need a hotel as just a place to sleep, not as a resort.

Our eight-night stay at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki was most enjoyable. The accommodations were excellent, and the entire staff was most friendly and helpful. It was nice to have both refrigerator and microwave oven in the room, and air conditioning control was very good. Facilities were neat and clean, and the room and floor both were very quiet. There is limited parking, only about 40 spaces or so, but we never had difficulty finding a space, even fairly late in the evening. There is a parking attendant on duty all the time to check and direct incoming cars. Location is not right in the heart of Waikiki but close enough for ease of getting around by walking or by taking the bus. The massive Ala Moana Shopping Center is within an easy walk from the hotel and features a huge assortment of stores and eating establishments, including a large food court featuring much of the local foods. We would certainly stay at this hotel again on a return visit to Honolulu.

Needed a 1-night stay before taking a cruise from Honolulu and spend HOURS looking online for the right place. Wanted a good, safe location at a reasonable price and this was it. This hotel is right across the street from a huge 5-star resort at a fraction of the price. Walk across that property to Waikiki beach. Ala Moana Blvd. has a variety of places to eat in easy walking distance. The hotel is a little difficult to find; it's a bit tucked back off the road-look for the red holiday lights on the palm trees. Hotel is small with no restaurant of it's own, small pool on the 2nd floor roof and small lobby. It's what you would expect given how much less expensive it is compared to surrounding properties; average rooms, décor is a bit tired and limited amenities but you can't beat the location and value. Staff was very friendly and helpful. In room fridge and a couple bottles complimentary water and candies were nice. All rooms in this area experience noise issues since it's a busy street; we were on 12th floor so it wasn't bad. Good value for the location; would recommend it for anyone needing to stay before/after cruise.

A basic clean 3-star hotel with amenities that match. Walls as thin as the wallpaper, bathrooms large enough to spin round in, carpet needing a good shampoo. Coffee machine in the bathroom(?). Swimming pool adequate for doggy paddling. Base for JAL cabin crew. Free wifi. 15mins walk to main Wiki beach - 5mins via Hilton. No double glazing - ask for an even numbered room to face away from the main road. Free wifi!
The hotel needs updating . Yellowis not a Great Wall Color. Staff friendly enough but no one goes out of their way to assist.
Great price and location across from Hilton Wakiki was nice since you could use the pools there

Hawaii seems to be very good to lot of visitors but we had experienced different. Hawaii government seems - No care for the VISITORS because it is very famous I the World that they receive millions of visitors ready to pay more without questions and no advertisement. People don't seem to be friendly even when you shop more they don't care. I think it has become trend for Hawaiians to be like no care attitudes. Anyways, the hotel staff was good doing their jobs. Especially the parking guards where very much after even if you are staying there not parking more then 1 hour since you stay in hotel and have handicap person to go to hotel and go for changing or get fresh, they won't let you park even with handicap placard sign even for little bit. Why because they use their handicap parking spots for shuttles or other transport. It is just that part of the hotel we didn't like.Else according to price, you can't get better hotel. Mahalo

I was concerned given the prices in Waikiki and less than stellar reviews for pretty much all hotels, but this one was awesome! Location was fabulous, hotel was clean, staff was very helpful, and it even came with a fitness center for guests to use free of charge. Definitely recommended!
we had 6 family members including a child and teen and staff was wonderful, rooms were very nice and location was good for walking had a great July 4th
Front desk staff was wonderful, very helpful, but the property is dated and the room small. There was hair in the sink and the AC didn't work very well.
It was a good trip.A weekend gataway on the 4 of july. The staff were the best they made sure we were well taken care of the whole time we were there.........thanks you guys

A good location for our next day visit to the USS Missouri and Pearl Harbor, this was one of the best priced hotels in the area and we knew we would not arrive until 8:00pm our first night. We had a penthouse room with a king size bed and balcony although the view once enjoyed by the hotel was obscured by the ginormous Hilton Hawaiian Village Resort located across the street. This was our starting point in Hawaii and it worked out well. Although the room was a bit small, especially the bathroom, it was extremely clean! Nominal parking fee, free coffee and free wifi. You are also steps away from Waikiki Beach and numerous restaurants. The staff was excellent and very accommodating.

We had stayed in this hotel a few years ago when it was a Holiday Inn, so I knew it was a basic hotel that would meet my needs. Easy parking in the back and received $5 off parking ($20) with a Wyndam rewards card. It is possible to walk to several places including the public beach by the Hale Koa. Not too far to walk to all the restaurants on Lewers Street. Our balcony was very small, but we could see a little of Diamond Head. We did not eat at any restaurants on the block. This is not a luxury hotel, but we have been here several times and only needed a hotel for 3 nights. The pool was extremely cold for the end of May, probably because it is in the shadow of skyscrapers part of the day, but you could do short laps in it. A lot of stewardesses stay here. The staff were very polite and friendly. There were no extra daily fees, which is one reason I chose this hotel over others. We were able to borrow beach towels from the front desk for no charge. Beds were comfortable and bathroom was adequate. We did not spend much time in the hotel since, after all, it is Waikiki!!!!

Rooms were clean, staff was extremely helpful, great concierge service, great location. Enjoyed center city location to beach, restaurants, shopping. Close enough to beach and shopping that you can walk to the destinations...multiple restaurants to choose from close at hand and not too pricy for Waikiki.....

right opposite the illikai colossus the bus from the airport (no bulky luggage allowed) stops opposite and the bus back stops right outside the hotelthis used to be a holiday inn and, although the rooms are dated they are clean, a reasonable size, have a fridge plus tea and coffee maker and fair size bathroom with full size bathtubplenty of storage space, tv with lots of channels, very efficient ac, and curtains which block the light (useful after a 20 hour journey from London and 10 hour time difference!)check in was a bit slow as I had forgotten how many nights I had booked (so my fault) but the receptionist coped with me with good humour and sorted me out!tour desk at reception had I needed a tour or attraction bookingnice sitting area there to wait for friends to arrivean easy walk to the beach via the illikai opposite (careful crossing the main road) and you can walk to Waikiki beach on a beachfront path all the way to Waikiki main beach in about twenty minutesplenty of bars and restaurants within easy walk, as was ala moana (less than ten minutes over the bridge) which has buses all over the island and is an enormous shopping centre.

I stayed on the 12th Floor Facing Ala Moana Boulevard. The toilets are extremely low flow flushing making. The internet service whether suing WIFI or the Ethernet cable connected to the router in the room was less than 1MB of download speed. The bathroom wasn't properly cleaned each day.

hotel was great and clean, all employees are nice and greet with a smile.i booked and paid for 7 days stay, but we have a death in the family and cut our vacation short by 2 days, otherwise everything great service as expected.

This hotel offers good value and a quite atmosphere you may not find at other hotels in the area. This is a little older establishment, but the overall amenities offered are good. Great place to stay short term and save a few dollars or for families traveling on a budget.

hotel is a bit dated. I had to move rooms as there was no hot water in my room. Could use a fresh coat of paint, and new furniture. Room was nice and big and comfy beds. I chose to stay here because it was within walking distance of Alamoana Shopping Center, Ross , Walmart, and also a nice walk towards Waikiki.

I recently stayed at this hotel with my family while I was attending a conference. The hotel was very accommodating with my room requests when booking the room over the phone. Our room was on the 16th floor and had two double beds. The AC was effective and having a small fridge in the room was a nice feature. The toilet in our room seemed to run constantly when used. The wifi was reliable and fast. The beds were comfortable and the pillows were of high quality. My only real critique of this hotel is that the pool area seemed to also function as a maintenance work space. The chairs were used to drape the ramada rugs from the hotel entrance in order to dry them in the sun. And the members of staff would visit in the washroom facilities in the poor area.Overall every member of staff I interacted with was friendly and said hello and wished me a good day. The location is convenient for going to the beach. The hotel is a 10-15 min walk to the Honolulu convention centre.

Stayed 2 nights between our stay on Kauai and flight home. Basic hotel room with comfortable beds. Nothing special about the hotel, but adequate for short stay and the price compared to others on Waikiki. No restaurant, bar on site but is a oriental buffet attached (did not eat there). Some restaurant and bars within short walking distance. Pool area with limited seating. Small lobby that can get crowded and noisy very quickly. With noon check out and late evening flights do not offer anywhere to freshen up if you decide to do any activities during the day.

We stayed here for 2 nights after a cruise. The reception and housekeeping staff are very friendly, responsive and knowledgeable, we were warmly welcomed and check-in for both our rooms was very quick and easy. The hotel is well situated close to the yacht basin on the Honolulu side of Waikiki Beach. The beach is great, and is no more than a 5-7 minute easy walk. There are restaurants nearby and in the Hilton Hawaiian Village across the road, the mall is also within walking distance. The rooms were clean and well maintained, although there is no central A/C, there are individual units in each room which can be a little noisy at night. The coffee machine, refrigerator, microwave were all clean and in good shape, which makes this an ideal hotel if you want to bring in food and don't want to every meal out, there is a Food Pantry supermarket 2 blocks away. Complimentary ice water, coffee and computers with internet access in the lobby is a nice touch which you don't find in more upscale properties. Wireless internet access is free in the rooms and public spaces. In summary: Great value in an expensive town, comfortable and clean accommodations and nice people working there !! Recommended

Short stay due to personal reasons.Room was very nice and clean.A decent shower which is unusual!.Location was good.Easy walk to Waikiki and Alo Moana Mall.Complimentary coffee in the morning was a nice touch.The pool on the second floor was nice and clean.plenty of Sun loungers and its a real suntrap if you want a tan!.Reception staff helpful and courteous.I was with my wife and 2 daughters and will definitely try and use the same hotel.I go to HNL every year for a vacation and have stayed in quite a few different hotels.The Ramada Waikiki ranks as one of the better hotels//Paul,Lancaster, Pa

We stayed the night before our cruise. A number of nearby restaurants. Within walking distance of Ala Moana shopping center. Staff very helpful and made us feel welcome. Other reviews spoke of street noise. Our room faced the street and found no noise. I would highly recommend this hotel.
The location is excellent. close to many restaurants, shopping and 15 minutes from the airport..parking is a little expensive at $ 25.00 per night. I certainly would like to come back to this hotel

we enjoyed our stay here. The room smells nice, clean towels and comfortable beds. The staff was very accommodating and respectful. We would recommend this to anyone visiting Hawaii on a budget. The beach is only a few miles away and the location is close to everything. We will stay here again!
We stayed overnight here this past weekend. Clean, comfortable, friendly staff, free am coffee and tea, free wireless, the only bummer was parking was $20 a night.
Only had one night to stay in Honolulu so chose this for price and location. Nice facility and friendly staff. Would definitely stay again.

I travel to Hawaii about once per quarter and recently I have been staying at the Ramada Waikiki. It is affordable and on a direct route to where I work. The staff is friendly though some are a little racist towards Caucasian people but that is actually normal for Hawaii so I'm not sure you can do much about that.
Just cross the street heading to Hilton village and you will see the beach. Very good location.

Unfriendly staff, musty smell in the room and hallway. Parking was not good for the price. If I didn't have a handicap placard I wouldn't have found parking. The only ice machine was located on the 2nd floor, and not throughout the property. No store to buy snacks in.

Stayed for 1 night with 3 rooms all with 2 double beds. House keeping was ok. Mattresses felt worn out, & pillows were lumpy. Windows aren't sealed unit so you can hear the street traffic readily. There was free coffee in the lobby in the morning, & I saw people printing boarding passes in the small business centre. They also have a small fitness centre but I didn't have time to use it.

Nice location on the edge of the Waikiki hotel strip. Good access to the beach through the Hilton. Quick walk into the Waikiki tourist trap. The hotel itself is no frills, basic room, a little small, a little out-of-date. Air conditioner a huge plus. Busy with tourist groups and airline employees. Our room was on the back side so it was relatively quiet. Parking was additional but very convenient. Free wi-fi was great. Staff seemed a little rushed but very friendly and efficient. Overall a nice stay.

Stayed here for a couple of nights. Chose this hotel for the location. Must be near the port. This hotel is good located. Nearby the beach (at Hilton, 3 minute walk), bus stop in front of hotel and a 10 minute walk from shopping centre. We had a balcony room at the 10th floor. Room was absolutely clean. Enough room for the both of us. Not a spectacular view from the balcony, but it was ok. Hotel is a little bit old. Gangways smelled a little bit old, but were clean. Staff is absolutely friendly and helpful. There is always coffee, hot and cold water in the lobby. There is a concierge to buy tours and for information. There is also a little parking, which is secured. No problem for a late check-out and to store your luggage.If we ever go back to Honolulu, we will stay here again.

The location was great with bus stops, restruants and shopping close. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Property was clean and our room had a balcony, and we could get a glimps of the harbor and ocean during the day and the lights at night were wonderful. Perfect for the budget minded vacationer.
Hotel is convenient. Awesome service when we had a problem with checking in. Recommended in next stay

we were well pleased with the exception of high Rates of parking and with an incident with my adult college kids came to pick up their handicap grandmother parking in a handicap stall with permit and took a hour to get her ready and bring her down and parking security insisted they play $7.00 I thought that was total uncalled.

Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Rooms were spacious and clean and the staff are very helpful and friendly. The king bed was fantastic to sleep on. The location is fantastic and you are able to walk to Waikiki Beach or to the huge Ala Moana shopping centre. The trolley or bus picks you up from out the front of the hotel for anyone not wanting to make the 10 min walk. Also a lot of the tour groups pick you up from next door or straight across the road. The Hilton Village is straight across the road with beach access for a swim and a lagoon where they do fireworks every Friday night. Although you don't get any such views from this hotel it doesn't really matter because you are too busy exploring during the day.

This hotel is so clean and neat..They have all the things for a business traveler and leisure one. Customer service is excellent. This is where we stayed all the time since 2000, beach is right across mall is just walking distance. We really like this hotel.

This hotel is located on the main drag in Honolulu near enough to restaurants and shops but at a reasonable price. We walked to a restaurant for seafood and enjoyed music . The staff were very helpful in giving us directions and suggestions. More than adequate for a one night stay.

This was our third time to Honolulu and our first stay at The Ramada. We spent one week here and will here again on our next trip. The staff are friendly and willing to give you maps and help with anything that you need. We had packed light and didn't have any razors etc which they were happy to give us through our stay. We stayed in a King room with a view of the pool. The room was spacious with a comfortable chair for lounging and has a desk for using a laptop etc. The wifi worked well throughout our stay and each room has it's own modem. Our room was cleaned daily no matter what time we went out. The bed was soft and comfy. Our room had a large flat screen TV and a fridge and microwave. The hotel is right across from the Hilton which has free fireworks at 7:00 PM on Fridays. The one negative aspect was that the hotel charges $25 for parking . If you rent a car there is plenty of free parking a few blocks away near the canal. The hotel doesn't offer a free breakfast but there is an Ihop just around the corner from the hotel. The location is great, right across from the beach and just a five to ten minute walk to Ala Moana shopping mall. Walmart is also just a short walk up from the mall as well.  The hotel has complimentary tea and coffee in the lobby in the afternoons and there is a small gift shop which sells post cards etc as well as stamps. The pool is outdoors and there is a small fitness center as well. If you pick up some of the coupon books which are located in the lobby and all over Waikiki there are coupons for transfers to the airport for $6.95 per person. It is well worth it to rent a car and spend the day driving around the island. Hanauma Bay,The bow holes The Bydo temple, Waimea, Dole plantation etc are worth a visit.The drive is absolutely beautiful. If you are looking for souvenirs , Walmart has a good selection at good prices. Also there is still a market near the old International Market and there are ABC stores on every corner. We took a surfing lesson at Moku surf which is just a block from the main beach. We had a Groupon which we paid $45 for. We also rented a board for $20 a day. If you take a lesson they will give you a deal on renting the next day. The Kings village has a little market in the evening with Thai and Chinese food for take away for about $6.00. Taco Bell is also just a short drive from the hotel and has a the dollar cravings menu but the prices are $1.39 an item. Kmart downtown has a Little Caesars in store which has large Cheese pizzas for $7.00. There are also lots of Burger Kings , Mc Donalds, Subways etc although the prices are a bit higher than on the mainland. The trolley is a good way to get around and only costs a couple dollars.

The Ramada Plaza Waikiki is in a great location convenient to everything the tourist needs and wants. It is certainly reasonable by typical costs in Hawaii. The check-in was easy, and the room was clean, comfortable, and up-to-date. Stephanie, the concierge, deserves a medal! She was a great help to us and aided us in making plans just right for us. I would be happy to stay there again!

It was a great location to be in. Many restaurants and cafes. Many places to shop. Entire hotel very neat and clean. Everyone went the extra mile to make sure all your needs were met. Ocean just a short walk away.

Walking distance to many and various types of restaurants of varying price ranges, bus line and beach.Great beds and very clean. Staff were friendly and helpful. No balcony but then again nothing to so see except more high rises.
The hotel was clean and comfortable. The staff was pleasant and helpful. Overall, I enjoyed my stay.

The hotel was nice, nothing fancy but supper clean! Great city view. Thank you ramada for the waters and chocolates you left us on the first day! Service was great! Wifi worked well. Tv had many channels. My only negative review was the parking fee, but Wyndham reward members get a discount!

The Ramada Plaza Waikiki is located across from the fabulous looking (but waaay too expensive) Hilton Hotel. It is about a 25 minute walk to the shopping strip in Waikiki, so far enough away to be not in a very touristy area. The Hilton's beach is about a 10 minute walk and there are lots of shops, including a Starbucks, Crazy Shirts and Hawaiian Cookie Company located in the grounds of the Hilton. Ala Moana Shopping Centre/Mall (the 17th biggest mall in the US) is about a 20 minute walk away also.The distances to walk would be much quicker if not for the many intersections that you need to cross.It is clearly a convenient hotel, as many airline staff use this hotel. The staff are lovely and polite and Stephanie, who takes all the tour bookings, was delightful! As were all of the staff that we dealt with. There is a small fitness centre and also a swimming pool which looked very inviting, but the beach beckoned.I'd highly recommend staying here and finding the Cheeseburger Waikiki restaurant that is just down the road. There is also an IHOP and an ABC store close by. Great place to stay that is not as expensive as many hotels in Honolulu.

Excellent staff who willingly go out of their way for you.Clean and well maintained and far enough away from the action to get a quiet nights sleep but close enough to walk to it when you want to share in the fun.Restaurants and shopping all close at hand.

The staff was wonderful! They allowed us to check in early, which we greatly appreciated. Offered wonderful tips to explore Honolulu for our family. I would highly recommend this location for a reasonably priced room close to Waikiki beach.

noisy location-not their fault, noisy air conditioner-awfulDO NOT have a shuttle-the shuttle for fee is the speedy shuttle at the airport (which I can recommend.) Rudest person in Hawaii was the guy I spoke to on the phone-did not get his name. Motel is older and the restaurant is not really in the motel- also not great. Many others within a short walk. Swimming pool and hot tub nothing to cheer about.

The Ramada Plaza offers the amenities that some larger hotels do not. Such as, free computers located off the lobby. The staff is very accommodating, including the Concierge. Rooms are large with microwave, fridge and safe. Very useful amenities. Beds are comfortable. Nice, clean pool, although shaded by taller buildings in the mornings. All types of restaurants and shops in walking distance and buses stop right on the corner outside the hotel. I would definitely stay there again.

Overall experience was satisfactory. Structure is very dated but has undergone several modernization projects over the years. Desk staff was friendly and accommodating. Housekeeping staff was very good. Concierge was knowledgeable about the islands and events. Parking lot is small and outside.Public transportation is nearby. No restaurant or continental breakfast on site. You can walk to Red Lobster, Outback, IHop, Buffalo Wild Wings, and several local restaurants and shops. There's an ABC Convenience store on nearly every corner in Waikiki.
Rooms were very dusty. Curtains had stains on them. Only basic cleaning done. A bad smell in the rooms. Decor was old fashioned. Parking is terrible there. $25 a day is ridiculous

Not a resort hotel by any stretch, but the staff was efficient, friendly, helpful, and the room was comfortable and clean. How much time do you plan on staying in the room, anyway? Very reasonably priced for the area. Parking is additional, as it is with all other hotels in HNL. The Wi-Fi is free but not secure. There are several restaurants of breakfast within a block. I'd stay here again if coming to HNL.

The hotel is a drive from the main Waikiki beach. Fortunately it is opposite the huge Hilton complex so we used their pool, beach and bars. The pool at the hotel was not worth bothering with. Just all concrete. Rooms were comfortable but we only used the hotel for sleeping in. The tour desk was a rip off. We were charged for a trip to pearl harbour which we later found was free. Not the hotels fault.

This property is across the street from the Hilton Hawaiian Village which is rated as the #1 hotel in Waikiki. You can't see the ocean but you can walk to it in minutes. There was a parking charge but no in and out/valet fee. As with all hotels I wear bedroom slippers in the room.
You can't beat this hotel in terms of price, location and quality. Highly recommend. We spent 15 nights.

very clean , comfortable , great place, very positive experience there at Ramada Waikiki. Strongly recommending this place to others. Everything was great except for the slowest wi-fi internet connection ever. However, they do have some public computers downstairs.
Great location, not caught in the hectic waikiki streets but close to many activities.
RRoos we ok. Bathroom and general area needs updating. When entering there was a bad smell like something was moldy.

we stayed at the Ramada Plaza for 7 nights April 11-17 - check in was quick, staff was nice, the room on the 9th floor had a view of other buildings- the bed was comfortable, room/bathroom look average, but clean- a/c did make some noise, but nothing to keep you awake- fridge,microwave,locker were included- the phone has multiple USB cables to charge Android/iPhone, this was convenient- wifi signal was great for VoIP, as each room as a access point and even a wired connection- even though we were on the 9th floor, we could hear some street noise: trucks, bikes etc, but there not much noise from other rooms and no disturbance from doors slamming- free coffee/tea and water was nice, lemon water after 11AM - there are 2 desktops and a printer near the elevator in the lobby, this was handy to print vouchers/maps during our stay - passwords and paper is provided by the front desk-hotel is very close to the beach, Ala Moana mall, McDonalds, IHOP, Wailana Coffee/Restaurant, Subway and other restaurants, and ubiquitous ABC stores-pickup for some tours/shuttles was at the Aqua Palms just next door, the bus stop was right outside the lobby, but we didn't have a chance to use it. -we had a late flight back, and the staff were accommodating to leave our bags for the day, after we checked-outWould recommend staying at the Ramada Plaza for the location and great service and friendly staff

Just a very short walk to the Waikiki beach through the Hilton, which has a great many shopping and drinking locations along the way. Makes for a lower cost stay if you do not mind no view of the beach. A ten minute walk from the largest outdoor mall. People are friendly and helpful in giving directions. Also close to low cost restaurants such as MacDonalds.

The hotel is walking distance to A lo moana shopping centre.. room was clean but but dated. .. wifi was good enough and easy... we were at the back side of the hotel on l 14.. However there is no view apart from buildings both on front and back. . So don't pay anything extra for rooms facing the front. There s bus stop right at the entrance from where I can catch local bus to pretty much everywhere...

My stay at the Ramada Waikiki was satisfactory for the price paid. The room was clean, the location was "decent" and no real complaints (considering the price paid) I got a 5$ discount on parking for being a wyndham rewards member. With that said, the staff could have been friendlier ( a simple hello/have a good day) would go a long way. The coffee/water station could have been available more often and filled. If your staying for a short time in Honolulu and trying to save some $$ i would recommend this hotel. If your staying in Waikiki on vacation for an extended stay i would look for a hotel closer to the action and spend a little bit more money to stay at a resort

parking is 20/night for Wyndham members, but the stay in general was nice. The facility is fairly new. The room is a bit small though. The Goofy cafe across the street has yummy breakfast. There is an ABC store right around the corner of the hotel. Free crib for baby/toddler, and the internet is free as well.

Absolutely amazing for what we paid! The staff were always helpful (even at 4am!), the rooms were clean and well looked after. The wifi is fast (slightly annoying to have to log in everytime you return back to the hotel, but nothing major)Great location (good food a few doors up and beach an easy stroll)If I had to post a non-positive comment it would be that you can hear the people in the room next door if they are loud, but it wasn't too much of an issue for us as we were in late and out early every morning... and probably the ones waking everyone else up oops!)They were accommodating and friendly and I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

booked last minute through jet star, economicall, best valued room for a simple lay over staykinda wished i went resort, but at half the price, for 18 hrs of a room, who cares for that, amply quiet roomclean in good ordergood staffdont expect a resort, expect a clean/freindly/ well kept close to conference centre hotelclose to the shopping centre, conference centre
Nice little spot near the Ala Moana Shopping Center. Very clean rooms look recently updated. Friendly and helpful staff. We would stay again.

nice place to stay on a budget, close to Waikiki, cafes and Ala Moana Shopping Center. Very easy to rent a car down the street instead of at airport. Rooms are small and they were undergoing remodeling. Bathrooms and storage area too tight.

I booked this room in Waikiki because I had an 18 hour layover. I used Wyndam rewards points for a king room and I wasn't expecting much. The room was large, immaculate, and included a small fridge and a safe I could program myself. Even the view was nice. The staff was friendly and helpful with directions. The room was warm when I first went in but the AC cooled it down in less than 10 mins. It is close to the beach, the Ala Moana Mall, and lots of affordable restaurants. I will be returning!!! Also, to get here from the airport use SpeediShuttle and by a round trip ticket to save on the fare. Enjoy!

We booked ramada hotel through our travel agent using Expedia. There was a confusion when we checked in because the reservation stated my name and then "wife" (because I was with my wife). The receptionist thought my family name was "wife" we had to wait for a while until the receptionist found out their mistake. It was funny and at the same time annoying. Anyway we stayed there for two nights and the hotel was ok. The room was clean and the cleaning ladies were great. I rate it as a 8 in a scale of 10. There was no ocean view there but it's centrally located.

We stayed here for 7 days. Hotel very good. Restaurant a little disappointing and bar was closed at 9.00pm daily. Food mostly catered for the Japanese clients. We ate elsewhere. Room very large two double beds. Lovely clean bathroom with bath and shower. Toiletries supplied and replenished daily. Most rooms do not have balconies.

The hotel was nice. Most of the staff were friendly. One parking attendant was a little over aggressive at her job. I would have liked this hotel much more if there wasn't a parking fee - I'm already renting a room, why do I have to pay an outrageous amount just to park my vehicle there??? Also would have like a hot tub to sit in and relax. Otherwise, it was a decent place to stay while in Hawaii. Luckily we didn't spend that much time there anyway.
Room was very comfortable. Staff very accommodating. Excellent location for short term stay. It was helpful to be able to leave our luggage and change clothing prior to our late flight departure.
Had an early flight into Honolulu. Staff allowed us to drop off luggage before 9am. Check in at 3. Staff was very helpful and courteous.

This was a great hotel at the start of waikiki infront of the hilton hawaiian village. We received a great room on the 16th floor which looked like itbhad recently been renovated. We got complimentary water and chocolates in the room. They had free coffee and water in the lobby. The hotel was near great places to eat such as wailana's coffee house and buffalo wild wings. It was also ideal for getting out of waikiki and seeing the rest of ohau without being stuck in traffic. I would stay here again

The hotel, staff and cleanliness was great. We had a wonderful two weeks and were able to call the Ramada Waikiki home for the duration. It's also close to everything including some great Happy Hours.
The room was nice, comfortable and clean. All the staff were helpful and friendly. The price was very reasonable for the location. I would recommend it to everyone.

My family and I travel about twice a year and this was the worse hotel experience we have had. The drapes were soiled. When we got off the elevator we can smell the mold in the carpet and room smelt just as terrible. We were going to stay there six days we barely spent two. The employee were unfriendly and the employee at the from desk was rude when I didn't understand what he was saying . No one helped us with our luggage. The bell man just stood there. My daughter cried the whole time she was there and we took her there for her 21st birthday. Don't go there. I can't say one good thing. I've stayed at cheaper hotels that had better service. What a dump!!!!!! Don't take your family there.

It's a basic Ramada. It's not a 5 star resort in Waikiki, but it's not priced like one. If you'd like a place to stay next to the beach and priced reasonably, this is it. The room was clean. There was some noise because the room I was in was one of those adjoining rooms where there is a door to the next room, but it remained closed and the neighbors weren't too noisy. I would stay there again.

A comfortable hotel close to the Alo Moana Shopping Centre..about 10 minutes walk. The hotel is also across the road from the Hilton Hotel resort which gives you access to Waikiki beach and all the restaurants and shopping there. The hotel is also a short walk to the main thoroughfare in Honolulu and close to other shopping and restaurants. The hotel staff were very helpful as were the housekeeping staff. A fluoro light started flickering in the bathroom and the maid arranged for maintenance to attend and the matter was dealt with immediately and with no fuss. Really good service. The pool and gym were fine but did not seem to get much use. It is an older style hotel but is being well maintained. The internet service was excellent and free in both the lobby and the rooms. Ours was a family holiday and we booked four king rooms and all couples were completely happy with their accommodation. The only gripe was the tours we booked through Elite Travel in the lobby. I think this is a separate company to the hotel. When I asked if we could do the Pearl Harbour and Missouri tours by ourselves we were informed that all tour operators book tickets well in advance and it was unlikely we would be able to do the tour without booking. The tour for both Pearl Harbour and the battleship Missouri cost approx. $US104. I found out on arrival that the Pearl Harbour entrance is free and a tour of the Missouri is $US25. I guess we paid for the bus ride out there and the hot dog we got for lunch, which was inclusive of the price. It was annoying as we had cars and could have driven ourselves out there and saved about $US80.

I stayed at the Ramada Plaza Hotel at Waikiki for a week in March of 2015. My room was very nice and very well maintained during my stay. This hotel was in the heart of the shopping and a 10 minute beach walk to Waikiki. Also, the laundry room was a nice touch since I was there on vacation. The internet connection was quite good and the hotel staff members were excellent. I would indeed stay here again.
everyone was so nice,,,rooms very clean. good location

We spent two segments of our holiday here as we were island hopping. Great central location, short walk to amazing shops and the beach, 24 hour iHop close if you arrive too late for anywhere else! Clean, friendly desk staff, near good locations for breakfast. We enjoyed our stays.

The room was very nice as was the balcony -- just the right size. I used the desk and internet connection throughout my visit. The microwave oven and fridge helped me to keep food for breakfast. The pool could stand some improvement -- it was in the shade whenever I visited it -- I think another location would be better. Otherwise I loved the Inn.

The Ramada Waikiki was clean and basic. The bed was comfortable, everything worked and we had no complaints. We were only there for 3 nights and that was ok. The traffic noise was very noticeable. The pool was basic, could have been a lot nicer. It's a less expensive hotel so if you're looking for luxury keep looking
Nothing fancy but room was up to date and very clean. Staff friendly and helpful. Location convienent for Waikiki area and close to multiple bus routes getting you to most tourist destinations.

This is not a fancy resort and not the newest hotel on the island, but it's nice, well kept and convenient. It's about a 30 minute cab trip from the airport--no free shuttle available. It's about 10 minutes from Norwegian's cruise ship pier. The view is mainly of other buildings, but it's nice enough and it doesn't cost fancy resort prices. The staff is friendly and helpful. There are a variety of restaurants and the ever-present ABC stores within walking distance.

Excellent hotel for a quick stop at Waikiki and Honolulu, near the beach. Very nicely done room, friendly and helpful staff, within walking distance of all needs and especially the Ala Moana beach park.

I traveled to Hawaii to attend a one-week business conference. Reviewing all of the different hotels in Waikiki, I was impressed with the reviews on the Ramada and the price point on the rooms. Upon arrival, I was immediately impressed. The hotel was nice and the amenities were in good shape. The staff was absolutely top-notch. Very accommodating and helpful to first-time visitors to Hawaii, providing local tips and places to see. Everything was great except for one problem (and this was not the hotel's fault, but I feel it relevant to point out for awareness.) My entire week-long stay was interrupted by a smoke-filled hotel floor each afternoon when I would return from the work day. And the smoke was of the "contraband" nature. It was coming from one room the entire week I was there. Let me say the staff was VERY responsive in trying to resolve the issue amicably. Having worked hotel security in a previous life, I know there are very limited avenues you can take in confronting guests about personal use and enforcing city/state laws. Outside of this situation, the stay was great and I would recommend to other friends in my business. Hats off to a very professional staff!

We wanted to stay close to Fort Derussy so chose to stay at the Ramada. This is diagonally across from the Hilton Hawaiian Village and was close enough to walk to the beach, lots of stores and resturants but far enough away from the hussle and bussel of the touristy crowd. The rooms were recently renovated. It is very clean, spacious and comfortable. We had a king bed, with lost of pillows. There was also a lanai facing away from the street. The room included a safe, a microwaive and a very small fridge. There is WIFI in the room and in the lobby. They also have two large computers for public use so keep your laptops at home! The staff are very accomodating, helpful and very pleasant. The housekeeping was excellent! I would definitely return to this hotel. There is a bus stop right in front and it is within walking distance of the Ala Moana Mall.

All the staff were very friendly and efficient.Pretty close to waikiki beach and loads of shopping it that's what floats your boat.Rooms are very comfortable and housekeepers keep them very clean.Handy for shopping mall. Restaurants close by and lots of ABC stores which are ok for buying snacks etc.Free WIFI available in all rooms and boarding passes can be printed out in the lobby.Coffee and tea in lobby early morning until mid afternoon also coffee suppled in rooms for coffee machine.

My wife and I stayed at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki in March of 2015 and were very satisfied. It is a clean, quiet, hotel that offers good value and especially caters to air crews. This is the kind of place to use as a home base for your travels around Oahu. It is a stand-alone hotel surrounded by other tall buildings, so there are no grounds to speak of and no dining facility run by the hotel.Very convenient for buses, shopping, restaurants and especially the Wailana Coffee House (restaurant)on the corner. We were told that it has been operating at that sight for a very long time and has very reasonably priced food all day long. Would not hesitate to stay at the Ramada a second time.

a great place for the baller on a budget. more prime of a location than one would think. stands accross the street from the Hilton Waikiki Resort. Buffet restaurant connected to the building. Bus/Trolley stops located a few steps out front on Ala Moana Blvd(main street). Restaurants/Cafes, convenient store, surf shop a few steps to the left, more restaurants, shops, a nail salon, tattoo shop to the right, the same accross the street... 5min or so walk to the beach(through the hilton), 30min to downtown waikiki beach and alot of shopping stores, 10min to Ala Moana Mall(largest outdoor mall in US), 20min to City Hall, etc.The Ramada is a simple place, nothin' fancy and definitely not too shabby at all. Their lobby is spacious. They have a lil uninteresting gift shop inside just before the elevators. The rooms are clean and attended to and has the usual neccesities. Bathrooms aren't too big, tho. The staff is awesome ...friendly, attentive, knowledgeable-average guys and gals just earning a living and trying to make your stay as comfy as possible.
