This place reminds of like a hotel in Reno/Tahoe or Indian Casino Hotel. You'll notice alot Japanese tourists and flight attendants staying here.Overall thought: not bad at all for the price paid. If ur gonna be out and about most of the time anyway, this place is will work and the nights are quiet in the area.
Good accomodation value. A bit of a walk to the beach. Hotel is on the edge of the resort area. Was great for a lay over.

We found it kind of sad, outdated and musty, with the online pictures better than our actual room, which showed wear and tear. Maybe some rooms have been updated. If you aren't paying a ton near Waikiki, it's better to temper expectations (like New Orleans hotels, right?), and the Ramada is good for the budget. Anyway, I think that if you can get an airport hotel type price, this hotel will serve you well. It's the kind of place that is good for a night if you are catching a flight to another island the next day, but it will not match the exhilaration and brightness of uber-busy Waikiki, especially if this is your dream vacation. Might be better to splurge on something higher end. I could imagine a group of college kids or family sharing a room here to save money, though, and there's obviously nothing wrong with that.Good location for going to the beach, which is just a few minutes away. Also, you can walk 15 to 20 minutes to get to the Ala Moana mall. There are some souvenir type stores there, but I would really go just for the fun of the food court. Lots of different Asian-ish fast food eateries with better than average mall food, including yummy poke bowls, several different places for bobas and smoothies, and a little Chinese bakery. Add another 5 minutes, and you can go to Walmart for cheaper macadamia nuts and stuff you forgot to pack.

As Wyndam rewards members, we always try to locate a convenient property for a reasonable price and we found one at the Ramada Waikiki. The room was clean, the front desk was helpful and knowledgeable when directions were needed. The bell staff even offered to loan us beach mats, free of charge, so we could comfortably watch the spontaneous firework display on the beach. Additionally, when we discovered that our flight home was cancelled for 24 hours due to weather conditions after we had checked out, the hotel gladly accommodated us at a discounted price, with just one last minute phone call from the airport area. We happily extended our visit one extra day. Parking was expensive and the accommodations were a little bit outdated.

we stayed here for a full week on points thanks to an amazing rewards program. The entrance to the hotel is beautiful with fresh coffee and water every morning. They should serve water all day that would of been nice! Rooms were okay. Wish it was a litter more modern and not much space in the room as furniture was old and clunky in space. Cleaning staff were so nice and generous! Can't wait to come back next January!
Nice helpful staff, microwave & frig & coffee maker, comfortable extra long bed. Arrange ahead for hourly shuttle, parking discount for wyndham members. Free wifi & fast internet.

Very well located near shops and beaches, this hotel it's a excellent choice to stay some days in Waikiki. The rooms are complete and comfortable and the hotel have a good gym and pool and also laundry equipments. The hotel staff are very competent and kind.

Do NOT share this review with other travelers. My problem is that we left our things in storage with the bellman the morning we checked out on 2/23. When we picked up our bags, my jacket was missing - I noticed this and the bellman found it in the room. However, when I got home I noticed that the Selfie Stick that was in the same carry one bag as my jacket was gone. I reported that by phone today. I was told it isn't in lost and found. The woman I talked to advised she would speak with the manager and get back to me.

Was kind of forced to be a member to get a discount with parking from $25 to $20/night. I thought charging for parking was ridiculous to begin with granted they should be honored that we are staying at their hotel. Spent $80 during our 4 day/night stay.

My husband I stayed for seven nights at this hotel. We were extremely comfortable and happy with our stay!Yes, the property is a bit outdated but the rooms are comfortable (best nights sleep I've had in a long time thanks to the super comfy beds!) and well maintained. We were on the ninth floor with a view of the buildings and parking lot out back. I wasn't happy with the view but will remember to ask for a different room the next time!I've read other reviews which complained about the street noise. Not an issue for us. We hardly noticed it. Maybe because we were on the back side of the hotel.Housekeeping was on top of things. We were always greeted with a super clean room when we returned at night.My only real issue was the coffee pot. I'm admittedly a bit of a coffee snob. The coffee provided in the rooms was incredibly weak. The coffee maker took forever to brew a small pot of coffee. I was disappointed as I thought there would be a Kuerig in our room. No worries. I purchased a pack of coffee filters from one of the many ABC stores in the area and brewed coffee from one of the plantations we had visited!The wifi was incredibly slow. It was a pain to constantly be required to sign in. But the service was free, so we can't complain too much!The hotel is located right across from the Ala Moana beach, and within walking distance from lots of shops and restaurants.The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.Overall, this was a great place to stay if you're on a budget and don't care about the glitz and glam of the other hotels in the area.

The hotel is a hidden gem, located near Ala Moana Beach. Our room was nicely decorated and very clean. It was also very quiet which made for a good night sleep. There where many restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. We liked that we were able to park our car within the property without dealing with a valet. The parking area was at ground level which was very convenient.
We are stayed one night due to a booking error at our other hotel. Room was clean, though very compact.
Wouldn't stay here again solely because the "high speed" internet was slower than a dial up modem. There are too many other less expensive hotels of equal quality and high speed internet service.

This hotel is older how're very clean. Good location to restaurants and a short walk to the beach. Right across the road is the Hilton Hawaiin Village which is lots of amenities and shopping. A short distance from the Alo Moana shopping centre . Bus stop right outside and a 2.00 bus ride can get you anywhere. The Conceierge in this hotel is outstanding. We stayed here 15 days with no complaints. Hotel also has a very private pool.
Nice hotel with very nice friendly helpful employees. The only real complaint was traffic noise, other than that great place!

Only stayed a night after a cruise, left bags until check in time. Then when we came to check in found that the high winds and resulting blackout had caused lifts to go out. Option was to sit in foyer until service men could come or walk up to 15th floor. We decided to walk have had lots of experience on the cruise. Our room was clean and had nice views. Lifts back working about an hour later. Enjoyed a good nights sleep and free wifi is fast. Good value for money.
Clean room. Not much of a view. Fairly close to rest of Waikiki. Fridge and microwave in room. Lots of outlets to plug electronics in - that is handy!

Excellent location for shopping in Waikiki and strolling through Al Moana Park.Room service did a great job in keeping room maintained and bathroom supplied. Also, my thanks to the Doorman/Bellboy who provided assistance when I needed it (he helped with transportation and phone usage which are difficult due to my hearing problems.). Mahalo!

First time staying at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki. It was a pretty good experience. I wish the room had more table space and electric outlets for electronics, but there's cable tv and internet. I also wish you did not have to provide an e-mail address and connect to your specific room's internet. It makes me feel like a hotel can track the websites you visit and either customize their marketing to you or sell that information to third parties. It's not anonymous. Further, when you attempted to click on their "Terms of Service" (which is required to connect to internet), the link does not work so you can't tell what you're agreeing to. Overall, however, it is a good hotel, well situated just outside of Waikiki and close to Ala Moana, so you don't need to fight too much traffic to get to your hotel. A decent amount of parking spots, although you are paying about $20/day for it. Microwave and refrigerator available. Also, a pool and small gym is available. I love that they also provide you with some small necessities if you forgot it.

We enjoyed our overnight at the Ramada Plaza. Hotel services were excellent, good suggestions for lunch, and tips on airport shuttles. The fitness center was a little hard to find, but other than that the place was great!

im the pickiest person also looking for the best bang for your buck and looking for cleanliness , stiff beds but felt new, sadly no pillowtop mattresses here. Front desk is great to deal with. Air China and Jal (japan airlines) employees stay here. Mostly Koreans and Japanese stay here. Building very quiet, very good soundproofing. we were in room 1107 its two queen size beds that we combine as one big bed for our 3 kids & no balcony :( they charge xtra $30 a day for a rollaway bed, so we just put beds together to make grand master king size bed. looks like our room was renovated on the 11th floor. new carpets, etc. i didnt like the toilet, and we bought our own toilet paper as the hotel toilet paper was one ply and rought. and the toilet it a low profile that didnt flush properly and too low and many on here complain about,, it should be replaced. we didnt like the cheap shampoo and body soap.. we bought our own from walmart which was a nice 20 minute walk, The Ala Monoa mall was about 15 minutes walk. The Hilton Village directly across the street. I parked my rental Jeep from Thrifty via expedia.ca for $179 tax included in canadian funds for 4 days pick up thursday 7:30pm to 9:45pm following monday.. The city bus runs every 15 minutes and theres a city bus that takes you to the airport in front of this hotel. also the trollies stop here too nearby. no resort fee and no hidden charges. do not go to Macdonals as it is not priced the same as other Mcdonald's in waikiki and the service is very bad and quality is the worse. 10 Mcnuggets is $7.88 where as other Mcdonald's in honolulu is 20 pieces for $5 we paid $34 for breakfast for family of 5 at this Mcdonalds near the Ramada and Hilton one block away.. we went to another Mcdonalds in Honolulu and the same stuff was $18.65. The wifi , i brought our own wireless router and hooked it up the internet inroom ,, was great and fast. wifi is included with our stay., i parked my car rental on the side street behind the hotel between 8pm-10pm took about 5 minutes to find spot but one night it took an hour and half. if you have patience then street parking is good. i just drop family off at lobby and go look for parking.hotel is in a very safe location, i would recommend anyone to this hotel. I didnt like the bleached towels has i felt they where overbleached as you can smell the chemicals and it made the towels wear out fast.also they take the top duvet after first nite.no fan in da bathroom
It was in a great location! Staff was great! Room smelled of urine. If we did not have the sliding glass door open 247 it would stink.

An excellent place to stay. Although the hotel does not have any dining facilities, it does not matter as there are a number of good quality restaurants are within a short walking distance. It is near all attractions. The front desk was helpful and the hotel has a high speed Internet access. We liked the hotel's non-smoking policy.
It was OK, clean and so forth. The parking policy during checkin was a bit draconian, for the price and location it was a great deal. Off Waikiki it would be a rip off. Cleaning staff super nice.
Clean Across the street from the Hilton which is nice as there is lots of shopping and restaurants.

We stayed at the Ramada in Waikiki for 10 days. The staff were friendly and helpful. There was always fresh water and coffee in the morning. A short walk to the Hilton and to the Ala Moana mall. Free wifi. Great value and staff who care. Would recommend this hotel for future visits.
The A/C unit kept shutting down during the night. Then the room would warm up and wake me up. Also the change from white noise to silence would also wake me up.

While the rooms are quite ok. They have the worse pillows I have ever had in my life. The pillows are so bad I struggle to sleep at night. The bed is comfortable and generally the staff are great and service is too but the pillows totally screwed the stay up.I Wouldnt recommend staying here unless you bring your own pillow.Staff are extremely helpful and courteous

So, I'm not sure where to begin. The lobby looks nice & the staff are friendly & the location is decent, but that's it. The place smells from the lobby to the room. Chairs in room are worn. Stains on the blackout curtains. Fridge smells very bad. Hair was left in the shower from previous guests & sat there on the wall ALL week till we left. A/C doesn't work all that well, even for a late trip in January. The WiFi was garbage. Beds were semi comfortable but the pillows were not.My advice is for people to pay more for a better place that doesn't smell & that has the maid service that will actually be attentive enough to properly clean a room.

My wife and I loved the hotel and services they have. All the employees were nice and knowledgeable, room was very clean and had everything we needed. We will definitely stay here if we come back to Oahu.

A serviceable place to stay in Waikiki, not a destinationThis budget hotel was perfectly adequate for a two-night stopover in Waikiki. No doubt the building is old and has been refurbished a number of times. But our room and the public spaces were clean enough, the elevators fast, and the staff pleasant and accommodating. The location is good enough to walk to most places in Waikiki, including the big mall, and there is a choice of breakfast places within a block or two. Unfortunately, the hotel's nicely located restaurant space has been given over to a separate Chinese food buffet restaurant, which was sparsely attended most of the time. In the room, the air con unit was predictably noisy but we found that we could open the window for air without too much noise from the street below. Not a destination, just a serviceable place to stay.

My family and I stayed at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki for 3 nights and we were very impressed with this hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful upon arrival and did everything they could to ensure that our stay was pleasurable. Clifford was very helpful and always willing to answer any questions we had. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. Overall, we were very happy with this hotel and would recommend it to anyone visiting Waikiki.
Liked the hotel and the staff was awesome. Older hotel, but spotlessly clean. The pool not very good but the hotel is close to the beach, which made up for it.

This is maybe the 3rd time I stayed at Ramada. This trip was made much better by a wonderful front desk clerk and unfortunately I can't recall his name. Very friendly and helpful. Others were a bit standoffish which is weird for those in the hospitality industry but... we are all human. The rooms were great the free wifi was wonderful the house cleaning staff were friendly and not intrusive. It has greatly improved outside as well... the grounds and the shrimp tent.... It was convenient to the conference at HHV. Will stay there again for sure.

I really have no complaints of the hotel. My wife and I stayed here for one night after a long day of travel. Bed was comfortable, a/c worked great, quiet room, high floor for a decent view. No issues at all. Check in and check out was a breeze.

I looked for somewhere in Oahu where I could relax on a short layover on my way back from Palau. I'm not here for touristy things, but if you were, this is a great place to stay. It's right around the corner from Hilton Hawaiian village and easy walking to some of the Waikiki shopping. Parking is $25 per night which is comparable to other hotels. In room safe, small refrigerator, microwave, and coffee-maker. Fluffy white towels and great water pressure even up on the 16th floor where I was. Free coffee in the lobby from 6am until 10 am (I think - wasn'T awake for most of that, and water in the lobby until 1:30pm. And, did I mention free wi-fi in the room? Bed was comfortable with multiple pillows. If you book directly on the Ramada site, check for AAA, government, aarp, and best available rates. My AAA rate was $153/nt- surely one of the best rates on Oahu for what you get.

Pretty Good. Hey what else can I stay. We came here for a Holiday. It was pretty good! I wouldn't say it was bad that's for sure. On the other hand, I wouldn't say it was Great! I would say that if someone asked me, I would be honest with them about my experience at the Ramada. I would tell them that my overall experience was Pretty Good.
It was a gorgeous room on the 15th floor. It was clean and convenient to cheap food and transportation.

Great place for me and my boy friend,nice view from the window, and front desk person was really helpful. The washroom was really clean but small tho. My bf cant have same with me in there. Overall, great place, and great people
Good location, good service, friendly staff, good facility. We liked it very much, would stay again if get chance.

Close enough to the beach to walk, across the street from Hilton Hawaiian Village so easy to get to the fireworks and dances on Friday night. Good basic hotel room, only negative is that I didn't notice or it wasn't posted that there is a $20/night parking fee.

Nice front desk staff. Place was clean and the rate was reasonable. A bit of a walk to the beach. Coffee shop down the block was nice too. This was a work trip so I didn't use the pool facilities but did count on the fitness equipment when I got back to the room. On Saturday I notified the front desk that 2 aerobic pieces of equipment were not working. They still weren't fixed by Tuesday and I notified the front desk again- Checked out on Wednesday so don't know if/when it was resolved. Also had to change my reservation unexpectedly and management would not budge on the additional charges. They did agree not to charge me for parking on the days I wasn't there.
Very hesitant at first to stay at a ramada. This hotel was very clean and was very adequate. Would definitely stay again. Not much compares for the prices.
The Ramada Waikiki is a great place to stay. The are centrally located and the rates are great. We would definitely stay there again.

The staff was extremely kind and helpful. The hotel lobby was nice and the rooms were fine. The bathrooms are pretty basic but in good condition. The hotel is in a great location for the price. It is a short walk to the beach.
Great service, friendly staff, good location. Consier was wonderful and all staff spoke English well. Parking was an unexpected extra.

We arrived on new year's eve, staff were very helpful and friendly. Decaf tea and coffee in the room is a BIG plus for me. Location was very central, walk to Ala Moana and the beach, ihop next door. The only issue is the restaurant - I didn't go in because the online reviews are uniformly terrible. Time for a change?

I really enjoyed this property much more than I expected., The room was exceptionally clean and the staff helpful and friendly.  It is far enough from Waikiki for me. I would definitely stay here again without hesitation. My only complains are the toilet was so low that getting up was a task. A comfort height toilet would have been fantastic and the air conditioner a little loud

Everything was fantastic.Staff excellent, rooms clean, amenities great.We'll be back.One note -- Forgot I was a Wyndham/Ramada Rewards Member. Could you please credit my account, and send the info. Thanx. - Mike

We booked one week here. Room was on 12th floor which was good and less noisy than on other floors. Room was clean and cleaning service more detailed than in other hotels. However you can hear bus in the morning and late night hours. Room was ok and bed also. You can walk to the busy shopping street in waikiki and to moana mall. Not far from airport. Parking only against payment. 1week175$. All in all ok to book again.

Our family of 4 stayed there for 2 weeks last month. The location is perfect for everything, 10 minutes walk to Ala Moana Shopping Centre, 6 mins walk to the beach,15 minutes walk to Waikiki, 1 minute walk to iHop, 3 minutes walk to Ilikai Hotel (all tours pick up point), 2 minutes walk to McDonalds and ABC shop around the hotel. We hired a car for a week and parking is easy, secured and will cost you $20. The room is a outdated, bed is comfy but they need to replace their pillows. I will rate Cleanliness and hospitality 9/10. Swimming pool in level too is not heated, small gym and good size laundry in level 2. it will cost you at least $4 to do your washing. Every morning they have free coffee, tea, cold water and sometimes hot chocolate in the lobby. Tours concierge is available as well. Wi-fi is free and good.i would recommend this hotel this hotel to family and couples who use the hotel for sleep and rest only. If you got small kids, they will get bored coz' the room is not big enough. Coming back? maybe in the next 2 years. We fall in love with Oahu.
10 minutes from SF airport on hotel's shuttle. Spotless room with more amenities than we could use--kitchenette makes it ideal for longer stay.

We stayed here at the end of our trip on a last minute booking and weren't too sure what to expect. The location is great, within walking distance to the beach, Ala Moana shopping mall, and different restaurants. It's not too busy an area as compared to further down on Waikiki beach, which we liked. The room was clean and large, if a little dated. There was a small balcony, microwave, mini-fridge and coffee machine which were nice to have. The bed was super comfortable, too. Didn't check out the pool area, as we only stayed one night but the lobby seemed pleasant and functional with an information desk and helpful staff. Parking was $25/day which seems to be the norm in Waikiki, but you do get $5 off the price if you sign up for Wyndham rewards club.

This hotel had the best price and it did not disappoint! Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. There is a concierge in the lobby and they helped book our excursion. Location was awesome! Close to several restaurants in varying price ranges (McDonald's, Ihop, Red Lobster, Outback, etc.), close to the Food Pantry so I got snacks and drinks for the beach, and a nice, short stroll to the beach through the Hilton Hawaiian Village. It was easy to walk with our four young kids (9,7,5,1). We even walked to Ala Moana shopping centre. The Bus also stops right in front of the hotel. When the kids didn't want to be in saltwater, they were happy with the pool.

Asked that the A/C be fixed twice, resulting in removal of the original unit with a replacement unit that was obviously broken as well. There was no follow up and because of the holiday, no priority was made. Finally solved the problem with 2 out of the 13 nights remaining. Very disappointed.

Clean, friendly and a nice location within walking distance to beaches, shopping and restaurants. Staff were really nice, always smiling and helpful. 3 adults shared a basic room and while it was small, we weren't there for the room and didn't spend much time there. Everything was clean and functional. The pool area was surprisingly decent, clean and well set up with plenty of chairs, tables and loungers. Parking was safe, reasonably priced for Waikiki and we didn't have any trouble finding a spot.

I stayed here in early September 2014 for about a week. I was pleasantly surprised at how close we were to Waikiki proper, an achieveable walking distance to both the beach and shopping area. The twin share room was clean, well stocked with towels, tea/coffee and all the other delightful freebies that come with staying in a hotel. The front counter staff were always friendly and the tourist information desk was an absolute time saver for us. If all you're wanting is a clean place to lay your head each night and a secure room for your things then this is the hotel for you. You may initially think to yourself that you'll spend alot of your time at the beach. It is Hawaii after all. Even more than that, it's Waikiki! But after a day of sightseeing and shopping, the beach doesn't really offer you the opportunity for quiet reflection and contemplation. All you can think of in the sweltering heat of the day is heading back to the hotel, stripping off and taking a refreshing dip in the pool you promised yourself at check in you'd never use. It's basic and clean and unlike the beach, it's not crowded. There's also a chinese buffet place on the ground floor that serves up good food at reasonable prices. Overall it was a great place to stay. .

We stayed there for five days, it's a good and cheap place to stay in Waikiki. The room has some amenities such as mini-bar, microwave and coffee maker. It's also spacious and the bed was comfortable. And the staff was friendly. All and all it was a good place to stay and worth our money!

Functional hotel, good location with reasonable 10-15 min walk to beach. Slightly dated but in good shape. Food mostly caters to non Western tastes. Pool was austere and non inviting. Perhaps some tables for 4 & a few potted trees on pool deck would be helpful. Lobby PC set up for obtaining printed boarding passes. Permitted smoking area useful and handy. Hawaii law prohibits smoking on balconies off private hotel rooms referred to as lanais. Live orchids placed in halls facing elevators were a nice touch.

Stayed here right before Christmas. It was the perfect little economy stay to cap off a series of expensive loyalty point stays. The staff are incredibly friendly. It is right next to good restaurants. It's a block from the beach--the good part. Stayed at the Hilton Waikiki down the road, and I was not impressed with that part of Honolulu. Very smelly and rough. Just down the road, I felt much safer here. It felt more homey. Lots of condos and boats on this end. The beds are comfy. The AC WORKS. The sheets were too thin for the level of cold I like. I sound spoiled, I know. I like to splurge on AC in hotels. No balcony, but that's okay. Window opened. When it got windy, there was an awful whistling though. The toilets in the bathroom have this funny design. You have to see it. The hot water was awesome. Great place!

Great place to stay , rooms clean and comfortable and hotel was central to all attractions. The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable . Highly recommended and will stay there again when I visit .. Mahalo ...

This hotel is located within walking distance to the Waikiki beach, Ala Moana mall and Magic island. The price was reasonable and staffs were friendly. They also offer free wifi. Parking is $20/day if you are a Wyndham Rewards member (free to apply).
This ramada is very nice. Staff is friendly and rooms are very clean. It's close to beach and out of very busy part of Waikiki. We would stay here again.
We had a great stay! Did not know we had to pay for parking until we arrived so that was a surprise. The beds could be alot better. We all had very sore backs through our stay.

This was the most cost effective place I could find to stay within the Waikiki area that had reasonable customer review ratings. The front desk and service staff were all very friendly and helpful throughout our six night stay. We arrived one hour before check-in. Our rooms were not ready, but they allowed for luggage storage so we were able to eat lunch nearby and check in after 3 p.m. We had a room with a balcony which offered a view of the city. (It was nice to be able to sit outside in December).The rooms were clean and quiet. Many amenities were included such as Kona coffee and mouthwash. The pool was not heated so it was a little too cool for swimming in the evening. We used the laundry facilities which all functioned properly and was very convenient for us having just been on a seven-night cruise.You could use their business center which consisted of two computers and they allowed for 10 sheets of printing paper per guest per day. Wifi was available in the guest rooms. We went to the beach which was just a short walk through the Hilton across the street. There is also a lagoon which offered a better swimming experience than the ocean. If we were to return to Honolulu, I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Rooms were renovated and clean and staff are very nice but it's a little nosy. You can hear people walking and slaming doors. It's ocated near Hilton village and ilikai, between Waikiki and Ala moana shopping center and quite a walk to the center of Waikiki. It does not offer ocean view nor much view. It's practical but felt like I was not in Hawaii.

stayed three times now and yet again the air conditioning didn't work properly - the room was almost always too hot. having said that (and the room servicing late afternoon) this is a nice hotel with big clean comfy rooms in a great position with airport bus (only cabin bag luggage accepted) stop outside and opposite. the hotel has efficient friendly staff and is quieter than might be expected given that lots of aircrew overnight there. being right opposite illikai you can walk to Waikiki beach with its restaurants, bars, shops etc along the beach and beachwalk in about ten minutes.

Stayed here for 4 nights through joining a 'budget' tour. Did not hold high expectation but it turned out to be quite okay. Reasonable size rooms. The decor of the room was outdated but at least it was clean. Convenient location; a few min of walk from Ala Moana and the lagoon. (Parking is convenient if you have a car). Staff service quite alright. Considering its price, I'd say this is a solid hotel; 3.5 out of 5.

Our stay at this property was a pleasure for my group and I. The rooms were clean, the decor pleasant and the staff helpful and friendly. The rates were affordable and the location not too out of the way for cruising the, 'magic mile' of Kalakaua Ave. I definitely will keep this place in mind when an event would make a stay in Waikiki convenient for this local.

I was in Hawaii for 2 weeks, first on business and I took the second week for vacation. This hotel had the best deal, secure parking (so I could drive around the island) and close walk to the beach. I would have probably gone for a more upscale hotel had my wife joined me (she couldn't) so this was perfect. The only downside was you got a 10% discount on breakfast at the next door Chinese buffet (the food wasn't that good). In addition, although the internet was excellent, I had to use my own router to use my Google Chromecast and their WiFi on their TV (and this was only possible since they had an Ethernet connection option - if they hadn't it would be impossible).

We showed up here after out flight got cancelled out of Hawaii and we needed two emergency nights accommodation.They had room and were more than happy to help. They offered us a rate that was however about 60 USD per night more than what we could book online. They told us to book it and come back once it was done- but at 1am I don't think you really care about that.They are really nice though, clean hotel, quiet, great location too. The pool doesn't get any afternoon sun due to the big Hawaiian Village- however just grab your towels and go there for a swim- no one asks questions and it's got a few bars too!Within walking distance to Ala Moana and an ABC store.

I really enjoyed this property much more than I expected. It is far enough from Waikiki for me and has an entrance to the parking lot off a back street (also important to me). The room was very comfortable and if you book a room with a balcony, it comes with a fridge and microwave. None of the other rooms do and it was only about $10 per night.

Great location; near restaurants, busline; walking distance to convention venue and shopping centers; our room was facing a back street for quiet from main street noise. Very comfortable accommodations; friendly staff.
The hotel was clean, beautiful decor was comfortable & pleasant to see. I give my highest regard for all of the hotel employees! They were so pleasant and helpful! What a great hotel!

The people who work there are so great! The Bellman ran over to help us as we got out of the cab! We have stayed in many hotels...hotel rooms can be similar... but we always go back to ones like this with the great people!
The Ramada Inn at Waikiki was clean and comfortable. The staff was especially warm and friendly and displayed hookipa(sincere hospitality )

My family was attending a Convention fo Jehovah's Witness at the Hawaii Convention Center and choose to stay in town. We booked this hotel as it is close to the convention center and reasonable. We were very pleased with the rooms and accomidations overall. The beds are wonderful, the hotel is very quite, slept great. I would highly recommend this hotel for location, cleanliness and affordability.

Bed and pillow were uncomfortable.I prefer a firmer bed and a soft pillow.A/C in the first room was noisy.Requested another room with a quieter A/C.There was a constant hum all night from motors on the roof.Truck backup "beeps" in the early morning.
Great location, nice hotel for the price. Will stay here again and use my Wyndham rewards.
Totally disapointed. Very old fashioned and aged Rooms sometimes Dirty roomservice Not reliable. Service at frontdesk Helpful but Not at all friendly!!!

We stayed in the junior suite on the 17th floor and it was worth every single penny. The room was equipped with everything we needed for our 4 day stay while attending a convention with family. It had a small kitchenette equipped with all of the necessities. The room was very clean and neat and it is in walking distance to the convention center.
clean and well kept, bathroom fixtures a bit worn looking, don't make coffee with the tap water! quite and very restful after a long day out and about.
I like the location and the accommodation that I received. Being that I had some challenging issues, I was accommodated real well.

We stayed at the Ramada Waikiki for two nights prior to taking a cruise. The room was very clean and the staff couldn't have been more helpful and friendly. Very close to the Ala Moana Mall and buses. Wishing however that I was closer to Diamond Head...

We were in Waikiki for about a week. We spent the first 5 days at a friends condo. We were so happy to have the last two days of our trip at the Ramada, It was the best two days we had. The hotel was very nice and the room was terrific. We had the entire pool to ourselves which was a pleasant surprise. The Service was great and the beds were very comfortable. We would definitely stay there again.
Good standard hotel on the edge of the main shopping area. A bit of a walk to the hub but the Pink shuttle stops nearby.

Stayed at this hotel for couple days after our cruise.We stayed prior to it also and were very pleased and was glad I chose this hotel.Everyone made our stay pleasant.Definitely would use this hotel again.
Older hotel with basic services. Clean & quiet. Charged for internet - bad for business travelers.

From recently staying here, being a travel agent i was very disappointed with the friendliness of staff and particularly at check in. Your given a room and thats it! No introduction at all and not once did a staff member during our stay acknowledge us. Location is good and the pool area nice. Rooms are average.

We just finished a great vacation with family and friends and the location of this hotel was perfect for a pre and post cruise stay. Not fancy but clean and great location. We did not need a car as the hotel was across from the Hilton which is a main transportation spot. Walking distance from food, beach and shops. Would stay again.
Basic hotel service that would improve if continental breakfast is served. Rooms A/C units are very noise.

Being in Honolulu for a funeral we were not looking for the glitz and glamour of Waikiki. The Ramada offered us a convenient and efficient albeit small place to stay at a very reasonable rate. The staff was friendly and helpful. The parking lot was truly a pleasure being on ground level and steps from the hotel. Once we figured out our escape route, we were able to navigate to the rest of Honolulu without going through busy Waikiki. The driving routes were so easy that we were constantly driving to other locations and Honolulu. The shaved ice and malasadas runs were very easy to do.

We were very satisfied with the position of the hotel, parking arrangement and additional room equpment (microwave, fridge and coffe machine). Free coffee in the lobby had also a very positive influence on me. All worked perfectly. Also the staff at the reception desk was very helpfull.

Good value and excellent location close to Waikiki beach and bus stops to all corners of Honululu. The rooms were okay and comfortable but nothing very special. We really like the "organic burger" stall just outside the hotel. The lounge is very comfortable with lots of orchids.

I was worried when I booked this hotel but the price was right and it had parking which is hard to find and expensive. This hotel had both for a great rate. Plus it is in the heart of Waikiki so all my tours picked up either at my hotel or with in a block of it. Add the two restaurants on the property plus a laundry room. It was amazing. The staff was friendly and helpful. I will stay there again for sure.

This hotel has a great location right across from the Hilton Hawaiian Village, close to McDonalds and ABC stores. BUT ... my room had a horrible smell that nothing would get rid of. Parking is limited and spendy ($25 a night unless you are a Wyndham rewards member then it is $20/night .I was told there would be parking every night but one night I had to park in a space reserved for guests checking in. I was asked to relinquish my keys in case the car needed to be moved (this request was not acccomated). Staff was frienndly. No paper is provided at the front desk. Not bad for a short staY!
Older hotel but seems recently renovated. Rooms were clean, and all similiar in size and style. There was 7 of us in 4 rooms. Would definitely stay here again.

Ramada Plaza was centrally located for our needs, which were basically sight-seeing, either with touring companies, or driving rented car. Everyone at the hotel were very helpful, things were fixed very quickly (air-conditioner didn't work when we arrived, new put in at once!). Also located close to beach, with restrooms open to the public, and super restaurants.
Very friendly staff and clean hotel. Short walk to Waikiki beach and to the hilton Hawaiian village. A safe easy 15 min walk to the strip. Several restaurants are located near the hotel

I have spent a lot of time at this Hotel over the past 3 years and I have no complaints. The staff is very helpful and pleasant and the hotel is clean and conveniently located with easy in -out parking. The beach is a short 5 minute walk to Hilton village and the shopping trolley is right outside the front door and takes you all the way down the Waikiki strip. When you come to Honolulu this is the best value for the money.
Everything was great it would be nice if there were a breakfast buffet. Something to take in consideration.

This is a return visit for my family, which speaks volumes for this hotel.The hotel employees are friendly and helpful... you feel like family each time you walk into the lobby. Our room was clean and comfortable with a view of the city. The location of the hotel is perfect, close to restaurants, the beach, transportation,the Ala Moana mall and other shops. Parking is convenient, being located right behind the hotel with easy access in and out of the area. We will definitely return to the Ramada Plaza in the future.
Very Boring and BLAH, Not impressed by appearance and could not understand hotel greeters/workers.

Stayed for the second half of our honeymoon. When we got into the room there was a visable stain on the sheets. Room service did change the sheets when we complained. Room had an odor. Shower was never cleaned. Several pieces of hair from the previous people was still in the shower. Cleaned most of it but left a piece to see if it was going to be cleaned. Hair still there 5 days later when we left. We had the air conditioner set at 56 degrees and it still was slightly warm. Located on a main road so we heard traffic all night long. Coffee machine was located right next to the toilet. Gift shop was never open. Concierge was of no help. Asked about buses and was told they didnt run where we wanted to go. Researched ourselves and found that they did. Was located in walking distance of food and shopping. Pool area did not look like website picture. Needs some work. They did let us into laundry room before our room was ready. Would not stay here again.

Service was great and restaurant reservation at the Chart House was excellent for our 50th anniversary. They stored our luggage after check out so we could continue our site seeing and a visit the Arizona memorial.

We had a top floor room, with 2 queen size beds, and balconyPro: great prize, thanks to early booking about 1 month beforehand ($164/night incl. taxes) - clean room - very urban surrounding/view - good location (beach is reasonably close)Con: strictly separated roles & responsibilities among the lobby personnel (need to talk to three different people to get answer on basic guest requests); reception staff seems to be not overly motivated to deliver a great experience; poor "elite" concierge (didn't know much about key landmarks, had no idea about public transport, lacked any pro-active behavior), but this desk seems to be no part of the official hotel service (but just located in the middle of the lobby)

Great location, without the super high price. Within walking distant of all the great destinations. Hotel is in average shape for Waikiki as it gets a lot of use, I stayed on the PH level. Great views of the city not really of any water. Staff was friendly, no problem to report. Would stay again without hesitation.

My wife and I stayed there this past week. Great location!Walking distance to a lot of restaurants and beach.The one thing that ticked me off was I couldn't connect to thw wifi. In fact the staff even said that it wad slow for them. They apologized but no cigar. I would stay there again.

I have stayed at this hotel in the past when it was a Hliday Inn Express. Things have improved. Everything was fine, except the bathroom. It was clean, but in need of maintenance. The toilet was sooooo low that getting up was a task. A comfort height toilet would have been fantastic. Just for fun, go to the room and sit on the toilet and let your eyes wonder and you will be amazed at what you see. Your customers see things from a different point of view than your staff does. Very good improvement from the last visits!!

My boyfriend and I stayed at the Ramada Plaza for 6 days and 5 nights. Overall, the Ramada is a great hotel based on it's location and price -- we were literally within walking distance of the Ala Moana Center as well as Waikiki Beach and all the restaurants in that area. As for the hotel itself, it's an average hotel with nothing special. Perks included the free Wi-Fi that was not slow (you can watch YouTube) and free coffee/tea in the lobby in the morning. Parking around the Ramada is terrible -- there was construction that took up a whole street of what would have been free parking, and Ala Wai is always packed. Hotel parking is $25/night (aka until 12PM the next day) and $20 for Wyndam members. Housekeeping was very nice -- I left a note requesting extra towels (for the beach and to avoid having them come in every day just to exchange the towels) and they gave us 6! We were also on the 12th floor and our room was at the end of the hallway so it was super quiet -- no view though, but we were never in our rooms anyways.The only trouble I had was when we checked out, the front desk charged me for an extra night of parking because THEY wrote down the wrong date. Thank god I saved my receipt/parking card to prove exactly when I parked in the hotel. We paid roughly $105/night and for the location and the fact that the hotel was just a place for us to store our stuff, shower and sleep, the Ramada is a great deal. Other than that, it's just your average hotel. I'd definitely book again whenever I return to Oahu/Waikiki.

We stayed here for our last two nights in Hawaii at the end of August. We had requested early check in, having arrived from Maui at around 10am and our room was ready by 12pm! Staff checking us in were friendly. We had staff come into our room with chocolates because they thought we weren't there yet. No problems but a heads up would have been nice. Room was outdated, air conditioner a little loud, but nothing we couldn't live with since we spent majority of our time outdoors anyway. Free wifi! Our toilet became blocked and was fixed immediately. Hotel close to Ala Moana and Hilton Hawaiian Village and Lagoon. Overall a comfortable stay. Thank you!

Employees were friendly and helpful, willing to arrange Wyndham convesrions for payment. Room was comfortable and as much as desired. Only problem encountered was getting around the city as city bus drivers are not helpful or knowledgeable.
This is the third time I have stayed at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki this year. The staff has been very helpful and the rooms have been consistently clean and well maintained.

My husband and i just got back from Oahu, we stayed at the Ramada Plaza, and were not impressed . Negatives......Non caring front end staff, definalty no Aloha greeting.Couldn't check in after a long flight, but cabin crew from the airlines do not have a problem checking in early.Air con are on sensors, they will tell you that they are heat sensors, but they are movement sensors. so god luck keeping cool at night when you are asleep.Coffee, shampoos, sugars do not get topped up all the time, we had to go looking for the cleaners to top it ourselves.Rooms are very outdated, musty smelling. carpets old and torn.Manager said we had been upgraded, but don't know how, as the room we had was very basic, the only thing we thought was upgraded was a little more room, as we did book a king size bed room.Concierge found it hard to help as she was to busy doing her nails.maintenance guys were fixing and cleaning equipment in the pool area, cleaners emptying mop buckets down drains where you lie next to the pool.We were told that management would personally get hold of us, and we had to e-mail them again to finally get a night back. The excuse was that the manager had a family issue, but can not the manager on duty give the information to another manager on duty.POSITIVES.......we received chocolates from management as a apology.we asked for a night back in money as we did not get any sleep the first night, we received that.The cleaners were always saying good morning.so please make your own mind up, but if we ever went again we would go to vrbo and book a condo. so much more cheaper and can get them overlooking the ocean for $150 per night. we looked into it while we were their, and condo's are the way to go.We thank the management in finally getting back to us, and also the cleaners, who seem to be stressed to work for this company, but still find a smile and a hello. We work hard all year to go on holidays, so when a hotel promises all that you expect and they don't deliver, it can lessen your experience for a great holiday, and Ramada lessened our experience.

Across the street from the Hilton Hawaiian Village, but much cheaper. Staff was friendly and hotel felt very safe. Parking attendant always on duty. Manager had chocolates and water bottles waiting in our room upon arrival. There was a slightly unpleasant smell in our room, especially upon entering, but not overpowering and did not interfere with our stay. Only used room for sleeping, anyway. If we had complained, then I feel like the management would have accommodated us. Room was comfortable, but would have liked it a little cooler. VJ's North Shore Dogs & Burgers has a location at this hotel and we really enjoyed the burgers and casual outside dining, too. Would definitely stay here again.

We had an overnight stay en route to Australia and this worked out well for us. Shuttle service to and from airport good. Older Hotel but has been updated with comfortable beds. Very friendly staff. Only negative would be it was hard to cool the room down to most comfortable sleeping temperature. Good lo action and in quieter part of city. Laundry on second floor helpful. Would stay there again.
The service was friendly and attentive. The elevator smelled and the hallway on the second floor was cluttered with cleaning equipment.

Close to Ala Moana Shopping Center, Across the street from Hilton Hawaiian (Friday Night Fireworks). Very clean and extremely well priced hotel. Our cost was $800 USD for the week. ($400/per person 7 days). Just a few blocks away and you are at the Hard Rock Cafe. It seemed quieter since we were away from the center of Waikikki (Royal Hawaiian, Embassy Suites etc.) so was very nice. In-room Microwave, coffee Maker, Mini-refrigerator, and a smallish safe. The beds were clean and bathroom was also very clean. A nice value place, can't beat the pricing and it's location is not too far from the action, but far enough away to avoid the noise and foot traffic.There are 2 computer terminals in the lobby so you can check in and print your e-tickets prior to going back to the airport. The pool and little fitness room are located on 2nd floor. Also on the 2nd Floor there are washers and dryers and 1 snack and 1 soda vending machine. Just need key-card to access.Really good value and location is quiet for restful nights of sleep.
clean. great bed. cool air conditioning. helpful staff. close to the airport. close to the beach. quiet, quiet, quiet. only disappointment was no breakfast..but i knew that goin in.

The hotel was great, clean, the location was better than on Waikiki Beach. Beautiful marina, Duke Kahanamaku lagoon nearby which was cleaner and not as crowded, lot of shopping and convenient to all attractions and dining. Half price compared to the Hilton village across the street.

I guess all the spending of this hotel is the location . Not far away from ala moana shopping center, u can even walk to the ward center. Opposite hilton hotel, close to the beach , 30 min drive from the airport. IHOP and McD also near by........The receptionist at the front desk was cold. I didn't ask much , but guess his smile is chargeable same as the parking fee (25$ per day )Housekeeping ladies and the souvenir shop lady were quite friendly tho

I liked the location, the staff was very nice, and our room was nice. Wish the view would've been better, but what ya gonna do about other buildings around you. Would stay again, just needs a complimentary breakfast

Reasonably priced and all was nice! Convenient, great service, and very quiet! Me and my junior high sweetheart hooked up later inside and decided to go on a trip every year for our birthday. This was our first trip together as a couple and we've been itching to go back. Of course we will definitely stay here again.

the hotel is directly across from Hilton Hawaiian Village and you can enjoy all the facilities there for a few 100 bucks a night. It's very clean, quiet, no view. but close to everything. Kid friendly, best breakfast in town at Waiahkoe - too many vowels for me but it's at the end of the block also good for dinner, diner kind of food, but food is expensive in Hawaii. Spend 12 bucks here or breakfast or 40 across the street. An egg is an egg. And you can still go for the $25 eggs benedict if you're in the mood. Dave is right, parking can be tight and it will cost you $20 unless you're a Starwood member. Join up on the internet for free and save $5. I wasn't but they gave it to me anyway - it worked - I'm a Starwood member now. Why not? Wakiki is Venice beach in Hawaii - not relaxing but beautiful all the same. You won't use your room and this hotel is perfect for sleeping and getting to every thing in Wakiki. I'd say the same about the Aqua Palms right next door. Romance - no, kids yes, it's a first class cheaper place if that makes sense. Don't spend your money on a hotel in Honolulu - spend it on the outer islands - where beauty and romance await. Oh, I was there during the "hurricane" and staff was Very accommodating. For the money, the location and service I'd give it a 4.

An excellent hotel to stay at! Convenient to Waikiki (walking distance), but take your GPS--there are a lot of winding and one-way streets to navigate in the vicinity. The room was exceptionally clean and the staff helpful and friendly. I used the prepaid option for my one night stay--which was low risk as all of the hotels had a one night charge for cancellation anyway.

This is a good place except for the smell of the room. There was a distinct odor like salt, urine, moisture yet not in the hallway or other rooms I have been in at this hotel. Do the smell test before unpacking and have them move you so they can address it.Thin windows so you hear, even on the 15th floor when the deliveries or other service vehicles come to start the day at 5 am AC was set on digital at 56 and I should have been freezing. Barely cooled the room

The hotel is very competitively priced for the perfect location in Waikiki! Just a short walk to the beach via the Hilton Resort / Mall (across the street!)Pros: PriceFriendly StaffLocationCons: The room had a weird smellDated decorLots of foreign tourists (don't speak english)AirConditioner needed to be run 24/7Construction behind hotelOverall - I would probably stay at this hotel again (if forced to travel on a budget) Considering that we didn't spend much time in the room - it was adequate for our needs.
Enjoyed our stay, Hotel is conveniently located. Staff was friendly and helpful. Short distance to the beach.
Staff was very accommodating especially since our travel agent made a mistake and cancelled and re-booked our rooms w
Your ReviewThe hotel was nice walking distance to.ihop and the beach. The only thing that made me hesitate was that the windows had no screens on them...so safety was the issue
Staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was comfortable and location was convenient. Walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping Center.

My experience with Ramada hotels in the past were not good so I was a little reluctant to book this property. I was surprised to find a very clean well kept hotel with a friendly staff, great room with a balcony and within walking distance to just about everything. The only downside is the small and tight parking lot. My rental car was dinged twice by people trying to open their doors. They need to enlarge the spaces or provide shoe horns and grease so the folks can squeeze into their cars. I would stay here again.
Very clean and modern. Great location (one block from beach & shops). Nice place. Quiet and clean, friendly staff.

My family and I stayed at the Ramada and had a great experience. Hotel staff was friendly and made our stay enjoyable. All our requests were accommodated. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The pool was wonderful. The hotel is located near many restaurants and close to the shopping mall and various beaches. We will certainly stay again.

This hotel is perfect if you are going to have a wonderful holiday in Hawai'i ... In a good location , with reasonable prices is offering very good services for a wonderful holiday!!!The room are large with beautiful view on the city .Not so far from the beaches, the hilton village , the Waikiki shopping center... If I will be back in Hawaii I will book a room in this hotel !!!

I was never going to pay top dollar for a hotel in Hawaii as I was never going to be in the room long enough. But I found this hotel the perfect balance between cost and value. The staff were always very helpful, and I was particularly impressed by the concierge who knew everything there was to do around the island. The room was clean, the bed huge, and the bathroom spotless. If anyone wants a hotel that is close to Waikiki Beach, but isn't going to break the bank, then I recommend this one.

Only stayed for 2 nights but room was clean, had a balcony and was located near reasonably-priced places to eat. Had a problem with my cell phone and their helpful staff located the nearest place for technical support along with the phone number and the easiest way to get there.

After not being able to stay at the Hale Koa due to my sons vacation being rescinded we stayed at the Ramada Waikiki Plaza. I was a little reluctant however the Ramada is a great place. The rooms were clean, beds comfortable & had a great view on Ala Moana. We had three rooms & two of the rooms we joining rooms, they made every effort to make us comfortable.Linda the housekeeper was great & Joe & everyone at the front desk were so helpful! I have no hesitation staying there again. The bus/trolley right in front, they will take you anywhere. The Wailiea Coffee shop down the street great food! My sister in law stood across the street at the Hawaiian Hilton & I personally think Ramadas rooms were better!
Not a high end hotel but fine for my purposes. I wished it had a balcony and a quieter AC. Great location.

This hotel is fine if you are looking for a clean hotel at a reasonable price. To begin, the positive attributes of this hotel are the following: refrigerator & microwave in room, pool, close to restaurants and a short walk to the beach. The negative attributes to the hotel are as follows: confusion upon check-in, parking problems, not located directly on the beach. Upon arriving there was confusion about my reservation. I had the paperwork and confirmation number. However, there was a delay in getting me checked in due to difficulty in finding the reservation. Fortunately, the front-desk employee asked for a manger to help and things got settled quickly. The manager actually "upgraded" my room to the 17th floor, or the "penthouse" floor. The room was a regular sized room with a small refrigerator, microwave, and balcony. The main problem I had with this hotel was the parking situation. Upon arriving, the "valet" employee told me to park in a certain space. She pointed to a space and instructed me to park there as I got checked in with the front desk. Within approximately 5 minutes, she came into the lobby and asked me to move my car. It is hard to multi-task and check in and move the car at the same time. Therefore, the front desk employee and manager told me it was fine to continue the check-in process and to not worry about the car. I understand the valet car-park employee was just trying to follow procedure and do her job. However, throughout the course of my stay, I came to realize that I don't think this particular employee even had a driver's license. Not once did I ever see her physically valet a car. Furthermore,this particular employee was from China and her English was not very good. It made it very difficult to communicate with her and fully understand the parking rules and expectations. That evening I went out and returned at approximately 1:40AM. There wasn't anywhere to park. The only place to park was in the "Reserved, Do Not Park, For Restaurant Only" spaces. Fortunately, the valet employee named Bridget, told me to valet the car with her and not to worry, that she would park the car and move it to an appropriate spot when one became available. Bridget was the most professional car-park employee whom I encountered. She was sure to mention her name and give me a claim check to retrieve the vehicle. I wish all valet car-park employees were as courteous as Bridget. Unfortunately, this was not the case. The following night I left and returned late and this time was an elderly American woman working the car-park. She was reading a book. When I asked her if where I was parking was permitted, she looked at me as if I was bothering her. After all, I just wanted to be certain I was parking in an authorized area and following the rules. I didn't want to have my rental car get towed. Upon checkout my rental car was blocked in. I tried explaining this to the Chinese employee and she had no idea what I was saying. Therefore, I went to my rental car and took a picture of the other car blocking me in and returned to show it to her. She had no idea how to solve the problem. I don't know exactly why Diamond Parking had employees working who more than likely did not have a driver's license. I thought the purpose of a valet at a car-park was to juggle cars by taking keys and moving cars as necessary. Since she walked around the parking lot not knowing what to do, I brought this parking fiasco to the attention of the front desk. They explained that the valet employee would help me get the car moved. Wrong! This fiasco continued for nearly 45minutes. What if I had to be at the airport for a flight? I would have missed it. With this parking disaster being stated over the past few paragraphs, I find it absolutely ridiculous the hotel charges $20.00/night for overnight parking. Actually, the price for parking is $25.00/night, but as a Wyndham Rewards Member it is $20.00/night. Regardless, I believe $20.00/night was too expensive considering the hassle. Out of 3 employees of Diamond Parking with whom I encountered, only 1 employee was worth the title of "valet employee." Bridget actually drove and moved cars, took keys and gave claim checks whereas the other employees (the Chinese woman and the older American woman with the book) were just there. I didn't see them actually working. Oh, it turns out the car that was blocking in my rental car was the car of the owner of the restaurant that shares the parking lot with the hotel. The woman came running out saying in her accent, "Oh, sorry, there was an emergency in the kitchen." Um, yeah...an emergency that took 45minutes? I ended up in Hawaii "by accident" because I was stopping in Honolulu for a layover on my way home from Australia. Hence, when looking for a hotel I was looking for something in Waikiki that was reasonably priced. With that being stated, the hotel is fine for a short stay. However, if you are looking for a hotel to spend your "once in a lifetime paradise vacation" I suggest you consider other options that are perhaps directly on the beach. Unfortunately, I don't think I will stay here again if in Waikiki.
I found the front desk staff not friendly. When I checked out Margaret did not smile, did not say hi and did not ask how was our stay. She was not friendly at all.

Stayed for one night.Great location.Courteous staff.Overnight parking is at $25 or $20 for Wyndham guest members (available to become a member on the spot).Good rooms. Couldn’t fault it.Slightly outdated interiors, but nothing too drastic that I would complain about
Good location, ok for the price if a short stay. Close to many stores and restaurants. The hotel could use improvement in the room's decor and comfort.

Was there with my best friend for 7 nights and have no complaints at all. Staffs there were very helpful and stored our luggage in a locked room as we got there very early before our check-in time. The room we had was big and clean and has all the basic electrical appliances that we need. Location wise, there is a lovely breakfast place just 2mins walk from it and most of the pick-up areas for day tours are just 2-8mins walk away which is very convenient. Price wise was very affordable. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Great Honolulu location. Convenient to everything. Rooms/lobby were clean and had a refrigerator and microwave. Nice feature. Great for a short stay with a family but for a longer stay more room would be nice.

Waikiki is very much city life (coming from a NYer), it's the complete opposite from the country life we experienced in Hilo. With that said, it should be expected that parking will suck in the area and that you have to pay for parking at this hotel ($25/night). It's worth it, especially if you'll be driving to other areas. The room wasn't big nor small, but you won't feel cramped. The room includes a mini fridge and a safe. The bathroom is decent sized. The TV sits atop the drawers. There's lots of space for clothes. The closet isn't bad either. The wifi was spotty at times, but it'll do. The rooms were made up very nicely. Everything is clean. The front desk was friendly and helpful. They pointed out a lot of places in the area for us to visit. My wife and I didn't have to deal with city noise -- or the construction that was going on behind the hotel across the street -- since we were in the penthouse.

Me and my family booked 3 nights but got stuck in LAX longer than expected so stayed 2. The ride from the airport was $36 excl tip. The reception staff were not welcoming in fact when he couldn't find the reservation and realised we had missed a night he reminded me I would get charged and even though out agent explained the reason for the delay he just said' you can't expect me to hold the room for nothing! " it' wasn't his fault take it up with the airline to be compensated. He went on to boast about his free wifi for only 2 devices there were 4 of us and told us that the Hilton across the road charged! The way to get around the 2 device limit was to use different email addresses for all the devices. We were given a room next to the lift, the room was stuffy so much so it triggered my asthma. The toilet water kept running and wouldn't fill. Even though the windows were closed I could still hear traffic on 12th floor.We were a good 15 mins from the beach by the sheraton. There is a bus stop outside for the normal town bus that gies to the airport and the shopping centre, also a trolley sightseeing bus. This hotel seems very popular with the Japanese clientele, in fact most of the area catered to them. To be honest we didn't feel welcome or valued and I wouldn't stay again.

This hotel was first on our trip and was slightly disappointed. It was close to the Ala Moana centre but out of the way of downtown Waikiki. The room was ok but not anything special. I'm glad this was our first stop, would hate hated it to have been our last on our trip!

Clean room, well presented. We appreciated the free coffee & tea in the lobby each morning but wished the ice water was available all day. Pool area was nothing fancy but pleasant. Overall good value for a young family and close to the public lagoon at the Hilton for swimming. Several inexpensive restaurants nearby suitable for families with kids. (Great if you are in town for the few days each month when the jellyfish are about). Nice to be allowed to move your own luggage so you didn't have to shell out on tips for a bellboy when you have lots of bags, but there was only one bell cart and a tour group had it stacked with their luggage while they awaited their tour bus in the morning.

I live on big island, westside/kona...had to go to Honolulu for wrist surgery...needed a 2 night stay...due to circumstances,most affordable was my criteria- I was so surprised..great staff..very clean and pleasant room...for the price...excellent.. just what I needed for medical trip. I would go again for same situation.
It was an amazing stay and customer service is always in the scene to help. Everyone was very helpful.

If you are looking for a cozy room, that is located a very short distance from the beach, this is the place to stay. Also, plenty of restaurants near by. Room was a bit outdated, but worked for our family of 4. It was nice to have a microwave and mini-frig.
i think itˊs a not bad experience in ramada !maybe you can apply room with kitchen! it would be a choice to mE!

It was comfortable. Staff is helpful and hospitable. Room was efficient & clean. Construction happening and it woke me up as early as 7 a.m. but who goes to Hawaii to sleep in. Ramada did warn there was construction happening across the road. Elevators were under repair, so only one was running but it wasn't so terrible. Life happens. The colour of the room is yuck, made it look dated. Hotel very central to everything. Beach just across the road. Price was reasonable.

Stayed for one week July 2014. Rooms were basic with limited views given the high rises surrounding the hotel (even on the top floor where my room was). Suites (there are only a few of them) allow for a better view and improved decor. Hotel was very clean! Staff were efficient and helpful. While not on the beach, the walk is not far (5 minutes) and the location is very central to the various local and tourist bus routes. About a 10 minute walk to the huge Ala Moana shopping centre. Free wifi in the rooms worked great; all rooms had safe, microwave and mini-fridge.
This motel met our requirements quite nicely. We stayed 2 nights before our cruise started. It is located an easy walk from the beach. Many restaurants close by.

This was a fairly priced, clean, and friendly hotel. When I walked into the lobby, I was pleased to see how extravagant the waiting area was. The room was clean, good-sized and our King bed had 6 pillows. I only stayed for a night but would feel satisfied with the price and the quality for a longer stay.

The room was average sized, bed was comfortable, fridge was nice, not much of a view, parking expensive. Good variety of places to eat nearby, beach is walking distance. Overall a nice place to stay downtown.

I only overnighted at this hotel and found it basic but nice. The staff were very friendly and the facilities were well kept and clean. Dont expect large rooms or a huge pool but the price compared to other hotels in this area was good value. The air conditioner was a little noisy. It is within walking distance to downtown and the Marina area and there are plenty of restaurants and shops close by.
The room smelled like dog pee. The curtains stunk as well. Parking was confusing because of the lady out patrolling it.

Everyone at hotel was friendly, rate was good, and room was comfortable size for our short stay in Honolulu. the hotel was a bit difficult to locate the first night using GPS as you can only approach from one side of Ala Moana so we had to drive around for an extra 10 mins before we located hotel, but it was close to several good restaurants and conveniently located in downtown Honolulu. If you are a Wyndyam rewards member parking is only $20/night, without the membership it is $25. Having rental car makes it much easier to see sights and enjoy less crowded beaches in Oahu.
I always enjoy my stay at Waikiki Ramada...great location,, clean rooms, and most of all great people at your hotel...

Stayed in one of the private condos in this complex. The ac running 24/7 never cooled to below 76. The floors in both the kitchen and bath were sticky and we checked out after 4 day even though we paid for a longer stay. The studio which stated to sleep 3 was correct but with the hide-a-bed pulled out there was no room at all

This is just an average hotel that is moderately priced. Given the location, the value is pretty good. The rooms were clean and everything was up to snuff. My only complaint is the smell in the pool area. There is an Asian buffet underneath near the lobby so the pool and pool are smell of horrible fried fish. It's pretty overwhelming. If you're looking to relax poolside or go for a quick swim, keep this in mind. All in all it was an ok place for the money.
it was in a good location, the room was clean and relaxing and it was across the street from the beach

The staff is very willing to accommodate your needs with pleasure. The room was clean with all the needed items. Parking was a bit annoying due to the one way in and out and sometimes there are busses and taxis who take precedence over you. Overall, a great stay and would be back.
The Ramada provides a clean. comfortable room for a modest price. The lobby area was well maintained and staffed. Coffee, business center, and gift shop are well stocked.

It was a very comfortable and clean hotel. We enjoyed our time there, although we were gone most of the day and night to attend a conference. The employee's were always kind and gracious to us. Mahalo!

The place was clean and not far from all the amenities and main beach, service desk and employees were helpful, parking is a bit narrow for big cars and 25 a night seems a bit much, free wifi is good, if going to Waikiki i would come back here!!!

Recent stay was excellent as always. Have stayed in the same hotel since the early 2005 and the service and friendliness of the staff is excellent. I will continue to stay at the same hotel while in Hawaii.

We enjoyed our stay here. It was in the center of the all the action..the beach, shopping centers, tour buses, trolleys, etc. Wayne, the hotel service person, was awesome. Always patient and helpful. The parking employees were also nice. However, it is $25 a day for parking.

Just 5 minutes walk to the Waikiki beach, and the Ala Moana shopping center is in walking distance. Convenient location and ABC mark is just on the corner. Couple sports bar near by. The room is nice and clean but the front desk staffs are not very friendly.

Excellent hotel staff!! Very helpful while I was in town for my Uncle's estate affairs. Wonderful accommodations. I used the mini fridge and microwave for most in-room meals. Very convenient! Close to restaurants and food stores. A great hotel that's close to everything.
At a reasonable distance from Waikiki beach and very close to Ala Moana mall.Just a pity that no breakfast is available.Rooms a little bit small but clean.
Our stay was a welcome respite away from the hustle of Honolulu, punctuated by a courteous staff, unexpected extras, a comfortable room, and convenience.

Helpful and friendly staff. The property and the rooms were very clean over all. Acceptable accomodations and location for the price of the room. I was not able to connect to the internet using the WiFi connection, I had to use the Ethernet cable, which was broken, and had trouble keeping it connected to the back of my lap top. I experienced water and power outages throughout my stay, somehow related to the construction taking place behind the building. Each outage lasting more than an hour.

If you're looking for a nice hotel for a short stay in Honolulu before your cruise this one can't be beat! It's not high on hotel amenities but we weren't looking for those as we just needed a place to stay overnight before our cruise sailed. We had to arrive a day early in order to make our cruise and this hotel was within walking distance of the Ala Moana Mall, Waikiki Beach and other major hotels. A short cab ride to the pier.

My girlfriend surprised me with a mini staycation in Waikiki. We returned to the site where we first fell in love on vacation. would not have been complete without a trip down memory lane - to those quaint little Waikiki pubs and attractions that we visited before.This time around, we found a great deal at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki through Booking.com. When we arrived, we we're surprised to hear a long list of free amenities (Free in-room and lobby WiFi, Free Computer and Printer, Kona Coffee in the lobby). We wandered the hotel and discovered brand new equipment and just about every kind of machine in a very nice workout room. The swimming pool was heated, and clean. There was a nice patio area to relax in with morning sunshine above. There was a laundry, in room microwave and mini fridge, and free HBO.Our stay was complimented by a sweet gesture from the hotel manager - who must have read a comment we wrote in the booking reservation. We wrote "It's our anniversary!" to which we discovered a bottle of Martinelli's Sparkling Cider in an ice-bucket, with two glasses and a box of Hawaiian Host Chocolate Macadamias. The note attached congratulated us on our romance, and invited us to call "Patti" directly if we needed anything.After we checked out, we left our bags in storage (for free) and played at the beach all day...The room was clean and bright. The hotel staff was very friendly, and everyone smiled and made eye contact. Everything we needed was close by (ABC Stores, Liquor, Restaurants, Bars, and of course... the BEACH!!)Fun and inexpensive! We will definitely go back.

My daughter and I recently stayed at Ramada Plaza Waikiki. We are Big Island residents and choose Ramada Plaza for the convenience of walking to Ala Moana Shopping Center. We got a great Kamaaina rate and found our room to be very comfortable for what we needed. We had a quiet room to the back of the hotel with lanai, frig and microwave. Housekeeping kept our room immaculate! We walked everywhere we needed to go and got great meals at Wailana Cafe just a few steps from the hotel.We will definately return to Ramada Plaza if we get a chance to island hop to Oahu!

Just came back from cruise and went directly to the hotel at very early in the morning, anyway the room was not ready cause it's only like 10:00am So the check in clerk just tell us to leave our baggage and try to go around and just came back anytime we want. And that what exactly what I did. Went to Pearl Harbor with the help of the concierge, she's very nice and told us exactly what bus to take and what we must do. Very, very nice and helpful, it's make our stay in Waikiki very pleasant. I ask for her help several times. The room was nice and location is about less than 10 minutes walk to the beach. The staff was very helpful. I will stay again in the same hotel in our next vacation to Hawaii. I did not used any of room service or bar so can't comment on those.
Very nice hotel. Rooms are clean and nice. Beds very comfortable. Very close to Waikiki Beach, shops and restaurants.

We stayed at the beginning of our trip on Waikiki and then went off island (Kauai) for a few days. We booked our return visit to the Ramada Waikiki when we came back to Honolulu. It is a great place to stay with a fabulous location for doing the strip. Staff are very helpful and attentive. Very satisfied.

Room is tiny, very tiny.AC is super noisy, but you have to turn it on all day just to stay alive.Parking fee is $25, remember to find a space at the back of the hotel, it's free but very hard to find a spot.Would not come back again.

Ideal location accross from Hilton HI Village. Parking available at a cost so rental car no issue. Coffe shop & IHOP down the block. Looking for a clean, reasonable, safe location within a walk to beach and convenience - it fit the bill.
