Hotel was clean and well appointed. I little outdated but well maintained. Construction behind the hotel was annoying but appears to be near to being done. Good location. Close to beach, shopping, eating. It was a great price for the location. Would recommend and would go there again.

There is construction behind the building right now and they are noisy, yelling at six in the morning then ripping payment at six thirty, the manager said he would talk to them but I would recommend staying somewhere else at least until the work is done. Everyone needs sleep especially on vacation.

Hotel is located in the newer Waikiki hotel location. It is close to the beach and central shopping centres. It has freindly staff and good service. The rooms are a bit on the small side - but you are just sleeping there, not entertaining. The room includes free WiFi and wired internet. The beds are very comfortable.Air condition is a bit noisy. Furniture can use a bit of an update.

We stayed here for 7 nights as it was part of the Wyndham group and we used points to stay. Although it was about a 15 min walk to the Main Street at Waikiki, it was kind of nice to be in a quieter area and enjoy the walk in the morning. You are also 10 min away from Ala Moana shops so a good location. Rooms are big with kind beds and comfy but let's hope you're out walking around beautiful Hawaii and not sitting in your room! Great stay for money. Nothing fancy, but suited our needs just fine!
Walking distance from the mall & lots of restaurants. Downfall,construction work & parking is expensive.

We've stayed at the ramada Waikiki plaza many times. It is just across the street from the Hilton but at half or a third of the cost. Pool is ok. Rooms are ok. Front desk is ok. Near the beach. Near ala moana park (nice for walking, running, paddling, etc). Near the ala moana center for shopping. Ask for a room on the backside (less of a view, but quieter.). Oh, and join the Wyndham rewards program and they give you a discount on parking fee (not many spaces btw).

This is a very nice hotel for the price. Front desk folks were pleasant and changed my room to one looking out to the street (set back from the street) instead of facing the construction in the rear. Instead I looked into other hotel rooms and condos :-). Room is a little outdated, but clean, nice amenities such as small frig & microwave, big flat screen tv, small balcony.Location is across from the Hilton Hawaiian Village but that is deceptive since the property is so large you have quite a hike to the beach. The hotel is in the middle of a long block and you take your life in your hands jaywalking over to the city bus stop or where tour buses do pick ups. Reasonably priced restaurants are scarce in the area, even the McDonalds, Subway & IHOP prices are higher than other states. There is a very nice coffee shop down the block open 24 hours with reasonable prices.I would have preferred a hotel off the beach a few blocks in the main Waikiki area where there was more selection of stores and restaurants and the main beach to walk on. As a senior I was able to ride the bus for $1, so I managed to get around pretty well. Not sure what some folks consider walking distance, but the Ala Moana mall is a good 2 miles down a busy road.

Our flight to Australia was delayed by a day so after leaving Wyndham's Beach Walk property which was great we stayed one night at Ramada as recommended by the Wyndham consultant. A bit disappointing as no spoons or bowls in the room, the air con was off so the room was stuffy for a while and also a bit noisy. One great feature was the free broadband wifi which performed much better than the slow service at the Beach Walk property.

i had a very nice stay at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki. the room was clean and the people were lovely and very helpful. i did not like the "breakfast" policy. i was charged for breakfasts that i did not use.

The Ramada Plaza was a great place to stay. I had been there five years ago when it was a Holiday Inn and returned because of the first experience. The location is perfect for anyone attending a conference (which I did). Ramada Plaza was just as good, if not better, than the previous hotel.

This is a great place if you have a tall vehicle such as an SUV or van. Most hotels in Waikiki have really short vertical clearance (around 6 ft) for their parking garage. However the Ramada has a secure parking lot with room to park trucks or SUVs with a lifted suspension, luggage racks, etc. I drive a Hummer H2 which is 81 inches tall and it was no problem. Thank you!

We really enjoyed our stay at th Ramada Plaza Waikiki. Our room was very nice and clean. They have an onsite parking lot right behind the hotel. There were several restaurants close by for breakfast. We left Honolulu for a few days and on our return, stayed at another hotel. We wished that we would have booked with the Ramada for the second stay. It was much nicer than the other hotel.
It was all together a great place to stay. Location is very nice. Would recommend to family and friends.
ideally located near restaurants, shops, and the beach . reasonably priced. the staff was very friendly and helpful.
Good basic hotel in great location. Attached restaurant attracts large numbers of Chinese tourists and is not a great experience for others.
Our first time to Hawaii, good value for money at this hotel central for beach and shopping, staff very helpful with tours and information.

I stayed at this hotel 2 nights, for leisure the first night and in the corporate hotel used by my employer the second night. I travelled early to rest and overcome jet lag before starting work. The room was comfortable and the location excellent. However, my second night the front desk staff was extremely nasty to me because I was staying there in a room paid that evening by my company. The first night as a paying guest, the staff swiped my card and all amenities were available, chocolates were left and my concerns were addressed post haste. The second night, even though I had the same card I was told that I could not even make local calls. Forget the chocolate. I would also like to see real milk or cream for the coffee. If you are going to bother with serving good coffee, the amenities should be good quality as well.

We arrived early, they let us have the room right away. Room was clean, front desk was very helpful. We used the pool, kids enjoyed time there. There was an odd odor when you got off the elevator in the lobby, really my only Complaint. Our plane left after check out, they were happy to hold our bags until our car arrived to take us to the airport.

After arriving in Honolulu early morning from our overnight flight from Brisbane we were surprised when they allowed us to check in. The room was large and spacious with good facilities and the bed very comfortable and heaps of storage space. We also loved the location accross the road from the Hilton Hawaiin Village and close to Ala Moana shopping centre.There is free wi-fi and Lan and tea and coffee facilities as well.What we didnt like was the chinese groups in the foyer and the buffet restaurant talking loudly , blocking the entrances and smoking. Other than that a very enjoyable stay.

First visit to Hawaii, hotel was within walking distance to the beach and the largest outdoor mall in the US. The closest food was a Chinese buffet and the people going there were smoking and blocking the entrance to the hotel which is why we didn't rate higher. Rude and no speak English nor understand it. Pool was very nice.

The hotel lobby was clean and the staff friendly. The rooms are large and neat. Some of the rooms have outdated single pane windows but outside noise is not too bothersome. WiFi internet is free and there are a lot of cable channels. If you need to take the bus to Kaka'ako, Chinatown, or the Airport, the bus stop is right outside along Ala Moana. Walking distance to Waikiki. Lastly unlike most hotels in Waikiki there are numerous FREE parking spaces along the streets surrounding the hotel. I enjoy staying here whenever I visit Oahu.

My husband and I were vacationing for the weekend from an outer island. This hotel was conveniently located for what we were there for (a concert at the Blaisdell Arena) and everything about it was great. The fitness room was great and the pool, though it's small, was clean and would have been great to swim in but it was a cloudy day on the day we were going to try it out, so the water was cold and we didn't get in. The only thing I didn't like were the pillows. But that's just a personal preference. I have a hard time sleeping well if I don't have my own pillow. There are like 6 pillows to choose from on the bed and they seem to be different thicknesses. So maybe for others it works, although my husband also couldn't find the perfect one for him. We will probably bring our own pillows next time. There is a restaurant downstairs, but we didn't try it. There are also other nearby restaurants you can walk to like IHOP and Buffalo Wild Wings and more. I already have another reservation later this year, so I would definitely recommend it.
Small property but very satisfying. If your not going to spend a lot of time in the hotel, but need a clean and pleasant place to sleep... this is the place.
I was unable to sleep because of the construction going on from sun up to sun down every day I was there.
Overall this was an excellent stay for the money. It is in a good location in Wakiki. The staff was very friendly and professional.

Wonderful location downtown Honolulu. The room was quiet, clean and and the housekeeping was very attentive. To use the internet in the lobby without any charge was very helpful to keep in touch with Germany.

The Ramada Plaza is comfortable, the employees were nice. The location is in a good spot, like in walking distance to tour the area, eating places, and the beach. This hotel would have rated higher if it had complementary breakfast.

This hotel was our base for a nine day stay on Oahu. It was a good choice and a good value compared to what many of the hotels at Waikiki were charging. We found this hotel to be clean and the bed very comfortable. Having a microwave and fridge in the room was a plus. Although it is not beachfront, it is in a great location. A 10 min. walk will put you on the beach. Several restaurants and car rental companies are within two blocks. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Thanks to Ramada for making our time on Oahu a great experience.

Comfy bed with lots of pillows! Room service was good, coffee/tea available in lobby, no place for breakfast in hotel but plenty of cafés and 10 min walk to Ala Moana Shopping Centre. 20 min walk to Waikiki. We stayed on Wyndham points for free so didn't mind the walk! Cheap shuttle, $12/person to airport.

We chose this hotel as it was reasonably close to Ala Moana Shopping Centre. It is across the road from Hilton Hawaiian Village and there are plenty of bars, restaurants and convenience stores nearby. Our room was a King Bed Room with balcony. It was clean and modern and had every thing we needed. Wifi and LAN were free and fast. Also free PC and printer in lobby. The staff were friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Highly recommended.

This hotel is an excellent value for Waikiki. The staff was very friendly and the rooms were spacious and clean. The location is close to public transportation that takes you all over Waikiki. The only drawback is that it not near the beach. We would stay again if we ever get back to Hawaii.

I booked online for a family trip. I reached the hotel early . I offered to pay for half day stay as my son was having fever and diarrhea. This was not possible. When I checked with front desk if it possible to cancel the rooms, they offered to check us in earlier. Room was decent but not spacious. The air conditioning blows into the curtain and is noisy. The gym was a great disappointment. It was small and at the time I was there , it was hot. Either the air conditioning was not working or it was switched off. There is no dedicated space for warm ups and floor works. The machines looks aged. The gym room is small and looks overwhelmed by the machines. Not inviting. The gym was one of the reason why I chose the hotel

We stayed at this property on March 6th when we had an overnight layover in Honolulu on our way to Australia. We wanted a property that was close to the beach, without having to pay the beachfront prices. Ramada Plaza Waikiki fit that description. While it is not situated on the beach, it is a mere 5 minute walk through the Hilton Hawaiian Village, and you will find yourself right on Waikiki Beach. While the room and decor at the Ramada appears older and dated, it was clean and we felt safe there. The staff were very pleasant and were even able to help me get a lock off my suitcase (I needed bolt cutters) that I was afraid I might not be able to remove myself.The hotel does not provide transportation to/from the airport, so be prepared for about a 30 min cab ride (depends on time/traffic) and about a $50 charge for the ride.We were very pleased with our stay at this hotel, and if we were back in Hawaii again wanting to stay at a decent hotel without paying exorbitant room prices, we would definitely stay there again.

Very nice and comfortable stay as what you pay here. Staff is friendly , helpful. Very close to the buses, restaurants and close proximity to the beach. Parking is 20 dolor a night. You don't need to rent scar if you r staying here. Tour operators can pick u from Waikiki hotels. Will comeback again.
The rooms were clean and had everything you needed. It is close to the beach and the main street. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Did a Group Booking for 3 day stay. The prices was great. Had the Top floor suite. Its was very spacious, updated furniture, Double beds were comfortable. Hotel lobby was nice. Information desk people were very nice, front desk helpful, parking attendents would always greet you, pool was OK not sure if it was heated. The fitness room was adequate. Over all stay was great...

Conveniently located - reasonably priced especially during peak Jan season. Close to Waikiki beach. Good breakfast restaurants close by. Walking distance to Malls as well as downtown shopping area.Good free coffee and tea in the mornings in the Lobby. Internet works fine.Hotel is clean and staff is good. Mailed back items that we had forgotten for a postage fee only.Have been staying there off and on 4 or 5 times and will stay there again.

On arrival I was concern about some of the constrution near the Hotel ( I am very sensitive to noise and light). When I checked-in, I related my concerns and I was informed that they had reserved a room on the PH level and away from the construction. I was soo impress that they had already had a room for me that dealt with my with my concerns even before I had to tell them. The service was excellent during my stay and I will stay here again. Also, the location of the hotel is a very short walk to the beach, restaurants and shopping.

My husband and I recently travelled to Waikiki on our wedding anniversary, and it also happened to be my husband's birthday. I let the hotel know ahead of time, and asked if possible for our room to please be upgraded (as the room I had booked was at a great rate, but on a lower floor).When we arrived, we were treated very courteously, they gave us a room on a higher floor, and we arrived to find a welcome gift of choc-coated macadamia nuts and sparkling apple juice. I really appreciated the ease of communication with the hotel before our arrival, the fact that they marked our special occasion with a gift, and the rest of our stay was very enjoyable, as the hotel is very centrally located. Would recommend this hotel to others wanting a place that is not too expensive at a great location!

Although I was staying for business away from downtown Honolulu, this hotel was a great location to be walking distance to Waikiki and all the businesses and beach. Hotel is a remodeled, older hotel but very nice facility. Very nice room decorations, friendly and helpful staff and no resort fee. Parking was $25 a night (reduced to $20 since I am a Wyndham rewards member).

We stayed at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki Hotel for 5 nights after we went on a 7 day cruise around Hawaii. The motel staff are very pleasant and helped us with any enquiry we had. The room was sufficient and had everything we needed (comfortable bed, microwave, safe, coffee machine & big TV & The shower was great). I liked the fact that they had washing machines and dyers we could use. They also have an ATM which was really handy as well. We booked this hotel through Otels.com and the price was around $115.00 AU per night which is really good value for Waikiki. Look, this motel is a little old, but it was clean which is important to me. There is a bar called Snappers not 5 minutes away that serves $3.99 breakfast which is pretty cool & happy hour 3 til 6 for $3.00 drinks. Give them a go.

Although the hotel looks a little outdated and in need of a refresh, the room was clean, the bed was comfortable and the staff were friendly. The room included a refridgerator, a microwave, a good sized TV, coffee and tea service and free and working wifi.

We were in Honolulu for a few days to see our daughter before we traveled on to Kauai. This hotel was inexpensive and served it's purpose. The locations is fantastic, very central. A 5 minute walk to the Hilton and on to the beach. The hotel itself did smell like Chinese food, I think it came from the attached restaurant, it concerned me when we first went to get on the elevator, even smelled it up on our floor, but as soon as we opened up our room and went it we couldn't smell it anymore. This property is a bit dated, but it was clean. The beds weren't very comfortable, but I didn't wake up with a back ache so I couldn't complain. The units are small, and the pool was rather small, but as I said before, we were just there for a quick visit so it served it's purpose. The staff was all very courteous & friendly. We would stay here again if were come back for a quick trip.

Pretty good place to stay,staff friendly,helpful,english speaking.About midway to Convention Center Ala Mona Mall or Waikiki beach 15 to 20 minuites walk .Taxi to beach $12 to Airport $40.Rooms were clean,quiet but a bit small. Do not recommend attached restuarent. IHOP or Red Lobster a few steps away are best choices . I would stay again

We paid $124 plus taxes per night for a cube size room with a bathroom longing for renovations. The soap dish was a porcelain like dish from the local dollar store. The window had caulking or sealant missing therefore there was street noise and air constantly fighting against the a/c. The a/c broke over night and the repair guy had to change a sensor. I was told that never happens, BS, it's a old unit and was not working properly on checkin along with the window and the gap under the fortitude always that had NO a/c what so ever! The Mgr made the whole thing sound like it was no it deal. He made me feel that my comfort was not important, but my card was charged immediately. No concession was made for the couple nights of discomfort. I would not recommend to anyone unless they do t need much space or they don't like the a/c.
Great staff and for the price close to beaches and activities. Didn't pay a big price like some hotels in the area but still had all the activities close by. Stayed there b4 and after our cruise.
All staff were friendly and kind. It was nice and confortable stay.It would be nice if you had a continental breakfast and a pick up service at HNL airport even with some charge.

The people at the hotel were very helpful and lovely however, the construction next door started at 7:30 am and was VERY loud. It is a good hotel for the money, but very basic, and not every room has a lanai.
Parking could be included in the price of the stay which would make this hotel more desirable overall.
This is a very nice hotel located close to many restaurants and within walking distance to the beach. It is also located near the Ala Moana shopping center which is a nice facility with many shops.

We stayed for a week with a 4 month old. They provided a crib, blankets, microwave and fridge which was very helpfull. Handy location for attending the Hawai'i Convention Centre and also being walking distance to resturants, beach and there is a bus stop right outside. 4 stars due to not having a restaurant and the pool was quite small and very overlooked by surrounding buildings. Would stay here againif we returned to Waikiki.
Basic, clean, good value hotel in Waikiki. Nothing fancy but it served our purposes. Not right on the main beach but close enough to walk.

Very good value for money. On the downside: No food options made it a bit difficult on business travel. Pool very cold. Bit noisy at night. On the bright side: Staff very friendly, room very clean. Great location.
It wasn't luxury but it was nice. It was conveniently located in Waikiki Beach and walking distance to lots of establishments. The workers were very friendly!

Our stay at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki was pleasant, comfortable, clean and affordable! Traveling with a family of 6 (including 2 small children) can present challenges - crib, changing sheets, bathroom accommodations, etc - the staff at Ramada were fabulous about helping us with everything! Thanks guys!! Lastly, the hotel itself was close to EVERYTHING so it was real easy to get to places around Honolulu/Waikiki, and find your way back. (:

The staff was very friendly. This hotel was a great value with it's location close to the beach and bus routes. We liked having the microwave and refrigerator in our room. It was also close to the convention center. Free Wifi.
The room was nice and clean, The hotel is in a really good location, the staff was helpful. I really advice this hotel.
I choose this hotel because of the Ramada name, I have always been happy with their rooms before, this one was old and dirty. I will not make that mistake again if I can help it.

Booked room for 3 people, Only 1 bed was provided. Our teenage son had to sleep sitting in a chair. We were told when we checked in that they were booked and we could pay an additional $30 if we wanted a cot. Don't know where they would have put it.There was no sofa or even room for any sort of pullout. A pillow and blanket were provided for him.
Construction starts promptly at 7AM across the street from this hotel. Hotel manager was never around.

I was impressed with the gal out front of the hotel lobby on the outside - she was great and funny and I enjoyed getting information from her. Also the gentleman that checked me in was very helpful - so all in all it was a very nice experience.
We enjoyed our stay very much. We weren't in the room except to sleep. We rested well and the staff we engaged were courteous and helpful.

In a high priced area as Waikiki that place is a excellent compromise. Clean, nice rooms, friendly staff and functional. 5 minutes walk from the beach and bus stop in front of hotel entrance. We recommend it!

Clean rooms, nice staff, great price ($114/night in February). Not a lot of amenities, and a little dated, but how much time do you spend in a hotel anyways? Microwave, little fridge and a room safe were good additions. Pool area was nice, but only used it once as it rained while we were there. Bed comfortable and lots of pillows! Staff always said hello in the hallways. Concierge lady was extremely pleasant. No restaurant,(except for weird Chinese buffet place frequented by bus tours) but only a 2 minute walk to McDonalds and Red Lobster. IHOP next door. At the west end of Waikiki strip. Easy city bus access. Only suggestion to management would be PLEASE get some real glasses and ceramic coffee cups for room. The disposable cups were cheesy, not eco-friendly and not very pleasant to drink from.

We stayed at Ramada Waikiki for 2 nights last week. The locations is FANTASTIC. Walking distance to the beach, lots of great restaurants, off the main drag a block, perfect walking distance to alot of things. The outside of the hotel was a little less than desired. Rooms are pretty nice, air conditioner works well, bathroom is decent, mini fridge and microwave in room, beds are very comfortable. Only complaint about the room is that the coffee pot was in the bathroom literally 2ft from the toilet. We are coffee drinkers so this was very disgusting to us. We were up at 4am both nights and asked the front desk person if he would please make us some coffee in the lobby and he told us to just move the coffee pot out of the bathroom. Which did not solve the problem in our eyes. The only time that anyone ever greeted us was when we checked in any other time we came into the lobby we were never spoken too. When we checked out the staff never once thanked me for staying, did not ask how are stay was, just checked me out and that was it. For the money and location I would stay here if you do not want to spend alot of money. But do not expect the staff to make you feel welcome or be helpful.

Hello, So we were there like 2 weeks ago, and we loved it, the room was very clean, and the staff was very friendly especially the concierge girl and the parking lot attendant, Concierge was awesome, she helped us right away. The only thing that sucked was that our view was for some construction,I think the location was great, everything is walking distance. The hilton is right across the street, its a nice walk. Love It

Good, clean large rooms with affordable prices. Good location as you can easily walk to Ala Moana shopping centre. Lots of takeaway places nearby for cheap meals. Only downside was that the pool water appeared slightly discoloured and cloudy.

We stayed at this Ramada just shy of 2 weeks. We had emailed months in advance explaining that we were arriving from Australia at 7am and asked if a room would be ready for then. They replied saying to just leave it with them. We assumed this would mean yes. We arrive and they told us check in would be at 3pm. At this stage we had been awake for close to 16 hours. They did nothing to help us and said "go for a walk". Yes just what you want to do when you are exhausted. But this hotel is right in the heart of Honolulu and just down the road from the main high-end shopping streets and mall making it an ideal location. The rooms were dated but clean and the house keeping staff were so sweet and lovely. The front desk staff never greeted us on one single day. When I asked for computer passwords they replied "are you even staying here?" No one ever helped us with our bags when we were struggling. On a happier note, the woman booking tours was amazingly helpful in choosing the right tour for us. I would stay there again for the location, but know not to expect too much from the front desk staff.

I stayed here twice this month--the end of Jan for two days and again for three days before leaving Hawaii. Both times I had extended my stay through a third party website and the front desk personnel each ensured that I did not have to check out of one room and into another as I found out that booking extensions through a third party website is treated as a separate reservation meaning that there could be a chance of moving a room. Luckily for me, I had one room for each of my stay with no changing.The cleaning staff work very hard and the rooms were spotless. My first room had two Queens and though spacious, it did not have a proper work desk, but instead a table. My second visit had me in a King room and this one had a proper work desk and computer chair.Each room had a microwave and a fridge which I found very useful. The pool downstairs got the sunlight most of the day so it was also nice not having to trek to the beach. I also used the laundry room on the last night I was there and the machines all worked well and they were reasonably priced.Waikiki is small so this hotel is literally walking distance to everything. Just because it is in the Marina area does not mean that it is far from all the action if one wants that. I stayed in five different hotels in Waikiki on this trip and by far I preferred this one the most!

The Ramada Plaza remains a good choice in the rapidly shrinking inventory of budget hotels. Of course, with so many budget hotels going upscale, Ramada has raised its rates significantly in recent years and may soon be unaffordable too, particularly for longer stays. Housekeeping remains the strong point here as there isn't a speck of dirt in the rooms and everything is done promptly and professionally. The hotel claims to be environmentally conscious with the usual cards about towel and linen reuse but that really doesn't ring true. There are only paper or Styrofoam cups wrapped in plastic bags for coffee and bathroom use. And the lobby, for some unknown reason, is excessively air conditioned to meat locker temperatures. Most hotels in Waikiki, including luxury properties, have open air lobbies. The Ramada, owing to the building's ancestry as Holiday Inn, chooses to refrigerate the lobby, especially by the elevators. By keeping the front doors open and replacing the window near the elevator with louvers the delightful island breezes would waft through and countless kilowatt hours would be saved. All in all, however, this is a good hotel where I'll probably be staying again.

My family stayed at the Ramada for five days and four nights. The front desk and all hotel staff were friendly, professional, and very helpful. For the two weeks we visited Hawaii, I must say that this hotel was the one thing my family of four happily agreed upon. One of my sister loved the coffee lobby service where she got to taste and sample different local coffees. My other sister loved the shampoo/personal hygiene products provided. I could say that the pool was cold and it needs a heater as the only complaint. While my 5 year old nephew exclaimed, "pool is cool, let's go!!! Overall, the Ramada offered a great location, everything was within walking distance. The room was big enough for the family. The beds were clean and comfortable. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Would I stay here again? A big definitely yes!!!

We stayed at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki Feb 6 - 9 of 2014. I want to thank the staff for taking such good care of my family during our stay. A special Wahalo to Rowena (housekeeping) and Mary (parking attendant) for going above and beyond making us feel so welcome. The location of the hotel is great. Everything is within walking distance. We enjoyed the coffee served in the lobby everyday until 1130. We enjoyed the pool which was refreshing (not heated). There are a few cons. Parking is $25 unless you are a member of the Wyndham Rewards program $20.

My comment is not directed at the hotel itself. The room was nicely appointed, clean, and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. However, the street noise made it nearly impossible to sleep, even on the 15th floor. Maybe it would have been quieter on the side away from the street. I realize this is not the hotel's fault, but it is a major drawback. I booked through Expedia but probably would have gotten a better rate from the hotel itself.

The Ramada Waikiki was much better than I had expected. For the price paid it was a good value. The room is on the small side for sure, but clean and well maintained. The location is right across the street from the Hilton Hawaiian Village which has a nice outdoor shopping mall and many restaurants in the area. There are many chains like Ihop, McDonalds, Red Lobster, Buffalo Wild Wings all within a block; not to mention many local (and better) restaurants. The beach is a very short 5 min walk and a nice one at that. If you are one that is trying to save a little money and still be close to a big resort this may be a great option. It is more than half the cost of the Hilton, and right across the street. This is a modest hotel, with smaller rooms, but again, if you plan on being out which you should be, this is a good starting point for your explorations. The beds were good, coffee in the lobby, and a good location for a budget hotel. One note: our room did not have a balcony which would have been nice. But some of the rooms do, so ask for one. Spend the extra money you save on nice dinners (the Shorebird at The Reef hotel is outstanding) and souvenirs. Enjoy!

The process of reservation was smooth with the hotel calls for confirmation when the time was near. Open the room to meet a welcome compliment with chocolates, card and brochures. Clean room, convenient location with a Thai restaurant nearby - I love that.

The hotel was very nice and clean. The location was great. Far enough for privacy but still walking distance to many nice restaurants and shopping. The staff was friendly and we were always greeted as we came and went.
Get a room on the shady side of the hotel. Each room has its own AC and the AC has a hard time keeping up on the sunny side.

Good value for the location. Friendly, helpful staff. Room service was very (aloha) friendly. I would recommend this hotel for families that wanted to get away from the congestion of Waikiki a little bit. Close enough for the fun, but far enough away from the craziness.
Comfortable, clean room that is very reasonably priced near the Waikiki area. The staff are all friendly and I feel like it's my second home when traveling for business on Oahu.

even though im just here for one night, this has been a veey pleasant experience from the time i pulled up to unload my luggage, reception at the from desk, even meet some staff along the way..roombis VERY clean from tge ceiling to the base boards... linen and towels are super duper white and fresh with tgat new laundry smell.. one and only minor complaint is that room has a slightly strong bleach smell... looking at walls, tile, and linen, they do belive in using bleach... i must have caught them on the day they wiped down all the walls and scrubbed the tile... *it actually brought back memories of my moms and aunts house on a cleaning day... rates are very reasonable considering the area located in... A+++ thank you Ramada and wyndam for making my first day of vacation a great one...

Ramada Plaza Honolulu is an older hotel in a good location. The hotel does not have food service but there are many places to eat within walking distance. The room was clean with good internet access. Hotel staff was very responsive to requests.

We had a great 3 days in the Ramada Plaza in Waikiki. The hotel itself is nothing spectacular or luxurious, but a good, solid, quality place to stay. The location is pretty good, a little bit out of the main tourist hustle of Waikiki, so a bit quieter. However it is only about a 5 min walk from Waikiki Beach and about 10 min to Ala Moana Mall and park. There are a number of handy shops and restaurants within a few minute’s walk from the hotel. Give the Wokkiki Chinese buffet out front a miss – definitely not worth it.The room was a bit smallish and we didn’t have any view from the 10th floor, but it was clean, comfortable, and functional with all the usual amenities (coffee maker, safe, microwave, AC, etc). The large, modern flat screen TV had a great selection of channels, and there was free, unlimited Wifi which is a major drawcard for us (we won’t stay places these days that don’t offer free Wifi). My only complaint was that we got a room with 2 smallish beds rather than 1 king size bed. Another thing we really liked about this hotel was the fact they had a fitness center. Although it was small, there was enough quality gear, both cardio and weights, to get a decent workout. We used the fitness center every day and applaud the hotel’s decision to install and maintain the fitness facility. It’s often hard to find a decent gym in the Waikiki hotels.Breakfast was included (from the Wokkiki Chinese buffet restaurant out front) in the room price. We tried it on the first morning and found it to be so awful that we went elsewhere for breakfast on the following mornings – disappointing. Our clothes ended up smelling like a Chinese deep fryer from just sitting in there for 15 min. There’s an IHOP just a few yards down the street so a much better option.Overall we had a really good stay at the Ramada and wouldn’t hesitate to stay there again in the future. Recommended to other travelers as an affordable option in Waikiki.

Great staff, fantastic beds and comfy pillow, clean bathroom but the carpet need to be steam cleaned or renewed. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel, Food Pantry shop and ABC stores everywhere, a short stroll to the beach, what more do you want? BTW, do not eat at the Wokkiki Chinese restaurant next to the hotel as the food there is expensive, dirty and old!

Location was OK and was really not hard to find. Service was good. Stayed on 14th floor and was fairly quiet. Only complaint is that everyday when we returned to our room it had a funky smell. Maybe cleaning products or because the window not open. Staff was nice, especially our parking attendant. Dee rocks!

Although we weren't able to book a beach front hotel (because that is what our daughter always wants) we were able to get accomodations at Ramada. Within walking distance to ALL Beach activites and Restaurants in the area. Loved It, Loved It, Loved It!!!!! The Staff was always more than helpfull, and the abilities or the "concierge" Jasmine was wonderful. She booked everything from The Luau we attended to confirming boarding passes prior to departing. This woman wa fantastic!!!! Rooms were always clean and ready when we were!!! Would book again if we visit Hawaii...

Overall stay is pleasant for our stay during 27 Dec 13 to 2 Jan 14. We checked in into the highest floor (17th) (penthouse floor) with a huge balcony overlooked the Hilton Village and a little view of the beach which was great. Room size is OK, very clean, with all amenities like safe, microwave, coffee drip machine, mini fridge and daily replenish coffee , tea etc. Also it's extremely helpful to have coin operated washing machines, driers and free ice machine on the level 2. A few minuses of the rooms are: there is a motion sensor to switch off electricity of the room, I understand that is used to switch off the power consuming appliances like air-con when no one is in the room but when we are sleeping in the middle of night, (when we get idle), the air-con got switch off too and we got hot and have to wave our hand or moved in order to switch the air-con back on. So that is pretty annoying. Another thing is that our room is right next to the lifts which beep when they pass through every floor, sometimes in the middle of the night when everything got really quiet, we could hear the beeps which was really disturbing our sleeps. Apart from the cons, all was good and the staffs were really helpful.

Excellent hotel off the main stip, but a pleasant few minutes from Waikiki beach. The staff are friendly, rooms are very clean and comfortable. Very pleasant to be close to alltge shopping but not in the busy traffic congestion of people, cars in tge hotels, shopping districtnof Waikiki beach itself. I would stay again.

We picked this property bec of the better than average reviews on this site. However, our room was a disappointment. It had a musty smell; there was no balcony in the room and the size was tiny. The odour actually is not just the room but also in the hallways of the hotel. This hotel needs updating or at least a professional cleaning. The only plus was the location as it is within walking distance to the beach and approx 20 mins to the main shopping strip. You can likely find better options for your stay in the same price range in the area.

Nice location near Ala Moana Shopping Center and Waikiki attraction but about a block off the "beaten path" so none of the noise and other distractions that come with a lot of Waikiki hotels. The property had obviously been renovated recently so everything felt new and clean. I'd definitely stay here again when passing through Honolulu.

The rooms were clean. The staff very very helpful and such a great team. Did like the coffee machine, microwave and fridge in the rooms. Bus stop was right out side the hotel which was great. Close to all. The beach was not far to walk. We would come back. Thanks you.
The property is very well located close to the Waikiki beach.Easy buss connections from the hotel front.Property well maintained with friendly staff

Our one night stay was made very pleasant due to the very helpful staff. We went for a walk as we arrived mid morning before check in. It poured while we were out. Gene ensured we had access to our room when we got back even though it was still before 11. A 10 minute walk gets you to the start of the Waikiki shops. Bus tickets are $2.50 on TheBus and remain valid for 2 hours, the expiry time is at the top of the ticket. This gives enough time to go a few places if you quick.

This hotel is in an excellent location-13 mins walk to Ala Moana Mall, across the street from Hilton Beach, close to tons of dining and shopping options. The rooms are not large (this is Waikiki) but they are clean with good cable package (Disney, Nick, CN for those with kids!), free Wi-Fi, fridge, and microwave. There is coffee, water and tea in the lobby in the mornings, and parking is $20 if you join Wyndham Rewards. We got a great price through a Priceline Express deal, so were very pleased with the value and location of this hotel. The pool was always empty when we used, and pool deck is a good spot to have a snack at the tables.

This is a well located hotel,with a very friendly staff in all areas,it was clean,no complaints at all on that matter.Yes it's a little older but price and cleanliness go along way.Parking was provided for a price,internet worked great,and pool was very nice as well.I can only say for me," And I'm speaking on "one issue" that came up,bearing in mind, my wife and I were both exhausted from traveling 18+ hours from Canada" and that issue was a lack of carts for luggage.I borrowed a cart to take up our luggage to our room,and staff came looking for it shortly after we were in our room.I guess I never returned it in a prompt manner,I did not think it was a great deal of time maybe 10-15 mins... ,really,did I miss something,is there only one cart in that entire hotel for luggage?I borrowed it again when checking out and had to reassure the staff,"yes" I won't be long with the cart! In all my travel, I have never seen a hotel with only one cart available....Ok,I know it's a petty gripe,but it bothered me at the time.Overall it was a nice location,for us,I would not hesitate to stay there again,"get some extra carts OMG!" :) Oh yes definitely value for money!

Good Value Waikiki Hotel.Clean, comfortable, quiet, free internet use, free wifi in room, tv, microwave. We were on floor 14 and we didn't hear any traffic noise. (No beach views but beach is just a short walk from Hotel). Hotel is close to lots of eating places & also walking distance into Waikiki or Ala Moana Mall. We enjoyed our stay at Ramada Plaza, staff were pleasant & helpful (even happy to help out with little things you may have forgotten - eg: deodorant or toothbrush!) Shuttles are happy to pick you up from this hotel when taking a day trip to Pearl Harbour etc. I'd definitely stay here again as I felt it was value for money. I've stayed in lots of accom. around the world & couldn't fault this hotel for the price.

The Ramada Plaza hotel is an excellent choice for anyone who wants to stay somewhere out of the middle of the hustle and bustle of the centre of Waikiki but still wanting close proximity.Pool was nice, the room was clean, the bed was VERY comfortable and as advertised. The only issue I had was the fridge had a bit of a fit and stopped working. The front desk were helpful and sent someone up to fix it, it was fixed, and I lost a tub of ice cream in the process but it's not like I'm going to let a 2 dollar tub of ice cream ruin a hotel's reputation over something they couldn't control and fixed immediately.Would definitely recommend and would definitely stay again.

You are not quite in the action of Waikiki (a plus point for us) Rooms are spacious air conditioned,clean and well maintained quality furniture/ fittings.Its a quiet location with quiet guestsalthough there is a building site across the road there was no evening activity. Sadly we didnt have any cockroaches but maybe we'lll be lucky next time.Honolulu is in the tropics after all.I had a huge one move into my shoe overnight when we stayed on Christmas Island!Staff were friendly and helpful. The Wailana resturant/diner is recommended and about 150 yards away.One downside the coffee machine in the room takes about an hour to percoloate.There is free coffee in the lobby from 7pm onwards.Its much quicker to go downstairs and get a cup than wait for the in room machine.The Ramada is great value for money and has everything you would expect from a Ramada Plaza with very helpful staff and concierge services.

After staying right in the centre of Waikiki for a week, we decided to move out of the hustle & bustle for a few days & moved to Ramada Plaza, Ala Moana Blvd. ( ...BUT still staying within one mile of the action! ) Ramada Plaza outdid our expectations ... it was comfortable & clean, air conditioned - good size room, bath/shower, coffee facilities, refrigerator, microwave,big screen tv, free room wifi, table & chairs, room safe + the handy amenities of shampoo, shower cap etc! What really surprised me was the convenience of 24hr internet available on their two computers in the foyer (FREE!) .. (also with a printer attached for convenience) ... AND each morning they also had a great little breakfast table with coffee, tea & water available to all patrons (again in the foyer)The staff was courteous & helpful (including the lovely lady looking after the carpark!) The day before we left they decorated the foyer in beautiful Christmas decorations - we LOVED the fresh Christmas tree with a beach theme! I booked directly with the hotel and got a good rate! Would I recommend it to friends ??? Most definitely value for money!

Friendly Staff. Right in between the Waikiki main beach and the Ala Moana center. Many places to eat steps from the Hotel. Food Court in Ala Moana as well. Hilton is right across the street and can walk to the beach thru it. The hotel was clean.

I got the room through Priceline, and wasn't worried initially given my previous stays with other Ramada locations. The positives: Great location, low noise level (our room was not facing the main drag), comfortable bed, free wifi, room safeThe negative: not much of a view, we returned to our room at around 10 PM the second night to find a roach (big, and the kind that flies). After a few minutes of chase, we were able to kill it. See attached pics.We informed the receptionist the same night, and was offered a room change (it was too late to get housekeeping to spray the room). It was late, and we had our belongings were all over the room. That said, we opted to stay put (we were checking out the following morning). We also informed the day manager of our experience and showed him pictures. He made the same offers as the night receptionist (spray the room or change room). We were checking out in a few hours, so those options were not beneficial to us. I showed him the pictures again so he could see what we found, and then went back to the room.When we checked out, the day receptionist gave us a box of chocolate (according to her, it was a gift from the day manager to make up for the roach). She also apologized and said that roaches were common to Honolulu given its tropical conditions. I have been to Hawaii (Hawaii, Maui, Oahu, and Kauai) many times. This was the first time I encountered a roach in a hotel.

I have stayed in Ramada hotels in most of my visits and usually had good experience. But for this one, i think there are much better options available for the same price in honolulu wakiki beach area. This one feels more like a Super8 motel. Do your research before you book it.

The Ramada Plaza Waikiki is not a hotel that you would "ooh and aah" over because of decor or architecture, but it is well appointed, well maintained, clean, relatively inexpensive & well located. The Ramada Plaza is about a quarter mile from Waikiki Beach & there are a number of restaurants in easy walking distance. Rooms have new big screen tv's. A lot of rooms do not have an ocean view. Jasmine at Elite Concierge Services in their lobby was extremely helpful.
Room and location were good. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Room and bed were good. No restaurant on site, but several nearby.

for $94 a night the hotel is really nice, it could be a little bit outdated on the exterior but the room are stunning clean , modern bedding, spacious bathroom, safe, microwave . Internet works great!
Rooms were dark and with poor lighting and did not appear vey clean. no information about area especially in regards to delivery services

A bit dated but clean and tidy. Beds were very comfortable and gave us a choice of pillows.Staff were helpful and friendly. Location good. No restaurant and no room service so would not consider again for long stay, but one or 2 nights are fine. Had free wifi in the rooms which was great.The room was reasonably quiet, a little road noise. Had a great shower with fantastic pressure. Really enjoyed that.Would stay again for a short stay.

A solid property – nothing lavish but a very comfortable, clean, modernly appointed property, a very reasonable price point, and an outstanding general location. I was initially greeted by the parking lot attendant whose friendliness and helpfulness set the tone for my three day, two night stay. The front desk staff was very friendly, helpful, and efficient.Self-parking adds $20 per day to the rate, but there was always an attendant present whenever I went out there and I felt very comfortable with respect to personal security and the safety of my vehicle.The property is right across the street from the Hilton Hawaiian Village, endless shopping and dining venues, and the Waikiki beaches. The only comment with regard to location is a slight annoyance of reaching the beach by heading a block mauka (inland) to go makai (towards the sea) to get to the beach. This involves the pedestrian crossing light at the corner of Ala Moana Boulevard and Kalia Road, which may be the longest “Don’t Walk” in the history of pedestrian crossings. Otherwise, the beach is an easy six or seven minute walk away.No restaurant in the hotel, but they have some agreement for a discount for a place right next door. I didn't have occasion to eath there during my stay.
The hotel was across the street from HHV. Close to main street and easy to catch buses.No view, but we slept very soudly as our room was on an upper floor!!Good deal/ 2/3 the cost of other hotels.

Booked this hotel because it was inexpensive with a three+ rating and restaurant. It appeared older from the outside. Inside, the staff were helpful and courteous at all times. We used the bellhop to arrange shuttles and the concierge to book a trip to the big island and a helicopter tour. the beach was nearby and we could view a sliver out our 14th floor window. The view of the city with mountains in the background was nice. Plenty of food nearby and we were able to keep foods from the market in the fridge for microwaving later. Room was comfortable and clean with lots of TV channels.
Well located for a short walk to Ala Moana shopping centre, and close to the beach and lagoon at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Friendly staff, clean rooms. Reasonable value.
no feed back  the room was comfortable had a great sleep we would recommend this hotel staff was friendly good experience thank you would recommend this hotel to others in Canada thank you

very nice hotel. good value and centrally located. only 2 computers and a little slow, but ok. friendly staff and clean premises. could hear phone ringing alot in nxt room, had to keep the fan on. no restaurant in hotel.

The hotel is clean and close to lots. Right across the street from Hilton Hawaiian Village. Many places to shop and eat. Parking is convenient and the cost is ok if you join the Wyndam club at no cost. Saves 5 a night parking.

If you are looking for a nice, clean and well run hotel, this is it. It is an older hotel, but the rooms are quite comfortable and the staff is outstanding. Do not expect any bells or whistles, just a good place to clean up and sleep. Room was exceptionally quiet.
Friendly desk personnel, lovely spacious comfortable room with nice furnishings and a wonderfully comfy king size bed with 6! Pillows!!!

My girlfriend and I stayed here and the hotel is conveniently located and it's a good hotel for what we paid for, it's nothing amazing, the rooms are kind of small but clean and service was excellentParking at the hotel is expensive but expected, you save $5 per night if you are a Wyndham rewards member

We stayed 2 nights in August. All the staff very nice. The rooms clean & beds comfy. There was construction outside our balcony which was loud, but they started at a decent time so didn't wake us. Didn't like paying to park but at least knew the car was safe. No bar or restaurant, but lots of places within walking as well as to the beach. Would recommend this hotel.

An awesome stay with this hotel. Front desk staff super helpful and accommodating, let my party check in several hours earlier and held our bags while we took a tour of Oahu. Pool and Gym area is very nice. Room was very clean.

Overall - the hotel was very nice. The staff was friendly, helpful and professional. There was no in-house restaurant which did not pose a problem due to the fact there is an Asian restaurant within feet of the hotel’s front door. There is also an IHOP and several eateries within the first block. Also having complimentary coffee/tea available in the lobby was a nice touch.

Parking was limited and hard to find but once you found it, you were good to go. The outside attendants watching the cars were SUPER friendly. So much so that we wanted to take a picture with them but totally forgot to do it. Walkable

Well priced hotel with everything you need in a great, central location. We did our own thing on arrival but would have appreciated an offer of some assistance/guidance from the concierge staff. We were left to our own devices to scour through the brochure collection for tourist things to do. Our room was neat and clean. Perhaps a little tired and outdated (and we missed having a balcony), but all in all a great base/bed for us to explore the city. Loved the outdoor pool on level 2!
Clean rooms in good location. Could hear street noise on 11th floor, need to insulate the windows. Would stay again.
Stay at the Ramada was quite nice. Bed was comfortable, room was clean and well equipped. Nice gym. Pool a bit to close to roadside so noisy traffic. Overall stay was pleasant.

Overall, this is a good, no frills hotel in Waikiki with comfortable beds and clean bathroom for those travelers looking for a good value.This is a good place to stay in Waikiki if you want to stay right across the Hilton Hawaiian Village and enjoy the amenities and shops at a fraction of the cost. You will have to pay for parking if you rent a car. Waikiki is like any major tourist areas (SF,NY) where there's no such thing as free parking.We spent most of our time away from the hotel so all we need is a comfortable bed and a clean bathroom which this hotel met our needs. If you are looking for a place to be pampered, this is not it. The hotel does have a small fitness center and pool which is decent if you want to take a break from the beach. There's only coffee, tea, or iced water in the morning in the lobby.We stayed for 10 days and noticed that there were many airline staff staying at the hotel. It was generally quiet during our stay. The hotel staff were nice and helpful.

Pretty good hotel with all the needed amenities. Great location with everything you need being within very close proximity.Makes a great starting point for walking out and exploring what the area has to offer.Plenty of food offerings in close proximity, and the beach a very short walk.
Place is very clean and good located!! Across the street from Hilton Village! The only thing missing was a breakfast!!

We picked this hotel for our very first trip to Hawaii. We had considered other places but the location and free Wifi of this place won us out. On arrival, we found the location of this place as good as we expected as it was only a short walk to the beach and a short bus ride (or longer walk) to the nearby Ala Moana Center. Our rooms were decent but the Wifi was spotty. Fortunately, there were quite a few access points and even though we couldn't reliably connect to the access point of our floor, we could always pick a floor above or below us.

We have been a great fan of this hotel since we found it as the original Holiday Inn Waikiki Hotel. We have found the hotel to be very well kept, clean, and conveniently located away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. The staff has always been friendly and parking although paid, has been very convenient and reasonable for Waikiki. Would recommend highly.

I will try to keep this one short...Pros:CheapDecent location (still actually in Waikiki)Has a poolCons:Poor servicePaid parking (even though I was told it would be free before I booked)Free Wifi barely workedRooms were uglyVery LOUD (there was major construction going on right behind the hotel)

We had a very good stay at the Ramada. It's centrally located and just a short walk away from everything. The room was very nice and clean and the people at reception very helpfull. The free wifi is a bonus. It's very good value for Waikiki and I would definitly stay again!
great hotel had the penthouse suite great city view friendly and helpful staff.booked tours with desk
Reservations & front desk staff great! Found bedbugs in the room. Restaurant service terrible.

We got in late about..11:30 and was upgraded from a regular room we had prepaid to a suit on the 22nd floor at no additional charge. We were unaware of the change until we saw the room. I don't know the reason and didn't ask, but I couldn't have been more pleased. Maybe they had sold out of the rooms we reserved? This hotel is in the perfect location (waking distance) for everything in the main part of the city. They also provided a great free breakfast. Also one block form the 16th street mall. I highly recommend it.

This was a great spot to stay. Away from the craziness on the main strip but close to everything you need. The staff were pleasant and helpful and Mary out in the parking was a total gem always a smile on her face and a good morning. The room was clean and well kept. They were doing touch ups to other rooms on our floor while we were there which is always nice to see. Overall it's a great spot.

Great location if you don't want to be in the middle of the busy and noisy beach/shopping scene and great if you do not have a car. It was more relaxing staying in a smaller hotel compared to the larger ones in the area.
couldn't ask for more in a hotel. So close to the beach and everything! friendly helpful staff

The only thing this place has going for it is its location. I had to request my room be moved due to some god awful smell. The next room wasn't that much better. This place badly needs a renovation. The carpets stink, the curtains are frayed. The bedding is old and tired. Hard as a rock too. If I hadn't used Priceline and been assigned this hotel .... I'd leave. We are here now and I want out of here but everything else tonight is too expensive and I won't get my money back if i do leave. There is construction noise outside as well. I don't even want to sleep in this bed. Run. Don't ever book this place and compromise.... Spend more. Stay somewhere else.

For the $ this room was a great value. It was remarkably clean and very quiet - even though on a very busy road. The location to beach, Marina, Ala Moana Center and ABC Store made it super convenient for us. The $20 parking fee was a bit steep per day - but parking in general in the area is a problem. In the end, we probably did not need the car as most everything was within walking distance and the traffic is no fun in this area. The pool was very small but adequate we only used it end-day for a quick cool off. The laundry room was terrific as we brought our own beach towels and they were pretty sandy and nasty at the end of each beach day. The front desk was adequate we really did not need too much interaction with them. I did want to upgrade to a balcony but decided the price was not worth it as the baloncy room available looked out over a construction site and parking lot. We were not really in the room much - only to crash at the end of very busy active days. We don't normally stay at Ramadas but got this one via PriceLine and in the end, it worked out perfectly. Plenty of places nearby to walk to for dinner but most nights were were so wiped from being in the sea all day that we got take-away from some awesome ethnic restaurants or salads from ABC store. Our only complaint was the safe in room #901 did not work very well - it took a million tries each day to get it locked. But - we were too busy to bother to move rooms so just dealt with it and allowed extra time before we left the room for the day. I'd definitely stay here again in Waikiki and next time, forget the rental car. The bus service and trolleys come by every 2 minutes so that would have been the better choice than the car.

Stayed here as I was attending a conference. For me it was a little far to walk to the Hawaiian Village and other places. You have to walk to the corner and then cross over. At the age of 60+ I really didn't like doing that. I recall the hotel as being certainly adequate and clean and the bed comfortable. I did have some trouble with the WiFi as it kept going in and out. Anyway, it was a place to stay and by the time I booked, was the last place available. It doesn't have all the amenities that other places on Waikiki have and is not on the beach side which was annoying. I don't recall how much I paid but I have to say it was a disappointment when I saw the hotels where other members of my association were staying for a little more money. Sigh. It did have a little frig and service was prompt and friendly.

This hotel is within walking distance to everything you need in Waikiki, including the beach. You don't need to rent a car if you stay at this hotel and plan on spending your time in downtown Waikiki, but if you do rent a car you will have to pay a $25/night parking fee. The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. The beds were comfortable, air conditioning worked perfectly and the whole room was clean. It is an older hotel but still in good shape overall. I will stay here again, primarily for the close proximity to the beach and shopping.

Our room was clean and comfortable, the staff was helpful and friendly, and the price was affordable. It's directly across the street from the Hilton Hawaiian Village (at double the cost) and convenient to public transportation.

This hotel is very convenient and very accomodating. When I checked in and the air conditioner was not working, they promptly found another room for me and graciously moved all the luggage. The hotel is situated two blocks from the famous Waikiki beaches, and one block from the fireworks which are free every Friday.No spa or breakfast included as part of the room rate, though there is morning Kona coffee available.The hotel has an IHOP just around the corner as well as a local breakfast place. There are numerous fast food and dine in restaurants within 1 block.The hotel is on a bus route and this makes it extremely easy to get around the hot spots very efficiently.

For a first-timer to Oahu, this was a great hotel and the price was very good. It is located very close to Waikiki beach, shopping, and the Ala Maona center. There are also bus stops located nearby to go to Diamond Head, or other parts of Oahu. It is right across the street from the Hilton, so you can make use of the bus depot there for all your booked tour needs. The room was clean, spacious, and well lit. Overall, a good experience and saved a ton of money staying here vs. some of the more expensive Waikiki hotels.

Staff was very nice and helpful, even the cleaning staff would greet you in the hall. Room was not very big but was fine for just two of us. Beds were comfortable. Our room had a fridge and a microwave. My understanding is not all rooms have microwaves. Bathroom was not very big, but water pressure was good and towels were decent. Flat screen TV with an OK selection of channels. WiFi was excellent. The router was in the room so if you had a problem you could reboot it without having to call someone. Only had to do this the first night then it worked fine the rest of the week. Our room faced Ala Moana on the 12th floor had just a little bit of road noise. Never heard anything from the other rooms.

Recently (May 2013) stayed at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki we found it clean and comfortable. Only a small hotel so no restaurants but you could get free coffee, tea & water in the Foyer until 1000 hrs. Also fresh coffee maker in the room. WiFi was free , staff very pleasant a good concierge service in reception. Our onward flight to Seattle was not until 2330 hrs so the reception looked after our luggage so that we could enjoy a full day in the resort.

We recently spend one week at Ramada Plaza Waikiki. For Waikiki standards, it´s a quite small hotel, there are 16 floors. It´s a very clean hotel. I liked the decor with typical Hawaiian patterns. There is a small pool (we didn´t use it), coin-operated washing machine, ice machine and a gift shop. WLAN is free and you can use PCs and a printer free of charge. The hotel doesn´t offer breakfast. There is free coffee - or rather: there should be free coffee in the morning, because most the time it was empty. We arrived early and were able to check in immediately to our standard room (without balcony) on the 11th floor. Our room was really nice: two very comfy double beds, two armchairs, large TV, microwave, coffee machine, fridge and a free safe. Wardrobe space is quite limited. The bathroom was average-sized with a very good showers. Toileteries and a hairdryer are provided. Beach towels can be borrowed at the reception.Room and bathroom were very clean and furnished to a good standard with Hawaiian decors. However, it´s a rather a city hotel room than a beach hotel room (I think this is what "Ramada PLAZA" is about...). Location of the hotel is very good. To the beach or to Duke Kahanamoku Lagoon, it´s best to go through Hilton Village, it´s a ten minute walk. It´s about 12 mins to go to Ala Moana Shopping Center (highly recommended!). The center of Waikiki (Waikiki Beach and Kalakaua Avenue) is about 20 mins. What we liked best about the hotel was the staff! Everyone was so friendly and helpful. Reception staff and the concierge were very competent to answer our questions about Oahu.

This Ramada was very accomodating. The location was great and close to a lot of things including the mall (Ala Moana Center with a great food court) and beach which were walking distance. The staff was very knowledgeable about the Honolulu area. It was our first time in Hawaii and the front desk could tell us which number bus to take to get to our destinations. The rooms were clean, air conditioning worked fine. The only reason I didn't give it a perfect score was because there was construction going on right outside our window. It had nothing to do with the hotel but I wish we would have been warned so I would not have been jolted out of my sleep. Otherwise, it was great!

Our return flight did not leave until 10 at night and the staff was very helpful with keeping our luggage until early evening and helping us plan our day when everything we wanted to see was closed on Sunday. Also the lack of heavy perfume cleaning products made it a great place to stay with our allergies.
I do not have any additional comments other than having a restaurant within the hotel. Staff was cordial

This hotel was exactly as advertised: clean and well located. While it does not have he amenities of the Hilton, it is perfect for those who want o experience Waikiki without the excessive cost. The service was very good and, again, the hotel was exceptionally clean.

I found hair on the hair dryer and on the bathroom floor,room was dark,and it looked like it was remodeled 15 years ago,price was pretty good but they made me pay 25 dollars per day just so I can park my car on their parking lot!ridiculous!

Staff members were very friendly, responsive, and helpful. Didn't spend much time in the room but it was clean and well appointed. Good location for my business needs (short walk to the Convention Center).

If you're looking for a clean and comfortable place to stay while touring around Hawaii I highly recommend this hotel. Starting with the room -- it was clean, comfortable and had all the necessary amenities. There was plenty of closet and drawer space, comfortable seating available, a desk, coffee maker, microwave, refrigerator, ice bucket and blow dryer. The decor was pleasant enough as well. We used the pool once and that was nice too. It seems to be shaded much of the time, but is not too crowded. There was also coffee available in the lobby each morning.The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful and take good care of guests. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived, but they worked quickly to prepare it. We came at the end of a HUGE conference and all of the hotels in the area were scrambling.The beach is about a five minute walk. The closest beach is at the Hilton Hawaiian Village -- it's right across the street and their beach is one of the nicest in Waikiki. There are plenty of options for food right around the hotel. The Ala Moana Shopping Center is an easy walk with more food options and a Foodland Grocery Store that is really nice and has takeout food too. If you don't rent a car, many buses to anywhere on the island stop at Ala Moana so you can get around easily for sightseeing from there. You can also walk to most places around Waikiki -- including the International Market and the Convention Center is also within walking distance.Parking is cheaper if you are a Wyndham rewards member, so if you are renting a car I recommend that you join (free) before staying there. If we return to Honolulu, we plan to stay here again because it was comfortable, nice, and met all of our needs. No complaints at all.

Very nice lobby, quite pool, large rooms, convenient position. Great confortable bed, clean, but the reception staff were not helpful and not very good. Free internet in the lobby. Really very good price/quality.

Our Big Island Softball Team needed a reasonable place to stay on Oahu that will allow for access to different venues while accommodating different income levels. Right across from the HIlton, it is a relatively small place that is clean and quiet. Nice pool, microwave, refrigerator and nice tv system. Easy access to internet, including business area in the lobby area. Staff were courteous and helpful. Parking was fine and priced per usual Waikiki prices. Beach access right through the upscale busy Hilton. The buffet below the restaurant was not any more pricey than most and one meal there a day was a way to get your calories. Food was primarily Chinese, but very good except for the rubber chicken
We check out Aug 7. But Deposits $100 do not refund yet. I would like to receive deposits $100. Could you refund it now. Except it, everything is excellent. Thank you.
A descent hotel about a block from the beach. No restaurant or bar but many within walking distance.
The room was kind of dingy and dark. The wireless didn't work until I figured out that the modem wasn't even plugged in! Definitely not one of the better properties on Waikiki.
Nice place. Convenient. Very, very helpful staff. No muss, no fuss - I could get up and out and go work or play for the day, then when I came back I could relax. What more could you want?

If you are looking for a hotel at a good price for the location, the Ramada Plaza is it. It’s an easy walk to the Ala Moana Shopping Center in one direction and Waikiki in the other. With the Hilton Hawai’ian Village directly across the street, there are plenty of shops, restaurants, and there’s beach access. One of the best parts of staying here is the staff. The staff at the desk are professional, helpful, efficient, and friendly. And, in all of our travels, we have never encountered such cheerful cleaning staff. The free wifi is great, and there is a laundry room for guests, which is a bonus. Some things that were less than optimal: the water in our room was not hot enough; the shower was tepid at best. We mentioned this at the front desk and they said they’d try to fix it but it still wasn’t hot. Also, we would have liked some materials/brochures in our room to see what was available to see/do. However, the most major downside for us – and this was not the fault of the hotel – was that we were on the side of the hotel facing a construction site. The noise from that (trucks, clanking materials, beeping from backing up) started at 7am every day except Sunday. If you are planning to stay here while the construction is going on, make sure you ask to be on the side of the hotel away from the it. Overall, if you want a luxury hotel, this is not the place for you. If you want to save on accommodation for activities, etc., then you should consider staying here. We’d actually give it a 3.5 rating if that were available.

Affordable hotel for family vacation. Staff very friendly and helpful. Construction noise from across the way, not Ramadas fault. I wish the bathroom exhaust fan was working because it got really stuffy after a shower. Very clean.
Nice and Friendly hotel, nice staff. Rooms were clean. Small swimmingpool and a free Fitness room were available. No restaurant in the hotel but, every room had a microwave and a refrigirator.
We had a very enjoyable stay at the Ramada Waikiki , clean room, good personal service and very informative and kind treatment of us while there.
We had a great stay in Honolulu. The room more then met our expectations and the staff super friendly.

Cheaper than a lot of hotels in the same area and just as nice rooms. No Ocean views, parking and enterance is off of a back street. But, for the price it is a very nice place to stay. The location is great, across from the Hawaiian village, next door to Aqua Palms.
The Health Center needs attention. It needs two or more Treadmills, the reclining cycle had no power connection and the room need some air movement.

We arrived late at night to be greeted pleasantly by the receptionist, who quickly and efficiently checked us with no hassle and a smile.The hotel itself is not on the main "strip". This was a 10 - 15 minutes walk away where you can find all the designer shops, bars and restaurants. This suited us because the hotel and area surrounding was much quieter with less hustle and bustle.Our rooms were on the 11th floor which was designated no smoking as requested. The room was large,spacious very clean and comfortable.and had a king size bed. Also there was a microwave, a safe, a coffee machine and a small fridge.The room has a very good air conditioning unit which can be easily, manually, adjusted to suit yourself. We also had FREE Wi-Fi in the room which also had a cable for connection to a laptop. Free Wi-Fi is available throughout the hotel and there is a computer in the lobby which is free to use.The hotel itself had a nice lobby with an information desk where you could book all of your tours. We booked two trips from here, ( Paradise Cove Lu'au and North Shore half day tour), as prices generally appear to be the same everywhere. In respect of Pearl Harbour, don't book a tour, it is much cheaper to get the local city bus for $2.50 and pay for the individual parts of the site that you want to visit. Free coffee and water was available early morning until around lunchtime.There was a pool and laundry room on the second floor. The pool had a few sun loungers and some tables and chairs. This area was never really busy whilst we were there which meant that the loungers and chairs were readily available. Pool towels were also provided at the pool side. The pool area was only in the sunshine for a few hours each day basically from mid morning to mid afternoon. Also near the pool is the small gym which we didn't use so I cannot comment on the facilities.The hotel does not have a bar or a restaurant although there are any number in the local vicinity.The closest beach to the hotel was accessible by cutting through the grounds of the Hilton Hawaii Village hotel directly across the road. This lovely beach was much quieter than the main Waikiki beach a further 10 -15 minutes walk away. It also had toilet facilities and a shower point.Overall a very pleasant stay and a pleasant mid range hotel. The hotel is ideal if you, like us, are travelling to Hawaii to see the sights and not the inside of a hotel room. We would definitely use this hotel again as a base for seeing all that Hawaii has to offer.

We stayed here for three days before heading to Kauai. Hotel was clean and well kept and in a great location. No frills to this place but it was exactly what we needed and at a great price considering the area. We were super close to Waikiki Beach and great shopping areas. Got to enjoy the Hilton's fireworks show on Friday and had fun wandering through the International Market Place, which in our opinion was much better than the Ala Moana shopping area, which is just a mall, a big mall yes but we can go to malls back home.

The staff at the Ramada Waikiki were extremely accomodating during my recent one week stay in Honolulu due to a family medical emergency. I was booked for four nights and requested an additional four more nights, but was told they were booked. When I explained my circumstances, the staff made every effort to see what could be done. They came through by keeping me in the same room and providing the additional days, though they were truly crunched with a fully booked hotel during the requested additional days. Thank you so much in making my stay as stress-free as possible.

Great proximity to the beach, directly across from the Hilton Hawaiian Village which has food and shops. Just about a 15-20 min walk to Duke's Restaurant and the International Market. Very affordable, tentative service, and a great location!
Very clean hotel. Only 15 min walk to Waikiki. Staffs are very friendly. definitely will go back there.

If you are not going to spend a lot of time in your room and are looking for a place to sleep at night and get a good deal on the room I'd recommend it. The staff was very friendly and the location was great. The room was a basic hotel room but middle of the road than some of the properties we have stayed at in the same area.
