Having once lived in Honolulu, we knew the location and knew it was a central location for being able to go to Waikiki but also being able to get out of Waikiki without much hassle of traffic. The location allows you to get to Ala Moana Shopping center quickly and you are not far from Ft DeRussy side of Waikiki or Ala Moana beaches which is less crowed than the normal strip of sand most tourists go to.

The property is just as we expected. Nothing very fancy, but clean rooms and clean building. Their was a slight smell in our hallway, and it was a little warm, but was rarley an issue. We received a nice honeymoon gift from the staff, and was very thankful for it. Front desk staff was very proffesional and helpful.

There's nothing particularly bad about this hotel but then there's nothing particularly memorable about it either. It's pleasantly average. Now I must say that the staff is above average. The several that I encountered and talked with were all quite friendly and helpful. It's nice to always be greeted with a smile no matter what time of day. The property seems to be on the older side. The room was small for three people to be in there. The double beds appeared to be on the smaller side as well. The bathroom was kind small too. But my mother did appreciate the microwave and mini-fridge. I got the hotel for a good price compared to the price of comparable hotels. I will admit that, next time, I would probably pay a little more to book a different place. I've seen rankings of three stars for this hotel on some travel sites. I disagree with that; 2.5 at the most.

This hotel needs some money put into it. The rooms are small and the bathrooms are tiny. The doors are from Elvis' time. The staff is very nice. I wouldn't stay here again. Spend a few dollars more and get a more updated room.

We stayed here both before and after our North Shore stay. Very nice for the money and within walking distance to everything you could want. The staff was very nice and helpful. The bus stop is right in front of the hotel that will take you anywhere you want to visit. This hotel is also right across the street from the Hilton which has a nice beach and many great places to eat and shop.
Ramada Honolulu was comfortable and well suited for our family needs. We had a quick lay over for a few hours overnight and it was a very convenient in location and cost.

Our stay at the Ramada Plaza was a pleasant experience. Room was comfortable and spotless. Parking is a bit high but parking in Honolulu is at a premium. As stated in other reviews, if you sign up for Wyndham Rewards, you save $5 a day off the parking price.Desk staff very helpful as well as cleaning crew. The restaurant which is actually right OUTSIDE the front of the hotel is called Wok-kiki. Breakfast buffets were $8.75 which incl tax/tip. American food is served along with oriental. Plenty of it&good. We also ate an oriental dinner buffet which was very tasty. There's 24hr diner a few steps away from Ramada too, or several chain restaurants just down the street. You can walk easily to the beach area in front of the Hilton Complex, watch sunset,swim, stroll or visit the Dairy Queen!!
A young man help me to resolve the problem of light switch inside my rental car. I am very appreciate his assistance. However, the air condition of room 1005 seems out of order.
This was the third time we have stayed at the Ramada Hotel.. Each stay has been enjoyable.. We will be back again..
Staff was helpful. Was worth the money to park locally. Make sure to sign up for rewards program to save $5 a day.

This was our third time staying at the Ramada. We booked the Junior Suite with King bed -1709- it was very affordable at US200 per night. This room is on the top floor and has a kitchenette, large couch, two aircon units and wraparound lanai. It was definitely worth the extra money for more room space and to sit on our balcony with drinks and get ocean glimpses at sunset! It was great to be able to check in at 11am, as the room was empty the night before. Each day we received two bottles of water and we also had a yummy box of choc macs with a card as a welcome gift. The staff were friendly and polite during our entire stay. Our only gripe was that the mini fridge was super noisy. Hopefully this may be replaced with a quieter model! Overall we really enjoyed our stay and would gladly return to the Ramada on future holidays.

We stayed for a week at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki and enjoyed our time there. Rooms were adequate and the beds were very comfortable. Service was excellent. The concierge was extremely helpful with local information re. beaches etc. Front desk staff very pleasant and always helpful. Rooms were cleaned promptly each day.The placement of laundry room right by the pool was the best decision ever! We had a deal with buffet breakfast included at the "Wok Kiki Chinese Buffet" downstairs -- not fantastic by any means, but if you could overlook the not so clean silverware and other blatant food handling violations, the eggs, pancakes and sausage were a satisfactory start to the day. If you like Chinese food for breakfast then you would be in for a real treat. :)

Shocked at the state of the Ramada Honolulu - both in the general state of the hotel and it's comparison with all the other hotels in the area , Hotel badly in need of refurbishment, We made the best of it but would certainly not recommend it to anyone else. One plus staff were very good and very helpful
The room is good. The discount price is excellent. Sleep quite well. The front desk also provides good services. I will come bak next time

They charge you extra parking fee $25 per day. the hotel restaurant doesn't exist. The hotel ask me to have breakfast outside restaurant connected to the hotel on the first floor. Only chinese food.They charge you $7 per person.I arrived at 9 am with two kids and wife on the red eye flight. they give you room after 3 pm. regardless of your situation.The hotel is not closed to Waikiki beach. if they say 5mins by walk, it is 15~20mins walk.Also A/C creates really bad unpleasant odor and noisy sound in the whole night. if you ask Reception twice about the same thing, they answer you in cold voice.considering all those expenses, and unkindness, I recommend you to look for other accomodation.I am a traveler. I traveled almost 55 countries. so you can judge my opinion.

We enjoyed our stay here! The king room we had was spacious, clean and everything was working properly. Housekeeping was prompt which was great cuz. we have a 2 yr old who needed to take naps and by the time we got back at 2pm, the room was already made up. Hotel was a little far from the heart of waikiki but we loved that it was near the Hilton lagoon which wasn't as crowded.
it is s nice place to stay if you are just looking for a bed. the parking is way to much. but in waikiki parking is at a premium. rooms are clean and staff is friendly.

The hotel is a little tired and needs some improvement. The foyer is quite impressive for a small hotel but the staff at the front desk need a lesson in customer relations. Our room on the 12 floor overlooked a building site but that is about par when we pay middle of the range prices. None of the rooms sport an ocean view. Our room was quite spacey with a big comfortable king size bed, flat screen TV, A/C, work desk and relaxation chair. There is also a safe, bar fridge and microwave and the free WIFI is a bonus. The coffee making facilities are poor and there are no glasses or spoons, only paper cups. So if you want to enjoy a wine or stir your coffee, bad luck. On the positive side the beach is only a 10 minute walk through the Hilton across the road and the Ala Moana shopping centre is a 15 minute walk. Also, there are no bed bugs and the room was very clean. On the negative side: 1. The included breakfast is disgusting. The restaurant is located at the front of the building and is semi detached. No cereals, no milk, no juice, no bacon. Caters only for Asians and there is the ever present smell of cabbage and sewage; 2. The congregation of smoking people outside the front door. They position themselves 24 hours a day between the restaurant and the front door and one must run the gauntlet.All in all we found the hotel okay. If you want this location (half way between Ala Moana and Waikiki proper) you will be satisfied. But if you want an edible breakfast and/or water views forget it.
We appreciated the friendly and courteous staff, the room was in excellent condition. Our only complaint was that the property is not well marked at all and very difficult to find regardless of gps.
This is a very clean and updated hotel. We did miss the usual complimentary breakfast. However there is a very good 24 hour cafe less than a block away.

The Ramada is close to any activity a couple or family would want or a short drive to many other activities. The beach is just a few short blocks away and a nice shopping center. The Ramada is a very clean well kept property with a relaxing pool area. The water was a little cool for our taste but pleasant. We could not get connected with out iPads and called the desk but still could not. There was no food offered and the coffee and tea were out for a limited time only.

Close to attractions. Very clean, comfortable, and friendly staff. There was a door man and a concierge to help us book sight seeing trips.The room was a nice size and the mattress was comfortable. We had asked for a nice view and did have a partial view of the ocean from our top floor room. There are several public transportation options very close by. Walking distance to great beaches, restaurants etc.

When a room change was requested the staff (Margaret) was very helpful and pleasant. Everything was taken care of by the time I returned from work. Convenient location for business, avoiding the worst of the Waikiki traffic.

My husband and I stayed for over a week at the plaza. The front desk staff, concierge, parking lot staff, and cleaning staff were always helpful. The room was clean when we arrived. The use of both a fridge and microwave in the room made the stay really beneficial. We were less than a five minute walk from the beach, but the price was significantly less than the hotels on the beach. This place was definitely a quality pick.
I loved my stay in Honolulu. Everyone was very pleasant. The room was comfortable, with Wi-Fi access... Loved it !!!

This was my second stay here within a few weeks. The staff is very friendly and always willing to address any concerns I may have had. Of course, there are other hotels that was a bit cheaper, but I enjoyed this smaller hotel away from all the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, but still in walking distance of the beach. I must say I was born and raised here in Hawaii, but moved to the continential US in 1989, so going home is always a pleasure for me and apparently I still look like a very local girl so I am addressed that way from the locals. My disappointed is the parking lot, a bit small and not enough stalls, otherwise a great place to stay!!!

Second time here and no real complaints. Housekeeping was superb and my room was cleaned meticulously every day and restocked with amenities. Refrigerator, microwave and especially the in-room safe are really appreciated. Most staff are nice and helpful and the location, while not in the very center of Waikiki, is adequate. The bus stops right in front going towards Ala Moana although bus service seems to be going downhill nowadays - obviously not the hotel's fault. Parking is easy as there's an open lot and you just display a sticker on your dashboard and park your own car whenever you care too. The lobby is still way too cold, especially near the elevators, but I guess the hotel gets free electricity or something. Nevertheless, if you're looking for a clean, decent and good value property, you won't be disappointed here.
This resort was very friendly and helpful in every way. We were only here for one night but they made it great.
Great value considering it's Honolulu. Many small conveniences that you pay for elsewhere were free.

Compared to many hotels in the area, the Ramada Plaza was a good priced hotel. It was clean and reasonably sized for three of us. It had a fridge and the free wifi was a bonus. The concierge staff were really helpful when we had a problem with a tour we had pre-booked before the trip. The hotel is ideally located between Waikiki centre/beach and the Ala Moana shopping mall. They are all in walking distance or you can get the pink line tourist trolley.

We stayed here on April 23rd and 24th. We had a great stay. Very comfortable bed. Very spacious room and comfortable furniture. We had tickets for breakfast at the corner Asian restaurant. Good food, but very slanted to the Asian crowds bused in. My wife had left her camera bag in the lobby when we left on a tour. Fortunately a quick call located it and they had it behind the desk when we returned late in the day. Kudos to the staff for saving our vacation as my wife's wallet was in that bag! We will definitely return.

I found a great deal on plane tickets, so I decided to work the week in Hawaii. I saw a few other hotels a bit cheaper, but they had many complaints about internet connectivity, so I chose the Ramada. Could not have been happier.

I have stayed here multiple times. If you are an avid traveler like me, you always do the "bed check" to make sure there aren't any unwanted visitors. Best thing ever? They have a heavy-duty mattress cover over the bed that couldn't let an atomic bomb in or out! Yahoo, I was destined to have a good-no, great, sleep! The mattress and pillows left me wanting to sleep until check out. I didn't actually leave the room till checkout, since I was so comfortable. The price is a little high and the rooms are tight, but the good news is that they offer a mini fridge so you can save money on eating out, an ABC store a block away (as well as McDonald's, Subway, Outback Steakhouse, IHOP, etc). Waikiki beach is across the road through another hotel's lobby, and the harbor is close, too.Another good thing? There is a place that offers discount hotel rooms in Hawaii and you can often get this Ramada hotel at up to half off ! That's what I usually do.Oh, and did I mention they have a pool and exercise room? They also offer to call airport shuttles, and keep you luggage so you can return to the beach if you have a late flight back home!

The hotel is situated at one end of Waikiki beach with fairly easy access via the Hilton Hawaiian Village to the beach. It odesn't provide meals but we were given breakfast tickets for the Asian cafe around the corner - the food was OK if more to Asian than European taste for breakfast. The rooms are spacious and clean but the experience was badly affected by building work nearby which started at 7am and lasted until 5-30 pm - loud banging of pile-drivers etc that encouraged you to vacate the room as soon as possible. Having said that, the hotel is reasonably priced in an expensive area.

Our experience was good at this Hotel, for the price that we paid. We did not eat at the Hotel, because we found a great Bar just down the street (go left to the main corner) w/good food and and happy hour drinks. It only took about 15 minutes to get to the beach and all the shops. The staff were all friendly and our room was clean, with a mini fridge, and coffe maker, and fairly quite, despite being located on a main street.

The people who gave this hotel good reviews must be use to staying in a motel 6. Location as crappy. Worst area in Waikiki. No amenities except a subpar gym with a treadmill that sounds like a freight train. The hallways were dirty and hot. Rooms were fairly clean and the AC worked. That's about the only thing positive. Toilet didn't flush right. Interior of rooms looked like they were last updated in 1960. No bar, no restaurant. Outside the front of the hotel smelled like a bad sewer. Clean towels had hair on them. They had a little gift shop which was either closed or the lady running it was eating her lunch and didn't want to be bothered. Very disappointed in this place.
My husband and I stayed here for one night before we heded up to the North Shore. The propety was a short walk to Waikiki Beach. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Friendly atmosphere. Easy bus transportation to all that Honolulu has to offer. Rooms were good and always clean. Swimming pool was enjoyable. Staff were accommodating for late checkout. Price was fair. We will probably use this hotel on our next trip to Hawaii.
The hotel was located just where we needed one. I feel it could have been cleaner and friendlier. I do think the parking cost was too much.

Loved staying here!! Small hotel with great service...concierge was very helpful also. Much less expensive than the big hotels. Did not spend much time in the hotel anyway, and with the money saved we were able to do more activities. Rooms were very quiet so we were well rested each night. Loved that it was not in the heart of Waikiki. It is away from all the crowds and noise. Overall great stay here.

The Staff was very friendly and helpful, very clean & the fastest elevators I've ever seen, the staff was also nice enough to let us use their beach mats and bogie boards. We also got a discount for the parking which I thought was very fair. ( something We of course asked for )

Great location, very friendly staff, complimentary coffee/tea in the morning, air conditioner noisy though and construction occurring on lot outside but that was okay since I had to get up early anyway.

We have been already twice to Honolulu. Therefore a hotel directly at aWaikiki was not that important at this time. We choose the Ramada, because of its better price than beach front hotels and its location between the beach and the Ala Moana shopping centre, which worked out very well (both beach and shopping (which is fantastic) are about 15 min of slow walk away). Our room on the upper floor was standard ( why it is called penthouse is beyond our understanding) and it had a nice smallish balcony. Maybe the best of the hotel is the Chinese buffet on the premises on the ground floor (it does not belong to the hotel) which serves fantastic, fresh and cheap food for dinner and lunch (and breakfast?) - we ate there twice an loved it both times. The staff of the reception of the hotel is typical American for basic chain hotels - when checking in they are professional but after that no more eye contact during your stay which is okay for that price. The service people on our floor were very friendly, though.

Average hotel..rooms were spacious on the top floor. Parking was an issue, both the fees and lack of convenient parking. No convenient facilities at poolside for changing, Location was great but crossing the street required walking to the next block and waiting on the crosswalk (4.5 minutes wait) to cross. Made bus service difficult because you had to cross the street and go down a side street to catch the bus. Very busy street. Lanai was dirty, maid kept shutting off air so room was very hot and stuffy upon return each day. Room was pricey for location and fact there was no decent dining room unless you wanted to walk down the street. Oriental food fare downstairs did not look aopealing.
Great value. Great location. Nice and very accommodating staff. Close to the beach. Right in downtown Waikiki near stores, shops, and restaurants.

Unfortunately the bathroom shower tub is blocked when we showed, it needs some plumbing work. The window is not sound proof as it has a gapBetween windows. Air conditioner is noisy and stops all the time so our room is always very warm. The door man was quite funny as he refused to book a taxi we specially requested in advance for the next day for our flight departure to the airport the next day. Not as good as seen on the hotel description.

I stayed at the Ramada Plaza for a short conference. The student rate made this hotel an attractive choice and the accommodations were perfect for my (relatively mild) expectations. The room was clean and simple with a nice size TV. I found the hotel quiet (i.e., no little kids running around) and it was very conducive to in-room work after a day at the conference. The staff (especially the custodial staff) were always friendly and accommodating. I would absolutely stay here again, even if there was no conference to attend! If you do have a conference at the Hawaiian Convention Center give this hotel some serious consideration!
I was expecting more from this hotel. We were on the 16th floor and it smelled like body odor. This place is badly in need of renovations.

Had a great stay for business and for pleasure. The location was convenient to both the convention center and the beaches although the view from the room was blocked by other hotels. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful and happy to answer any of my questions. The bus stops right in front of the hotel if you want to travel around the island or if you rent a car they have parking.
The hotel is very clean and quite. it felt very welcoming and friendly treat.i would love to see having breakfast and parking free for guests.

We had an overnight in Honolulu before taking an inter-island flight. We decided not to stay at an airport hotel after hearing that the airport hotels are pretty disgusting and cost way too much for what you get. We booked the ramada plaza in waikiki on priceline and got a good rate. We were impressed with the lobby and overall first impression of the hotel. However, when we arrived in our room we were greeted by a cockroach crawling on the wall behind the bed. YUCK. We spent a restless 6 hours in our room, as we checked in at 12am and left by 6am for the airport. I would not stay here again.
The staff was extremely nice and friendly. It is an older hotel but very clean and comfortable. We would stay there again if we had a few days in Waikiki.
Very good hotel and in excellent location. It is very clean, very good staff, and wi-fi problematic.
The hotel is nice at whole. But the parking isn't cheap. Moreover the service of staff is poor. But the wifi is very nice.

The hotel is not particularly outstanding from the outside, but it has everything you might need. The location is very good, not in the centre of Waikiki, but all the closer to central Honolulu, very close to Ala Moana shopping mall and Walmart. There is a bus stop right in front of the hotel (in the direction to central Oahu). Beach is about 5-10 minutes distance through a complex of Hilton hotels and it's one of those that do not get annoyingly crowded.Room is large enough, with a huge bed, work desk, armchair and large HD TV. Rooms come with a small fridge and safe (and a microvawe on only floors 9 and higher, I think). There is even an ironing board and an iron if you needed it. Bathroom is basic, but it has everything you need, including amenities and a hairdryer. There is also a coffee / hot water maker (while coffee was replenished, I have never received additional tea - but you can always get it in the lobby in the morning).I was at 11th floor at the back side of the hotel and didn't have any trouble sleeping at night, even though the soundproofing is very poor and you can hear the traffic in the daytime.Internet is provided both hardwired and wi-fi, worked most of the time and is quite fast.Staff was friendly and helpful. There is a concierge service in the lobby as well.Overall, I was very satisfied with pretty much everything and I will gladly return if I get the chance.

We were passing through Honolulu and stayed two days at the Ramada. We would have liked to stay much longer. The hotel is in a perfect location for seeing everything there is to see. Although it is on a major street, the room was amazingly quiet. The staff are excellent. They are very friendly and there wasn't a single question that they could not answer. Their advice and guidance about what to see and do was invaluable. Everything that we needed was within easy walking distance.

This hotel is in a great location. It's very close to the beach. Bus transportation is right out front. The staff members were very helpful and go above and beyond. Melvin at the front desk did way more than was expected. The rooms were very clean. The only negative would be the small beds. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel. Great value for the money.

Room had a microwave oven but now dishes were supplied that were microwave proof! so I had to purchase one to use at Kmart, no daily paper was provided as is the case with a hotel 2 doors down that has a lower star rating! and the same with no fruit basket in the lobby which a lower star property provides down the road! No balcony! which a lower star property next door has, and the window only opened about 10 cms!
hotel was located in a great location. Staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. Didn't like the Chinese restaraunt. food was cold and not much selection.

Pros: This hotel had an excellent value: good location - close to everything. Staff was polite and the maintenance guy was extremely fast and efficient when our safe did not work. They even gave us a nice wedding present. Room was clean(except for the windows) and nice - very small though.Cons:Even though we had a nice high-floor room, the street noise was considerable. I found out the reason: the windows outside did not seal - meaning that there was always a crack left no matter what you did. The windows were also only one layer. That made street noise a lot louder than I would have thought. Windows were also dirty.There is too little parking space.Noise was a bit of an issue but I might still stay again if the price was right- I would just ask for a room facing the parking lot, not the main road.
Location is good. Price is fair. Hotel is clean. I would stay at this hotel again. I would also recommend it to a friend.

We really enjoyed our maid and had a great visit at this hotel. Sleep was good most nights. One neighbor got a little loud at midnight and the staff security got it right. Use your rewards card to save five dollars a day on parking. Only stay issue was either an American Express issue or the desk issue on a one extra night charge we received. We disputed it with American Express since this was suppose to be our card on hold when we checked in. We paid for our eight nights and the one night stayed on our card when we last checked two weeks out. It appears the card on hold got charged a night extra.
Great location, convenient microwave and fridge in the room. Nice staff, quiet neighboorhood and clean rooms!

The front desk staff was rude and extremely unaccommodating. We booked a king bed (I even called to clarify), but when we arrived they put us in a room with two full size beds. When we went down to request to change, the front desk worker was extremely rude and made it sound like it was all our fault. The rooms were small and rather dingy, there are no views, no continental breakfast, and you have to pay $25 a day for parking. The beach and shopping are close by, but that was all we liked. The walls were thin and we could hear the neighbor's tv on the whole time we were there.We would not stay here again.

The staff had very little knowledge about local sightseeing and directions. The buffet restaurant offered for breakfast was ridiculous. The odor coming out of the restaurant was unbearable and this was inconvenient because the restaurant was located in front of the hotel. The Wifi connection was very low.

I love this hotel. Considerable price and really nice services. Plus free wifi in the room. The room is clean and quiet. The concierge in the lobby is so helpful. I booked all my tours there and they were awesome! People are nice. The location is good although it's not right next to the ocean. But there is a bus station and trolley station right in front of the hotel. It is also close to the mall and hilton village which has public beach. It's just perfect for me! I would stay there again next time.

This is the second time I've stayed at this Ramada, and I am very impressed with the cleanliness and friendliness of this hotel. I wish there were a hot tub, but other than that, it is a great deal in a very convenient location and parking is cheaper than similar hotels if you are a Wyndham Rewards member.

I stayed twice in this hotel during my last stays in Honolulu (3 nights and 1 night). Can not say anything bad about it. It is located about 10 minutes from Waikiki beach. Truth be told I had a little problem to find it (when first time in HL), but it can not blame the hotel itself :) The hotel has maintained swimming pool and Laundromats. Concierge was always willing to help with any problems.Taxi from the airport was about $ 40. The hotel is ideal for my short stays at an acceptable price.
The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. I would stay here again

We stayed just for one night in March. We had told the hotel it was my birthday and they had left a card and box of yummy chocolates in our room, which was a really nice touch and very much appreciated.Our room was on the top floor - large, clean and comfortable. There was a fridge and in room safe which would fit a laptop, camera, lenses amongst other valuables. The in room wifi was fast and reliable. There is on site parking which is an additional cost of $25 per day, you can reduce this to $15 if you sign up for Wyndham rewards and make your reservation using their website. It's free to sign up and worth saving the $10.The hotel is very well positioned for Waikiki beach - about a 10 minute easy walk and the Ala Moana shopping centre is about a 10/15 minute easy walk away.The staff are friendly, the accommodation feels very safe and is a reasonable cost for what you get - all of Waikiki decent accommodation seems pretty expensive.

The Ramada Plaza Waikiki is within walk distance of restaurants, i.e. Red Lobster, Outbacks just to name a few and the local stores and ABC stores. I would recommend the Ramada Plaza Waikiki, great staff and great service.

They charge $25 to park here and they have VERY limited spaces. Pool closes early - 9 pm. The area is nice, easy walk to Waikiki beach - close to numerous restaurants, bars, bicycle/auto rental, and ABC stores.

I went there expecting the worst, but it was way better than I thought. it will be the first hotel that I would look up before I check out any other hotel. And the staff was very friendly and welcoming.

$160/night with aarp discount, reasonable walking distance to everything in Waikiki, comfy bed, friendly service. 17th floor room directly across from the A/C machinery on the bldg. next door and with new construction at street level.. noisy 24/7... was never able to access Wi-Fi despite repeated requests for help at the front desk... lowest price i could find in the area, but still somewhat disappointing. Make sure you reserve through Wyndam and join the Wyndham Club - saves $10 a day on the $25 daily parking fee...ps - staff advised against eating at the hotel restaurant...

Great pool, big enough for swimming lengths, had it to myself both mornings. Very clean property, and quiet. Had pretty reasonable open view toward Ala Wai and mountains, not sure what the new condo that just started going up will do to that (and to quietness), but probably a bummer for Ramada. I think you can get good value here if you don't mind not having a lanai and a window that opens only a crack.

We booked online having read other reviews. The comment about airline stewardesses giving this place their patronage was borne out by there being a dozen or so in reception when we checked in. It IS a good sign. We found the location to be convenient, with all amenities (shops, restaurants, beach) all close by. This side of town also seemed to us to be slightly more upmarket than the Waikiki end. By way of confirmation, my wife developed a dislike for Honolulu when we stopped over at the Waikiki end 2 years ago (admittedly not in a great hotel). This time she fell in love with the place!The hotel reception area is tastefully finished with marble flooring and a comfortable guest lounge with complimentary iced water and coffee. Complimentary wifi both here and in the room plus printing facilities.The room is not large, but easily accommodates a king bed and a small lounge area with table and chairs. Smallish bathroom, with shower over the bath.Cleanliness beyond reproach.At the time of our stay (Feb 3013) construction had begun over the road at the rear of some condos. This included pile-driving, but they didn't start before 9.00am and I can honestly say that it did not affect our stay in any way whatsoever. In fact it was quite interesting to observe their progress. If you need to be sleeping after 9.00am however, you might have a problem whilst this is going on!There is a rooftop pool at second floor level which didn't seem to be very much used. We were the only ones in it mid-afternoon. The water temperature was bracing to say the least and at this time of year the surrounding high-rise blocks blot out the sun from the pool side terrace.Overall a satisfactory experience, assisted by very friendly and helpful staff.Would we come again? Most definitely.

We stayed here 1 night post cruise 2-2-13. We found the room to be clean and spacious. Our room had a king bed that was comfortable. The room was located on the 16th floor and faced the back of the property so noise was not a problem for us. We had a rental car, finding a parking space out back was never a problem and you get a discount off parking when you join Wyndham rewards which cost you nothing to join. We ate breakfast at an IHOP just a few doors down. And you can access the beach by walking thru the Hilton Village resort grounds across the street.

We enjoyed our stay here but you have to know what you are getting. We had a rental car and no interest in parking our butts on Waikiki Beach. The hotel is off the "strip" so to speak but on the fairly busy Ala Moana Blvd. We had a room on the back side of the hotel so it was quieter and being on a higher floor probably helped too. The room was clean and comfortable but not overly large. We had the room with 2 beds, so a room with 1 bed may be a bit less cramped with luggage and stuff. Over all great value and we would definitely stay here again. This is the place to stay if you are not too caught up in the Waikiki hype and want to tour Oahu. Tip: as a Wyndham rewards member you get a discount on the parking charge.

Just returned from Ramada Waikiki. Nothing to complain about. Short walk over the canal to the mall. Clean rooms.Good service. Easy walk to major resturants and beach. Walk through hilton to get to beach,note how crowded and loud it is at the hilton and be glad you choose the Ramada. Free WiFi is far from excellent, had to reset router several times but it did work most of the time. Several resturants close by-even a couple good ones. Great stay and great value at this hotel. No car needed. Will stay here again. Friendly staff! Thanks

small hotel by waikiki standards but clean, bright, average size rooms with good ac, comfy beds, fridge which actually froze water! coffee maker with free filter coffee replaced every day. efficient wi-fi, flat screen tv with lots of choice of channels.checked us in at 11am after a short wait during which time we had breakfast at the ihop almost next door. lots of pretty air hostesses also awaiting roomsrooms exceptionally quiet for area - even if there was noise in corridor(which didn't happen very often) hardly heard in roomsgreat position opposite ilikai (nice ground level bar there with great value food) which has walkway beachside to waikiki beachbus stop to ala moana shopping and dining centre, airport, pearl harbour, football stadium right outside hotel, although you can walk to ala moana from hotel in 1o minutes or sonice pool on 2nd floor, also washing machines/dryers for guest use in same areahelpful check in staff/concierge. free coffee in reception am

I stay 3 nights in this hotel while my vacation time with my family. I was expected close to the mall but we had to walk 15 - 20 min at least to get there. Same as going to the beach, we walked 15 mins at least. There are restaurants around but price not cheap or not worth your money. Room is average but the staffs acted not professional. No greeting or smile while see u earily morning in hallway or lobby. Provide wrong info while asked front desk regrading how to go to the beach. We were end up walking almost 30 min to the beach, double time. Bus stop to Waikii was opposite the road but you have to make a long walk to the crossing. Anyway, compare to other Ramada hotels, this one made us disappointed.
great hotel for a good price. close to airport and cruise ship port. great, friendly and helpful staff. room was as expected and more. would definitely recommend if coming to Waikiki.

We stayed here for several days after having stayed at the "Resort" across the street. What a world of difference as far as noise is concerned (no slamming bedroom doors, or drumming at midnight, or drunks roaming the halls, etc.). We were actually able to sleep here. Rooms and lobby were very clean. Internet was free. Staff were always available. Plus we booked here at an auction site for a total of $105 per night during the peak season, well less than half what we paid at the "Resort" across the street. The only drawback would be the lack of views and the proximity to the ocean (two blocks).
The hotel might not be the fanciest, but the hospitality was outstanding. The concierge was most accomodating. Really appreciated the free computer usage. Close enough to beach and shopping.
This hotel is in a great location. The room was a little out of date but the room was clean and comfortable.

We needed an extra night so I booked at the Ramada, not expecting much. We were pleasantly surprised by the clean / newly renovated rooms and the lobby. The outside of the hotel (and especially the entrance down a driveway beside a fast food restaurant) gives the wrong impression. We would definitely stay here again.

This was our first time in Honolulu and I didn't want to spend a fortune on hotels but wanted a good location. Seemed like this is a popular hotel for Japan Air and China Air flight attendants..which is a good sign.The room was a good size. The bed wasn't great but wasn't horrible. They do not have ocean views but we had a nice view of the city. Sound proofing was not fabulous but we were high enough up that it wasn't too bad. The only issue we had was a group of girls there for a swim meet were quite loud. My husband had just come down with the flu and needed sleep so I asked to move. No problem, other than the fact that the wireless internet didn't seem to work in the new room.When I reserved the room there was a deal that included breakfast but it was not provided to me on arrival (ie, voucher) so I questioned it. Even though their website no longer displayed this deal they honoured the customer and gave me a voucher. I was very happy.The restaurant at the hotel was essentially a chinese restaurant. We ate at the IHOP a few buildings over the first morning. It was the worst IHOP I've ever eaten at so we decided to try the hotel restaurant brunch buffet. The pancakes were actually pretty good and the staff was really nice. I asked to bring food up to my husband in the room and she server was great.Good: great service, decent size rooms, good shower, good value and good locationBad: very limited parking (but parking attendant was very nice)I WOULD stay here again.
Average hotel for Waikiki but across from the beach and walking distance near restaurants and mall. good value for one night stay on Waikiki

We booked the hotel sight unseen, hoping for the best. We received far more than expected. Staff was excellent. Very attentive and helpful. Location outstanding, just a few minutes away from Waikiki beach as well as all the fun shops. Restaurants around every corner. It was a great experience.

Very clean and efficient hotel. I booked here for 1 night because it was the only moderately priced room in Waikiki for that night (I had reservations for the next week at another hotel). Having stayed here under a different management years ago (not a great experience) I was surprised at how pleasant and comfortable the hotel is. I was in town for business so it was great for me. It's a little far from the beach, but if you rent a car and park it at the hotel, you can have both worlds. It's a an easy two block drive to Ala Moana beach (not crowded with tourists) or beautiful DeRussey beach at the top of Waikiki and you can take a ten minute bus ride to and from Waikiki for all the action. One disappointment. I couldn't stay more than one day ... they were booked solid.

Have been to Honolulu numerous times, this hotel was one of the most well run and extremely clean and quiet. I highly recommend this to family and friends.The staff from the front desk to maids were friendly, pleasant and always did a GREAT JOB. I will be reserving again for my next trip. Location was great and convenient to all activities. Loved the ice water and free coffee. The Operations Manager Rick Valcourt was outstanding and takes good care of his clients. Thank you for making our stay so pleasant and a trip to remember.

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Upon arrival, we were advised that we had been upgraded to an upper floor balcony room because we were Wyndham Reward members. There are only 17 floors and we were on the 15th with great views. We enjoyed our morning coffee on the balcony. Room was comfortable but could use a bigger closet as the one we had was tiny - not much room to hang things if you are staying for a longer time.Location was excellent. The Ramada Plaza is across the street from the Hilton Hawaiian Village and close to everything with a convenience store around the corner to pick up snacks & drinks to take to your room.

We stayed at this Ramada before our Hawaii Cruise for three nights. We were group of 10 people. The rooms were suburb. The buffet Chinese Breakfast had lots of items including Fresh Pineapple. All the furnishing was good. Waikiki Beach was only walking distance away.

I stayed here in February and this hotel has everything you need. Its just across the road from the Hilton Village which was really convenient as they have very good facilities and you can walk through it to the beach/bars/restaurants. I used the beach outside the Hilton and it is less crowded than down further in the heart of Waikiki. Its a 10min walk to the main Waikiki shops either down the beach or around the road which I was fine with. The location is pretty quiet considering its on a main road and its situated back from the road down a drive. The rooms themselves were nicely decorated and the beds comfy. There was free wifi. The staff were excellent, very helpful and professional at the front desk. Theres a great Italian Restaurant around the corner call DaVinos.

We stayed for 4 nights in February. We got a great price through Priceline, much more affortable than any of the other 3 star hotels I looked into. The location is excellent, in the heart of Waikiki next to Hilton Hawaiian Village. The staff was very responsive and friendly. I had emailed the hotel in advanced worried about getting a room that is close to street level and very noisy since I am a light sleeper. The hotel responded to my email, and when we arrived, we were placed in a room on the 15th floor, and the traffic noise was faint and definitely acceptable. However, the walls are a bit thin and you can clearly hear your neighbors if they are just a tad loud. Having just visited Tokyo, the room is very large in comparison. We had 2 full beds in the room, and I would have preferred 2 queens or 1 king bed instead since it was a bit cramped for me and my husband in one bed. There is now wifi in the room, which was newly installed in January. Wifi speed was pretty decent, and we were able to watch Amazon videos on our iPads. There is also a small refrigerator and a microwave in the room which is very convenient if you buy food from the neighboring ABC stores. There is a safe in the room large enough to fit our iPads and valuables. The shower is spacious and water pressure good, with plenty of hot water. Gym is small with a treadmill, a glider, a stationary bike, and weights. It would be nice if there is more than one treadmill. Equipment all work fine. We didn't use the pool. Plenty of parking is available at $25/day. If you become a Wyndham member, which is free to join, it only cost $15/day. There are 2 computers in the lobby which will allow you to print your boarding passes for free. There are only 2 elevators for all the guest rooms, but they go pretty fast and we didn't have to wait long for one. From the hotel, we were able to walk to a number of great restaurants, which are all within 1.5 miles from the hotel. Overall, I am pretty satisfied with my stay and would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Great room for the price. The staff were all very helpful and recommended some great places to go and restaurants. Would stay again if I ever go back to Waikiki. The beds were sooooo comfortable. It is a bit a walk from the Waikiki beach, but really close to the beach by the Hilton.

We were very happy here for two days prior to our cruise and one day after. The location is great! There are restaurants and shopping close by and you are within walking distance to the beach and so much more! Free Wifi is always a plus along with the ability to print your boarding passes prior to leaving for the airport! I think everyone in our group was very pleased with our stay here!

This hotel is in a great location in Waikiki. Being a smaller hotel (17 floors) with the entrance off the main road, it is easy to get in and out. We were delighted to be advised upon arrival that we had been upgraded to a superior room with balcony Jan. 11 - 14 for 3 nights. The room had a very comfortable king bed, small frig, microwave and coffeemaker. Only drawback was that the closet was very small.

Right in the heart of the hotel district. A great price and you are just across the street from the beach. Book early and the prices are great! Staff were very friendly and professional, always had a smile and a hello . Hotel was spotless, our room was great. We used the pool daily and it was very refreshing and nice and quiet. Lots of restaurants to walk to close by and IHOP right next door almost. I would certainly go there again!

We stayed here for 1 night in January as we were transiting through Honolulu. It's about a 5 minute walk to the main drag of Waikiki but there are plenty of restaurants and shops close by. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Our room was spacious but the bathroom could have used some updating and better lighting. We did hear the people in the next room through out the night but know that sometimes that does happen. Overall, we were very happy with our stay.

I decided to stop over in Hawaii on my transition of moving from Australia to Canada in November. I was really excited to get to stay in beautiful Honolulu for five nights. Upon arrival after a ten hour flight which i managed to get no sleep the room was actually ready at 10am which was really amazing and much appreciated, the porter on duty took my bags to my room for me which was lovely, in fact the entire stay i found the porters to be really exceptional at their job. After a much needed rest i decided to unpack then go and explore, i found that the safe in the room was not working and the sign told me i had to obtain a piece from reception to make it work. I went down to reception and the lady told me that the safe was old and they no longer work. Unfortunately for me i was traveling with $7000 in Canadian money due to my move. I had booked activities with the concierge for each day i was there, some of which i was gone all day, this caused me much stress as i had to hide the money in my room and avoid my room being serviced daily due to not wanting anyone in there as my money was un-secure. It really affected my experience though it all worked out in the end. The hotel seems to do a lot of corporate trade and i found that whilst waiting for my tour bus on two mornings the lobby was full which was great for the hotel but left little to be desired with different cultures wearing hospital masks inside in fear of contracting or spreading diseases only to walk out the front of the hotel lift them off their face and spit on the side walk. Obviously this isn’t the hotels fault for bad manners, just a major turn off. On many good notes though the hotel is within walking distance to everything, The beach is a five minute walk away for those who are seeking to stay in cheaper accommodation but close to the main attractions. I walked and had dinner at beachside restaurants each night of my stay. The concierge I dealt with went above and beyond for me in booking and referring me to the best activities that Honolulu had to offer (I forget her name though I remember she was from Michigan). The rooms are old fashioned but I found them very comfortable with a view of the surrounding city. Thank you for the stay.

This was our first time to Honolulu/Waikiki -- found it hard to find a reasonably priced hotel until we came across Ramada Plaza Waikiki at $149/night. Other reviewers have found this hotel at better prices -- check below. This was our base for three days before picking up a cruise, and it suited our needs perfectly. Rooms are clean, quiet and fairly spacious. It's not on the beach, but is an easy less-than-ten-minute walk to the beach. There are plenty of dining options nearby, Outback Steakhouse, etc., and a couple of ABC stores for convenient food or other items. The hotel does not include breakfast, so we just bought bananas, cereal and milk at the ABC and made use of the in-room mini-frig. There are two computers available in the hallway to the elevators and a laundry facility on the second floor for those who are traveling light. Available wi-fi in the rooms. On the whole, unless you have an overwhelming desire to be on the beach with an ocean view, this is a good place to stay that will save you $$ that can be spent on other things. The hotel's location is a little difficult to find initially, as it's entrance is set back from the road and marked only by a fairly small Ramada sign, but once you've found it, no problem. NOTE: There is on-site parking at $25/day, convenient and worth it, as parking otherwise is non-existent. We would definitely stay here again.

To anyone that is looking to travel Hawaii the Ramada is a good place to stay. We did not spend much time in the hotel due to our activities. But our bed was comfortable, the room was clean, and we enjoyed our stay.

My room on the 16th floor was very noisy. It was like the window was open. The room was clean and spacious enough. Linens were rough, but clean. Price was too much since I could have stayed at the Hilton for the same price. I chose this place because my stay was extended and I could not stay longer at the Hilton.

For the entire week I was there they ran out of coffee sometime around 8am. No matter if I came down between 8 and 9 they were out of coffee. It would take 20 minutes after I asked for them to fill it. If you have a rush at 8am every morning, buy a second pot and have it ready. This is ridiculous behavior if you ask me.

We only stayed 4 nights so we knew would be out and about so not so concerned about the view from the window. There was not one thing wrong with the room it was great. The desk was great on giving us info and all the staff would say aloha when you saw them. The best news was the hotel is across the street from the Hilton, and down the street was a corner restaurant that had very good food prices that equal home town prices and great service.

The Ramada was the perfect place for us to stay the night before our cruise. The location was great, near the beach and several good eating establishments. We would stay here again if we ever travel to Hawaii in the future.

Had employee discount which was promised and never given to me. Stayed one night instead of 5. Front desk is very rude. Very bad sleeping situation. No balcony. Window only opens 4 inches. No air. Air vent full of dust. Horrible hotel. Will never stay there again and will for sure not recommend it to anyone.

I only stayed here one night because hotel was booked my other nights. It was slightly hidden and hard to find. It was worth it. Easy check in, great clean room, nice balcony and awesome services. Desk was friendly and very helpful. Checkout was a breeze and no hidden fees. I would highly recommend this hotel

We stayed 8 nights here in dec/jan and were very happy with Ramada for the price. We paid $100 a night through Hotwire. The highlights of this hotel was it's free wifi and location - it is in between 2 ABC stores (24/7 convenience stores), 10 min walk to Ala Moana mall and the beach. It is also a walkable distance to the Waikiki area. The only negative aspects of Ramada would be that it's furnishings are quite aged and bathroom quite old fashioned.

Our room included a roll in shower in the bathroom which was good-a little small. To accomodate someone using mobility aids one of the beds should be removed, the safe or fridge needs to be away from the entrance to allow easier access to the room.

This is a great place to stay on a budget without feeling shafted, it was a standard hotel without any bells and whistles. The room was clean, the staff were very friendly, and we had free WiFi. When we made our reservations our package included a complimentary breakfast, granted it was from the Chinese buffet next door but hey it was free and they had eggs and toast. It is located right near Waikiki beach, less than a 1/5 mile walk, we were so busy that we didn't stay in our room that much. For the price I say go for it if you don't mind being away from the "downtown" action, that is about a mile away.

Feels more business-style than resort-style, but its well located for Waikiki and Ala Moana, direct bus to/from airport and seems quite keenly priced. Don't be too put off by the cheap Chinese restaurant out the front. It's really fine inside! Small pool and fitness room is usable. No food served but there are lots of local places including the 24h Wailana coffee house and the bars and restaurants of the pricier Waikiki hotels. Feels like it should be cheaper though.

Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in July 2012. Pros - great location, close to Waikiki beach, shopping and restaurants. Didn't rent a car, used public transit to see Diamond Head and Pearl Harbour, the bus stops right out front. Hotel staff was very helpful providing tourist info (restaurants, shopping, etc...) and arranging return transportation to airport. Cons - one of the hotel's two elevators was out of service and apparently had been all summer, resulting in long waits. Our room had no balcony and window only opened a couple inches. Our first trip to Hawaii and we couldn't have a drink on the 'lanai'! The free breakfast at the attached restaurant is very Oriental with only a few western items. We ate there the first morning but elsewhere the other days. Overall a decent stay but probably won't stay there again. Although having a great location, no balcony and the 'oriental breakfast' were deal breakers.

The hotel was a nice place to stay. It's location is great for beach access, shopping and local transit. The only drawback for us was the "free" breakfast vouchers for the restaurant. We found the breakfast to be very below average, and ended up only going there once. Overall, a great hotel for the value.

They gave us a high floor room with microwave, refrigerator, safe and was very quiet not facing Ala Moana Blvd. The room was clean and spacious with a nice tropical feel décor. Thebus stop is right in front of the hotel that was very convenient. We took one way Circle line bus 55 at Ala Moana Center which was very good but the bus journey used coast line was quite long for more than 2 hours with traffic. It is a good economic way to see the Island of Oahu. But we strongly suggest you take one way only either way to or from Wahiawa Transit Center or Ala Moana Center since there are many direct lines from Ala Moana Center to Wahiawa using the highway that would be much faster. From the hotel you can walk to the beaches easily. We use the hotel's outdoor pool once and that was so so with plenty of chairs.

Booked this sight unseen, and very happy with staff, location and room. Neat, tidy, clean and bedding was comfortable. Especially liked the full blockout curtains - great for jetlag recovery. Pool also good.

We stayed at Ramada Dec 10—17th and loved it… it’s very reasonably priced for its great location and decent amenities. Our room was aesthetically laid out… comfy beds, huge window from which we even watched the Friday fireworks from Hilton.. the bath was spacious and the daily “towel art” from the maids was a nice touch. loved the convenience of the microwave and minifridge in the rooms. The easy walk to Waikiki for sunrise was a bonus. The ‘bus’ was stopping right at the entrance but we had our own car, so didn’t avail it. Parking was $15… I guess the norm in Oahu… we always found parking space… so no problem with that…we always quickly unloaded our bags at the entrance, otherwise you’ll have to roll your bags from the parking lot to the hotel…they do their best to discourage parking even for a few seconds in their entrance but it is not an attractive proposition when you have to face busy days of sight seeing…..Their lobby is kept at freezing temperature… may be they can adjust the thermostat a few notches higher for customer comfort also saving themselves unnecessary wastage of electricity The free breakfast at the next door Chinese restaurant has had such bad reviews but we found their vegetarian options … fried rice, spring rolls, roasted potatoes and the roasted peanuts quite tasty... loved the pineapple as well. You could toast your slices of bread as well, though we never did. It was good ambience to sit by the glass windows and watch a couple of resident red breasted birds jump about in the small patch of green. the owner lady’s cheerfulness started off the day right for us…. All the spread was ready at 6.30 am when we walked in… commendable I would say. If they can put out some yogurt and juices, it’ll be great. May be they can also change the numbers they play… it became quite repetitive… esp the Hawaiian rain song… which we found ourselves humming after being forced to hear it umpteen times…Can’t really think of any negatives… may be the gift shop could have been open…it had attractive stuff but was always closed when we left and when we returned each dayWill totally recommend Ramada… we had a great stay … when one’s in Hawaii where’s the need for the frills of a resort hotel with its attendant exorbitant prices? Go out and enjoy the paradise outside!!

We experienced rather small parking space which did not allow us to park our rent-a-car over-nightt. Besides, even incase we got space to park car, it did cost at least U.S.$15.0 per night as membership and $25 as non-member, which is terribly expensive compared with your room rate. We can't afford. It is another topics but your hotel front does not have service function to exchange foreign money into U.S.Dollar, which is really inconvenient for guest.

Our stay was excellent. Their customer service was excellent. I'm a local here on the islands and I'll for sure use this hotel again when staying in Honolulu. The only negative for potential clients is that they are slightly off the strip, which I prefer so it wasn't a negative for me at all.

This basic hotel is fairly inexpensive and a good 15-20 minute walk to the heart of Waikiki Beach, which I didn't mind (burns off all the mai tai's). The fitness center was very basic and the pool small. The reception staff was very nice. There's a small fridge in the room if you want to save on eating out every meal. Some nice happy hours (3-6pm) around the hotel.

Stayed here over the New Year break while we were visting family. Enjoyed our stay, but it is pretty basic - no beach front access, hotel bar, or scenic vistas. However there was a small fitness room (treadmill, recumbent bike, elliptical, universal machine and weights), a small pool with room to lay out, free wifi, breakfast coupons at the chinese buffet in front of the hotel (see my other review), and discounted parking $15 if you have a Ramada rewards card. It's not a resort destination by any means. However you can go across the street to access the beach through the Hawaiian Hilton hotel complex. It's a short walk to Ala Moana Shopping Center. The rooms were clean and comfortable with microwave, fridge, and good sized TV with lots of channels. The one thing that's interesting is that they are the lay over hotel for Japan and China Airlines. So you will see teams of uniformed Asian stewards and stewardesses trooping in and out during your stay. All in all I'd recommend it, but if you're looking for a beachside resort, this is not it.

First up - very friendly staff here. We asked for an early check-in on New Years Day and not only were they able to accommodate us, but they did it in a completely friendly and unfussed way. Breakfast not great for us - primarily Chinese dishes - but hotel room was fine and comfortable. Good location - opposite Hilton Hawaiian Village so about a 5 min walk to the beach and a 15 min walk along the beach to the restaurant/shopping area. Easy, affordable place to stay in Honolulu.

This was our second visit to the Waikiki Ramada Hotel. We were pleasantly surprised that though the Ramada Hotel is on the smaller scale, it provided for all our needs -- pool, fitness center, laundry room, vending machine, restaurant on grounds, near shopping mall along with a comfortable, clean room. We plan to return again with our family.

The Waikiki Ramada Inn is located at the entrance to Waikiki convenient to Ala Moana Shopping Center. Staff is friendly and super helpful. Rooms are clean and comfortable. The shower head in our room was easy and sprayed water outside the tub. The only glitch in an otherwise nice stay.

I recommend that hotel! You will have the possibility to choose the best for you - only ask and smile! Hotel is located in the walking distance from Ala Moana Shopping center, Down Town, China Town, Diamond Head, school of Barac Obama etc. At least I reached every place (except D.H.) in 40 min.Good offer of different tours. I strongly recommend ENOA Tours! Many thanks to everybody serving in hotel.

This hotel has only one positive thing: location.We have stayed here for 7 days and we just slept in the room. That part of our stay is the only negative thing about wonderful Waikiki.Would not recommend this hotel for stays longer than 2 days.Staff was not that friendly and helpful.

Christmas time is incredibly busy for a resort city like Honolulu. We had planned to stay at one of the major hotels closer to the airport. They were unavailable. This led us to the Ramada Plaza Waikiki. While somewhat difficult to approach, once we found the location, the Ramada Plaza Waikiki well served our purpose, an overnight stay. The staff was accommodating and friendly. the room was clean and comfortable. Parking was convenient.

We were so pleased with our stay at the Ramada Wakiki ! From the moment we arrived all the staff were courtious and helpful. We read all the reviews before booking and would like eveyrone ot knwo the following facts as of our stay Dec 27 - 1) location - excellent !! close to a major mall and surrounded by numerous restaurants- most importantly the hotel is actually recessed of the street and so there is minimal to no noise ! 2) Parking - easy - safe - right behind the hotel and well worth the $20 to have the freedom of a car in Oahu 3) Internet - just added !!! free in all the rooms - 4) Breakfast - none in the hotel but the IHOP and an even better and cheaper coffee shop are right next door - excellent portions and choices 5) rooms - very comfortable beds and good size rooms - the side facing the mountains is a nice choice - 6) Negatives - really none - very very competitive prices and we researched them all - nice mid range not luxury but perfectly very good hotel - choose this hotel and save your money to spend on Luaus and touring excursions !

Upon arrival, my shuttle driver dropped me often on Ala Moana Blvd, right in front of the "777 China Buffet" with its makeshift sign and notorious aroma. To reach the hotel entrance you walk along a narrow covered walkway that's about as attractive as the loading dock at Walmart. Restrooms for patrons of the malodorous Chinese restaurant add to the squalor. Had I not had a pre-paid reservation, I would have probably made a U-turn and looked elsewhere. But don't let first impressions matter. Despite being air conditioned to the same temperature as my refrigerator at home, the hotel lobby is rather comfortable and inviting. And the warmth of the staff more than compensates for the wasteful air conditioning. The elevators were speedy and my room was spacious, very clean and very comfortable. There are 14 rooms per floor and the lower numbered rooms are closer to the Chinese restaurant. The even numbered rooms face the rear and are quiet and pleasant. The bed was super comfortable and the safe, refrigerator and (unexpected) microwave were a big plus. The towels were thick and plentiful and the shower powerful. Free wired and wifi is now in all rooms and each room has a wifi router attached to the cable modem so you're assured of a strong signal, when there is one. The service is provided by Oceanic Time Warner and frequent brief outages are not uncommon. The fitness room was adequate and the coin laundry very good. The pool area was also quite pleasant and relaxing. The only real drawback to this hotel is the location. Ala Moana Blvd is probably the most pedestrian unfriendly street in Honolulu other than the H-1 Freeway. The bus towards Ala Moana Center and downtown stops right in front of the China Buffet. But to get the bus towards central Waikiki and Diamond Head, you have to either turn left and walk a good block to Ena Road / Kalia Road, cross there (where the signal disfavors pedestrians) and then walk along Kalia all the way past the Hilton to get to the bus stop. Alternatively you can turn right from the hotel and walk 1.5 blocks to Hobron Lane, cross and then back 0.5 block to the bus stop. There is a signalized intersection right near the hotel (Kahanamoku St) but it's designed for cars only - no pedestrian crossing allowed! In fact there was once a bus stop across the street from the hotel but it was removed as Honolulu seems to favor private cars over people and public transit nowadays. In any other country there would at least be a pedestrian overpass, but not here. There is an ABC store directly across the street from the hotel, but getting there can take 10 minutes given the lack of a pedestrian crossing. A better solution is to walk up to Ena Road, turn left, and you'll find a smaller ABC store there without crossing Ala Moana Blvd. Another recommended option is to exit the rear of the hotel onto Kaioo Dr., turn right and then just after the road curves there's a shortcut between two buildings to the Eaton Square Food Pantry supermarket. Look for the blue roof. So, all in all, this is a well run hotel offering good value. If you can deal with the pedestrian unfriendly location and don't mind frightening your guests by the sight and smell of the tawdry Chinese restaurant, this hotel is for you. Having stayed in a variety of hotels along Kuhio Ave., I would only choose this hotel again if I got a good rate.

This is the second time I have stayed at the Ramada. I so enjoy the location and the rooms are nice and clean. All of the employees are extremely friendly and helpful. I will always stay at the Ramada when I stay in Waikiki

The hotel was a little bit overpriced we went there for the honolulu marathon and all we really wanted was to sit in a hot tub after but there wasn't one. I wish I knew that before hand but it was my bad for just assuming every hotel has one. The staff was very friendly and the hotel was in the perfect location for walking everywhere which we did just wish your kamaaina rate was lower and we'de stay there more.

We finished off our cruise around the Hawaiian islands with a 2 night stay at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki. Our room was wonderfully clean and comfortable. We appreciated an early check-in as we disembarked at 9 AM. Staff were great at answering questions. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Waikiki-great location!

We had to stay a night in Oahu for personal medical issues and couldn't find a reasonably priced and reasonably quality place to stay until we discovered this Ramada. The beds were great, rooms very clean and the only negative thing one could say is lack of breakfast restaurant on the premesis, although there is an IHOP next door at the Aqua Palms. We would definitely stay here again.

This hotel is a transition point for travellers and business people on overnight excursions period. NOT FOR VACATIONERS!Do NOT stay here if you are looking for a relaxing vacation. Stay somewhere that appreciates and treats their guests as more than space fillers. Anyone who writes a positive review for this hotel has probably stayed here one night on their way to somewhere else. The rooms are bland, outdated and have no character- the hallways are dingy and very skid row hotel looking. Do not be fooled by positive reviews written by overnight travellers. This place wants your money and nothing more to do with you.The entrance to the hotel smells like raw sewage- a very good indicator of what awaits you. Oh, and if you think the free breakfast is a great bonus- wait until you see the leftover chinese fare you'll be getting. Yes, that's right chinese buffet breakfast. Disgusting.You will not get a warm fuzzy feeling being here- you are nothing more than space filler.Oh- there's a pool here- but no shower by the pool for guests to shower before entering- so rest assured you are swimming in everyone's filth. Mind you- we never saw anyone use the pool area- I don't think it's encouraged. They have the pool only so they can pretend to be a holiday vacation destination. They are anything but.

Great location on Ala Moana Blvd. 7th floor view was nice , but still quiet at night. Quick Check-in and Comfortable King Bed and room after long late night flight was a Great start to our vacation. Bus Stops, Tour pickups and walking distance to Ala Moana Mall and other shopping was Great. Waikik Beach and other parks a short walk. Lots of Restaurants close-by and a ABC store for shopping or Late night Snacks.The Staff was very friendly and efficient. Would definitely recomend and stay there again.

What a mistake booking this place- it reminds me of any annoymous hotel you book into when you're on a road tirp and just need a bed. It is NOT for vacationers- it is for overnighters only. They preserve the rooms with balconies- for their preferred guests- not for people on week long stays- the windows in the room are only able to open 3 inches so stale stuffy air unless you want to run the loud ancient air conditioners all night long. Oh, and the included breakfast- is at a chinese buffet outfront that serves last nights leftovers for breakfast everyday- we ate there once and that was enough! Unless you like cold hard boiled eggs or egg fu yung for breakfast avoid this dump. Their coffee was horredous and watered down- there was not milk or cream for it- only crusty old powdered creamer with a filthy spoon in the jar. Oh, and did I mention the homeless man lliving in their bushes out front?The hotel has zero personality and zero amendments- nothing much to say on the positive side other than a bed to sleep in.Last time we were in Oahu we stayed at the Ashton Waikiki and it was lovely- beautiful breakfast by the pool every morning with hawaiin dancers, free morning newspaper outside your door, and directly across the street from the beach and in a very cool part of Waikiki.The coffee at the Aston is delicious and they have a variety of fresh juice and local fruit. EVERY room has a balcony and a view. Our view here is of a dirt parking lot.We booked throught Priceline and we are here until 9 p.m. wednesday- checkout time is noon- they are inflexable in extending our room beyond 5. Even though we are more than willing to pay.For some crazy reason this impersonal concrete hotel with no personality or good qualities gets a higher rating on trip advisor than the Aston Waikiki beach- which is why we made the foolhardy choice to stay here. Thinking that if this place was rated higher than the Aston- with all it's charm then we were in for a real treat. HA. Joke was on us. NEVER AGAIN. This place stinks. Literally. There is a sewage problem out front and everymorning it smells like diareah.All I can say in closing- is do NOT stay here if you like a charming, and comfortable home away from home when traveling. You can NOT even get water in the lobby after three o'clock.OH-I am in the lobby right now writing this as there is NO wifi in the room- when I last went to Mexico we had wifi in the room- just sayin.

Located across the street from the Hilton just a couple of blocks from the beach. Lots of restaurants nearby. Ala Moana Mall and WalMart within walking distance (10 minutes or so). Also the Bus stop is right by the hotel entrance. You can catch a bus to the airport, however no large luggage is allowed. Hotel service was welcoming and friendly and the rooms were clean and comfortable. Overall a great place to stay.

Staff make this place a good choice for travelers. Located slightly off Waikiki, still has good restaurants nearby. Free wired internet in room. The room itself is good, however, building surrounded by taller ones, and noise from adjacent generators makes opening the balcony door extremely unpleasant. Also AC was not powerful enough.Despite all shortcomings, staff was very accomodative and made the stay pleasant. 5 stars for service.

Looks like they have renovated certain floors and we stayed in room 1209. Property is well maintained. Free breakfast in the adjacent 777 Chinese restaurant has mainly Chinese food for breakfast which is a big disappointment. Drawback to the property is that they do not have WiFi access in each and every floor. They do have wired internet access.

It is close to everything - Ala Moana Mall, Ala Moana Beach Park, Waikiki Beach, bus, shopping, you name it. The staff is friendly and polite; housekeeping does a good job. And it's pretty quiet at night (we had a room facing the back). The breakfast is not bad, but I wish they would vary their menu a bit. It gets a little boring if you stay for more than a couple of days. Overall, it's a good place to stay, and if I come back to Honolulu, I would definitely consider Ramada Plaza again.

had advised hotel prior to arrival,we would be on a late flight,at 1 a.m. when we arrived,we were greeted , quickly checked in and in bed within the hour..what a relief,bed was wonderful!!Would stay here again.

This hotel is in the perfect location....in between Ala Moana Shopping Mall and the main drag of Waikiki beach. There is a trolley stop just out the front of the hotel which can take you to the mall or beach or close enough to walk to either. This hotel represents value for money. The facilities are clean, neat and tidy and staff are helpful. The tour desk is very good for organising tours and day trips. The property has a nice pool, a great vending machine and laundry. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone that wants value for money. I would definitely stay here again!

I've been staying at the same hotel(previously Dynasty Inn & Holiday Inn) since 1985. I got to know all level of staffs working there for a long time, and I feel very comfortable working with them. Their Hawaiian hospitality and Aloha welcome always make me going back. I also like the location from where I can walk to shopping center and beaches. I enjoy stay at this hotel.

I stayed at Aston At Executive Center, Ramada Plaza Waikiki, Waikiki Marina Resort at the Ilikai, Best Western Plaza. They are all rated 3 stars but one is better or worse that other. Out of all 4 hotels, Waikiki Marina Resort at 1777 Ala Moana Blvd is # 1 in terms of condition and price. The building is more that 47 yr old plus but the condition of the room is very good, if you look through the a/c vent hole then you you might be able to see the old dusty structure. The furniture and kitchen equipment are up to date. My room is on 23rd floor facing the street so I did hear quite a bit of street noise. Ramada Plaza Waikiki at 1830 Ala Moana Boulevard is #2. The room is much smaller and the condition of the room is OK, the price is higher than #1. The biggest problem is noise from next rooms. I can hear people talking and I can smell liquor through the locked door that connected to next room. My kid were frighten with all the cursing, screaming, and banging on the wall from throughout the night. I have to call security twice to settle the disturbances. I suppose next time if I smell heavy liquor in the hall way then that should be a big red flag to ask for room exchange. Aston At The Executive Centre Hotel at 1088 Bishop Street is # 3. the room and is spacious and stylus but very dusty smelling. Cabinet, wall paper, and capet are very old. Sheet and carpet had spots. Lot of dust and smoke buildup around the air vent. My room is on 27th floor and the view is very nice. The price on this one is highest of all. Best Western Plaza is # 4. This one is another version of Ramada Plaza but much older condition. My room is facing the freeway so plenty of noise all night long. The only good thing is this hotel has shuttle bus to pick up and drop off at the airport since I missed my standby flight that night

The hotel has a good location, close enough to everything for the cost. The only thing I would recommend is that you have (better) coffee available earlier in the morning with real creamer, half & half etc. I had to leave the hotel every morning in search of a cup of coffee. The coffee in the room was not that good and cleaning staff, left only decaf.

Our stay at the hotel was very nice. It is a little far from the beach and you do have to ride the bus to get to most places. If you walk then plan to walk pretty far, but that is why it is priced lower than the other hotels near the beach.Our experience with hotel staff was fine, except an encounter with the hotel concierge. She was polite and informative when we arrived and gave us information on some of the sites and tours. The next day when we told her we booked our tours online ourselves she became very rude and was pretty much done with us. We were really shocked at how rude she was and dismissive. We had no idea that she wanted us to book the tours through her or we probably would have, but that wasn't communicated to us. We took the brochures and figured out our schedule for the week and then started booking.
