Her behaviour was uncalled for and frankly put us off the hotel, but we were determined not to let it ruin our time. We avoided her the rest of the trip.Otherwise, we recommend the hotel. It was clean, the pool area was great (except the water is freezing cold!), and for the money it was a nice stay. The only other complaint was that there was a sewer smell outside the hotel just in front of the Chinese Buffet. It was there everyday and only in that area by the bus pick up. It would benefit the hotel to check into this and see what can be done because it is unfortunately a negative even though it isn't the fault of the hotel. The free breakfast was at the China Buffet out front and they did serve some American breakfast food. It was clean and they did a pretty good job of keeping up with the buffet.The internet service is not wireless in the rooms and it is a bit slow, but it worked fine once we figured out how to get on the system. I did call down to the main desk to ask questions about logging on and the person that answered said they were a temp and didn't know. Otherwise, we did receive our wake up call on time and had pizza delivered to the lobby and they called us when the driver arrived.Overall, it was a good experience and if you are on a budget then this hotel will serve your needs. If you want to be close to the beach and are looking for a 5 star hotel then you will need to look elsewhere.
Room air conditioner would give off a moldy smell at times. Asked to change room and the new room had the same problem.

This Ramada is in a great location. From our room we could see the Ala Moana Mall, ten minutes away. Closeby, walked the marina and enjoyed a frothy beverage at sunset from so many choice watering holes. If pounding the waves and getting all icky with sandy between your toes isn't your thing, their 2nd floor outdoor pool is the way to go.

Last minute booking, came through in a pinch. Good value, great location. Only downside was traffic noise on weekend and difficulty to physically locate if your not familiar with the area. Overall- above average!

Location was not good stuck behind other bldgs..everynight the sprinklers would water the small patch of grass for the Chinese restaurant in front of the hotel which smelled like waste as recycled water used and you had to walk thru area and smell this to get to front door of hotel...run down area behind hotel--car alarm went off one night--Would not recommed this hotel to anyone nor would we stay there again

No problem with checking in, the staff was friendly and comfortable room...did not eat at the restaurant, though...and, I don't think room service was an option. But, it was within walking distance to the popular Wailana Coffee Shop and we were able to walk to the Hilton to watch the fireworks show, which my kids enjoyed. The coffee maker in the room was a nice touch and my husband and I appreciated that.
Excellent location and great service. The only downside is you have to pay for the parking. But very much all the hotels in the area charge for the parking.

For the price you can't beat this Ramada! It's right downtown and walking distance to everything in Waikiki, and have parking on site. The free internet was nice, and the staff was extremely accomodating. I liked that their pool and fitness rooms were on the second floor and not at street level, too. The rooms are relatively simple but very comfortable, and our view was fantastic
Great stay we went as a family vacation another staff were awesome as were the other guests. Amenities were average but good!

Make a nicer smoking area for guests that smoke. Good or bad, there are many who choose to smoke while traveling. If you make an accomodation, it should be clean and comfortable - not one in the back alley.

We checked into our room and 5 minutes later the tsunami alarms ring. They were evacuating the area and the hotel staff said we would be fine but our car would not be safe due to water damage. We choose to leave and not stay the night at the hotel. We were told that Kayak could could call and refund the money for our trip. The Ramada hotel refused to inform them that we did not stay and were billed for the hotel night we did not use. We feel that Ramada inn was dishonest and took advantage of a bad situation Kayak was willing to contact the hotel to fix the problem but Ramada refuse to work with us in a disater situation and they did not care about our safety.

Hotel was very good other than room was noisy. Windows didn't fit tight and a lot of traffic noises. Being on the 12th. floor should be very quiet but it wasn't. Perhaps on other side of hotel would be better. View wasn't a concern after we arrived as you couldn't see the beach so location in hotel could have been anywhere. Price was in line with other hotels around and maybe in a better location than some as nice restaurants near as well as shopping. near both beaches-waikiki and ala moana. Probably less congestion than down town. Buss stops near by.

I enjoyed my stay at the Ramada. Accommodations are very basic but the bed is comfortable and the hotel is clean, and that's all I ever really want from a hotel. My only suggestion to the hotel in this day and age - get wireless internet.Love the microwave and refrigerator!
Good value for business traveler. Free wireless Internet in the lobby and wired in the rooms. Parking on location for $15 per night. Easy walking distance to Waikiki Beach and hotels.

This hotel was simple, clean and convenient. It is located in the best part of Waikiki. The area that is quite, has the best beaches, and a ton of restaurants. The room was cozy and well thought out. I liked that it featured free internet, a fridge and microwave. The room was designed to comfortably enjoy a trip in Waikiki focused on being outside and out and about.
They said they have free wireless internet service but it wasn't working in my room. The restaurant was terrible but very cheap.
Very pleasant stay.Good location, close to the beach restaurants and shopping.Easy to get to and from the airport.Overall good location for my visit.

I was pleased with this hotel. The only reason why I gave it 4 put of 5 stars is because in my package it includes breakfast which I knew it was At the Chinese place in front, it isn't that great but that does not reflect the hotel. They should offer there own breakfast. Even the basics. Other than that the staff was great very friendly. I would stay here again

We got in late after our flight & that wasn't an issue at all. The beds are super comfy with plenty of nice fluffy pillows & our room was clean, clean, clean! We were lucky enough to have a room with a balcony (most rooms don't have one). With the time change I was up at 4am, but having the balcony afforded me to be able to sit outside & enjoy a nice view of Waikiki & take some fabulous night time pictures. I would definitely stay here again & would recommend it to anyone.

The Ramada Plaza was very clean and the staff always provided a welcoming ALOHA to all their guests, they were friendly and helpful. Their little souvenir shop has some wonderful hawaiian shirts and sundresses or whatever nick-nack you might want, just ask if you don't find what you want. The concierge "Pamela " was a great help for us being first-time visitors to Hawaii and made many great recommendations.

It's not the hotel you would choose if you had money, but if you are watching your budget, then it might be for you. Any Marriot brand is better. Same with Hilton, and Hyatt.Staff is freindly, but not really that interested in the guests. Yeah, I guess I'd feel that way too if I worked at this place. The best thing about this "Ramada" hotel is that the Hilton, just a block away has a 10 minute fireworks show every Friday night @ 7pm, but of course, the front desk won't tell you that, so you'll miss it unless you read this reveiw.+ The GoodBig flat TV. Not much on this cable system, save HBO, Discovery, A&E, & History Chanl.Woking Sunbeam Iron & padded boardSmall refrig beats mini bar.Beds and carpets are old but clean.Lighting is adequate.Table for working but no desk or desk chair.Mirrors.Working iron & board.Combo Mini-safe.Wired Internet is free.Good concierge service.Wake up calls came.All staff are friendly.soaps provided are good quality.clean, reasonable quality & quantity of towels.option to reuse or not at guest choice.A large pool, with chairs and sun umbrellas.Same day laundry service (weekedays).IHOP next door.Self-parking at daily fee avaiable.Quick hop to/from Airport.3 blocks from Outback Steak House -- Quite good.3 blocks from Red Lobster -- Okay but not great.No Subway deli or other fast food in sight :)- The BadLobby store seems to be closed all the time, so it's 2 blocks to ABC convenience store.Room is jammed with 2 beds, a dresser, and two comfy chairs.The cooler/heater is crap, but works if you leave it on 24 hours every day.No wireless except in lobby.Window does not close and does not lock.Both elevators are slow in coming, and have no A/C.Front desk staff competent but not particularly professional -- It's a Hawaiian thing I think.Lousy overpriced Chinese restaurant and way-overpriced ABC convenience stores.2 computers in lobby for boarding pass -- Many China Airlines attendents in line.Not in Honolulu, nor in Waikiki, nor in Pearl Harbor; Basically, nowhere but near a beach.Views are of streets; Only water view is the swimming pool.Homeless people stink & sometimes beg on route to overpriced ABC store, 2 blocks away.

Check in was simple and hassle free. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Room was comfortable although the furniture was packed in there and you had to scoot around them when going about the room. Parking lot is very small for the size of the hotel, but we were able to find parking easily during our stay.

This was our first trip to Hawaii and it was for our honeymoon. We arrived at the hotel in the evening and had a few issues checking in. We had prepaid cards to pay for the room, the hotel staff were confused on how to do this with out authorizing my credit card for the entire stay. While trying to figure it out they were able to just let us go to our room and settle in. When we got to our room we were a bit disapointed with the bed, it was hard as a rock and there were scuff marks and a dirty bathroom. We really didnt want to complain as we really dont complain anyway about things but it was our honeymoon after all. A very nice gentleman came to the room from the front desk to let us know that they were able to resolve the payment issue and we showed him the room and let him know we werent really satisfied with it and he took us back downstairs and was able to show us a different room. The second room was great and I was ready to settle in and go find some dinner. We dropped the keys off at the desk and the Manager on duty greeted us with some chocolates and waters and apologized again for the mishap and the room and said he was upgrading us to a penthouse suite. I was totally blew away as I was not expecting that at all. They all remained friendly and courteous through out the changes in rooms the payment situation and our entire stay was great. It became my home away from home for over a week and I would recommend them to anyone I know in the future. The concierge staff were awesome and got us set up for shuttles and tours. They were very helpful in giving insight on where to go for dinner, what they liked and recommended for shopping and were even able to send us to a great place for a massage. We did have breakfast vouchers for the buffet downstairs, we only used them one day. We dont really do breakfast much, when we arrived the buffet was pretty picked over but the staff had it replenished before we left for the day. The menu wasnt what we really expected as it was mostly chinese. It was busy and alot of people seemed to enjoy it. It was clean and smelled good, just wasnt our thing. Overall it was the best trip ever!

This is a nice, modest, comfortable hotel. We stayed for approximately $100US a night and considered it provided a good base for us while we were in Waikiki at a reasonable cost. The rooms are clean and the staff are all really friendly. If you are trying to keep costs low then this is a good option.

the staff were friendly. the housekeeping staff do an excellent job at making the rooms feel as if you are at home. It is conveniently located near the ala moana shopping center and the waikiki strip. my family and I had a great stay.

I stayed three weeks in Ramada between 25th September and 16th October and I have only good things to say about the hotel. Location is great - not only close to the Waikiki, but also to Ala Moana Mall. Additional points for The Bus stop just in front of the hotel that makes traveling around the city very easy, if you don't want to rent a car. The staff was always very helpful and trying to make the stay as smooth and pleasant as possible. Rooms are very big, always cleaned thoroughly and with very comfortable big beds. I've read in some reviews that some people were having problems with internet connection in the rooms, but I only experienced it once during three weeks. I really recommend the place as a very friendly and comfortable base for great vacation. Mahalo for taking such great care of me! :)

We found this hotel on Hotwire. It offered us a spacious, clean room with a mini-fridge, satellite TV, safe, and 2 beds. The front desk service was great; one staff member was really helpful when it came to getting me a cab, and making sure I got to where I needed to be on time. It's located very close to Ala Moana Beach Park, the Ala Wai Canal, and the Ala Moana Centre. We walked to these places. However, to get to Waikiki Beach and the surrounding area, it was a bit of a trek. Public transit is not particularly good; it's better to rent a car to get around, which is what we did. We rarely stayed at the hotel - we visited a lot of attractions: Pearl Harbor, Waikele Premium Outlets, Germaine's Luau, International Marketplace, Ala Moana Center, Ala Moana Beach Park, Waikiki Beach, Judiciary History Center, Iolani Palace, Aloha Tower and Marketplace, etc. All amazing! I definitely recommend the hotel and Honolulu. I'd return. (We travelled October 2011).
Great location. Short walk to Waikiki Beach & Hawaiian Hilton Hilton.Walked to Moose McGillycuddy's for the Giants vs. 49ers and breakfast.Wedding was at the Halekulani. Fabulous!!.

I really appreciated the service and attention to detail at the hotel. The lobby staff were helpful and friendly. We asked for some restaurant suggestions from the desk staff and found some excellent restaurants in the area as a result of their recommendations.My only negatives would be the cost of on-property parking and the restaurant. The parking cost is a little ridiculous at $20 per day. I understand the need to control parking in a dense urban area like this, but that is stupid expensive. It would be much more customer-friendly to give out a parking pass or other indication that you are a hotel guest and have a staff member walk the lot every couple of hours to ensure compliance.The hotel includes a free breakfast each morning. This is provided by the attached restaurant which is oriental cuisine. The food was good but was a bit lacking in variety especially for multi-day guests. They offer eggs, sausage, pancakes, toast, fresh pineapple, cereal (limited choices) and milk, and a few oriental items (wontons, etc.). It tastes fine and the staff is very friendly, it just gets a little repetitive if you stay more than a few days.

rooms were clean, but the moldy musty smell was horrible.The beakfast buffet is in the chinese restuant infront of the hotel, not actually in the hotel, and it doesn't open till 7;00 and with the time delay your up arond 5, so you end up going to the corner and paying for breakfast.The lobby person didnt understand what i was saying to him when i asked a question, and the lobby smells horrible
Didn't stay very long mostly with relatives, but for the short time there the Ramada was a great place to stay and will consider it again if I should stay in Honolulu.

We actually really enjoyed the Ramada's room and location. It's central to the beach and the convention center (where I was attending a conference). The problem with this hotel is that it caters mainly to Asian clientele, perhaps a little too much.The included breakfast is actually vouchers for a Chinese restaurant that shares the building with the hotel. I knew this when I reserved my room, however I was under the impression that the restaurant would serve some traditional American breakfast items. It does not! There are Chinese dumplings, egg rolls, rice, etc. with nothing for the non-Chinese guest. I found this to be a huge disappointment, so much that I only ate breakfast using the hotel's vouchers the one day.
Everything was satisfactory. Wish there was no charge for parking!! Computer had a few problems when we tried to use it. Coffee could have been left out a little longer.

This facility is a bit older, but they try to maintain it well. Staff was very helpful and wanted to assist in anyway.Parking, as with most, is charged daily.Free WIRED internet in the rooms, but connectivity can be spotty and required frequent re-connection.Overall I would stay again for work, and a value centered vacation however would prefer beachfront for a once in a lifetime family vacation

Room set up awkward . . . coffee pot in bathroom, but no plugin nearby, guest has to move it out of bathroom to use it. Housekeeper not thorough -- some items on floor that didn't make it to wastebasket weren't picked up. Wastebaskets too small -- filled to brim every day.Sliding glass door difficult to open.Pool was not cleaned one morning by 9:00 a.m., and it was never heated.Desk staff cordial, but not really friendly.Would be nice to have newspapers in lobby and water available all day, not just during mid day hours.wi fi only available in lobby which is often crowded due to flight attendants.

I liked the convenience of the location, just on the outskirts of Waikiki's main strips. (I used to live in Waikiki so I know). Still close to the beach, the Ala Wai harbor, and the Waikiki scene if that is what you want. And still close the exit of Waikiki, so I could go do the areas us locals like. Bed and pillows were fabulous. Clean, seems safe, and it's convenient. Had a microwave, and refrigerator...Yeah!! So when I couldn't eat all my meals I had somewhere to store it and heat it up the next day....a plus for me as I never finish my meals. Parking was $20 per nite, $15 if you signed up for the hotel chain's frequent flyer card. The only thing I didn't like was 1) no free water in refrigerator (even a small bottle would have been great and the toilet seemed to run or make noises every hour or so. Still I enjoyed the stay. This is my second time and I would stay there again. I live on one of the other Hawaiian Islands now, and come to HNL a couple times a year. I'm glad I rediscovered this hotel again.

Great hotel, great value for money, close to Waikiki and Ala Moana. Would definately use again. 1 small complaint, bedding is a little hard, need to use more fabric softner or get new softer ones. Also need to invest in wirless in guest rooms.

This hotel is in a great location. The only complaint I have is in regard to the breakfast buffet. It is located in a Chinese restaurant and the day I went for breakfast, it smelled like boiled fish in there. The smell was aweful and I could not stomach it. I did not return and would not recommend eating there. Other than that, every thing else was fine. A good idea would be to supply a continental breakfast somewhere else in the hotel that would offer, cereal, coffee, fruits, toast/muffins etc. I'm pretty sure I'm not the only guest that has suggested this.

Nice place. Rooms were clean. Lobby was nice. The staff was extremely accomodating...checking us in before appropriate time and holding our luggage for us after we left. They have onsite parking. There are wonderful eating options very, very close and the beach is not far away.

When choosing a hotel in Honolulu, my husband and I were looking for a clean, quiet room at a reasonable price with comfortable beds and convenient location. Ramada met those requirements perfectly. People preferring a resort-type atmosphere might want to go directly across the street to Hilton Hawaiian Village. The Ramada is an older hotel (former Holiday Inn?) with no attached restaurants (other than an Asian buffet near the entrance). It was clean and, when I checked the Bed Bug Registry online, was one of few Honolulu hotels I checked with no registered incident reports. There were fresh flowers and orchids in common areas, and a small but attractive lobby. A concierge is on duty daily to help arrange tours as needed, the bellmen were friendly, and they had an enclosed room to store our bags while we waited for an evening flight out. The Wailana Coffee House (and bar) is just down the street on the corner for a Denny's-type breakfast, and IHOP is even closer. Coffee is available in the lobby in the mornings. Our room had coffee maker, microwave, small fridge as well as a larger safe than one in our room at a prestigious resort in Lihue, Kauai. We were on the 14th floor so didn't notice noise.

The hotel has an excellent location and the service people are well organized and in control of the facility. I just wish the reception personal would be warmer and provided a genuine smiling to the people. The cleaning staff does not fill all the items used consistently and would not change the sheets unless you request for them to do it.The majority of guests are Chinese and you may have to adapt to Asian culture behaviors such giving the right away and smoking debris left around the hotel and on the way to the breakfast area. You would need to start a conversation if you want to communicate with them.Other than those minor constructive observations. This Hotel is excellent!!!

We stayed at the Ramada plaza for 2 weeks as we got married in Waikiki. I also booked the rooms for my family who came from overseas. The hotel itself is undoubtly very good value for money. The beds are quite comfortable (not the pillows, I have to say I stayed at the Aqua Palms and had the best sleep ever there), nice tv, bathroom is small and the actual bathtub need renovation but overall the rooms are clean and nice.No balcony in our room which is not great but for the price one can leave without it. The swimming pool is big and cleaned everyday and there is a gym also.I did find that the customer service was great at times and poor in other occasions. For example, in one of the rooms that we booked the beds weren't made for 2 days in a row, I complained and the bed was then made.... next day bed wasn't made again... The excuse was that we left something on the bed and the staff isn't allowed to touch anything at all (not true in one of the occasions).I think given the fact that for 3 days we didn't receive the service, we should have been compensated but no, didn't happen.. it was just a sorry and thanks for your feedback even when I send the review through the survey that I was sent after the stay. On the other hand, when we arranged for the car space, we were told tht we were going to be given a lower discount than what I saw online and when I told the receptionist she was very kind to honour the discount I'd seen. So I pretty much think customer service here is a hit or miss. As with the location, I personally love the fact that it's just a short walk to Ala Moana mall, and a short walk to Waikiki and a bit of a longer walk to the Ala Moana Beach Park. I am not sure I'd go back there, purely because I had previously had such a great experience at the Aqua Palms in terms of customer service but great value for money and overall I would recommend it.

Stayed at the Ramada Plaza Waiakiki after a cruise from Vancouver to Honolulu. Selected this hotel because of closeness to the beach and price. We had forgotten that our stay included a free hot breakfast. Would recomment this place for sure.

This property has a good location just across the street from the HGVC and the Ilikai on Ala Moana Blvd. It's actually entered off Hobron St. The IHop and Wailana Cafe are very close by. All the employees we encountered were friendly.There is a very cozy lobby and it was busy. The hotel does show her age. She was alive and well when they filmed the original Hawaii 50 years ago back in the 1960s. The building is 17 stories tall. There is plenty of traffic noise from the street. Old buildings aren't sound proof. This is obviously a well managed property.We needed a one night stay on our way to the Big Island. We found a great deal on the well known opaque hotel site, and our needs were met.Because the Ramada Plaza is on the West edge of Waikiki it was easy to get to and from HNL. The pillows were not very good, there were plenty of towels and shampoo/soap.The dated window box AC conked out over night and Hawaii's humidity won out. Overall, this is a good place for a transition stay and the price was right.

This hotel was good for the price, and off the beach, but not too far. I was tall and 10 rooms per floor which made it not to far from end to end to get to your room. Most one room hotels are the same so the bed and bathroom tend to be what can make or break a room. This one had good clean beds and bedding, bathroom was clean and they clean the vents and tops where dust can accumulate. Parking was the only issue, it was limited and the regular $20 a day, so if you come in late there is no room to park, so they have to double park you. I would stay here again.

We were attending a wedding in northern Oahu in September, so to make it easier we stay one night in downtown before heading north, so we booked Ramada based on trip advisor's review.This hotel is old, not just outdated decor that kind of old, but just not up to par at all. The carpet is dirty, the hall smells, the elevator doesn't work, the window can't close all the way, you name it.Unless you are really really tight on budget, otherwise please book some place else.

We spent 4 nights at Honolulu and didn't want to spend too much on accomadation yet still be able to stay in a good hotel... which leaves many hotels on the Kuhio Ave stretch out. I have booked Ramada Shanghai more than once because of the great experience we've had there.. Great value for money yet never compromise the quality of their rooms. So when i stumbled onto the hotel having a deal of about $109 per night incl breakfast, I immediately booked it for 3 nights.The hotel is along Ala Moana Blvd, which is abt 10min walk to the Ala Moana Center with lots of shops and also Ward Center just behind. You can take a bus to Waikiki for $2.50 per person but i will suggest taking a cab if you're not too tight. It costs around $7-$10. There are many shops but still not as lively as the main Waikiki area. Seriously, the breakfast is ok only if its complimentary, I wouldn't pay $7 for a buffet breakfast even with this quality. This place is full of chinese tour groups.. hardly any walk ins. But the good news is food is so readily available around the corner. There is a bar around the corner which serves breakfast for abt $4.. and then there is Macdonalds and ABC store which sells everything from microwavables, sandwich, spam musubi. The hotel has a microwave so it becomes so much more convenient. If you need to rent a car anytime during your stay.. there is National, Alamo, Enterprise within 3min walk at Discovery Bay Center. If you wanna save some money on parking, Red Lobster offers $7 for 10 hours.. so if you come back around 9ish and head out early, you'll save a bit instead of parking at the hotel.I got a king bed which was very spacious and there was a couch with a leg rest. The air con is by the window which can be quite irritating and the don't understand why they didnt make the curtain able to close fully. There is wifi at the lobby and internet cable in the room which runs at reasonable speed. But as another reviewer mentioned.. it'll be better if they had wifi in the room too. Sometimes for international travellers who have no laptop..being able to communicate back home via whatsapp serves as a big convenience. tried the wifi at the lobby though, pretty laggy.We booked shuttles from the hotel to the Waikele outlet and airport for $11/pax.. pretty reasonable. If you're going to Hawaii to enjoy beautiful beaches right outside your window, Ramada might not be able to offer that.Overall, Ramada has continued to impressed me and I will definitely be back the next time I visit hawaii or anywhere around the world.

We spent 3 nights at Ramada Plaza Waikiki. The staff was very helpful, and the lobby was nice. Our room was good and comfortable.Internet: It seems to me that most of the hotels have wifi only at their lobby, and only wired internet in the rooms. It is the same at this hotel, but it would be very good to use wifi at the room as well. But it was not a crucial problem for us.The location was good for us, the ocean or the the shopping and entertainment areas are very close (couple of minutes by walk). We went to Pearl Harbor, and it is very good that the bus stop is in front of the hotel (direct bus to the Memorials). It is an easy way to go there, and it took for us approx. 50 minutes.Altogether the hotel was very good, it gave good value for our money, so I recommend to visit it.

This hotel is nothing fancy, but it is a clean, reasonably priced hotel very near the beach. Most of the staff was helpful and friendly although the female parking valet ignored us for several minutes before deciding to do her job--well, after she finished her cigarette. Parking has an extra charge, but most hotels in the area do. You might want to let the valet do the parking. The spaces are approximately the width of the car, so getting in and out is TIGHT! Several reviews have mentioned a free breakfast. We were not offered one, but rather were given a coupon for a nearby Chinese buffet for about $7. My suggestion is to go across Ala Moana Blvd or around the corner to the East and go to an ABC Store. They have several good breakfast options including fresh fruit bowls and heat-up snack items at very reasonable prices. (Try the rice cake with Spam on it. It is surprisingly good and quite filling!) Back to the hotel, it was fine for our purposes. Our hotel was not our destination. Out of two elevators, only one was operational, and I got the impression that it is permanently that way. For some reason, hotel personnel can make the other one work even though it has an "Out of Order" sign. Overall, we would stay here again.

I stayed 7 nights , and I had the room 1710 Penthouse , 17 th floor the hotel is clean , with friendly staff , the room is very pleasant large and spacious with 2 balcony , so 2 different view , everything is near by .... Restaurants , Alamoana , sushi restaurants , ABC store ...You can cook yourself , refrigerator , coffee maker , microwave , T V , large bed , I really enjoyed ,will definitly go back there for my next trip plan in january 2013 Good price , good service and good friends there ...Go for it !!

Our recent stay here was as a 4 day stop over between Australia and the US mainland. We were looking to stay somewhere reasonably priced yet close to transport, facilities and Waikiki beach. The Ramada offers all of this. The hotel is situated a short walk from the amazing Ala Moana shopping centre. For $2 the trolley can bring you back if you're ladened down with shopping bags! Although we didn't use it, the bus stop is right outside the door. An ABC store is located 2 blocks down and stocks nearly everything you could need. Our double room included tea, coffee maker, fridge and flat screen tv. The beds were comfortable. The room staff were very friendly and did a great job. After our first night we upgraded to a balcony room which the front desk were able to facilitate easily for a small charge.Unfortunately, the noise from the air conditioning was as bad as that from traffic. If you decide to book or upgrade to a balcony, DONT get one facing the Boulevard. Turn the aircon off and open the door for the breeze. You may have a better nights sleep!Lastly, the internet. My understanding was that free fast speed wifi would be available in all rooms. Not so! It is only available in the lobby and you can go wireless or use one of the hotels PCs. It is definitely not high speed though.Overall, Ramada Plaza was pleasant and value for money. With so many places to stay in Waikiki, this would be a good choice for a short stay.

I have recently stayed at this hotel about 4 weeks on a business trip to Honolulu. I cannot say enought about this hotel. It is fantastic! Large spacious rooms, microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker, flat screen TVs, comfortable beds, and clean! The location is perfect. Restaurants are close by in walking distance and so is the beach. When I come to Honolulu, I always want to stay at this hotel. It's like my "home" away from home. If you don't have car, this hotel is right on the bus line as well. It's quiet which is also important to me as I am working vs. the vacation crowd. I hightly recommend this hotel to all. The price paid is very reasonable in comparison to surrounding hotels. The staff is very pleasant and efficient as well - same with the reservations department. The elevators are fast.....also important to me as I am always on the go. Donna

My wife and I stayed here 8/9 to 8/17 because of all the freebies that were listed on Priceline's site. We found out when we got there, the parking was not free, but Priceline picked up that tab. This was our 3rd stay in Honolulu and the first at Ramada. We liked the location because it is less than a mile to most of Waikiki and Ala Moana Mall in the other direction. The staff was friendly and helpful. Bed was very comfortable. The breakfast was average but we ate there 7 out of the 8 mornings we were there. It gave us an opportunity to sample foods we had never tried. You always had the standard American food to eat. There are many restaurants that offer breakfast specials, like Snappers just around the corner and Seaside if you like to walk.If you like saving money on your meals, buy an Entertainment Book for Hawaii before you go. It is good for all the islands. You can also save on attractions and adventures. We were able to print their on-line coupons in the hotel lobby. We just leave the book in our room when we go back home. I'm sure the staff can use it.The only complaint which 99.9% of guest would not agree with, was the elevator. My wife and I like the stairs for the exercise even tho we were on the 12th floor. The only way to get to the 2nd floor was the elevator. All first floor doors have alarms except the lobby. We took the elevator to the 2nd floor and walked the rest of the way. A minor inconvenience unless you are afraid of elevators. A maintenance man told me it was to cut down on thefts.

I finally found a reasonable hotel in waikiki! They had parking, breakfast, and the coziest beds i have ever slept in! The staff was so kind professional and helpful! I so enjoyed and trusted my maid, wish i could put her in my pocket!!

This was my husand, Martin and I first trip to Hawaii and our stay at the Ramada Plaza Waikki was a great one. The staff was helpful and courteous. The very first day the concierge, Pamela, gave us some awesome suggestions on how to get around the island and the best sights to see. She found us an awesome luau for the second night there, then she found us a trip to the Big Island, where we toured Hilo. The room was clean and quiet. The location was close to the Pink Line, so we travel around the island with no problems. I would return to this hotel if I took another trip to Oahu and would definitely recommend this hotel.

After reading some of the 2- and 3-blob reviews we were a little dubious about staying here. (I always read the bad reviews first!)However, it's clean, the staff are friendly and everything worked as it should. It's very close to the GOOD end of Waikiki beach. It does appear to be one of the oldest in the area however, and the 'complete renovation in 2009' did not include new windows. We were at the back of the hotel so it wasn't a problem - and I'm a light sleeper.I fail to see how anyone can say it's 'difficult to find' - it's right on Ala Moana Boulevard and even has a sign that's visible from the street!The Chinese/American buffet breakfast was good, but got boring after 3 days - I hope that the hotel manage to persuade them to vary the selection. (I read Pattie Furtado's comment). Don't lose the scrambled eggs though; when fresh from the kitchen they were the best ever! Bottom line: I would stay here again. If you want a clean room, comfortable bed and a hot shower for a good price, this is the place. It's a 10 minute walk to the shore, so don't stay here if you want to be in a giant anonymous resort right on the beach or if you MUST have an ocean view!

While visiting Waikiki, Hawaii in August 0f 2012 my wife and I stayed at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki. I found the hotel to be of excellent quality. The facilities were great and the staff were very professional, courteous and helpful. I would recommend Ramada Plaza Waikiki to all my family and friends who were going to visit Waikiki, Hawaii.

I was very unimpressed with this hotel. It was hard to find; out of the way; and the staff was very discourteous. We chose this hotel because their website says they have a breakfast buffet with guest rooms. But they don't. Also; parking is supposed to be half off with a Ramada card; but they only took $5 off per night. The hallways were dark. The elevator didn't work. The gift shops were always closed. And the parking was very narrow.

I have stayed at other hotels in Waikiki and I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised at how comfortable and safe I felt (I was traveling solo). I only stayed two nights but I would stay there agin for a longer visit and will recommend it to friends and family. The staff is wonderful and although I arrived too early for check-in (12 noon), I was allowed to leave my bags with the bellman and went out for lunch and a walk around the area before returning to check-in.

Very reasonnable price for the location. The hotel has all the services needed: small pool, microwave and fridge, coffee pot, GOOD internet access, loundry, many restaurants nearby, in a walking distance from a big shopping mall (Ala Moana Center) and close to the Hilton beach, which is very nice and open to all public. Waikiki area is also close, 10-15 minutes walking. Would go back anytime!

This hotel is in a great location, but is not as cheap as its battered appearance would suggest and only has views of concrete, not unlike other hotels in the US.On the plus side, the check in process was wonderfully fast and the front desk staff were always very good. The room was a reasonable size and the bed comfortable.On the downside, breakfast was a $7 Chinese buffet round the corner from the hotel. Unwavering in content, it was only truly hot when it was served at 6:30am. All you can eat tho. Also there was no in-room wifi and the communal wifi was patchy at best. A reasonable place to get a budget bed, but best suited to its dominant clientele - airline crews.

Back in April, when I discovered that my wife and I would be on Oahu for 10 nights for business/pleasure (we're both teachers) I began looking on TA for a good, value-based hotel. I was immediately impressed by visitors' comments on the Ramada Plaza. What impressed me even more, however, was the fact that the manager had the interest in, and made the time to, reply to comments that were both positive and negative in nature. This demonstrated a real commitment to meeting the needs of those travelers who stayed with them.I am happy to say that I was not proven wrong!From the moment of our late midnight arrival, when Keola - manning the front desk - took the time to track down our forgotten Rewards account number, and had it waiting for us in the morning - to the helpful concierge desk, to the comfort of our room (as promised, on a higher floor) through our easy check out - everything was smooth and easy. More importantly the staff were polite and helpful. I wish I could remember all the names - was it "Griffen"? who had his name tattooed on his arm? Very helpful, always smiling- nice folks.There's not much I can add to the other positive comments about the hotel's location and proximately to the beach (which my wife thoroughly appreciated while I was in the classroom). And parking - if you are so inclined - is reasonable (though I'd really recommend trying to do without a car and using public trans. which is what I would do when if I return).Two minor quibbles: First, the internet. Yes, it's available, but not in your room unless you have an ethernet port/cable. This means that if you're traveling with an iPad, as I did, your access to the internet is restricted to the lobby and pool areas. Not a big deal. You're in Waikiki - you shouldn't be spending too much time on the web anyway! But I was maintaining a daily blog of our trip for family and friends, and making the daily pilgrimage to these two areas did get a little tiresome.Second, and this was more significant, was the continued "software" problems that took one of two elevators out of service. We were staying at the the Ramada from July 2 - 13, perhaps it's fixed now? I know that this problem had been posted for months. I also realize that the elevator ran intermittently when operated manually by a staff person. When there was only one elevator available it was a major annoyance, and frankly, something that guests should not have to deal with at a reasonably priced hotel of this calibre. The standard explanation is that a software update was required, and that the work was being done on the mainland. But frankly, this made little sense. More importantly, if one of two elevators is known to have problems that will take it out of service I would strongly suggest assigning staff elevator duty on a rotating basis - perhaps one hour shifts. Not pleasant, I know - but necessary. Thoughts?I just want to close by saying that I would very definitely stay at the Ramada again, and would recommend it highly. In fact, I recommended it to a colleague while in Waikiki, and he left another hotel he was staying in to move over to the Ramada and was equally impressed.Bottom line: book it! Unless you have enough money, and the desire, to bath yourself in the lap of luxury at one of the "over-the-top" Waikiki resorts (which ironically, are about as un-Hawaiian as you can get) stay at the Ramada. The money you save could be better spent on the dinner, or snorkeling trip, or luau you've always dreamed about.Practice aloha!

This hotel was very reasonably priced and had an excellent location. I don't like the Honolulu/Waikiki area, it's much too congested and you cannot see the beauty of Hawaii. But we had a 3 night stint here on our way to Kauai, so it served it's purpose. The hotel is very clean, the beds were comfortable, and it felt very safe. Staff was very helpful. The worst part was the breakfast. They have made arrangements with a Chinese food buffet restaurant next door for breakfast for their guests. This restaurant has a combo of American breakfast foods and really bad Chinese food. It's kind of grungy and the steam tables definitely do not keep the food warm. The eggs, sausage, potatoes, and pancakes were good, but, as I said, they were luke warm at best. You can save money by eating here, but I preferred the iHop for a cheap breakfast just a few doors down from this buffet. This is really the only negative about this hotel.If you are staying on Oahu, I'd suggest another part of the island. The west side, near Disney's Aulani Resort and Paradise Cove Luau is gorgeous and much more remote and calm. You'll pay a bit more, but you'll be out of the rat race and you'll be able to see the true beauty of this island, unlike in Honolulu/Waikiki.

Location is perfect. This is useful in the heart of Waikiki, to do anything the beach and shopping. Hawaii has more than 20 times already, but you are visiting, make sure you stay in this hotel. Also widely room is bright. And this time go, all had been remodeling, furniture, appliances, fabric of the room. Even now, there is a sense of cleanliness, but was clean, had become even more beautiful. and I feel the Hotel Staff and other people around are very friendly..

I stay at the Ramada Waikiki from July 26 - 30, 2012. I was very happy to be greeted by the staff at the hotel. All I can say is I will be returning to the Ramada Plaza when I'm in Honolulu. The hotel was very, very clean, my room was clean, pool was sparkling clean, and the staff, ALL STAFF members, where very nice and accommodating to me and my guest. Location was excellent. You will not be disappointed.

I only stayed at the Ramada Waikiki for 1 night but it was very nice. The location is walking distance from Ala Moana and Waikiki beach. If you stay here on a Friday night, please make sure to walk across the street to the Hilton Hawaiian Village were they do fireworks once a week on Fridays at 1945. Beds were comfortable and the rooms were clean. High Speed internet is available but please note that it is wired. Great for laptops. another note to mention is that Parking is not free, $20/night. if you are a Wyndham rewards member, you get a discount so its $15/night. If you are not a rewards member, sign up there so that you will pay about $10 for the first night and I think $15 for rest of the nights. The Lobby is wonderful and the Staff have lots of ALOHA ;)I'm a big fan of the Ramada chain and this is probably one of the Nicest I have been to. If you don't have a rental car, no worries, Hawaii has an awesome transportation system. Pick up the Trolley if you get the chance to get around Waikiki.

I stayed at this hotel for 10 days in July 2012. Everything was pretty good especially the cleanliness of the room and the friendliness of all the staff. Across from the Hilton Hawaiian Village it is a short walk to Waikiki beach and within walking distance to the International market. Breakfast was included at the co-located chinese restaurant, average food. Great palce to stay while in Hawaii. Aloha

Hotel is just five minutes far from a beautiful beach. The rooms are clean, wifi is only in the lobby and next to the swimming pool. The only problem is the Chinese breakfast what is for Europeans very unconvenient. What looks like European or American is toast, butter and jely, pancakes. We missed some cereals, milk, jogurt products, cheese and a bigger fruit options instead of everdays pineapple.

I stayed her for 2 weeks in July 2011 with my girlfriend and we had a great time!Pros:Excellent rooms.Excellent price.Nice poolShort walk to beachFridge & Coffee maker in roomsFree internet in rooms (tip: it's wired internet, so you might want to pack your own wireless router, then you can connect all your devices at once)Tourist desk where you could book various fun and interesting tours.Small but nice gymCons:Hotel cleaning staff comes at kinda random times, hard to time your daytrips so that you won't be bothered by them.No breakfast included, but there is a chinese restaurant next doors with a nice breakfast buffet (and I hear you can get discount tickets to it from the hotel these days).If I ever visit Honolulu again I'll definitely stay here!

Stayed here 2 nights on business. Paid $131 online for a room with 2 beds, refrigerator, lock box (broken), free internet in common areas and breakfast buffet. Parking was $20 extra. It was a good deal for what I got and being close to the beach. It is across the street from the Hilton Hawaiian Village and lots of restaurants. It is owned by China Air so all the crew stay here. Also large tour groups from China do too. The restaurant was veryauthentic Chinese but they had American breakfast options. Good option on a budget.

We stayed at the Ramada for 2 nights and for what we paid it was worth it. It's not a super luxury hotel, but we were only in Honolulu at the end of our trip to go shopping for a few days, so fine for us. The fridge was handy and there was coffee and tea provided, although no kettle or milk. We used the pool as well which was small but adequate. The bed was very comfy and having a nice flat screen TV was great, we got to see the Olympic opening ceremony. Service was very friendly and attentive. We were on the 3rd floor at the back which I found a bit noisy still, as I'm a light sleeper. Overall though we were happy with the decision to stay here.

We stayed for six nights and found the hotel to be very clean and comfortable and staff very friendly and helpful. Location is good, just 10 minute walk to Ala Moana Shopping Centre and 5 to 10 minutes walk to the beach, depending upon which side of Waikiki you want to swim at. Rooms had tea/coffee making facilities and use of fridge and safe, which were very convenient. Lots of towels to use in room, at the pool or take to the beach and all facilities always spotless. Hilton Hawaii Village is just across the road and many restaurants and food outlets closeby, plus supermarket a 2 minute walk from the hotel. Stop for TheBus and the 'trolley' is right outside the door, so very handy if you don't want to walk! Included breakfast was a bonus but feel they need to provide more variety as currently caters mostly for the Chinese market - inclusion of cereal, fruit juice and milk would be great, particularly for families with younger children. Check in and out was very quick and efficient and Pam the Concierge was helpful with information and tour bookings. Parking available at the hotel at $20 per day for guests or less for 'reward' program members. Room on 11th floor overlooking the pool and street was a little noisy at times so would request room at the back of the hotel next time. This was a last minute decision to travel to Hawaii so rate a little higher than if booked in advance but still good value for money and would certainly stay at the Ramada again and recommend to friends, particularly if not looking for a beachfront resort!

The rooms were comfortable, clean and the use of a tiny fridge and safe were nice. I didn't have any real noise issues as I was on the 16th floor and the a/c helped drown out any big city street noise (which in any city there always is.)The pool was comfortable, if a little cold in the afternoon shade, but was quite warm in the morning when the sun was beaming down on the pool. Towels were always available and the pool was spotlessly clean. The hotel was right across the street from the Hilton Hawaiian Village, and it is convenient to go see the free Friday night fireworks. The hotel staff were helpful with a quick check in and check out (it helped that I prepaid on Expedia) and I have to give a good thumbs up for the gentleman who summoned cabs for me when I needed them on Saturday morning and upon check-out. The only down side was the "free Aloha" breakfast that was run out of the front Chinese buffet restaurant. I only ate the breakfast once but it mostly catered to the Chinese guests with a large assortment of Chinese foods. Don't get me wrong, I love Chinese food, just not for breakfast. Add in the fact that the Western selections (eggs, sausages, pancakes) were often cold-ish, didn't help the situation any. For the other two mornings I was there I simply ate down the street at a 24-hour diner that had quick service, decent prices for Waikiki ($15.00 for breakfast with tip) and good filling food.Nevertheless, I would certainly stay here again!

I've never stayed at a Ramada before, but this hotel was comparable to other mid-priced chain hotels I have stayed in. Rooms were clean and modern with unexceptional decor. We had a tiny fridge, microwave and safe in our room which were nice. We used the pool quite a bit and it was always well maintained as were the lobby and other common areas. Hotel was quiet for sleeping and had a decent view of Ala Moana Blvd. Staff was courteous and friendly to us. One complaint was that one of the hotel's two elevators was broken during our stay which made getting to and from our 15th floor room rather slow. Not the hotel's fault, but I learned that it was broken for 6 weeks. A nice location with short walk to beach and restaurants. One tip: there is a Food Pantry store (also bank and Post Office) in Eaton Square behind the hotel that has a better selection of food, drinks, etc. than the ABC stores which are everywhere.

Stayed here for one night because we flew in one day early before going to Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club. We got a super rate for only $99 through Hotwire.com HotDeal. The hotel is small, typical Ramada. Room was small, but had a little fridge for drinks which was convenient. Beds were comfy and room and bathroom were clean. It was fine for one night, but I am spoiled so I can't say I'd want to stay there longer then one night. Parking was $20 which was a rip for non secure parking. Location was easy with about three ABC stores to walk to..I woukd stay here again in a pinch, but only if I paid $99 not the full price. Wasn't worth more than that..

Affordable clean rooms with small frig and microwave located across the street from the Hilton Hawaiian Village. (The military hotel Hale Koa is behind the Hilton. So,if the Hale koa is booked the Ramada is a great alternative.) Free breakfast buffet only gets 3 stars (food is ok, but I'm not a fan of Chinese food for bkfst) but the staff's hospitality more than makes up for it, thus overall the 5 stars! Parking was $20/night, or you can take your chances parking on the mostly residential streets behind the hotel.

My wife and I were hit with an awful smell of Chinese food when we hit the room. Only to find out the next day that there is a sub-par Chinese restaurant downstairs. The room was ok. The walls were filthy, but the restroom was clean. The bed was comfortable and we slept well once we got use to the smell. If you are on a budget and you only plan to use the room to sleep then this place is ok. I think I will spend a few more $ next time and avoid this place. Parking is $20.00 a night be aware.

Our stay at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki was great. The staff are helpful and friendly from Management to Housekeeping, rooms are very clean, location close to Ala Moana shopping was very convenient. Very good value for the money - and included all the amenities we needed. Quiet rooms, everything worked, AC was wonderful. The staff make you feel very welcome - it feels like a home away from home! We will most definitely stay here again!

I recently stayed at Ramada Plaza Waikiki for 6 nights. The room was clean and large enough for two adults and a baby. It is not a luxury hotel, but you get everything you need in the room, and excellent value for money.The swimming pool is located next to the laundry, and most of the time we could use the pool just for ourselves which was nice.The traffic noise was pretty bad as we stayed on a lower floor, and I couldn't get much sleep. If you can avoid lower floors, your stay will be more pleasant (defenitely worth paying extra!). Also there was only one lift working, and we had to wait for a long time which was inconvenient.

I stay at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki (formerly known as the Waikiki Holiday Inn) whenever I am on O'ahu. They are my first choice and I highly recommend them to any and all travelers. I have to say, I have yet to stay at a hotel where I feel more welcome, more at ease, or more at home than when I stay at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki. The front desk staff, bell hops, parking attendants, and housekeeping are ALL extremely hospitable and have excellent customer service. The rooms are very clean, no bad smells, and cool AC. The beds are comfortable and the bathrooms are nice. There is a nice sized mini fridge in each room, as well as an iron/ironing board, and blow dryer. Internet access is available and there are movies and video games on demand. The location is great for getting in and out to the rest of the island with ease. It's conveniently off the main strip so driving is easier. One of the things I really like is that the parking is actually an open, but secure, parking lot, and not one of those big, scary parking garages. I am always completely satisfied with my stay here.

oh- maybe 2 elevators that worked lolJust spent 8 nights there and enjoyed our stay- rooms clean, staff friendly, fridge worked, bed comfy... (elevator was out of service entire stay- so took a long time to get up and down from floor 11- and taking the stairs made you dizzy hehe)

It was our third visit to Waikiki but our first stay at the Ramada Plaza. It definitely was an outstanding hotel for a three star. The rooms were very clean, comfortable , and well fitted out. Every morning we would walk to the beach and into town in the evening for dinner. It was also close to the shopping centre, Aloa Moana. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We definitely would stay at the Ramada again.

I was really impressed at the speed of check-in and check-out. The staff were super helpful and friendly. The room was very comfortable, clean and very quiet. It was an excellent price for the location. The laundry room was well set up and the washers and dryers worked well. I love the fact that all the rooms were non smoking. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've been in any hotel. The staff were very helpful about giving directions and suggesting places to eat etc. It was a very satisfying experience. We inadvertently locked ourselves out and they were super nice about making us a new door key. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Yes, that would be me. I like to travel first class. I like resorts with lots of amenities. I expect great service (I work in the hospitality industry). This visit to Hawaii was a little different. We had just booked and paid for a cruise to Vancouver from San Diego and an additional 4 nights in Vancouver. That was going to be our Summer vacation. Then....it happened. Our favorite airline emailed us about a killer deal on airfare to Oahu and we could not resist. We booked it right away and 2 weeks after we returned from Canada, we were on a flight to Hawaii without a lot of extra vacation money. This leads us to Champagne tastes and a beer budget. I cringed as I read the reviews of hotels in our budget range in Waikiki. People claiming mold, mildew, awful service, theft etc. Then I found the Ramada Plaza Waikiki and nervously booked and paid for 6 nights. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a bellman that helped us unload our bags and get them to our room! (hello, five star service!). Parking was a bit tight, but it worked. I was a bit bothered that they raised the parking rate on June 1st and we checked in on the 3rd and there was no mention of the increase on the website. The room was clean and looked out to the Hilton Hawaiian Village (HHV). The walls were solid (even with the adjoining room, ugh) and we never heard any outside noise even though the hotel was full. The staff was friendly and the cleaning staff was always on their game. As a former housekeeping manager, I know where to look for "missed" cleaning spots and they passed my entire room check. They were very generous with towels to take to the beach. They gave us a crib to use for free. I was beyond pleased with the service we received while staying there. It is a great location near Ala Moana and HHV. When we wanted the resort atmosphere we headed over to the HHV and enjoyed a cocktail or meal. The Ramada does have a pool, but we are a DoD family, so we used to pool at Hale Koa for free, so I cannot comment on that.Seriously, if you have champagne tastes and a beer budget for your trip to Waikiki, I would suggest this hotel. The only (sort of) bummer was that the traffic light almost directly in front of the hotel does not allow pedestrians to cross so it is a little bit of a walk to get across the street to the HHV or the harbor.Thank you Ramada staff for making our budget vacation feel a lot more luxurious!

Had 3 rooms for a week and all rooms were next to one another as we had requested before arriving. The furnishings were as pictured on the web site with large flat screens TVs and very comfortable beds. All our rooms were clean and fresh, honestly, I felt like I was at a Marriott Courtyard. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The laundry room on the second floor was very clean and brightly lit. The parking fee was much less than other Honolulu hotels I looked at. The lot is a little small, but they always had a parking space saved for me. I had a Ford Edge SUV and had no problem parking it. Walking to the beach is no problem for a normal healthy person, however, it was about as far as my 74 year old mother-in-law with a bad knee could walk.On the evening of day 3 one of the two elevators went out of order. The elevator repair truck was in the parking lot the next morning, later that day the doorman told me a circuit board went out and a new one was having to be made in Texas. The out of order elevator actually worked but someone had to stay with it and push one of the floor buttons to get it to go. During a busy period I noticed one of the staff acted as an old fashion elevator operator taking people to their respective floors. We were on the 16th floor and even with only one elevator working we never waited more than 10 minutes for an elevator. Usually the wait was only a few minutes, actually I was impressed how fast that one elevator was. We had such a fantastic stay at the Ramada Plaza and Waikiki Beach, I highly recommend it. BTW, my wife was apprehensive about staying at a Ramada and she too was very pleased with this hotel.

The rooms are in very good condition and houskeeping does a great job - very clean! The hotel team is doing a wonderful job in making you feel welcome and at home. Always there to assist you and they give great tips for travel. I warmly recommend!

In a 17 story hotel having one elevator shared by guests and staff is unacceptable. The other elevator had a sign saying it was broken but no one appeared to work on it during our six day stay and my dad asked and apparently they never use it. Expect very long waits. The room is nice. Restaurants walkable. Parking tight but there's a helpful attendant that directs you. Become a member of their club to save $10 a night on parking (pay $10 instead of $20).

We arrived in HNL at 5:30pm and were leaving the next day at 2:30pm and wanted a place to stay close by the airport with a pool and access to dining. I was depressed reading the reviews of the real airport hotels and then found the Ramada. It was only a 20 minute ride and was well placed for the time we were there. We used Mark at Hawaii23 Transportation 1-888-598-5751) and he was great. Only $23 each way. They were waiting for us when we arrived and on time for our departure. Check-in was quick and after settling in we walked around the Hitlon, along the beach and through the park before selecting a place for dinner. The Ramada is well situated - close to the Hilton Hawaiian VIllage, close to the beach, close to Ala Moana mall and close to small bars and restaurants. The pool is above ground floor so you have privacy from foot traffic. The beds were comfortable, the sheets like silk and the bathroom had everything you might need. We had planned to stay at the pool the next morning but the weather was iffy so we walked to the mall instead and had lunch. I always struggle to find a good place to stay when on a layover. I will definitely stay here again. Given the price and location close to the beach, I think this is a good option for vacationers as well.

The Ramada Plaza Waikiki was perfect for our overnite stay! We attended an event at the Hilton Hawaiian Village (literally across the street) and with rooms sold out at the Hilton we decided to give the Ramada a try! Excellect location, staff, and if you're enrolled in Wyndham Rewards program, the parking at the Ramada is only $10. Trust me, this is a bargain for Honolulu. The rooms had coffee makers and a little refrigerator; the king bed was comfy and the linens were crisp and clean. Don't sleep on this hidden gem in Waikiki!

Things I liked:(1) Wonderfully helpful, friendly staff (especially Margaret, Melvin and James).(2) Great location: directly across the road from the Hilton complex, with its conference facilities, restaurants, shops, tour desks, and beach/lagoon that anyone can use. Ten minutes stroll to the Ala Moana Shopping Mall; 15-20 minutes stroll to the nice shopping area and beaches of Waikiki. (3) Nice, comfortable, professional hotel. Nothing grand or fancy, but good value and service, and a friendly feel to it. The room has a fridge, ironing board & iron, and big screen TV. There's wired internet for those who like cables. This hotel is the Hawaii base for flight attendants on several airlines, and I'll very happily stay here again next time I'm in Honolulu.Things that could be improved:(1) They forgot to do my room after the first night. When I queried this, they said it was because the "do not disturb" sign had been on the door all day -- but it hadn't been (it was removed at lunchtime, and I was told the staff clean rooms till 6pm). This seems to have been an oversight and the room was done properly all other days. (2) Free wifi was only in the lobby. There was no wifi access in the rooms. Every hotel should have free wifi in rooms in this era of mobile phones, tablets, etc!!

My Husband and I were in Honolulu back in May of this year (2012) , the Ramada Plaza Waikiki was at a great location. Right across the street from the fancy Hilton Hawaiian Village which does have its own beach and also private lagaun that you can use. The room was spacious and very clean. They didnt have a king room for us but the front desk staff was very pleasent and told us we could move the two doubles together which actually worked well we had a super large bed! haha - but again staff was super pleasant, the pool was the only downfall we saw and it wasnt a total downfall because who goes to hawaii to sit in a pool at the hotel when u have some of the most beautiful beaches in the world!! The Coffee House on the Corner is Delicous and decent prices, they are also open 24hours! , Todai is a japanese buffet right down the street that is also very good! and if u go down Ala Moana just a mile or so and you will be right infront of Ala Moana Beach Park & the mall is right there also, which has some good resturants and shopping. (great shopping) In the other direction about a mile or so you are right on the Waikiki Strip of Shops, resturants, and the famous Waikiki Beach! :) and you cant go there with out stopping at the International Market Place for gifts or treats for yourself! its an awesome experiance to be in hawaii to begin with!

I absolutely loved my experience at the Ramada. Everything about it was awesome! I reserved my room and paid for it 6 months in advance, so I was able to lock in a $99 a night rate for a stay the first week of June. Our room had a refrigerator with a small freezer in it - this came in handy as we went to Food Pantry across the street and bought cereal, milk and sandwich makings so we could make our own breakfast and lunch every day. You are right next the Wailana Coffee House, which has a great variety of food and is very affordable compared to most other restaurants around (plus it's open 24 hours). The wait staff there is very attentive. Highly recommend this restaurant.The staff at the Ramada were extremely helpful with everything, especially Pam at the Concierge desk. She really knows her stuff! We did activities every day, and she was able to recommend some great suggestions, transportation, and restaurant options. She is warm and genuine, and made me definitely want to return to the Ramada for future trips. Lisa was also very helpful at the concierge desk.The room was clean and quiet. Our view was just of a dirt field, a parking lot and a bunch of other hotels, but we didn't care, as we were just using it as a place to sleep. There is a 24-hour laundry room (washer and dryer are $1.50 each), and a small fitness center (that needs a fan!).The only bad thing was the cold lobby... it was windy with some rain during our stay, so the A/C didn't need to be cranked so high in the lobby. Also, I would like another soft pillow in the room. Other than that, an absolutely awesome experience!Thank you again Pamela! I highly recommend the Ramada and will be returning :)

I would highly recommend this hotel. This trip was a surprise to my wife. She was impressed with the hotel. Newly remodeled and exteremly clean. There are plenty of resturants in the area from expensive to IHOP. Waikiki Beach is a block away with free fire works every night. The parking fee that has to be paid for all hotels was the least expensive at $15.00. A negative was that the rooms do not have wifi.

The hotel is centrally located, clean and comfortable. The rooms are large with adequate facilities including refrigerator, safe and coffee/tea making facilities.The only negative aspect was the housekeeping. The beds were badly made and the first impression was that they had not been made at all.veral, we recommend the hotel as a good place to stay in Honolulu.

I stayed at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki the first time I went to Honolulu. I was needing to be budget minded, so picked a higher-ranked 2-3 star hotel. The Ramada's location is a plus. It is in the quieter western park of Waikiki and right across the street is the Hilton Hawaiian Village. There were plenty of restaurants and stores nearby. The rooms were nice with window overlooking the outdoor pool. The staff was knowledgeable about attractions and kept the hotel clean.
We were helped by a concierge her name is Pamela T she really so good. She can give the best plan with good companies for attractions and packages for everything. She made our honeymoon the best.

I came to town for a conference at the Hawaii Conference Center. The rest of my group stayed at the Hilton across the street. I got the better stay! The rooms were just right, good internet, clean, and very generous on towels, soap, etc. so we never ran out. The refrigerator was medium sized (although older in model), it allowed us to pack with food for the week. The TV was awesomely huge and I connected my computer to watch movies. The channel selection was fine...be sure to watch the "This Week In Oahu" to see what's going on at the island. The staff was helpful especially James and Danny at the front desk. The concierge, Pam, was awesome! The pool, laundry, and fitness center were so clean and tidy, you would think no one used them. (people actually did, though) Pool water nice and cool, the sunshine was perfect from mid-morning until long into the afternoon. Laundry was right next to pool, so I took a swim as my wash got done. Fitness center was more than most hotels offer. It is the basics, but kept up nicely, not dirty or worn out. I could easily walk the 5 minutes to the conference center. Locals were very friendly and easily gave an "Aloha!" as I walked by. While at the hotel, you can take a right and hit the shops (literally 1 block then continues from there) or take a left and walk two blocks to the trolley stop. Grab the Pink Line trolley ($2) and hitch a ride through Waikiki or stop at the Kuhio Beach area. Honolulu Zoo, shops, restaurants, bars, night life...fun, fun, fun! Overall, much less expensive (half the price), much less crowded, and actually cleaner then where my co-workers stayed at the Hilton. Only disadvantage: had to walk a couple blocks to hit the beach...but is that really a disadvantage??

Needs updating, but perfect location. Who goes to hawaii to stay in the room? The rooms also need updating, but it was clean and functional. It could be home to the japanese airlines.... and the help could be nicer.. so go pay $400-500/night to be on the beach and get the same.Overall, the best value for the money.. you save more than enough money, so rent a car..who wants to catch the bus..

Clean room, close to bus station, quiet, good internet connection. Here, one can have privacy. Small room but ok. Room was better than I expected. Everything was ok almost. If only staff at the reception could be a little bit more friendly and accommodating, it would have been better. Maybe, they were tired or just serious in their jobs. Especially at night when we asked the guy in suit at the reception about something, he seemed irritated that we had to ask a question. All staff at the reception don't know how to smile. But we are a cool couple, we never let such thing affect us. Overall experience was ok.

Decent hotel in a great location. Right across the street was the Hilton, that has a nice beach, many stores and restaurants open to the public. We could walk to many restaurants, shops and to the beach. Convenient parking lot under a fair surchage. Would stay there again. The hotel´s restaurant was not great because its target seemed to be mostly japaneses... but right next door we had an Ihop, ABC stores and the hilton´s shops with starbucks and stuff.

The photos of the property, including rooms, made it seem nicer and more spacious than it was. The room was small, mildew smelling, and bathroom was not the cleanest. When we arrived in our room, we discovered a letter stating there would be emergency water shut down that night. There were two bottles of water in our room to "compensate" for no water between 9 p.m. and 5:30 a.m. When I asked for two additional bottles, the desk clerk told me the manager said two only. And there was no mention at check in so we weren't even given the option of seeking alternative lodging. I do have to say the bellman was extremely pleasant and helpful. But what a way to begin a long anticipated and planned-for vacation. Poor job Ramada!

We stayed here for our holiday in March 2012 and found the rooms to be clean and tidy. The location was great as it was a short walk to the beach and also Ala Moana Shopping Centre. The hotel has gym, pool and swimming pool facilities also which were good. The thing that we loved was the King size bed we had which was so comfortable!

This was our first time in Hawaii and we started our trip here. The Hotel was very clean. The staff were very friendly, polite and very helpful in recommending a place for dinner. The rooms were very clean. The location was good also, a lot of things were within walking distance.

I returned to this hotel in February (2012), this time with my sister (who had never stayed their before so i was interested to see what she thought of the Ramada).The Jnr suites had been renovated some more, and thankfully the road was quieter (the metal sheets had moved further down Ala Moana). Check In- took 10 minutes, which was great for 8.30 in the morning arrival from Australia.Complimentary water but the box of chocolates replaced by 2 small chocolates-oh well an excuse to slim down!Friday night, you can sit out on the balcony & watch (some) of the fireworks over at the beach near the Hilton. It echoes like crazy through the skyscraper hotel blocks.My one complaint- the phone went dead in the middle of a call to the states/mainland & the hotel took nearly an hour to send someone up. (and the DVD player didn't work but we were in Honolulu to explore not watch DVD so didn't care too much about that).The housekeeping staff- fantastic -possibly the best we've ever had. Incredibly polite and efficient. My Sis loved the hotel & will stay their again too , with or without her brother. Free internet in the foyer for guests very handy, & easy to book the Atlantis submarine from the activities desk. The submarine leaves from the jetty at the Hilton, a 5 minute walk. The Indian restaurant down the road has changed hands, and seems more expensive, still good quality Indian food if you are happy to pay. Facemask & snorkel on special at the ABC store around the corner so perfect for Fort De Russey beach.  Sears Valentines Day sale on, very tempting for Sis and relieved she only had a short walk back to the hotel- way to many bargains and a strong Aussie dollar. We can't recommend this wonderful little hotel highly enough.

Thiis was our first time in Hawaii , The hotel has very clean , comfortable beds with nice linens , Free wired in room internet, Free safe and all rooms have a 37 inch tv and a fridge , The rooms were small and not a great view , great shower with lots of hot water and good soaps ,. Alot of airline staff stay here , The front desk staff was great ,we had a room with 2 double beds for 4 days , Asked if we could move to a kingsize bed room , No problem ,we were there for next 4 days ( alot more room to move around ),the pool area was not fun , never anybody there , We asked if we could check out at 100pm when our shuttle was coming , No problem at all , and no extra costs for anything , ,We rented a car at enterprise car rental ,next door at Discovery Bay ( $30 a day ) Ramada charges $15 a day for parking ,but free street parking a couple of blocks to the back of the hotel , All the tour buses pick you up at the Ilikai Hotel across the street , Great city bus service , We used the beach across the road at Hilton Hawaiian Village , We went to Walgreens and got an entertainment coupon book for $35 , was well worth it ,saved hundreds of dollars , lots of 2 for 1 tours , Roberts Hawaii are an excellent tour company ,Hawaiian People are awesome , and very freindly , Great small Hotel , lots of cheap eats at the coffie shop around the corner , Great Hotel Staff , Great Value ,Highly Recommend ! ! !

This was our first time at this hotel and it lived up to and exceeded our expectations. The room was well appointed and clean. The lobby was nice and the use of the business center was great for printing boarding passes. It is a about a 25-30 minute walk to Duke's at the north end of Waikiki. It is only about a 10 minute walk to the beach fronting the Hilton. When we return to Oahu we will be at the Ramada again. PS. parking at $15 a day is a steal, but like every lot in Honolulu, the spaces are small. This was fine for us since we had small car.

After staying at the Hyatt in the middle of Waikiki recently, we were torn about whether to book this hotel. The price was great. The location we thought was fine because we wanted to shop at Ala Moana and, in the other direction, we knew Waikiki was only a short walk away. We just worried that if we booked something so much cheaper than the Hyatt it might not be very nice.On arrival we were still unsure. The first room we went into was on a low floor and seemed very noisy (traffic) so we asked to change. We were given a higher floor which was still a bit noisy but with the air con on the traffic was drowned out.Very quickly, though, we settled in and decided this hotel was actually an excellent choice. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was not brand new but worked perfectly well and everything was clean.I really liked the laundry located right next to the pool which was right next to the gym, so you could wait for your clothes to wash/dry without wasting time or having to leave them there and go away.
