We enjoyed lying by the pool as did a few other guests.As mentioned the hotel's an easy walk to Ala Moana shopping mall which we loved. We also actually walked all the way across Waikiki, up to the top of Diamond Head and back to the Ramada. I wouldn't recommend this, though, unless you're on a crazy fitness drive like we were.A couple of other recommendations: go to the Wailana coffee lounge for breakfast. Old school American type diner which we (as foreigners) found kind of charming. We liked the i-Hop too! Both these restaurants are on the street outside the hotel (turn left and walk a few metres). Also, there's a car hire place really close to this hotel where we picked up a vehicle for the day and drove up to the North Shore and back via the pineapple plantation. That was a memorable day.In short, this hotel was a great choice because it wasn't hugely expensive but gave us everything we wanted. I enjoyed it very much and would definitely stay there again.

It was excellent for the price you pay. What do you expect? if you want to have a place to stay right in the heart of Waikiki yet cheap and clean you can not get it from Sheraton or five star hotel. Who would want the hotel to be a part of your vacation? You do not want the hotel to ruin your vacation but it does not need to be extra special. They provide free internet, free ammenities. Internet is super fast. There is a 15 dollars parking fee but you go to other hotels where you do not pay for parking fee but yet you will have to pay for other stuff which turn out to be the same. The one trick people do not bring up on here is from this location, it is very easy to drive your car around town which is a big plus. It is easy to get in and out of the hotel which I can not say for other hotels. For us, a family of two and a small kid, the room provide two full beds which is more than enough. If I come back to Hawaii which I will, I will stay at this location again. if you are rich and wanted to be treated special stay at the big hotel and pay more. This hotel is not for the super rich who want wine service to their rooms but it is for people who want to go around the island during the day and go shopping at night in the waikiki area and then come back to nice comfortable beds and friendly nice staff. Some people ask for Kids activities inside a hotel. Why do you want to kid activities inside a hotel when you are on vacation in Hawaii??????????This hotel is across from the Hilton and you can just walk your kids over there and see all the Koi fish and just walk down the beach.
this is a nice hotel staff very friendly rooms clean and comfortable

Hotel look and amenities were basic, as the way a small hotel is. The nice part is that it offers the following:1) Complementary Coffee and water in the morning2) Complementary in-room internet3) Complementary computer with internet and free printer at front desk 4) Probably lowest price parking in Waikiki-- $15/day 5) Bus stop right in front of hotel. Ala Moana mall is about 10 minutes walk away, and National and Enterprise rental cars are just next door. 6) Front Desk personnels were attentive to my requests. And for about $100 (tax included), what else can I ask for?!Lots of airline employees stay here.

I had a very brief overnight stay in this hotel (overnight layover). The staff were friendly, the rooms clean. The bathroom is quite small, the main room is average or slightly bigger in size.The rooms are basic, they do the job, this is not a hotel that you stay in if you want your hotel to be part of the vacation.The best thing I found about this hotel is that it is very quiet. I was beginning to think that street noise and Waikiki went hand in hand but the rooms at the back of this hotel (facing away from Ala Moana Blvd) are actually very quiet which suited me perfectly.To be perfectly honest, I wouldn’t stay here again except for another overnight connection, however there is absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel. I would highly recommend it to anyone that wants to stay in Waikiki and still be able to sleep without interruptions from the street noise, that is one thing this hotel has going for it compared to most Waikiki hotels.

Our room on the 12th floor was spotlessly clean and the staff were very helpful. We had a 7PM flight and wanted a late check out so we could hit the beach in the morning, come back and shower before checking out. Even though our check out day was the day before the pro bowl and they were fully booked they allowed us a late checkout at 1PM. The hotel is a short walk from Waikiki Beach, restaurants and shops

we stayed for 4 nights and the hotel is ok , A little far from the main attractions.However, we found a local restaurant(I think the name is aloha coffee house) close to the hotel and the food is delicious and price is reasonable. A lot of tourists said that Honolulu is expensive. In this case, we are lucky. It takes about 1/2 hr to walk to main beach Waikiki. But you can use the beach at hilton village

We stayed at this hotel at the end of our two week vacation to Hawai'i. It was nice to have air conditioning and a king sized bed. But there was no continental breakfast and no wireless internet. Only pretty awful coffee in the morning and a hook up cable on the desk (which means no relaxing in bed with the laptop or iPad). Other than that, it was a roof over our heads.

Although this hotel is situated away from the beach, I think in a way I preffered that! Its lovely and quiet, away from all the hussle and bussle along the main strip. The walk to the beach is not long at all, there is also a bus stop right around the corner - very convieniant! I-hop is also around the corner so not far to go for breakfast! The room itself is compact but clean and the in room safe is definatley a bonus! Check in was quick and easy and the staff were very helpful! The only downside was the lobby is freezing!! But other than that everything was great. Thanks very much Ramada Plaza!

Our family stayed at Ramada Place Waikiki thru XMas ..we were really enjoyed it . The location is central, buses were right at front, Staff were very friendly, helpful, room was very clean, the beach was not too far - across the street . Decoration at XMas was very beautiful . This is not a fancy hotel but with it was good with the price we paid .We will be back next year and will recommend to our Canadian friends about this hotel. The Wilsons.

We needed somewhere to sleep & breakup some long flights & the Ramada provided the perfect solution. Easy access, public transport right out front, ihop & dinner just down the street for a quick breakfast. The room was compact & basic but at the price we paid & for an overnight sleep - perfect. Easy walk to main strip, maybe 20mins (at kids pace) or sneak in across the road behind some of the other hotels & wander down along the beach.

We had two days at the end of a trip to Kauai to spend in Honolulu - my husband, myself and our son, his wife, and their infant. We chose this hotel after reading reviews on tripadvisor and seeing the photographs posted there. I must say that the hotel is as represented in the photographs. It is close to a very nice beach and beach promenade, and just two blocks from Ala Moana Shopping Mall. Our room was fresh and clean and it had all the extra amenities we needed; i.e., refrigerator and microwave, free internet, and a nice TV. The beds were very good, and the linens were crisp and fresh. The management was extremely accommodating to us, as we arrived early from Kauai and they allowed us to check in when we got there, before 12:00! They arranged for us to have our rooms across from each other, which made it very easy for us to communicate. The rooms are not the largest hotel rooms I've seen, but they were adequate in size. The furniture was very nice. The pool area was nice, and my daughter-in-law took advantage of the laundry facilities provided. All-in-all, it was a very satisfactory experience and I would stay there again. Mahalo to the people at the Ramada Plaza. They gave us very good value for our dollars.

Great boutique-like property. Courteous, efficient, friendly front desk staffer, James, a pleasure after long day and late check-in. Onsite fee parking convenient. Location excellent for bus access; considering staying again using their $9 airport shuttle and local bus instead of renting car. Short easy walk to numerous restaurants from $ to $$$$ within one block from lobby. Downstairs restaurant is all you can eat buffet BLD for <$8.00. Ala Moana or Waikiki beaches just a few more scenic blocks away. Our 16th floor room facing busy street was exceptionally clean and surprisingly quiet. Free wifi and computer station in lobby with printer handy for boarding pass. High recommend for business and/or vacation.

I haven't been to Waikiki in about 20 years so I wasn't sure what to expect. We actually got stranded in HNL for 2 nights because airlines oversold airlines (we fly standby) and so this was a last minute deal for us from Hotwire. The hotel is quite old but then again, most hotels and buildings in this area are so I'm not sure what I was expecting. The room was a good size and it had a safe and mini fridge which is a good feature. We were given a low level room with a terrible view of the back parking lot but to be honest, I didn't really care. We did ask for a late check out due to the fact that my son wasn't feeling well and our flight didn't leave until 11 pm. We were 'allowed' to stay for an extra 2 hours until 2 pm. The only think I didn't really like is that the room didn't have any 'on demand' movies. After a long day at the beach, it's nice to come back and order up a movie with the family and all relax in the evening. The hotel does not have a restaurant on site so we ended up eating at a VERY overpriced IHOP next door. For the $100 we paid, it was probably the best choice we could have found so all in all, it was fine.

Good hotel, not groundbreaking, but clean and in good location for the price. The bus towards the downtown area is right outside, and it's a short walk across the street to the Waikiki beach buses. No restaurant really, but there's an IHOP or other restaurants nearby for breakfast etc. It is a bit quieter than right on the strip. We'd stay again.
Great location. The hotel is very clean and the service is very good. Parking rate is very reasonable.

Great location and good price for the area. Nothing fancy, but clean and comfortable. Short walk to the beach and bus routes. We had a partial view of the ocean from our room. Smelled like the chinese food restaurant on the first floor...in a good way. We didn't try the food. I liked staying in this part of Waikiki better then the other side. Less crowded, cleaner, no street vendors or "performers" and a little more quiet. Would definitely recommend if your trying to stick to a budget.

I read many reviews of hotels on Waikiki and chose the Ramada Plaza Waikiki because of the consistant good reviews. We were very pleased with our stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone. Our room was very clean, the furnishings attractive and modern, we had a mini frig and microwave which was convenient. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful. Waikiki beach is within walking distance, ABC stores that have whatever you might need close by, The Ala Moana Shopping Center within a 10 minute walk having a multitude of stores and a very large food court. Be sure to find the Honolulu Cookie Company kiosk there and try all of the excellant shortbread cookies. Great for gifts to take home.

Very casual and local place to stay near Waikiki beach, shopping and restaurants. This is the second time we have stayed at the Ramada Waikiki and will continue to as bus lines stop right in front of the hotel. They have a very attentive staff and an onsite consierge that can book fun day trips for you and transportation back to the airport. Also there are many restuarants nearby. Reason for not 5 stars is only that you need to realizut there are not many good views of the ocean from this location by you are within close walking distance from Waikiki beach and Ala Moana part. Also on this stay the shower nozzle stuck and there was a leak in the sink faucet which we reported upon leaving.

We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We booked on Hotwire and got It for $100US. It was clean, comfortable, 5 minutes to the beach by walking through the Hilton Village. The in-room refrigerator was a great convenience. Not a place for a romantic stay, in my view, but great for us as we were on a points run (LOL). We noticed a number of airlines use this hotel for their crew. Def better (imho) than the Aqua Palms we had also considered. There's a popular locally-run cafeteria for breakfast on the next corner. Don't go to the IHOP - portions were simply enormous and priced to match, food was so so, and service was friendly but incompetent.

We stayed at the Ramada Plaza in Waikiki one night prior to embarking on a cruise of the Hawaiian Islands. It just so happened that our arrival coincided with the APEC meeting of world leaders and it took almost 2 hours to get from the airport to the outskirts of Waikiki (we walked the last mile). Check-in was pleasant and we found our room easily. The room was spacious and clean and had all that was needed for one night. The bed was a bid old (dent in the middle) but we slept fine. The did hear the TV and talking in teh room next door and wished we had brought our sound machine to drown-out the noise (lesson learned). We checked-out the next morning and the staff was very helpful in explaining where we would need to catch a taxi to the port (impossible to get in or out of Waikiki because of Security with Obama and other world leaders). We would definitely stay here again if it is a short trip.

Great clean motel just across from the very expensive Hilton. Only two blocks from the main bus pickup location used for most events. Desk help very helpful especially on how to get somewhere in the city.

The lobby was very clean and cute,As were the rooms.Beds were huge And comfy with alot of pillows,my husband loved the flat screen tv. The bathroom was a little small but still clean.AC could have been colder and the hallways were strangely hot,but other then that the staff & location are great.
Very good in any respect. Good price, friendly, they store things for you.

A short walk away from the private beach owned by the Hilton, but there's nothing much to do on that stretch, i would recommend one walk to the public area - there's a lot more stuff going on there, restaurants and pubs and shops. about a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel to the main shopping district (huge forever21, cheesecake factory, tiffany & co, prada etc etc)small lobby, no breakfast (coffee/tea/water provided) but there's wifi in the lobby so it makes waiting a lot easier. we arrived at the hotel about 6am and we were so grateful they allowed us to check in early at 9am. there was an ihop right next to the hotel so we kept ourselves occupied while they were getting our room ready.in the room there was only one internet connection (wired) but luckily i was using a mac so we could share the internet. the room wasnt big, but was clean and comfortable. the toilet was clean too. we had 4 people staying in the room but we managed fine. staff were great too, giving us tips on getting to places like the international market place. there was a tour booth right by the elevators too.if youre heading to pearl harbour, get up early because the free tickets for the general tour are usually snapped up early. its about a 1.5 hr drive down.dont forget to check out the flea market at the aloha stadium!! its super huge and great place to scour some finds. dont miss out on the luau as well. I LOVE HAWAI'I!HANG LOOSE!

This hotel is a great place to stay. The staff was extremely helpful and was quick to give us tips about where to go and what to see. Along with being helpful, they were very friendly and were always wearing a smile. Although it's an older property, the hotel was very clean and well maintained. The ethernet connection in the room was fantastic. High speed and reliable. The room was always made up promptly and in good order. The location is great too. It's just across Ala Moana Blvd. from the Hilton Hawaiian Village and the beach. Also it's just up the block from the Wialana Coffee House, a very good place to eat. Great location and reasonable rates; what's not to like!

From the time we first contacted the Ramada Plaza for information we were incredibly impressed with the staff, especially Joanne. They were extremely accommodating before, during and after our stay. I want to thank them for taking the time to send me the camera I left behind on the counter. As others have said, the location is perfect, the rooms are clean, and everything worked which is not common in handicap accessible rooms in other hotels. The beds were very comfortable, the drapes pulled completely closed for total privacy, and the new TV’s are great. We were there for 3 nights before a cruise and two nights after, while we were gone the TV’s were replaced. I have to applaud management for keeping this hotel up. Parking was easy and at $15 a day a relative bargain compare to the $30 the other hotels were charging. We felt the hotel was a real value, and recommend prepaying through the hotel to get a great price and a good room. Thanks for everything, we highly recommend your hotel.

I felt the location for us was just perfect. A quick walk to largest shopping mall , beach and the restaurants, even night time entertainment. The complete staff was friendly, helpful and the room was very clean. The beds were very comfortable and we enjoyed the large flat screen. The deck is wrapped around so you were able to enjoy shade or sun. If you needed to use internet or wifi it was free and down at their beautiful lobby. I felt I did'nt need a car . I would definitely stay there again.

Have just had a few days at this hotel. Its situated at the quieter end of Waikiki, opposite the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Just a quick walk to the beach, and lots of eating places nearby. The internet and wifi is free, and the rooms are large, clean and nicely decorated, including new flat screen tv's. Service is great, and I would definitely stay here again.

Just got back from 9 nights at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki. Very nice hotel, beautiful lobby, nice rooms. Very comfortable bed and good sized bathroom. Asked for quiet floor and was put on the 15th floor overlooking Ala Moana Blvd. Not sure if it is just these rooms, there are only two that face Ala Moana, but it was very quiet, never heard other guests. While there they installed big screen LCD tvs with much better choice of channels. Very friendly and helpful staff on the front desk, as well as maintenance and maids. We had a car and never had a problem finding a spot to park (we come and go a lot) even tho they do have limited parking (self park only $15 a day which is a bargain). Make sure your car is small, the spaces are tight and parking is an issue all over Waikiki. Wish the A/C had been quieter but this is the norm for most hotel rooms. Right across the street from the Hilton Hawaiian Village so good beach access. This part of Waikiki is much quieter than other spots. Great rate, no complaints.

We booked this hotel for one night only before we left on our NCL cruise. The rooms were neat clean and tidy and the beds were quite comfortable.I prefer to stay down town in Waikiki closer to all that is offered but for one or two nights, the Ramada was convenient to what we wanted. It doesn't have a restaurant attached but there is a Chinese out front ???? a great Greek restaurant across the road and a sport bar with cheap eats just around the corner. Overall an enjoyable stay.

We stayed at Ramada Plaza for 2 days before our cruise. For a very reasonable AARP rate we got a room that was clean and spacious with a nice view of the city and mountains. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. Friday night we walked across the street to the Hilton Hawaiian Village to watch a beautiful fireworks show. The hotel is convenient to restaurants and the beach.The staff was friendly and very helpful. When we requested transportation to the cruise terminal, the staff called us ten minutes later with a cab. We will go back.

I spent several days in Hawaii and used the Ramada Plaza Waikiki as my base. The staff were polite and helpful, giving directions, answering questions. The room was clean, there was no noise from the street, the rates very reasonable, and the location is convenient to restaurants and just across the street from the Atlantis submarine ride which I also recommend.I would recommend this location.

This hotel was booked off priceline for around $120 per night. It was one of the cheaper priced hotels we could find in Waikiki. The location is excellent, across the street is the Hilton Hawaiian Village, and just beyond that is the beach. This hotel is walking distance to the main strip and near some decent restaurants. The happy hour at the 24hr coffee shop on the corner is a great casual place for a beer. The aircon in our room was not working properly so the helpful and friendly front desk staff relocated us to a different room. The pool was ok for a quick dip however the smell of grease from the awful chineese food restaurant was sometimes over powering. The fitness facilities were a joke, most of the equipment is old and barely operable such as the treadmill and elliptical machines. I would probably stay here again if the price were right.

We stayed at the Ramada Waikiki and I would highly recommend this hotel to others. The rates were very reasonable compared to the other hotels we priced. The location was also great. The accommodations at the Ramada were clean and comfortable and provided a good base to tour from. A number of stores, etc. were in walking distance. The hotel does not have a restaurant and does not serve a continental breakfast, but the refrigerator in the room and storage above and below the refrigerator was large enough to store breakfast foods and snacks. ABC is a convenience store in Waikiki where you can purchase food, snacks and souvenirs. There were 3 within two blocks of the hotel. I would not hesitate to book this hotel the next time we visit Oahu.

Well appointed room for the price, very clean, free in room internet.Restaurant in front, walking distance to Waikiki Beach + numerous restaurants of all prices.Also in front of the hotel is a stop for "TheBus" Honolulu's fabulous public transit system, have never anywhere in my visit to 40 countries have I been able to do a 5 hr circle tour on an very good wheel chair accessible, A/C equipped bus operated by friendly , helpful drivers for a buck (seniors rate) $2.50 regular fare.Helpful, knowledgeable staff, on site tour desk.

Clean, good customer service, centrally located in Waikiki and within walking distance to the beach, restaurants, and tour pick up spots. We were at the Ramada for only 3 nights before we went on our Hawaiian cruise amd we have no complaints other than having to go out for breakfast. The staff was very welcoming and helped us with directions and arranging transportation whenever we needed it.

I live in Hawaii so I just wanted to stay downtown for the weekend. The deal was great I took a blind deal on one of the websites and this was what I got. Location wasn't to bad your not on the main strip so expect to do a little walking. When I called to confirm reservations and ask about parking ($16 a day) they were very short with me on the phone. The room it self is old and a little run down. The pool isn't to bad and there won't be many people at it. Overall its downtown and cheap, defiantly no frills.

The hotel is conveniently located near the famous Waikiki beach, restaurants, and shopping centers. For the price that we paid for the room, this hotel is a great value (great bargain). At night time, it was pleasant short walk from the hotel to the beach to watch the sunset and for a quick swim. The room is clean with all the amenities. The hotel staff are courteous and are very helpful with travel tips and requests. The computers downstair are handy which allow us to do a quick check before making day trip for the island. We highly recommend for family travel in group. We love the place and plan to be back there again soon.

I am always facinated by the friendly atmosphere of the Ramada Plaza Waikiki hotel. The staff are very professional and very family oriented in the way they interact with us. I will always look forward to staying here in the future wether business or pleasure trips. I will also look forward to having my family share this experience with me in the future.Mahalo to the staff and thank you so much for making us feel home while away from home.

We've stayed at the Ramada Plaza around a dozen times over the past decade. It used to be the Holiday Inn and was bought out and renovated over the past 18 months.The prices are good, and if you can get one of the Jnr suites located on the PH (penthouse) level do so. The 2 bed suite on the side away from Ala Moana is quieter- as the road is always patched with metal grating so you can hear cars driving over the metal at night, the other side of the building is MUCH better. The staff are great, my only complaint- THEY DO NOT HAVE BOTTLE OPENERS in the rooms- how weird is that and reception suggested I buy one or come down stairs and they will open bottles- it's just odd.The beds are great ,pillows comfortable, pool usually empty because the beaches are so close- so if you don't like salt sand and crowds you could have a pool to yourself.There is a fantastic Indian restaurant 1 minutes walk away, an ABC store for milk etc for your rooms kitchen, and of course the Ala Moana Shopping centre is 5 minutes walk. If you need to mail postcards, there is a US mail box on the corner near the back entrance to the hotel.The rooms are super clean, and the JNR Suites have decent balcony's with views (but not of the beach). You know they are doing the right thing when you keep returning and we keep doing so. A box of hawaiian chocolates and bottle water awaited us (free) which was thoughtful. Not sure if this is just for the jnr suite or all rooms.

I recently stayed @ the Ramada Plaza Waikiki and thoroughly enjoyed my stay which was a combination of business & pleasure. The hotel, while not on the beach offers a great variety of Honolulu views, including some water views. The Ramada is very clean and the rooms comfortable and recently renovated. The front desk, bellmen and activites desk were extremely helpful. One of the best parts is the location - the Ramada is located directly across from the Hilton Hawaiian Village and a 3 minute walk gets you to the shops, restaurants & bars and the Beach. While there is a parking fee at the Ramada a quick pre-booking comparison showed that it was the best value in Waikiki. I will be back to the Ramada Plaza Waikiki.

This is an older hotel that looks like it has been very tastefully remodeled recently. This is not a resort where we would hang out at the pool or the beach (it's not on the beach), but it served us well as our home base while we were exploring the island. I was worried that we might be too close to the street, but there was no noticeable road noise to hinder our sleep.

The central location close to restaraunts, beaches, and Waikiki make this hotel a best kept secret. The staff are so friendly and willing to help with directions and advice with their genuine Hawaiian charm and aloha. The free internet is enough for a travelling businessman's justification alone where free in Hawaii is difficult to find. Ramada is my first choice whenever I travel to Honolulu for business or pleasure. I should know, I'm a local from the Big Island! Why pay more?

We just stayed for a week at the Ramada Plaza Waikiki. It was a great trip. The rooms are a good size, and the beds are really comfortable. The bathroom's are a good size, and the water pressure is great. Parking was very reasonable, and you are in a good location. Easy beach access, and also very close to shopping mall and theatres as well. The price we paid for the hotel was good enough that we were able to get 2 rooms so we had plenty of room for less than we could have spent at other hotels very near this one for one room. I would definitely recommend this hotel as there are plenty of things that are going to cost you money in Oahu, and saving on the hotel will help you afford them. Parking is $15, which is very reasonable for the area and considering the difficulty in finding parking is a deal. Great stay, I will definitely stay again next time I am visiting Oahu.

We especially enjoyed the location of the Ramada. It's within easy walking distance to the Ala Moana Center and Beach Park, but not as congested as the Waikiki area. The front desk staff was helpful. The room was standard, but the beds were extremely comfortable. The room was also quiet for the location. My husband really loved the San Francisco soap company toiletry products. Nice pool especially beautiful at night when lit. The only negatives are that the hallways were very hot and the recommended China Buffet breakfast place did not look or smell appealing. But there is an IHOP within a very short walking distance. With the location and value, we would definitely stay again!

Stayed here solo after a business trip. For under $110, this hotel is a fantastic deal. Situated directly across the street from the $300+ Hilton hotel and about a block from Waikiki Beach, surrounded by restaurants and shops. The room was nice, slightly above average, but who stays in their hotel room in Waikiki? I'll definitely stay here when I visit again.PS the front desk will arrange an airport shuttle for $10 (taxis are ~$25-$35).
Room is dirtyService is slowFrontdesk isnt helpfull

The service was excellent and the rooms were comfortable and very clean! The location is in walking distance of Ala Moana which was exciting for us because we got to watch the fireworks from Ala Moana shopping center without having to deal with parking and traffic. Although we did not try the Chinese buffet there were other restaurants to pick from as well as an ABC store which sold food items as well as other necessities for visitors.Overall our stay at the Ramada was a good one and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for an enjoyable yet affordable stay!

Good location but unexpected charges came up at check-in Our daily charged jumped up over $20 dollars per day. The room included breakfast for one person even when paying double. I don't like surprises at check-in. I don't mind paying more if I know it when making the reservation. With the hgher rate there are better properties to consider.

We appreciated the friendly, helpful attitude of the staff.Our room had the most comfortable king size bed i have slept on in the world.Located beside the Hilton meant we were close to all the best beaches and activities while still being very quiet.Nice little gym... Never crowded.Good value for money ...Included internet

This hotel is in a perfect location. It is right across the street from the Hilton and within walking distance to Waikiki beach. We also walked to shopping centers and restraurants easily. The bus stops right in front of the hotel and at the Mauna Loa shopping center. We reserved this hotel on Hotwire for less than $100 a night. We were very pleased with our stay. Free computers were available in the lobby and the staff was very helpful with places to eat and transportation arrangements.

Throughly enjoyed my stay here at this hotel! It was conveniently located right outside of town which made it great to either go to the mall or into town! Friendly staff was great! Rooms were very clean and beds were great!

We were travelling from Vancouver B.C. and arrived late at the Ramada Inn but the staff was friendly and efficient. Our rooms were nice, neat , clean, and well appointed. Everything in Waikiki Beach is within easy walking distance. We had a great time.

It was a good, reasonably priced hotel. The room was quiet and clean and I enjoyed the view from the balcony. All the hotel staff were very friendly and efficient. The Ethernet cable in the room ensured a fast and secure connection to the Internet. True, the Chinese restaurant downstairs is an abomination, but there is free coffee in rooms as well as in the lobby. If I wanted a real breakfast, there were about a million options to choose from within one block. The beach is next door -- just cross Ala Moana blvd. and go through the Hilton hotel and you are there in five minutes. I had a nice dip every morning before breakfast. All in all, it was a very agreeable place and I would certainly stay there again.

I must have been missing something when I stayed here. After reading the reviews (quite a few written by people in Honolulu/Waikiki which should have rung a bell) I expected a hotel that was above the standard expected of a Ramada Plaza/Holiday Inn Express/Marriott Courtyard.Instead I got my least enjoyable stay for a long time.Climbing out of a taxi at the end of a 20+hr journey, the last thing you need is inefficient front desk staff. That is what we got. The issue was simply a Visa card that the night desk staff didn't recognise, and instead of running the card to get pre-authorisation, they simply dug their heals in and said they didn't recognise the card. To resolve the situation I had to resort to saying that I would simply go and book in to the Hilton across the road and take the issue up with the manager the next morning. Hey presto! They ran the card and it worked. Grrrrrrr.The "restaurant" for the hotel is a chinese buffet which is at the front of the property. Our rate included breakfast. This was a chinese style buffet breakfast, which seemed to cater for coach groups of Chinese and Korean tourists. Coffee and tea was not included! If you wanted coffee without paying, you had to walk back outside and into the lobby of the hotel and get coffee from the coffee pots there! For most people Breakfast is Coffee - I certainly will forgive a lot if my first cup of coffee is a good cup.The rooms were nothing special, normal size and as clean as you would expect for this level of brand. My room didn't appear to have been upgraded recently. It was a high floor but all I got for that was a view of the high floors of the surrounding tower blocks, and a slight separation from the main road (6 lanes) which goes straight past the front of the hotel. In addition my room was next to the lift, which annoyingly makes an alarm at every floor as it moves up and down the lift shaft.The hotel asked for my positive Trip Advisor Report - so here it is and I have been generous, as the hotel was by far the worst element of a 36hr stopover in Hawaii. I doubt I will use Ramada Plaza as a brand again - I certainly will not stay at this hotel again and having looked at some other hotels as I walked around Waikiki, I would book the Holiday Inn Express Waikiki (genuinely renovated), the Best Western Waikiki or one of the Hiltons, all in roughly the same price bracket.

You could not do better than this hotel. Stay here-it is clean, quiet and refreshed. Nothing wrong with it. Park on the street - not too hard to find parking. Then eat at the Tropics Restaurant-ask for Ramfls the waiter-he is very special and at nite it is lovely there. I would highly, highly recommend this hotel. It is inexpensive for Hawaii but a great location in the quiet part of Waiikiki. Take the city bus from the airport and save more money-it takes you right to the door of the Ramada. We love luxury and this was great.

We really liked staying at the Ramada. We will stay there again and we will recommend it to our friends. It was very easy to come and go as we pleased. The guys parking the cars were the best! They acknowledged and joked with us every time we came and went. It gave us that small town feel of customer relations. And.... the towels were nice and fluffy! We hope to get back there soon.

The staff of this hotel were always very friendly and extremely helpful. You were always treated wonderfully and with a pleasant "good morning" or "enjoy your day" by all staff, front desk, housekeeping, service and management. This is important as you were made to feel genuinely cared for.The rooms were very comfortable and extremely clean. The housekeeping staff were always quick to make up the rooms and did a great job everyday for the 2 weeks we were there.
The Ramada on Ala Moana is quiet, clean and a great value. It's conveniently located relative to Waikiki beach, as well as a multitude of restaurants (all within walking distance).

This was a very nice hotel for our say in Waikiki. It is across from the HIlton Hawaiian Village (and beach access) but slightly further to other hotels and shops, which was a plus to stay in a quieter area. Although a bit older, the rooms were kept up nicely and the mattresses slept comfortably. The room (especially bathroom) was a bit tight for 3 people. The staff was very helpful, especially with an abundance of towels to take off premises to the beach. Use of the lobby computers was a plus and we were always able to get plenty of paper to print items as needed. The location was great, there is a bus stop in front of the hotel (if you want to use public transport) with several restaurants within walking distance. The room was quiet, the only sounds we heard were the tsunami sirens on the night of the tsunami. Would definitely recommend. There was a Chinese-American buffet on site (with separate entrance) but we did not eat there.

Because of the reasonable price of the room for a Saturday night on Waikiki, we wondered about the quality. We were pleasantly surprised and would gladly stay at this property again. Our room was not large (although space is at a premium in Honolulu) but it was perfectly adequate for 2 people. The furniture was new and comfortable, including a small balcony and a convenient desk. The room was spotless, carpeting clean, with a mini-refrigerator and microwave that were helpful for beverages and snacks. The location is within walking distance of a number of fine dining and casual restaurants that can accommodate any budget. Free wifi was a great feature, as was the printer in the lobby for boarding passes. The front desk staff is professional and acts as though they are glad you came!
Nice hotel. Staff friendly. Limited parking (but that is typical in Hawaii).

This hotel is great., the staff is helpful and courtious. The rooms are clean and pleasant. It is an older hotel but is kept up very well. As a business traveler I stay in a lot of hotels from three to five star and this is one of my favorites. It is closs enough to all the attractions that you can walk to anywhere you need to go within 20 minutes. The parking is convient and reasonable. I will stay here when ever I travel to honolulu.

I have stayed here a few times. The rooms are very clean and roomy. Great for a night out. The hotel is at the beginning of Waikiki and near a lot of restaurants, night clubs, and beaches. Just a few streets from the Ala Moana mall. Ihop is right below and red lobster is just across the street. I will definitely be staying here again soon.

I love this hotel. It's clean, quiet and comfortable. The staff is incredible and I cannot thank them enough for making my stay so wonderful. The rooms are spacious and decor is very nice. This hotel sits back a little from one of the main streets in Waikiki. The beach is just a walk away and this hotel sits in the middle of numerous restaurants and shopping stores - including markets. Also, public transportation is readily available if the need would arise. Each room has a microwave and refrigerator, coffee maker and some rooms have a balcony! I call this hotel my little hidden secret.....because so many of you are paying way too much and may be getting less for your money at another hotel in Waikiki. Try it - I think you will like it! Donna

Having lived and worked in Honolulu years ago and been a semi-frequent business traveler there over the past 2-3 years, I'd give high marks to the Ramada Plaza. It is not a resort destination but is convenient to all Waikiki attractions and easy walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping Center and Ward Warehouse. Rooms were clean and well furnished. Our stay was short so didn't get to use the pool or fitness room but most vacationers would be at the beach anyways. Lots of dining options within walking distance and just across the way from Hilton Hawaiian Village and Ilikai Hotel. Only thing I missed out on was no balcony to sit out on and enjoy my morning coffee and newspaper.

I found the " Aloha " sprit from this hotele because their services are excellent, so real. . not only the front desk staff but the housekeepers and bellman.the room is so clean and cozy and the bed is so confortable.I was curious to ask one of the front desk staff when I check out, she told me that the owner consider the bed is very important to the guests, so they provide all beds are same brand as the local five diamond hotels such as Merriot and Hilton.I definately want to book again if I travel to Hawaii next time.

I stayed at the Ramada mainly for business but had a couple of pleasure days. I booked the room on line and wanted to make sure I had a microwave in the room which immediately was confirmed by e mail. My flight was early and I was able to check in right away. The rooms could use a little updating, however I found everything I needed, I was even able to access WIFI in the room. Housekeeping was great, clean, friendly. The swimming pool and gym were always attended and the laundry worked. The hotel is right across from the Hawaiian Hilton Village and there are a lot of shop and stores, restaurants and the beach. There is Chinese restaurant downstairs which also caters for room service, but there are ABC stores and an IHOP very close. It is about a 10-15 minute walk to the Alamoana Shopping Center, but there is a bus stop and trolly stop right in front. I do not like aircon, so I always had the balcony door open and still slept like a baby, there was no noise from the outside. For the price, I would recommend this hotel and stay there again.

I very much enjoyed my stay at the Ramada Plaza, and thought the staff was extra accommodating as well. The Hotel is CLEAN, has a laundry room, security, even the Pool is nicely located and safe. I also liked the fact that the computers were not hard to get on to, as there is a time frame if others are waiting to use them. Toward the last day of our stay (9 days) the ice machine needed repairs, but it didn't deter them from providing ice by other means. The cleaning crew was super nice, and fun to talk to. : ) The only problem with the room was the location of the chairs. Nowhere to set drinks, etc. ~ we were in a room with 2 full sized beds, and the aircon made it hard to sit because of blowing directly on you. The location is great, we walked a lot even though we did have a rental car, because things were not too far.I felt very rested at this Hotel, and look forward to my next visit as well~ next time we'll have to get a room with a balcony! : )

We stayed in a double standard room, we wanted clean, we got it along with comfortable beds and friendly service. We did not "live" in our room, but wanted a microwave, so we had to upgrade :). The upgrade included a downsized refrig, but it worked for us. Ramada Waikiki provides a central location close to everything a tourist could want. Ala Moana is in walking distance, the buses and trolley services run to Waikiki beach. The secure surroundings, include hotel laundry, internet available in your room and a pool that is private. We commended the staff on their friendly "aloha" ,it was our home away from home :)...

This was our first trip to Hawaii and we feel we got a good deal on this hotel. The staff was very helpful, we mostly had the pool to ourselves. Waikiki beach, resteraunts etc. are close and a beautiful walk. Near enough to Ala Moana shopping center to walk to that also. We were there also with other family so had a lot of sightseeing and trips planned. The beds were comfortable and room was always clean, so for the short times we were in our room it was an all around great time!! We would definetly stay there again.

CLEANLINESS: clean, maid service came everyday unless we put the "do not disturb" sign and even then if they saw us walking down the hall they would ask if we needed any towels or toilet paper. STAFF: great staff, very helpful.LOCATION: not too close to busy waikiki area, but still close. only 1 1/2 blocks from the beach. restaurants close by.ROOM: small, but still okay size. we had a king size bed and it was comfortable and still had room to walk around. bathroom a bit small. room had a fridge that kept our lunchables, fruits and water cold.VALUE: GREAT!

When we travel we check out all reviews. I was pleased with the reviews for this particular property. We always take in to consideration the "bad apple" reviews. Yes the hotel is older, but so are the other hotels in this area. For the price we paid we were very, very pleased with our stay. The beds were very comfortable. The towels were very plush and plentiful, The front desk staff was very plesant and the parking was close and never had to wait for a parking slot.All other hotels i checked around the same price we paid had horrible reviews about the uncomfortable beds. When we are on vacation our rest is very important to us. I must say the beds, sheets and pillows were excellent, always clean and fluffy..The location is OK.. we walked to Waikiki beach but had to drive to other places we wanted to see.

We spent a week in the hotel and enjoyed our stay. Rooms are comfortable and reasonably spacious. Household staff were great. The hotel is convenient to transport, beach and a short walk from the large Ala Moana Shopping and transport centre.

The Ramada Plaza Waikiki is not a bad hotel. It is an average hotel. The location is right across from the Hilton Hawaiian Village which is where I spent a lot of my non-sleeping time. It is also a 10-15 minute walk to the Ala Moana shopping center which has tons to offer. The room was clean and the staff friendly. If you are looking for a place to lay your head and can get a good price, this Ramada is just fine. The cons: The two computers in the lobby that have internet access are very slow. Don't plan on doing anything more intensive than checking email and allow about 10 minutes just to open up yahoo mail. The fitness room consists of one treadmill, one bike and one elliptical plus some free weights. You're better off taking a jog in Ala Moana park or along the Ala Wai canal. Now, I've stayed in inexpensive hotels in Hawaii before (Castle Ocean Resort) and they all had a doorman that could get you a taxi to the airport really quickly. When I checked out of here and asked for a cab to the airport (thinking it would be fairly easy) the guy at the front desk asked me if I had already phoned for one. He then had to phone for one for me - I think I could have just walked out and flagged one down easier. I cannot recommend this place for first time visitors to Hawaii. If it's your first time, you would be well served to pay a little extra to get a balcony and someplace that makes you feel like you're actually in Hawaii. While it's true that you are not in Hawaii to spend time in your room, it would be nice to have a place with a balcony or some type of view or bar or garden or entertainment to come back to after a long day of sightseeing. That said, if you are a business traveler or really do just need a place to lay your head for eight hours per night, then the Ramada will be fine as long as you don't expect any frills.

The hotel is within a walking distance to everything!!Across the street is the Hilton where the night entertainment is and the use of beach is free.The hotel pool is big and luckyly always empty during our stay we have it all to ourselves.My theory is most of the hotel guest are flight attendants on lay over and they don't use the pool much they rather go out.Just outside the hotel are bus stops one for the trolley and one the regular bus which can bring you to the shopping mall and chinatown.One of the trolley ride is free this one goes to ala moana shopping mall,it's also a 15 min walk from the hotel.But we discovered Wal-mart where we bought all of our souvenirs which is much much cheaper.The day hotel staff were very friendly and hospitable but evening desk personnel needs improvement in their attitude.There's a parking fee of $15\day the cheapest other hotel charges $20 and up.There's free coffee and water in the lobby.request for a room that have a large size refrigerator this hotel used to be Holiday Inn and was recently acquired by ramada so the're doing some fixing upgrade.We fell in love with Hawaii and definitely go back in this one.P.S.Use of computer in the lobby is free.

I recently stayed here for business and I will stay again, they recently changed from a Holiday Inn and have painted outside and in. The rooms are great. This is not the place to stay if you want beach. But it's perfect for business stays.

My husband & I, plus our mothers, our son , his girlfriend, & our daughter were in Honolulu for our oldest son's wedding. Our stay was 10 days long, with the wedding happening during the 1st weekend. We chose Holiday Inn because of its close proximity to the Hilton Hawaiian Village, which was where the wedding and reception took place, and it was booked full many months before our event. We had two adjoining rooms that served us very nicely. Comfortable beds, quiet rooms and a more than helpful friendly staff. I happened to leave some cash in the lobby ATM in my absent-minded state the morning of the wedding. Thanks to the desk staff who spotted it right away, when I returned about 5 minutes later after realizing that I didn't have the money they'd already found it, put it in the safe along with my receipt. The pool area was being redone the last three days of our stay, but the beach was just a 5 minute stroll thru Hilton Hawaiian Village, it wasn't really a problem, besides that's where we really wanted to be! It was just a block from the "busy" streets and had a bus stop right out front. McDonalds right around the corner and a nice family style restaraunt, plus an IHOP next door. We LOVED it!

Very friendly staff and nice room. The pool was small but we had it to ourselves whenever we wanted it. This is not a fancy upscale hotel, which is fine and as advertised. I have no problem recommending this hotel. So long as you keep your expectations reasonable and understand what you are getting you will enjoy your stay.

This was our first stay in Honolulu in ten years and we chose HI Waikiki on price.HI and ICH group choices are limited in the Islands.Next time we would probably pay more and stay somewhere else with larger newer rooms.Staff were friendly and check in was done quickly.Free internet access in lobby on two computers and room WiFi (didn't use this).Room was small and old but clean.The pool is tiny and cold from being in high rise shadow most of the day.One meal in Chinese buffet and did not go back. The food didn't seem fresh and Waikiki has restaraunt and diner choices galore.Location of the hotel is good for walking to beach and Ala Moana and there is a Bus stop at the front. We used Bus for everything except booked airport transfers.At the time of our stay hotel was a crew hotel for JAL and China Air so some mornings and evenings lobby was crowded for a while as a crew arrived or left.

I stayed here two nights in December while I was waiting for my resort hotel to come available. It was unsure at first but I had to free nights from Priority Club that were going to expire. It all turned out great. The parking was free, the hotel was clean, it was no frills like any Holiday Inn but it was super comfy and there were lots of great restaurants around. It was also quiet (I was on a high floor) and had free internet. If you are on a budget, stay here. You will still be close to the attractions. The room was spacious too.

I found this hotel to be a very nice pleasant hotel with nice view of the area and close to many area restaurants. The staff was not as nice as they could have been but overall was a pleasant experiece and good rate for the quality hotel. The beach is not really close if that is what you are looking for.

The Pros:(1) Very close walking distance to Waikiki Beach. (Hint: Don't bother walking down any further than Fort de Russy - you'll do just fine there.)(2) On-site restaurant.(3) Right on Ala Moana Blvd, so lots and lots of great shopping within walking distance.(4) Free high-speed internet (but see also Cons), and printing of documents under 10 pages (a HUGE help when all you need are two boarding passes!).(5) Super clean and a beautiful lobby.(6) Nice and helpful staff, even in late nights or early mornings.(7) Actually not too loud for being in a busy area.The Cons:(1) Parking is an extra $15/day. But this is Honolulu, so that's just par for the course. You pay it and don't complain. (You do have permission to get irritated when you STILL have trouble parking thanks to the attached restaurant - though, again: Welcome To Honolulu. ;) )(2) The high-speed wireless internet didn't work at all from our room, even plugging it in via Ethernet. You can get a wireless signal from your laptop from the lobby, though.(3) No oceanview, although (a) you get what you pay for, and (b) there's a nice city view.(4) Rooms are your standard-size American hotel room. In other words: cramped, if you've packed for over a week for the next leg of your trip to Maui. ;)(5) And that's about all the Cons I can think of.Overall, a nice experience for a quick pass-through on O'ahu if you're ultimately going to stay most of your time on one of the Neighbor Islands. I'd stay here again if we did a quick O'ahu trip.

Believe it or not, Waikiki is HOT, even in late October!! The trade winds weren't around during my stay, so the second I left the comfort of an air conditioned room and hit a sunbeam, I started to sweat. It was 85-89 degrees for my entire stay. So let me say how WONDERFUL it was to come back to our room after a long day of sight seeing and open the door to my ice cold room and comfy bed. We had a mini fridge to keep our drinks and snacks, which was really nice. A microwave would have been nice to have, but not having one certainly wasn’t a deal breaker. The room wasn’t super huge, but it wasn't tiny like a cruise ship cabin either. The staff was always friendly and accommodating. We did decide to rent a car during our stay, which meant we had to pay $15 per day for parking, but I suppose parking fees are standard in big cities. We got the 16th floor (the only floor higher was the penthouse level). Our room faced Ana Moana Blvd - I don't believe there are any rooms with an ocean view in this hotel. But to get to Waikiki Beach, just stroll across the street and down a block or two and you are there. There is a Chinese/American Buffet restaurant on the property, but we never had a chance to eat there. I believe it was $7.99 for breakfast, $9.99 for lunch and $15.99 for dinner.

I completely disagree with those who say this hotel is modern! I'm a road warrior and I would classify this hotel as a dump. It should have been renovated decades ago! How old is old? They have a tiny closet with a pole 7' above the ground so most women can't reach it, and they only have the kind of hangers for men's trousers, not the kind with clips. There's a second pole about 3' high but the hotel doesn't have hangers for it, although they managed to scrounge up a few wire ones (from laundry cleaners) for me. It's a 10 - 15 minute walk to the beach if you cheat and go the Hilton Hawaiian Village's private beach. It's a 15 - 20 minute walk if you go to the public beach.On the positive side, free Internet and a refrigerator are nice, and the service is good.

Hotel was very clean and modern. Staff was courteous and friendly. Excellent location, right across the street from the Hilton Hawaiian Village and a short walk to the beach. Excellent fitness room and pool. They could use a sauna next to the pool, and a parking lot for guests. Street parking was a challenge every night we stayed there. Also, the computers in the lobby for internet use was very convenient.

We stayed for one night and were pleasantly suprised by thyis hotel. Good 3 - 4 star option for a stopover of one to two days. Rooms well appointed and clean. Staff were very helpfull. Great beds!!Great location for shopping right near the Alomoana shopping centre Short walk to the beach 5 to ten mins, you are right opposite all the big holel facilities of the hilton resort.Excellent Value option for Honolulu. There is a pool and a fitness room but we did not use these.

This place was nice; not the best place in Waikiki, but not bad. Very clean hotel, nice and polite staff, no huge issues to write about. When we asked for directions, front desk staff gave us a walking map and detailed bus directions. It is rather close to the Ala Moana shopping center, if you're into that sort of thing, but a bit farther from the beach than most hotels. All in all, a pleasant experience.

My wife and I stayed for a week recently - we were given a top floor (bar the penthouse suite) king room. It was small but not too pokey. Clean and tidy. High speed (and reliable!) cabled internet connection free of charge.The hotel runs parallel with Ala Moana Blvd. The room we had was on the other side from Ala Moana Blvd, and it was still a little noisy - but nothing you would not get in any other city Hotel.Very basic amenities and toiletries etc supplied and topped up each day. This Hotel is all about the location as others have already indicated. There is a trolley stop directly outside the front, and you can easily walk to Ala Moana Shopping Mall or into the centre of the Waikiki shopping district in 20 minutes (or 10 minutes if you are feeling energetic). You can also take a short stroll over the other side of Ala Moana Blvd and into the Hilton Hawaiian Village, onto the beach, or into one of their restaurants for some grub.There are plenty of good eateries around including in the Ala Moana Centre. We chose not to eat at the Chinese at the front of the Hotel, although contrary to other reports, there were always plenty of people eating in there each night when we passed.Value for money, location, and the friendly staff make this a place we would look at returning to. In the absence of an "overall rating" of Good, I have rated it as Average because it does not quite meet the criteria for "very good".

we stayed in this hotel because i am in the military and we were leaving hawaii to a new job. i went to my room and i saw an envelope on my tv which said i owe then 100.00 for a blanket that they said i burned. when i went to the manager and told them that i did not burn it he told me to calm down or i would have to leave the hotel. he called my wife a liar and said that the house cleaning was there for 15 years and they would not lie. when i talked to the district manager he told me that if i would of said that i burned the blanket that they would not of charged me. the parking of this place is really bad for 15 dollars a day. i will never stay in this hotel again. the rooms are dirty and the pool is small compared to what you could get for a few more dollars a night at another hotel.

I sayed for 5 nights using points. It was the only IC Hotels property in Hawaii so it was our only choice. Thankfully the restricted choice didnt end up being a problem. The hotel had just finished renovations when I stayed there. They have done a good job of the rooms. The hotel pool was very quiet - like having a private pool. The fitness room was also very quiet. There is a laundry on site for travellers who need such facilities and a ABC store a few minutes walk away as well. The hotel is in a decent location, almost opposite a large Hilton. It is also well placed for shopping at the Ala Moana Centre - which also has some restaurants. If i had been paying cash i am not sure if i would have stayed here. There is free internet in the lobby (two pc's for guest use). The rooms service appears to be run from the China Buffet restaurant - which incidentally appeared to be always empty and has a limited menu.

Spent over a week in this hotel and thoroughly enjoyed it. The staff were friendly and it was well located. Room was excellent, I couldn’t ask for better. I wasn’t a fan of the restaurant though, it seemed to be run separately from the hotel. There was no wi-fi but you could hard cable your laptop for a free Internet connection. I would stay here again.

Had a brilliant time in Honolulu after a cruise around the Hawaiin islands this was the perfect ending to a lovely holiday. This hotel is the best value for money that you will find in Waikiki. The rooms are spotless clean and have just ben refurbished, staff are freindly and will do anything they can to make your holiday memorable. It is just across the road from the Hilton Holiday Village and a lovely uncrowded beach but only minutes away from the lively centre of Waikiki. I would definitely go back there is I ever return to Hawaii.Thanks for a great time.

I stayed at this Holiday Inn 3 times last year (June, Sept, & Nov 2008) and I must admit the ownership took notice to the much needed renovations required. Although the SERVICE is still outstanding, the added bonus of a new FRESH FEEL of the rooms makes coming back to the room after a long day at the beach much appreciated. We especially liked the everyday "ALOHA" by any and all staff passing by and or near us, weither it was on the floor, in the elevator, or in the laundry room. I felt welcomed. My only two recommendations would be to have an Ice machine on every other floor or so as there was only one located on the 2nd floor. I also recommend your BELLHOP monitor the flow of the lobby area. On a few occasions I found myself blocked by incoming or outgoing flight attendants and noticed the BELLHOP not doing anything to clear a walking path.Btw, parking is NOT $25.00 it is a mere $15.00. I find that price to be one of the lowest in the WAIKIKI general area. Other surrounding properties are average $20-$35. I was also told by a staff memeber that they are currently upgrading the Fitness Center, Conference Room, and other surrounding areas. I cant wait to see the upgrades done when I return in June. Finally, If you are a repeat guest of this hotel, you may wnat to try contacting the hotel directly to make a reservation. The agent there offered me a very good deal not advertised on the web or through Priority Club.

Stayed here in the middle of March for 2 nights and the hotel has definately improved since my last stay here at the beginning of 2008.The rooms are currently going renovations and on checking in, we found ourselves in one of the new rooms. Whilst the rooms are on the smaller side, the new fitouts of the room bring a more modern and much needed update to the older/drab look i found last year. Things such as the aircondiitoning, tv and bathrooms are still from the original rooms and so bring down the comfort a little.The service from the staff of this hotel is generally on par with what you would expect to find from a Holiday Inn.Rates were a little on the higher side compared to other hotels around Honolulu (i stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Wave, see review). Its location is a bit further from most things, within walking distance from Ala Moana shopping centre, but probably too far to walk from the main waikiki tourist area/beach. The benefits of this however, is a much quieter location. Ihop, maccas, starbucks and abc stores nearby.There are no powerpoints located near the internet connection for laptops/mobiles etc, so a bit inconventient to hook your computer up.Would stay here again if the rates are cheap next time and because of the added bonus of priority club etc, but there are others such as the Wave that have bigger rooms and a more central location for similar or less.

We stayed here at the beginning and end of our trip to Hawaii. It was a clean, comfortable spot to rest our head at night. It is located close to downtown Honolulu, and within walking distance of a few restaurants and shopping options. Rooms were clean, staff friendly.

Upper floor room got severe traffic noise and vibration from Ala Moana, due to a late-discovered non-closing sliding glass window. Older construction with loud self-slamming doors. Bathroom was small but fine. Bedding seemed overly hard. Mini fridge was fine, hairdrier in room. No WiFi but wired Internet and cable movies on 27" CRT TV, but no iPod/MP3 inputs. No in-house restaurant, but room service menu. Adjacent Chinese restaurant with bland buffet selections. Busy lobby from JAL flight crews coming and going. Slow lobby PCs. Very friendly and helpful staff. Tight parking at $25/day.

We stayed here one night in January 2009.We arrived very late from an international flight. The front desk greeted us by name (probably because we were the last ones to check in that night!)We were assigned a room on the 16th floor, which another reviewer noted, is the top floor except for the penthouse. We were facing Ala Moana.I'm not sure what the bad or mediocre reviews are about for this hotel. It's a perfectly acceptable Waikiki high-rise and we thought a great value for the price. The room we were in had obviously relatively recently been refurbished. The bed was a bit firm but comfortable enough. The bathroom is small, but that's due to the fact that the building is obviously older. We found the whole room well maintained. We never had any issues with waiting for the elevators while going up or down, which was surprising given other experiences at older properties in Waikiki and given that we were on such a high floor. The hotel isn't on the beach (but come on -- for the rates on offer, would you really expect it to be??) but it's a quick stroll to get there. There is decent shopping nearby, and a 24 hour coffee shop for quick cheap eats. In addition there is a great Thai restaurant up the street (Singha). For the price we paid I was actually pleasantly surprised. We would definitely consider staying here again when we're in Honolulu and want to be in Waikiki, but don't want to pay 4 times as much to be "on the beach".

This is an older hotel, but was fine. I was given a room on the 16th floor (top floor exept for the PH), facing the street. The windows do not seal when closed, so the sound coming from the street was as if the windows were wide open. The lobby was large and nicely furnished, and the staff were all very friendly and extremely helpful. It was a short walk to the beach and all of the shopping in Waikiki. The pool area was clean, and was empty most of the time.

Older clean and quiet, no-frills (including no restaurant) hotelDecent workout room - small poolStaff amazingly helpful and friendlyA short walk from the beach - next door to the Hilton Hawaiin VillageVery good price option hotel for a one night stay before we headed out for the cruise - would not have wanted to spend more time there

Family of four-we stayed there for a week in march and have nothing to complain about. It was clean, the staff were helpful and polite. Yes, it is a 15-20 minute walk to popular area of waikiki but we enjoyed walking back to the hotel with a warm wind at night. If you want the beach, there is a closer beach across the street(5 minute walk). Our room faced onto the main blvd but noise did not seem to be an issue. They gave us a late check out and held our luggage after that since our flight wasn't until 9pm. Pool was small but never seemed to be many people in it so was fine for our family. overall, great stay, clean, simple, great staff.

If you want the true Hawaiian Experience, do not stay here. Yes, the rooms are clean, but they are also small. It is not as close to the beach as the state, I believe it is because the path to the beach is blocked by a new hotel being built. The atmosphere is one of a city hotel, no paradise feel. No lounge or restaurant, unless you count the lousy Chinese Buffet connected to the hotel. The bed was uncomfortable, the pool was small and uninviting and the staff was mediocre at best. I have no complaints about the service, however, it is definately no frills all around. This was my first trip to Hawaii and I would recommend trying to stay on Kalakaua Blvd, this is the main drag near the beach. Ala Moana connects to it and the hotel is practically on the corner, however this is not the end to be on. I consider this a trial trip and next time will definately spend the extra money to stay on or closer to the beach. I have stayed at many Holiday Inns and this one is substandard. My husband travels quite a bit and is priority club for this chain, he commented that he has had better stays at Holiday Inn Express. If you do stay here, just plan on sleeping(if you like a rock hard mattress) and showering in the room only! With my husband at the desk checking email, I had to climb over the bed to get to the other side of the room!! All of this and no balcony either. We stayed with gift certificates from my husbands points, and I would still pay $ to stay somewhere else. Do yourself a favor and pay to stay somewhere else, especially if your not sure you can go back, you'll be happy you did!!

This hotel is located on Ala Moana Blvd. so be aware that there can be street noise on that side of the hotel. Also, they are building a new hotel across the street, so the construction starts early and lasts all day. You are subjected to this noise while you are at the pool, which is a decent size, but not heated. There is a nice beach across the street at the Hilton Hawaiian Village which also has free fireworks on Friday nights. I think most of the other reviews are pretty spot on about this hotel. The rooms are a bit dated, but do have refrigerators which is nice. The staff is very friendly and helpful. My AC was not loud and blocked out some of the street noise. There are two computers for guests in the lobby, but are busy most of the time. There is also an Asian restaurant at the hotel serving all day. It is buffet only. The gym was not the greatest, but ok for a few days. There is also a tour desk on site. The hotel is close to the Ala Moana Mall and about a 10-15 minute walk to Waikiki Beach. If you want to stay in a luxury hotel, this is not the place for you. The Holiday Inn is for people who want to stay in a clean room and save a few bucks at the same time.

I think Honolulu must have the largest collection of shabby and overpriced 2 and 3 star hotels in the world. Normally I stay at the New Otani which is a $140-$160 per night property, great location, breakfast on the beach, some nice views and friendly staff. Rooms are so so. I thought I would try something different for a change and wanted to be closer to Ala Moana shopping and movies. The Holiday Inn was offering a $125/night room with free high speed internet access and is only a 10 minute walk from Ala Moana and Victoria Plaza shopping.The staff were very helpful, room was generous in size, internet access worked as advertised.If you book a stay DEFINITELY ask for a room NOT facing Ala Moana Blvd unless you find traffic noise soothing.Overall a good stay, average by most standards but a tremendous value for Waikiki.

I stayed here for one night while transiting through Hawaii. My flight was delayed and I didn't end up at the hotel until around 0430. The agent already knew who I was when I walked throught the door. When questioned how she knew, she replied "because you're the last check-n". I found that to be a good sign, meaning, the staff actually is paying attention to details. Actually, the entire staff is extremely courteous and friendly. The room itself is what I expected, nothing too fancy, but free high-speed internet (which most hotels charge extra for). There is some street noise, but nothing too terrible. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it for business travelers or people who want to just make a 'base camp' while they are in Waikiki.

Holiday Inn Waikiki is nothing fancy, but will get you a clean room at a good price in an expensive area. It is great if you are basicly just using the room as a base and a place to sleep while touring around Waikiki.The hotel sits off the road with just a drive on the main street. There is a chinese restaurant in front of the entrance. It is walking distance from the beach (I did not go there), shopping and many restaurants including McDonalds, Starbucks and the popular Wailana Coffee House (decent food.) There is a bus stop out front, too (kind of in front of the chinese restaurant.)The lobby is small and basic for a Holiday Inn. You will find just coffee there in the morning. There is no restaurant on the premises. The staff is friendly and accomodating (they held our luggage in the back on the day we arrived early, and the day we checked out and then went sightseeing.) The rooms are basic, but clean. Ours had a refridgerator. The A/C unit was kind of loud (not unusual for this category of room.) We had a room that faced the street (Ala Moana Blvd) which added to the noise level at night. (Tip: Try to get a room that faces the back of the hotel. This might cut down on the noise.) The hotel has a pool, but we did not use it.In addition to the restaurants on Ala Moana Blvd, there are restaurants and shopping in the Hilton complex across the street. There is also an ABC (convenience) store there where you can buy an OK breakfast or lunch and sit at outdoor tables next to the pool. We weren't shy about this, and no one ever chased us away for not buying the outdoor cafe food.One last observation: pilots and flight attendants from China and Japan airlines were staying in the Holiday Inn while we were there. I take this an indicator of consistancy (quality, price) since they are obviously in Honolulu all the time, and the hotel is not real close to the airport.

Waikiki has a lot of fabulous and luxurious beach front hotels, however, we found most of them are rather overpriced.The Holiday Inn proved to be the best-priced hotel for us. For under $130 a night, we got a decent sized room that was clean and quiet. The bed was comfortable and the beddings were changed everyday. A good place to return to after a day at the beach.The reception staff were friendly, even at midnight when we checked in. Our request for data cables to connect to the internet was fulfilled, without additional charge. And broadband internet access was free.The laundry facility was convenient and the gym was well equiped.

We stayed at Holiday Inn for one night prior to our cruise and found the property clean and had a very comfortable bed. We had a tour scheduled for the morning of our depature and the hotel was nice enough to allow us to store our luggage with them until we got back..The staff was very friendly and the chinese buffet was pretty good. I will stay there again on my next visit.

I am currently staying at the Holiday Inn Waikiki. The reception staff were friendly, and the facilities in the room worked as expected, including a free safe deposit box and free Internet access both wired and wireless (though the wireless is by accident and not supplied by the hotel).The problems I did run into were unclear information in the service booklet in the room, which mentioned use of the safe costs money. Furthermore, if you want to catch a public bus downtown or to other Oahu attractions you have to walk about 2 blocks. Even the airport shuttle did dropped me a short walk from the hotel entrance.The hotel is several blocks away from both the beach and the conference center, which means you do not need to take a car or bus if you are attending either of these.In all, for $100+tax a night for two double beds, this hotel is satisfactory.

The Holiday Inn Waikiki is opposite the Hilton Hawaiian Village - but you wouldn't know it, because it is hidden back from busy Ala Moana Boulevarde. Rooms away from the road do not have too much road noise - but do have noise from air conditioning.I found the hotel very clean and the staff pleasant and helpful. I didn't try the restaurant, but the patrons inside looked well fed. Recreational facilities are nothing to write home about, and you need to cross the road to reach Waikiki's beach - and then down near the Hilton, so several hundred metres from the main part. However, being closer to town means that the Ala Moana shopping center is within walking distance. I would recommend this hotel for a night or two in Honolulu, especially if you want to spend your savings (compared to the big name hotels in Waikiki) on food, shopping or adventures.

My husband had a business trip to Oahu and he arranged it so I could go with him.The first couple of nights, it was so noisy in the room right over us that we could not sleep most of the night. The noise continued til about 3 or 4 am.......after a 9 hrs flight it made for a very restless night. Then two days before we left there was a bunch of kids it sound like that was jumping on the beds and making all kinds of noise for most of the night. The bed was pretty comfortable though.The staff were all very friendly and helpful.  The rooms are pretty dated and room service was okay....had better. The coffee pot didn't get cleaned every day and we had to keep asking for extra packets of coffee....they need bigger pots.Our view was the parking lot.....and a tiny sneak peek of the ocean in between the buildings off to the side of our balcony. ....the railings were a little scary to stand next to. Our visitors also felt 'a little shakey' around them. The ac was noisy.The parking was very limited....we were lucky to find a place to park some nights....it was a good thing that we could walk to some of the other places.

I stayed at the Waikiki Holiday Inn for five nights in November of this past year and loved it. While not paying attention the first day I went right past the entrance, which while marked is easy to go by if you're not paying attention. I was on the 9th floor and had a wonderful view of the ocean, albeit over the hotel across the road. The staff was extremely helpful and the housekeepers were extremely friendly and helpful. You do have to pay for parking, but the price includes lock-out service, which I used when we left the keys in the car. In about 20 minutes they had a service person there to unlock our car, even though I had AAA. The lobby is beautiful and the staff took wonderful care of anything I asked about, from directions to restuarants to additional towels. It was a wonderful experience and I recommend it to anyone heading to the Waikiki area.

Not too bad and within walking distance of the beach. I did have a problem when the night General manager accused me of ordering a movie when I told him I had not. Also I was surprised the room did not have a microwave oven. Finally, on the first night, the front desk had the professionalism of a teenager on the phone.
